Reviews.Title: “good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: superal2
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 nights. 1. The location is very convenient, right next to a subway and a little restaurant where you can have a good breakfast. 2. Standard welcome, nothing special to say. 3. The floor in our room was completely wet when we get in. We immediately called the front desk and ask to be changed when we'll be back from our dinner. Then we got out to have dinner. When we came back nobody knew about the change request and we had to explain and show again. We finally got another room, better. 4. The carpet seemed old... and certainly not hygienic (stains, bad feeling about it...). Very standard bathroom, not refurbished for a while. 5. The persons at the front desk were not helpful, working like robots. We won't come again.

Reviews.Title: “Being refurbished and needs it....”
Reviews.Author: Liselou4769
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb 2012, the lobby is very impressive but sadly the rooms are very dated, they are in the middle of refurbishing and hopefully this will bring the rooms up to standard with the first impression you get when you walk in. Staff were very friendly although felt a bit cheated when we were given what we assumed to be complimentary nuts when having a drink at the bar only to find out we'd been charged for them!! Hotel is in a good location though and easy to walk to most of the touristy places and subway very close too. At the moment i feel the hotel is aimed more at business people than people on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with very large rooms”
Reviews.Author: flo1020
Reviews.Content: The hotel is being renovated, so beware of that. The rooms were not quite finished. The hotel clerk was kind enough to give us a room on a top floor, where the renovations were almost completed. The halls and the room were very clean. The room size was very large for a new york hotel. It was very quiet and the bed very, very comfortable. The rate was fantastic, as is the location. The continental breakfast ordered through room service was amazingly satisfying and at a reasonable cost. The staff were all friendly, pleasant and accomodating. Would definitely return if the rates don't soar after the renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be worse !”
Reviews.Author: Ana Z
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this hotel was ok, but this time as they were under renovation was terrible. I couldn't sleep after 7.20 a.m. because a drill and a hammer started working. I had no air conditioning ,so I had to leave the window open( as possible).I complained about it and I was told that it was season time! But my friends had the air conditioning working properly !?!?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at the Hilton Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Raquel O
Reviews.Content: I celebrated by 40th Birthday on March 10, 2012. My husband arranged an incredible weekend in the city for us. Party at Sofrito's restaurant on Saturday and massages on Sunday all in the Big Apple. We live in Harriman, NY and thought we should just go all out and stay in the city instead of communting both days. I picked a hotel near the restaurant... to my surprise it was absolutely beautiful. Hilton Doubletree was so accomodating. We checked in early and with our 2 kids since we had some time before we had to drop them off to my dad house for the night so that David and I can start our weekend. The receptionist was awesome she even gave them warm cookies to enjoy while they hung out in our beautiful room for 2 hours. Incredible views, beautiful clean rooms and welcoming lobby. Thank you Doubletree for being the icing on my cake for my 40th Birthday Celebration!!! Will return and will absolutely recommend to my friends and family. Raquel & David Ortiz

Reviews.Title: “Rooms great, hotel not bad, breakfast no thanks”
Reviews.Author: christhesinger
Reviews.Content: Staying for a week at the Doubletree Metropolitan while at a conference. It seems all the renovations are over or not in evidence from what I've seen. Comfortable rooms, not bad shower over a tiny bath tub. Amazing and very strong Mojitos in the bar and not bad bar food. Don't bother with the breakfast though. Stupidly overpriced, cremated bacon with Scrambled egg made with powdered egg - the kind of stuff you'd expect at a really cheap greasy spoon. There's a decent cafe next door that is way under half the price for better food.

Reviews.Title: “Another NYC Ripoff”
Reviews.Author: Peter P
Reviews.Content: We made the mistake of staying at the Doubletree Metropolitan the week before Xmas, 2011. Through Orbitz, we paid approx $40 to $50 extra for a "high floor" room. However, at Check-In, we were given a "low floor" room. After realizing the room was wrong, I verified that it was "low-floor", questioned the night manager about it, and was immediately told by him that "the rooms on the higher floors aren't any bigger." When told that we selected the high floor room to reduce the street noise, he said "I could give you a room on a higher floor, but then you would complain about the construction noise." So we stayed in the low floor room that night and the remainder of the trip. I called Orbitz the next day to get a refund for the difference in room quality, they were no help and "negotiated" with the hotel to get us a high floor room. Because we were settled in the room and busy vacationing in NYC, we did not change, and of course never received a refund. Upon Check-Out, I discussed the matter with a desk clerk named Venus, who immediately said "the rooms on the higher floors aren't any bigger," so that must be the hotel's standard reply to any complaint about a low-floor room. Venus agreed that we should be refunded the difference for at least the first night, took great delight in saying that the high floor room to which we did not change was given as a free upgrade to someone else, and would call me back about the first night refund later that day. Well Venus, three months later I'm still waiting for your call. As I expected, no money was ever refunded, so we were cheated by Hilton Hotels, a $Billion corporation and Orbitz for about $250. As for the accommodations, the room itself was tired, worn, ancient, and small. I've stayed at Holiday Inn Express that were nicer. So overall, we will never stay at this hotel again, never stay in a Hilton hotel again, nor use Orbitz to make travel arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “AAA+++ Rating, Don't Hesitate! Book It!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyNewyorks
Reviews.Content: Compared to other high priced hotels in NYC this was the best value, hope the renovations dont increase the price. Super clean Great location Room was spacious not huge Will stay again Will recommend We are from NY and hold everything to a high standard this met and exceded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you have the right room”
Reviews.Author: Jeff P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business. The room was fine, and the location of the hotel was great. Make sure your room doesn't face 51st street. The police station was across from my room, and the noise woke me repeatedly. Otherwise my stay would have been very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best option for this section of the city”
Reviews.Author: SpartaChris
Reviews.Content: I come into the city this time every year for an industry event at the Waldorf and have stayed at this hotel for 3 years in a row. I have stayed at nearby hotels over the years and consider this the best value, booking online direct through Hilton and well in advance. My room was on the 17th floor and I did not experience any noise or disruption whatsoever from the renovations. The check-in and check-out are very effecient. Rooms are comfortable. If you drive in the valet service is very efficient. No complaints and will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again after renovation”
Reviews.Author: IzzysMum86
Reviews.Content: Returned today after a 4night stay in nyc..the hotels location is perfect, yes its noisy but you expect that, however you don't plan on drilling from 7.30am. We also didnt plan on having to leave a card on reception and $200 dollars being held until check out...overall brilliant holiday and will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Midtown excellence”
Reviews.Author: TravelMavenHouston
Reviews.Content: I had to be in and out of New York on business and chose the hotel closest to where my business was going to be. This hotel was clean, neat, responsive and, of course, scored big points with giving us as cookie hot out of the oven on check in. I called ahead and they told me the best way to get from Newark to the hotel and confirmed I was a 2 minute walk from the place I would be doing business. My only gripe was no luncheon room service, a small thing, but could easily be accommodated.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but hotel under construction”
Reviews.Author: Djrrossi
Reviews.Content: My room was not fully finished from the renovations, and leaked cold air by the siding door. I liked the location and a lot nearby. I liked the balcony and the earplugs, but missed not having coffee pot and second tv.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Ootle
Reviews.Content: You're paying for the location. The hotel is walking distance from many sights in midtown. The hotel itself is decent. The bed was comfortable but the bathroom was the size of a closet and I saw a dead cockroach on the floor!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Knightrider0219
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Nov and we were very pleased. Right in the center of eveything. Rooms are clean and nice. Helpful staff. Would defiinitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: lisa h
Reviews.Content: loved stopping in this hotel. Was so close to everything shopping wise. Although it was a bit away from Times Square and all the touristy things down that area....if y a took your time and walked it whilst taking in the sights it was awesome. Plenty of shops to occupy you as you strolled and soaked up the hustle bustle of the city. The rooms themselves were clean and comfortable. The staff were excellent and the location was fine. A lot of history on Lexington...i loved every minute of my stay in NYC and even tho i ve been several times i cannot wait to go back and enjoy it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PavlovsK9
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, with a subway stop right around the corner and easily walkable to Grand Central, and close many restaurants, bars and shops along Lex, Madison, Park, etc. The rooms are in serious need of renovations, and from some reviews lately I see that is currently underway, so I assume my room has yet to be renovated. Room decor resembled a dorm room. Decent size room for NYC, it just needs to be upgraded. Hotel staff was friendly upon check-in, etc. The doorman was very helpful and informative. He arranged a car service for my trip to the airport and told me a little about the GE building across the street. I checked my bags at the desk since my flight was after checkout and there was a $4 fee to do so. Paid $2 upfront and $2 when getting my bags. Normally I tip the staff $5 for storing my bags, but I was never charged a fee to do this anywhere else. I paid the fee and kept the tip for myself. Other small things: greeted with a warm chocolate chip cookie upon arrival. Wifi is $15/day in the rooms, but free in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until the renovations are done!”
Reviews.Author: Dolfan55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business/shopping trip in January 2012. Didn't get a lot of sleep due to very loud renovations going on. Good location, typical small NYC rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation time, not a good time”
Reviews.Author: painterg
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on staying at the Doubletree in the next few weeks, think again. They are renovating the premises and things are dusty , at best! We arrived to find that the floor was shaking with drilling noise. The staff (all very accommodating) moved us to a lower floor however, the room was shabby, there was dirt under the bed and the worst of it was a bathroom which reeled of cigarette smoke. During our entire stay the bathroom emitted such a string stench that we kept the door closed. After showering the entire ceiling dripped continuously with water. Hurry up with the renovations Hilton! Even the cookies can't keep up with the mess!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location!”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful Doubletree Hotel. The rooms are slightly smaller than I am used to from a Doubletree, but then again, it is in the heart of NYC. The location is absolutely perfect. There is a Metro station on the corner of the hotel (literally). It is one of the side exits from the Metro, so it is not very busy, but does make it convenient to jump onboard the Green line. To me, the location makes up for any negatives to the room itself...because of that golden rule...location, location, location. To be right next to the metro can save you lots of time as you are touring the city and it can give you an "easy" stop to go back to the hotel to drop off purchases, etc, and then just keep going. You cannot trade that. Wonderful friendly staff. Warm chocolate chip cookie on arrival. The hotel main areas are not hugely popular, so the hotel is a little more quiet with that regard (i.e. its not "the" place to hang out) There is a police station on the side street near the hotel, so that can make extra noise on one side of the hotel. Additionally, if you walk a block behind the hotel, you will find a little grocery store, which is nice to pick up some snacks. There are also a few fast food restaurants on that street. Breakfasts are not included unless you have a special package deal...even then, it is not up to the cost of what you paid extra for the package. There are plenty of places to get a better breakfast for the same price or cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised At How Bad This Place Is”
Reviews.Author: Sue E
Reviews.Content: My friend checked in first and arrived in the room to find they were using a jackhammer in the room directly above. After complaining, we were told "the website said there was construction". At least they don't work on the weekend. When I checked in the front desk person was not friendly and seemed to bristle when I asked a couple of questions since my friend checked in first. The halls are hot and heavily perfumed. The room was okay, but the bathroom was pretty bad. The shower still had hair in it as did the back of the bathroom door (hair stuck to it). This place is in desparate need of renovations. It's currenty 5:42 pm and our room has still not been cleaned. I love the location, but I won't be staying here again. I'm surprised Doubletree would allow their name to be associated with a property like this.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, nice price”
Reviews.Author: 4everNYC
Reviews.Content: We chose the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel in our last trip to NYC because of its location in a quiet area, yet close to the most touristic places. Our room was perfect, big and clean, with a comfy bed and flat TV and even though it overlooked a fire fighter station on 51st street, we didn't have trouble sleeping thanks to well-insulated windows. This hotel is cool, with a relaxed spirit and more than OK for the price of the room ($200) Service was excellent and attentive, making their best to make you feel confortable and cozy, despite the fact that the hotel is big, with lots of rooms. Make sure to get your Welcome Cookie when you check in...itÂ´s more than welcome if you are landing after a 10-hour flight!

Reviews.Title: “Great New York hotel at a reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: lind_klp
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel in New York, we didn't want to spend a lot, knowing we would be spending most of our time out and about in the city. However, we also wanted something safe, clean and comfortable for our time at the hotel. We found all of that in this hotel. It appeared that they were in the process of renovating (we weren't in a reno. room), but even the older rooms were clean and comfortable. We were able to get a great rate ($150 a night). It was surprisingly quiet at night. Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue, etc are all within walking distance. A great choice for someone visiting the city for the first time. The hotel staff was also very helpful. They did charge to hold our bags for the day (we were flying out at night), which surprised us.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas D
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a quieter area of Manhattan. It was a little bit noisy one of the mornings since they had a street fair outside, I think sunday for Veterans Day or something, but we shopped and got some cheap souvenirs and great crepes from the street venders. Easy cab ride to everything, close to the subway, and a cheap rate for Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and refreshing stay in NY - rare at this price”
Reviews.Author: berricks
Reviews.Content: After several stays in NY the past few years, this hotel was by far the best for a lower price point. I booked through get a room for $189 per night and found the hotel a great spot for this price. I think the normal booking price is higher so maybe it's just a slow season. Location on Lex and 51st is right in the middle of midtown and is perfect for walking. The rooms were clean and compared to other NY hotels they're quite good. Bed was comfortable, nice flat screen tv and the quiet was really rare for NY hotels. Room 647 was a-ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not up to par with expectations”
Reviews.Author: abdallah7107
Reviews.Content: Expected much nicer for how much we paid. We stayed at the Intercontinental times square for about the same price and the intercontinental was much more luxurious. The Doubletree is a very simple hotel that tries to be more than it is. The hotel is clean, safe, & is great if your just planning on being in your room to sleep. The location is alright but nothing spectacular. In my honest opinion, I feel you would be much better off spending the same amount at one of the better hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheKapes
Reviews.Content: A very nice hote, This hotel is not far from time sq, I walked all around central new York from here, central park, broadway, time sq & all the shoppes near Macy's, The rooms a very simple Hilton like ? All the basic ammmeniets in the room, The Reasturant is in the basement and served a good breakfast, I didn't have any lunch or dinner there, it was to gloomy for that, the bar was. A great hang out place with loud music late in the evenings, But you couldnet hear it once you got in the lift, When u arrive they give you a hot chocolate cookie, which is delicious, The doormen & porters try to put you in a private car when you ask for a taxi, but it's the same price..... A very practical place to stay, I'll be back very soon

Reviews.Title: “Crowded, huge hotel, tiny rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Birotteau
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for one night for around $170, around new year's eve. The lobby was teeming with people: waiting in line to check in, check out, just walking around, or looking for the ticket counter. Elevators are always busy. Corridors are dim-lit and not very nice. Renovations seem to be imminent (January 2012). Heating in my room was not working, which was not very convenient for mid-winter. Called housekeeping, and after reviewing the AC unit they determined it should be changed, Nothing they could do until the next morning, so they offered to get a small portable heater. The front desk offered another room on the same floor. Both of the rooms were minute, barely enough for 2 people. Space between the bed and the wall was extremely narrow, views out of the window were very urban, but nice. The overall feel was that pending renovations would be very welcome. I could actually hear the banging of hammers for these renovations elsewhere in the hotel - they started at 8:00 am! Bathroom was also small, but usable. Toiletries were OK. Next door cafeteria was convenient. Being right beside a subway station entrance is a plus - probably the only one for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Nothing Special and not personal”
Reviews.Author: ejd_deplanque
Reviews.Content: It's a BIG hotel, about 700 rooms or so, so ensure you know where you sign up to. This hotel is like a factory, it was my first time in New York and would have loved a bit of curtsey on check in. My check in lasted about 30 seconds ("good evening, passport and your credit card please", followed by "room 644") I stayed 2 nights, the room was ok but the heating system was not the best on the planet, it was -10 at night (Celsius) and the room did not stay warm. Also there is a firestation and a police station across the road, so be prepared for some "action". The worst was the last night, the hotel porters push your bill through the door so you dont need to check out. A nice thing but i woke up from the noise of things being pushed through the door and through someone came in my room. It's a ok base for New York, but there is nothing "great" about this, it's factory style sleeping in a good location. So, Average, nothing special nothing really "wrong" but nothing what would make me come back.... or is this why they give you a cookie on check in, true, that's probably why, If a cookie is enough to make you feel welcome, go! otherwise, pick something else.

Reviews.Title: “Got bites on my leg from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: I got bites on my leg from this hotel room. The hotel itself is in bad need of a make over. The rooms are small dark and dirty, despite the best efforts of the over-worked house keeping staff. Who are very nice hard working people..... But, the overall hotel is in dire need of a make over. The bathrooms are small and dingy. The rooms are carpeted with carpet that looks like it was secondhand when they put it down many, many years ago. My bed bugs left a nice little marks on the legs as a souvenir of my visit, which are disgusting. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel -- don't go in with high expectations”
Reviews.Author: ctaylor0159
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December 2011. For $429/night, I was unimpressed. The room itself was OK, but the bathroom was terrible. It badly needed a makeover. There was mold in the shower, places where the wallpaper was nonexistent or pulled back & I could see the wall. There is a W a block away for about the same price -- stay there instead. The difference is night & day. On the positive side, it is a great location in midtown Manhattan and the lobby staff was helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Very Efficient, Well Placed Hotel in Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: BromleySimon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Doubletree in New York over New Year for 3 nights. You don't get a particularly warm feeling , more a feeling of efficiency, which i don't mind at all. Very well located, within walking distance of The Rock, 5th Avenue and Times Square. There is also a great little deli/cafe next door!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfort but a bit loud”
Reviews.Author: Shannon M
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were just stayed at this hotel over this past weekend. This hotel is very nice, clean and has such a friendly staff. The location of this hotel is awesome too. The 51st subway station is literally right outside their door, which is great! My one and only complaint is that it is a noisey hotel (they even give you ear plugs in the room to wear at night). The police and fire station are right next to hotel. So if it is a busy night for them, you will hear the sirens. I know the hotel is doing some renovating so maybe this will help. But i honestly would highly reccommend this hotel to people!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location - but ripped off by the concierge”
Reviews.Author: constantf
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a great location close to 5th AV, Rockefeller Centre and Times Square. Just beside a subway station. But the concierge left a bad experience. We booked a show, but the concierge charged us double the price. We wouldn't mind a fee or commission but not twice the ticket price.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable”
Reviews.Author: LSA23320
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this location several times and always liked it. You cannot beat the location. Walking distance to Rockefeller Center, and a little longer distance to Grand Central Station. It is right on the subway line that can take you to Grand Central, Union Square, Spring St and others. There is a 24-hour Metro Cafe right next door that is overpriced but fresh and good and convenient. The room rates can be very good, depending on the time of year and when you book. The rooms are always clean, if small. No shortage of hot water or heat. The warm cookies at check in are nice but they need to skip the nuts. The bar was OK; $9 for a glass of California Sauvignon Blanc but add in state tax, etc. and it came to $10.35. This trip was a little disappointing. We went through a new room each day due to some problem but at least, each was more spacious! The effort by management was appreciated but the moving was a little tiring.

Reviews.Title: “WORST EVER EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: 544Athinaia
Reviews.Content: The showcase pictures looked great; the price was super. The reality, though, sucked, and the legal term for this is fraud. From the filthy lobby floors we walked into, to the stiff and smelly towels stacked in the showcase room we were switched to -- the first room was harrowing -- this hotel was about a notch up America's most terrible motels. The best part of it all: an arcane billing system that may leave your credit card racked with double the fees and charges you initially agreed to. This is week three for me and I have yet to be redeemed for charges the hotel assured me it would have released upon my check out. DoubleFee, than DoubleTree, seems a money suitable name.

Reviews.Title: “Except bed linens, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanderingEarthling
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that is well located and with nice room amenities. The shower pressure was great and we didn't hear noise from other rooms. My boyfriend noticed that the bottom sheet on the bed was not put on properly and the matress was exposed...see the photo. We know the sheet fits properly because we actually remade the bed just fine. So it was laziness / sloppiness on the part of the housekeeping staff...not okay in a hotel of this caliber. Otherwise, no complaints, and great warm cookies at check in as usual!

Reviews.Title: “Quick Check-in, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Augal479
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute add-on to a New Year's trip to NYC. Its in close proximity to some of the sights we wanted to fit in our arrival evening.... Rockefeller Center, Radio City and Bryant Park. 10min walk from this hotel location. Lobby was a little tight spaced, rooms were also just a typical hotel room versus the 2-rm suite I usually get with the Doubletree, but the rate was very reasonable for the location and the room was nicely furnished and clean. Bathrooms could use a touch up job, and I do believe the hotel was in the process of a facelift. Check in was quick and room requested with 2beds was available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Service and rooms sub par.”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights after Christmas holiday. Location of hotel is fantastic. Rooms are old and outdated needed a lot of car. Cracks in bathtub and wallpaper peeling off walls. Furniture very old as well. I'm a Hilton Diamond and i requested extra towels and pillows prior to arriving which i did not receive. At check-in i was not offered an upgraded room and was given a 4th floor room over looking the heating and ventilation system. Apparently there is a lot of work going on on the higher floors. Exec lounge was not available either. We ate breakfast in the restaurant on the lobby level which was fine but i noticed that this doubletree only gives free breakfast to 1 adult and 1 child for Diamond members. Typically it is free for 2 adults. I have to admit i got the rooms at a very competitive price so i shouldn't complain but i think i'd rather pay an extra $30 next time to stay in a more updated hotel. Valet parking was fine, doorman got us into the hotel quickly and the car was parked. I was charged a higher fee for my car ($64 per day) which i wasn't charged at the Doubletree Times Square the week before so i found that to be very odd. Overall, i'd only go back there if i was determined to go to NYC on the cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great service. Awful property.”
Reviews.Author: strategic2020
Reviews.Content: I have stayed next door at the "W", the Waldorf Astoria, and the Intercontinental. I love this location when I stay in NYC. So, the location is great, if not pricey, normally. The property is in a great location. The service, too, was great. From check-in, to all services, staff were attentive and caring. Now the awful part: Yikes! This property is in need of a make-over. And they were working on it, too! That was part of the awful part. At two minutes to 9:00 AM, the walls started vibrating and kept vibrating. I was on the 9th floor and they were doing construction on 17th floor and above, but it was very loud. Sounded like it was coming from the next room. When I called to complain that it woke us up (it WAS supposed to be a vacation morning), they offered us earplugs. Really? That was what the "careline" was offering as a caring gesture? It was an odd stay, for certain. The fire alarm had gone off the day before and when I called about it, concerned, they were just interested in getting it shut off. (you mean no one was worried there was a fire?). I haven't read the reviews here about the property, so if I am being redundant, I apologize. The paint is peeling from the ceiling and walls - I think because there is no ventilation system in the bathroom. After both of us had showered, the room held so much humidity, it was necessary to open the door to the hall to get air in. The windows didn't seem to open. The heating/cooling system worked fine for my comfort, with the exception of this. The privacy lock was broken on my door. There were paint specks all over the floor and walls of the bathroom. The towel bar was not hung, though the holes were there to hang it. With all of that said, it was very clean and well kept. Sheets and bedding were very comfortable with nice pillows. The safe worked. The water pressure was good and hot water was plentiful. Good towel quality. No robes. But a good working hair dryer and shampoo products. (my daughter did mention that everyone in the elevator smelled the same from the personal care products.) We were not facing the street so it was quieter than it would have been with the street noise in a room on the opposite side. However, no view whatsoever and the building next door looks right in to the room. Again, nice window treatments to address this. The room size was comfortable because we ended up getting a double even though I had reserved a queen. It was spacious for New York City. Getting our boarding passes printed was very easy in the lobby area and the gift shop was well stocked. I am sure once this property is updated by Hilton (they just took it over a year ago?) two things will occur: one it will be to Hilton quality standards across the board and two, the prices will skyrocket. For now, for a good rate, it is worth it, if like on most NYC trips, you are only going to be in the room to sleep. My one regret: I bought the room as part of a Jet Blue package and the rate was the same as the hotel offered, but I did not get my points for staying there as a Hilton Honors member. I would not ever do this again. The travel service lied to me and told me to just give my honors number upon arrival. Jet Blue has a deceptive service provider. I had a few problems with inconsistencies in email confirmations, pricing and service fees. They made me nervous and in the future, I will book the room directly myself. Sorry Jet Blue!

Reviews.Title: “First choice hotel but parking garage awful”
Reviews.Author: smf44
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that I lived in NYC for 40 years before moving out of town to the suburbs. We have tried a number of midtown hotels but this one ranks the best to us and is reasonable in price and we stopped searching around for better alternatives. We have stayed here about ten times in total. What is especially good is the location. Right by the subway as well as easy walking distance to most things in midtown. The rooms are clean (I always check my hotel rooms with a flashlight for bugs) but one of these years could use a little updating. The bathrooms are tiny. The beds are comfortable and the sleep quality is good. The check in staff are hit or miss, mostly friendly but sometimes could care less. What prompted me to write a review here is is that they have a parking garage which we use which unfortunately does not take good care of your car. Two stays ago the bumper got scratched by the cement wall they parked it against and this time the passenger side mirror had a one inch scratch (apparently because they do not take the time to adjust the mirrors by the interior controls and instead force them by hand to save time and the attendant must have worn a sharp ring). There were also sneaker prints on the bumpers, they must really park the cars very close and they need to climb over them. Frustrating, they would not own up to the fact of damaging my mirror telling me it happened elsewhere and after a few minute debate the manager basically told us to get the car out of the driveway and then walked away from us. I'm considering filling a report with the NYC consumer affairs which likely will be a waste of time and really don't know where to park my car next time I come into the city and honestly might be in the market for a better hotel again because of this. However, overall this is a good place that is not too expensive and in a great location and overall clean. Just consider not taking your care here.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay”
Reviews.Author: itrade
Reviews.Content: I was incredibly apprehensive of this hotel after reading prior TripAdvisor reviews - which ranged from good to awful. Overall, I felt the hotel was fine. I have to concur with many reviews that the hotel rooms and hallways are in need of renovation. Carpeting needs to be cleaned; wallpaper needs to be replaced in corridors, bathrooms and rooms. The rooms were average size for New York standards, but the sleep was certainly comfortable enough. There are complaints about the NYPD 17th Precinct and a fire station that is next door - this could be an issue if you are on a low floor (5 or lower), but we were not affected by it. All of the room decor and condition issues will be resolved soon as the rooms undergo a complete renovation (examples of the decoration palates are on display in the lobby). The breakfast (included in our rate) was fine. The Met Grill staff was terrific - especially Bolivar who waited our table all three days. Management should give this man a serious raise - he deserves it. The concierge staff, bell staff, and front desk staff were all good and we have several requests taken care of promptly. We arrived early (before 2:00 pm) and we had rooms immediately available. Checkout was quick. The hotel location was fine for our needs - convenient to the Theater district; directly on the East side 4/5/6 subway lines, and within 1.5 miles of Penn Station. For the price, a good stay - especially over Christmas. A higher rating would be given for improvements in the physical condition of the rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: jb1488
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in December 2011, and was extremely underwhelmed with the service and quality I experienced at the property. It was certainly not what have come to expect from the Hilton family. Although the location was excellent (only a short walk from many of New York's major attractions), the room was small, the heating was up too high with no way to adjust the thermostat, and worst of all, all of the water sources in the room released brown water with a pungent odour - this in a city renowned for the quality of its tap water! I called the "Careline" and was told an engineer was being sent to the room, but no engineer ever came. I was eventually able to get clean water myself by running the taps for about fifteen minutes. Hilton HHonors Gold members should also be wary of this hotel. It took a considerable amount of effort - several phone calls both to front desk and HHonors, and two physical visits downstairs - to receive the free breakfast to which Gold members are entitled. I was given several stories by staff as to why I was not entitled to a free breakfast, including that Hilton has stopped offering breakfast to Gold members, or that this hotel is a franchise that has opted out of the breakfast benefit for Golds. I confirmed with Hilton HHonors that neither of these excuses are true. Eventually I was told by the Duty Manager that the Executive Lounge (where breakfast is usually taken) was closed due to the renovations that commenced two days before my stay, but that I was able to take my free breakfast in the hotel restaurant instead. This was all well and good, but I have since found out that other HHonors members have been in the Executive Lounge on and after the date of my stay - so this was a lie as well! It seems that hotel staff, management included, have no clue what they are talking about when it comes to HHonors benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal-Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lizzj79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the doubletree in manhattan on 57th & lexington & it was amazing. This was our first time to NY & the hotel was great. Smaller than we are used to on the westcoast but it was nice all the same. Great staff with great directions on where to go & what to visit. It was overall a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Yasemin D
Reviews.Content: We visited New York for 2 nights and stayed at Metropolitan Doubletree Hilton. It wes like a nightmare! The first day the rooms were not ready, and we had to wait until 7 pm to have our rooms (despite our reservation 1 month ago!). Than, the rooms were not clean (especially bathrooms). The night was also terrible, because we could hear any small noise from the door, up down, everwhere... And the last day, at the check out time we had to wait more than 1 hour for our car coming from the garage (it supposed to came in 5 to 10 minutes).. The only good thing that remains is the good location of the hotel... It shouldn't be a "Hilton"

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Metro - great location”
Reviews.Author: cmjl2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. My husband and I traveled to NYC (my first time) last week for 5 days for my birthday. We were greeted by a beautiful lobby and a friendly front desk staff. One of the major downfalls was that the room left a lot to be desired. While I didn't mind the size (we had a King deluxe which was actually larger than I expected for NYC standards), the room was very dingy. Everything seemed clean enough, but a little undone. There was wallpaper coming off the walls, bathroom hardware wasn't completely attached, only the heat was turned on so we couldn't cool off our hot room, etc (we were later advised by the front desk staff that we could open our window to let a little cool air in to cool it off). I recognize that the hotel is about to be renovated and that's probably why small things have not been fixed. But is that really an excuse? Seems like guests who are staying there before the renovation are being punished for not booking their stay after the renovation. Another major disappointment was the concierge staff. Each time we called concierge to ask a question (i.e. info on cabs, or recommendations for dinner) they didn't answer. We even left voice messages for them and they never returned our call. We wound up having to call the front desk staff (who, again, were super friendly) for information. One night, around 8pm, we walked down to the concierge desk (because we couldn't get them on the phone) to ask for dinner recommendations. It was my birthday and we wanted to go somewhere fun but had a hard time choosing based on what we could find online. To our surprise (again, this was about 8pm), the concierge desk was closed. Who closes their concierge desk before 8pm on a Saturday? Seems like you should know people are going to be asking for dinner recommendations. Isn't that a huge portion of what concierge staff do? Positives: friendly front desk staff, great location (you are literally 4-5 blocks from Rockefeller Center), a major subway (the 6) is next door, the Cafe Metro next door was really good, inexpensive, and stayed open until 11pm in case you needed an after dinner snack. I am very picky about hotel beds and found this one very comfortable to sleep in after long days walking around NYC. The lobby smelled wonderful too! I would definitely stay here again after the hotel rooms have been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Really a 2 star acting as if a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Mersejohn
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel approximately 5 and then 3 years ago for Christmas time trips, I thought I would try it again. Very mixed results. The GOOD: 1. Easy walk to Rockefeller Center-great for the holidays; 2. Lexington Ave. subway stop right there; 3. Price; 4.Breakfast included with room- very good breakfast and incredibly nice folks who work in the breakfast area; Comfortable beds. The BAD: 1. Room (now being in New York City one should really only be in the room to sleep and shower however...)- this room reminded me of my road trip days travelling with friends and trying to find the cheapest room available- wallpaper pealing in main room and all over the bathroom (along with lots of rust, some mold) due to absolutely no ventilation; thermostat hanging off wall (room 303 if management reads this and cares), but it didn't matter because it didn't seem to control anything as we had to open window to cool room down and get circulation and heating and a/c unit had obviously seen much better days; moldy smell in closet as it appeared water from shower had leaked into it at some point; Carpet had not been given good cleaning in quite some time; Each morning we had a towel shortage and had to call housekeeping to correct. Now when you arrive at the hotel there are numerous people working the lobby in different capacities and this gives the hotel an upscale veneer, but I would recommend that management along with some of these employees go room to room and take note of the serious problems. Will not stay again unless I hear of some improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannii53
Reviews.Content: We went 21st November 2011 - there were 5 'young at heart' ladies and 1 young lady - and were where very impressed - we arrived and unfortunately we were given king size rooms for three in each room but only with 1 bed (bit difficult) so we rang down to reception and they were changed immediatly to 2 rooms with double beds in (apparently got us mixed up with the very nice man that knocked on our door thinking he had the same room....... shame) (55chicos - thats what the ear plugs were for then, we did not need them either - We were on the Police station side also, on the 6th floor) - we did not eat in the hotel but the Cafe next door and one down the next block towards Bloomingdales on the same side of the road this was the better one and value for money - impressed with the cookie for each of us upon arrival at the hotel they were lovely - the hotel shop was very reasonable bought 2 sweatshirts for 40$ - very nice place no bugs, clean towels every day could not fault it - very close to most of the sites - Central park, Bloomingdales, Macys, Times square, Rockafella centre, the Subway is next door for the Up Town and one block up for Down Town - dont forget to go to 9/11 Memorial, is a must, beautiful even tho still building work still going on (Breaks your Heart) other than that all is very safe in the area, never felt threatened at all even at night

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the HH benefits!”
Reviews.Author: Powersmurf
Reviews.Content: The positives of the hotel is the location. The hotel is great if you want to take a slow walk out to Times Square or see any of the local sights. Considering the price of some of the other hotels right in Times Square, this was perfect as we paid $139 by booking through hilton.co.uk The room was comfortable and clean. Our bath didn't work and the maintenance guy had to spend over 20 minutes trying to fix it. In the end he was unable to fix the problem so we just moved rooms, however this was not an issue. The one thing that did bother me was the fact that as a Hilton Gold member you get certain perks, one being free breakfast. However, when i checked in I was informed that this is not the case any more at this hotel and that all Gold members were sent an email which explained this. The women at check in said that this policy changed last week. Rather surprised at this, but understanding that I may have missed this email I went to the room and rang Hilton Honors direct and spoke to them. They were also surprised at this and told me that I will be having breakfast. Next morning when checking out the breakfast appeared on my bill. I informed the person that this should not be there. This women said that Doubletree have not given breakfasts to Gold members for over a year??? So getting 2 different types of information. In the end the breakfast was taken off the bill, but if your booking this hotel as an HHonors member be very aware, as there is clearly an issue at this property over who is intilted to what!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Texas wishing i was on the beach
Reviews.Title: “Its not as bad as I read in some of the post”
Reviews.Author: bkstar00
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel last week 12/4-9/11 and got a great room. Very clean - no noise at night. Always had fresh towels and a turn down service when I got in. No bed bugs, no loud noises and loved the cookie upon check-in. It was a pleasant stay and the staff from housekeeping all the way to front desk were very friendly. The only thing I didn't like was the price. I know that I went during the 1st week in Dec but really 400.00 a night! thats the most I have ever paid in NYC! We had no choice as other hotels in the area were sold out. I would return to this hotel but during off peak time.

Reviews.Title: “Good but under construction a bit.”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value and location for a NYC hotel. Rooms are very comfortable and large and the staff were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, comfortable but in need of significant updating”
Reviews.Author: EMTConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for one night at this Hilton affiliated Doubletree located on Lexington Avenue at 51st street in New York City. While the lobby is fairly nice if not fancy, the sleeping room and bathroom were dated and in serious need of renovation. The room and bathroom were clean though, and the bed was quite comfortable. The negatives were the insufficient number of electrical outlets, flimsey and cheap looking bathroom fixtures, antiquated heating/cooling system, old carpeting and furniture and flaking paint and buldging wall paper in the bathroom. Free internet was in the lobby only with wireless and hard wire internet for a fee in the room. The room did have a nice large screen HD television. There are phtographs all over the lobby concerning the apparent major renovation project that is coming in 2012. While recognizing that hotel prices in NYC are through the roof, espcially in December, I did expect a bit more for the accomodations for the rate I paid. This Doubltree has a breakfast only restaurant but the area of the hotel has everything anyone might need by way of dining or otherwise, 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “A little "rough around the edges" but great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Branden T
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Doubletree, so I think I knew what to expect. It was a little rough around the edges, but the staff worked hard to resolve my issues. I actually changed rooms twice right after checking in, but the staff seemed more than willing to let me move around until I found a room that suited me. I can't imagine paying $400+/night here as some others have mentioned -- I paid something like $180/night for a "junior suite" which I thought was a reasonable price for a midtown Manhattan hotel. That being said, I think the value was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no amenities, POOR acknowledgment from accounting.”
Reviews.Author: ChgoTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 1526 on the side of the building. Hotel is in a good location. Near the 51st & Lexington train stop and only about a 20 minute walk to Times Square. Other than that, nothing else. Lobby very small and awkward design. Small sitting area. Small bar, but bartender staff were very informative and polite. Bartender gave us suggestions for dinner and produced his own list of places nearby. Nice area in the morning to get some coffee, juice or muffin. Room was outdated and clean. Decent size bedroom area. Had a space for mini bar, but area had not mini bar? Maid service was very good. Nice thing was to have windows that can open slightly. Bathroom very small. Sink area separated from rest of room and bathroom. Cramped area, no place to place toiletries. One this I have to say, "water pressure and hot water was no issue". Was great to take a hot shower whenever you wanted. No restaurant on property, except a banquet room in next area that served a decent breakfast buffet. Staff was attentive and polite, but noticed with other guests, were more removed. Price was typical of a hotel. Check out went smoothly. Had a charge on room that I wasn't sure was mine. Clerk took off charges since he couldn't locate receipt, plus accounting wasn't open. I had other charges that I paid for other than the room and tax. However, a month later, the charge shows up on my credit card. Although it was about $22, I contacted the hotel, both by phone and fax, regarding the charge. All I asked was they show me a copy of the charge, NOT ONCE have they responded. Still waiting for a response. I was there for 5 days at $295 a night. Needless to say, I expected better from them. I had a better stay at the Mariott Marquis and the Crowne Plaza in Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sdavi
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here because of its location to my business meeting and I had points for a free night. I definitely got what I paid for. When I walked into the room it had a musty smell and the thermostat had no control over temperature or air flow in the room. I then knew I was in trouble when I saw the complementary ear plugs. You don't need the ear plugs for the street noise; you need them because the walls are paper thin. As I unpacked and open some drawers and closet doors, I uncovered a smoke smell, in a non-smoking room. At least the bed and bathroom were clean. Although the Internet was very fast, $15/day is ridiculous. As a Hilton Honors member, I am very disappointed. I doubt I will return here.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better.”
Reviews.Author: mholder37
Reviews.Content: For $424 a night you can do better. The cons: My queen room was tiny and drab. A hospital room has more color and personality. No upgrade for a Gold member. No breakfast room. No restaurant open in the afternoon. $16 for internet service. Rooms tiny. Bathroom about the size you would get on a cruise ship. Bellman provided me with ridiculously incorrect walking directions to another hotel (he said 2 blocks and it was 10 plus). In room, paint peeling, headboard stained, and window shades damaged. The pros: good location, good water pressure in the shower, standard nice doubletree bed, wireless works well, big tv. Would have preferred my usual haunt (NY Hilton) but it was sold out. A college stayed at the Marriott Marquius for much less and that is a far nicer hotel -- I got burned for my Hilton loyal on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: avideno
Reviews.Content: We forgot to book a hotel for our trip to NY and got a really good last minute deal at this hotel. The room was very comfortable, clean and quiet... exactly what you would expect from a Doubletree Hotel. The only things I would mark the hotel down on were that when we arrived and checked in at 1am, the desk clerk told us we had to wait for a few minutes before the room would be available. In the end, it was only about 10 minutes, but at 1am, after traveling all day and needing to wake up 4 1/2 hours later, it seemed like an eternity. It wasn't really clear why we had to wait, but it was a little annoying. At least they gave us a warm cookie while we waited. Then, there was the other kind of weird thing... if we had not had to wait so long in the lobby, we probably wouldn't have noticed the "seedy" element that was coming and going from the hotel. It was a bit of a scene, that is for sure! We are not uptight travelers by any means, but I have to say, I was a bit uncomfortable with the number of women in the lobby trying to coordinate with their "dates" upstairs via cell phone, with phrases like "What was your name again?" I'm sure this hotel is great for some, but I would not recommend it for families or people who are leading sheltered lives... lol.

Reviews.Title: “Many pluses, but some minuses”
Reviews.Author: Nordkvinnen
Reviews.Content: Just back home after spending 5 nights at the Doubletree in Lex. Ave, NY. The hotel has many pluses, but also some minuses: Pluses: Great location, close to many sights, such as Rockefeller Center, Times Square and Central Park. Famous buildings such as Chrysler Building and Empire State Building are also nearby. Nice rooms, we had a deluxe room at one of the upper floors. Clean rooms and comfy beds. Polite and helpful staff. Minuses: No breakfast room. Breakfast can be ordered one day in advance and is served at your room. (Many breakfast places in the area.) No fridge or minibar, no tea og coffee facilities. Bathroom could need an upgrade. Wifi is free in the lobby, but has a ridiculous high fee if you want to use it from your room. This is why there is always a lot of people queuing up in the reception area surfing the internet from their laptop or smartphone. High rates, but thatÂ´s New York.... All in all - we might be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not much for the price”
Reviews.Author: Olympia_Deb
Reviews.Content: Well - I don't expect great prices in New York, but was disappointed with the lack of ambiance and overall friendliness. With 3 of us, the price was OK to share a room. But they added in $15 per night for wifi, the lobby was frenetic and bar service lackadaisical, decor felt dated. There are definitely better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel very well located”
Reviews.Author: Paula_Dublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: the first thing struck me about this hotel was location i was surprised how close to everything it is but without the noise and madness. Its a very clean hotel with good size rooms, the furniture clutters it a bit there's a bedside locker, table chest of drawers 2 chairs but it worked out well in the end i was able to store cases in wardrobe and use the chest for all shopping. The bed was really comfortable, sleep quality was great and temperature was perfect, sometimes i find hotels far too warm. The shower is fantastic, bathrooms are good size and there is a hairdryer in the rooms which is great because it saves you packing one and the plugs a re different anyway. Very efficient check in and check out facilities and the staff are very helpful. The subway station is just outside the hotel which is excellent for getting around. Many things are within walking distance too. The hotel also have an airport shuttle service for c. $20 per person avail at the concierge or the bell boys out front have unmarked taxis very comfortable cars for $55 including tolls. note yellow cabs offer $45 but it doesn't include tolls etc. Definitely recommend this as a well located, friendly,comfortable hotel. I would recommend the NYC sightseeing tours too a great way to see the city especially if you are on a short break. the 4 day one is excellent value at $114 as it includes a trip to woodbury common which would cost you $45 anyway and it also includes about 4 bus tours and entry fee to a number of sight plus boat to Statue of Liberty.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Ling
Reviews.Content: This is not as center as hotels right by Time Square, but it is right next to the subway, so it makes it easy to get anywhere. Lobby area downstairs is modern and well-kept, very nice. Rooms have been updated so they are decent too. The sound from the hallways is pretty loud, as is the sirens from outside. They did provide ear plugs in the room. Our standard king room had a crappy view, but I didn't ask for the city view nor mention I was a travel agent, which usually gets me better rooms. Our room got pretty hot at night, but we didn't bother to change the thermostat, which we should've done before going to bed. Overall, satisfied with it. Nothing to rave about back at home, but decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: PortiaLancs
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here as we were on a budget and it was a brilliant price. No breakfast included but that was not a down side to me (actually I didnt even know there was a restaurant here until I read a previous review as there is little evidence of it!!). Perfect location right next to the 6 subway. A friend and I were visiting my daughter who lives in WIlliamsburgh so it was great, straight on the 6 subway then the L train to Bedford. Bit confusing when you get off the subway but that was probably more our fault. Anyway, back to the hotel. On arrival there was a coffin outside which was a bit spooky but it appeared to be a demonstration of some sort, not a representative of the beds! Room was a queen (upgrade to twin was $30 per night so decided against this) which was big enough. Bathroom adequate size - no complaints. Very clean although not sure towels were changed much during our 5 night stay. Huge TV which showed every wrinkle on the breakfast presenters faces!!! Didnt eat in the hotel so cannot comment on food. although service charge on a bottle of wine we drank there was horrendous.. Bit disappointed about lack of tea and coffee making facilities, I dont drink first thing but my friend does and I like a coffee at night time. This was no big deal as there were perfectly good delis along Lexington. Walkable to Central Park (well part of it), Park Ave. Madision and Fifth. Everything pretty much within either a good walk or subway ride. We were on the 9th floor and had no real probs with the lift at all. I did notice that there was an ice machine on our floor but we never used it as we were never in the place long enough. One downside was that there appeared to be no form of heating in the room (although it was comfortable) we had got soaked in the NY downpour and had nowhere to air our clothes. A complaint about a faulty hairdryer also took from 9.00am to 10.00PM to sort out although reception did apologise. Would have been nice to have been advised about wi-fi availability in bedrooms as we were not aware of this - it does not say this on the website. Taking everything into account I would stay here again, but to be honest that would be more for the location than the hotel itself. My husband and I are booked for January and are staying at the Thirty Thirty. next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dated experience”
Reviews.Author: rgmDurham
Reviews.Content: Great location, but the hotel itself is pretty dated. Our room left quite a bit to be desired - no adjustable thermostat (it was on or off, hot or cold - nothing in between), shabby carpet, paint chipping into stalactites in the bathroom, security lock on the door in poor shape. I do have to praise the fitness room though - one of the best I've been to in a hotel, and they didn't charge for it! I guess it was a good deal for what we paid for it, but you don't want to expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Upgrading”
Reviews.Author: LAFSudbury
Reviews.Content: When I started going to this hotel about 10 years ago, it had just been renovated. Well, they've waited too long. The room was shabby, the carpet warn, the bathroom wallpaper falling off, and the plumbing coming out of the wall. They did post a note in the lobby that they are renovating in 2012, but I'm not going back until it's done! They waited a bit too long.

Reviews.Title: “great Location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: sonic8899
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a short trip to New York City. The location was great. 5 minutes walk to Rockefeller and 10 minutes to Times Square. There is a Subway stop right next to hotel. Staff was good. Check in fast at 2PM. Looked crowded later. Room was nice and clean. Only negative is that in winter you can only use heat in room. We went on a room day and even with heat off, room was dry at night. overall great place if you can get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: donandsue
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here because it was so close to Rockerfeller Center and Radio City, not to mention a short walk to a great view for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. The room was awesome. Clean and very comfortable. The staff were pleasant when checking in and checking out. Nice lounge for drinks and wonderful buffet breakfast on Thanksgiving morning as they were closed the remainder of that day. Next door a great deli for breakfast, lunch and snacks! The price was right for us to stay in Manhatten for 2 nights!! There are other Hotels close by, but they were at a much higher price point. Double tree was great for us. We liked our warm chocolate cookies we received at check in. My only complaint: no coffee maker in the room, but as I said we got coffee next door at the Deli and brought it up to our room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing special: New York style service”
Reviews.Author: dannyirawan
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here one night because of its convenient location in Manhattan. I made a very short trip to the U.S., stayed a few nights in Queens (New York) and Boston, then to New York again just in time to see the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade before I fly back home. It was a nice hotel; comfortable room, cozy bed, excellent location, but apart from that I don't think there was anything special. Checking-in was quick and efficient, and so was checking-out, but no one smiled or made you feel special as a guest. The security guard even checked my ID as I came back at night, even though I showed my room key (I have no problems with security check, but some courtesy and friendliness would make guests feel better). I guess it was just regular, New York-style, businesslike, impersonal treatment. Back home if I stayed at a Hilton hotel, especially with a room rate like this (USD 200++), I would be treated like a royalty!

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a good hotel - poor attitudes from staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Double Tree quite regularly because my company has a contract with them. As a result I was told by one rather rude front desk manager that I didn't have the right to complain, as I wasn't paying for the room. (Can you believe it.....typical New Yorker attitude). The cleaning staff are loud, disturbing your sleep. I get faxes sent to the hotel: they lose them and then when I insist that they were sent, they look a little harder, find it then don't have the decency to apologize. I get incorrect wake up calls from the operator: when I tell the manager he doesn't even apologize for it. One manager said "oh well, we are working on trying to get our operator staff to get it right, but they are unionized" (Kurt - Front Desk Manager). This is a crap hotel.....If I could get the company to move our group I would....but they must have offered them a great deal! If you have a choice DO NOT STAY HERE.....there are much better places in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Larger than Average Rooms for NYC; subpar Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyage74
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the Doubletree Metropolitan probably won't be my last. First thing you notice: the room size is really large compared to other Manhattan hotels. Some of the decor, including rugs, wall paper, paint, etc, looks very worn, but they are in the process of a renovation. The staff was accommodating and aimed to please, especially Rachel, one of the food and beverage mgrs, who helped me overcome a specific room service issue I had during my stay. I was disappointed with the Executive Lounge, however. The breakfast offerings were weak, and when i wanted to complain about the stale bread and lack of working toaster, there was no one around to talk too. Other hotels offer drinks, or at least hot coffee or tea throughout the day...this one has neither. Luckily, I didn't pay extra for access as a gold member, and I would not advise anyone to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, central hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Sim0nmc
Reviews.Content: We were looked after well. Check in guy wished us a happy anniversary. We received an upgrade and were on 17th floor. Some of their rooms have been updated so important to make sure you ask for those. Room was large for NYC for the budget. Location is super central and on Saturday the whole area is closed for a big street market (nice). Thanks to Jasmine for taking good care of us...P.S. If you want, from JFK, take Airport Train to Jamaica and then take subway to "51st and Lexington", that's a 2 minute walk and total budget $7.50, total time 45-60 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: winwolf56
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location (at 51st and Lex) right on the green subway lines. Rooms are modestly sized and a bit tired, but the hotel is reasonably piced (for New York) and staff are very accomodating. Get the bellman to hail a cab, otherwise can be a bit chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HEC4
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable hotel, helpful staff. My first visit to NY, hotel in great location. My only complaint was the $14.95/day charge for wifi in your room when it is free in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Busy location with easy Subway access”
Reviews.Author: Friendaza1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one-night on business and was upgraded to a suite. The bed was extremely comfortable and the gym was larger than average with quality equipment. There is a subway stop directly outside of the hotel and food options are plentiful. The hotel seems to have recently completed renovations, which were well done. Ask for lounge access - there is warm breakfast and drinks available.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: HHDXB
Reviews.Content: Was fortunate to get a good deal on a room through a website, otherwise I don't think I would have stayed as it would have been beyond my budget. Great sized room for NYC, but traveling alone the 2 double beds made the room a bit cramped - I guess for couples/friends traveling together that wouldn't be an issue. (But going on what most NYC hotels have to offer the room was HUGE!!) Bathroom was a bit outdated, but clean and nice products. Sink took a long time to drain (but a minor issue that could be lived with!) Bed was VERY comfortable as were the pillows. It snowed the one day and I was very reluctant to move too far from the comfort! Staff were mostly friendly and the concierge gave sound advice on attractions, restaurants and shows. Only staff that didn't make the grade was on check out when I was enquiring about staying on...and he was the manager on duty - strange?! Never tried the lobby-bar out - but it was always humming. Cookies were a nice touch, BUT (and this is a BIG BUT considering it is free in most public places throughout the city and in all starbucks) as a paying guest you have to pay for wifi??? Seriously?!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: Miriamblock1978
Reviews.Content: I was going to give this place 4 stars for service and accommodations but on our last morning in the hotel my husband and I noticed our legs were itching and covered with red bites!!!!. You can draw whatever conclusions you want from this review. I have painfully swollen bitten legs that itch like crazy!.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AryCuesta
Reviews.Content: Location: It's just a couple of blocks to Rockefeller Center. Next door there's a Cafe Metro so you can eat something quick. Service: Good, they even give you a hot cookie when yoy checkin. Room: It was ok, but a little cold.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but expensive”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeEB
Reviews.Content: I guess I shouldn't "look a gift horse in the mouth". The reservation for our room was made by some friends from California who were coming East to visit us and then stay a couple of nights in the city before going home. Our friends made the reservations long in advance and chose a non-refundable rate of $379 plus tax ($404 per night total with tax). Unfortunately, a few weeks before their trip the wife injured her back and had to have surgery. They could not use the reservation and transferred the name on the reservation to ours. So the room was "free" to us. We had no trouble checking in and we were told they had upgraded our room to a "king room". Also, when we were checking in, I thought i recognized the building and the location and asked if this was formerly the Summit Hotel. The answer was yes. I first stayed in this hotel in 1971, 40+ years ago. When we got to our room we were somewhat shocked at the small size and the furnishings. The room was small and all of the furniture except the bed, flat panel TV and the toilet was the orginal blonde furniture for 40 years ago. When i put my computer on the "desk" and sat in the chair to use it, there was no room for my wife to walk between the bed and desk. There was only one small sitting chair and no ottoman. The rooms are also a bit noisy, since the hotel is right across 51st Street from a police precint and a large fire house (engine and ladder companies). The hotel must know this, since they leave earplugs on the night stand. We did have a nice continental breakfast in their dining room in the mornings. The food was good, albeit, a bit pricey, but that is NYC. My advice would be, unless you absolutely need to be on the East Side, I would choose the Doubletree in Times Sqaure. It is closer to more restaurants and the theaters, but further from the shopping. The rooms are nicer. We were there on 9/11/2001 and have stayed several times since. Also, since this reservation was made through hotels.com it was not eligible for any HHilton Honors points or recognition.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms with a small bathroom-well located”
Reviews.Author: oilmanDorset_U_K_
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights whilst touring New York. It is located 20 yards from the subway and taxis are all around. The staff are helpful- especially the doorman who know practically everything. there is a reasonable takeaway next door- or Subway 300 yards up the road. The room was large by New York standards, and the bathroom also typical of New York: small and only a tub rather than a bath. Interestingly the room had an air purifier rather than the normal a/c.

Reviews.Title: “Lesson learned”
Reviews.Author: Ssitto
Reviews.Content: The hotel left me stranded in New York city. I was disappointed with the customer service provided by hotel management. My hotel was booked through price line, which I advise everybody to never use there service provided because they were not accommodating to my experience which surprised me even more since I paid the extra fee for travel insurance. As for double tree , I called and confirmed my reservations with reservations once my hotel was booked. Unfortunately when I arrived there the room was not a 2 double bed as I was informed to have . Management insisted that staff would never confirm with me that I was all set with the double bed non-smoking. I explained that I would be more than willing to stay at a different double tree or refund my money and still all he would tell me there was nothing he was able to do for me and wanted me to deal with price line. Dealing with price line was worse and it became the blaming game.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, just a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingleo12345
Reviews.Content: I was there on a business trip, the hotel was nice and the staff was really helpfull and professional. The location of the hotel is good as well, close to the subway station so you're everywhere fairly quick. I didn't try the restaurant in the hotel since there're so many places closeby but it looked nice. The bathroom was a bit old-fashioned but the shower was good. The view from the room wasn't really good, but I guess if you pay more for a top floor room it is better. Would recommend it for business travellers, for vaction it is a bit plain, but then the rates are pretty good for that location so you might give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: E J
Reviews.Content: Can I put it a bit better than good, but not 'very good'? Nice staff, clean room, maybe a bit on the small side. Excellet view from the window! Were given a complimentary breakfast, which maybe wasn't quite as good as I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Great stay !”
Reviews.Author: einat_10
Reviews.Content: I am so thankfull for the staff that did everything to make my stay at NYC unforgetable. We were celebrated our anniversary and recived a signed card by all the hotel workers together with a cake and a bottle of wine. We asked for a high floor room and got a big room with city view and a balcony on the 18th floor, lots of space.. We stayed 4 nights and 5 days and in one of them was the snow storm. it was so great to stay at the cozy room beside the window and to watched the snow. The hotel has a great location and all the room are about to be renoveted soon. I defently recomond this hotel and for for sure i will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms have gone severely downhill”
Reviews.Author: Lou P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Doubltree Metropolitan about 20 times over the past few years, and this will be my last. Although this was never a high end hotel, the rooms were clean and the staff was alwaysfriendly during prior stays. This stay, i booked a "Pure Allergy Friendly" room at a premium -- $419 a night. As you can see from the attached pictures, the room is poorly maintained, with ripped up carpet in the closet and mold, mildew, and falling ceilings in the bathrooms, My colleagues' rooms had similar problems. One word: YUCK.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Serkan A
Reviews.Content: Location were perfect close to shopping ang times square. But rooms were not very clean

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Midtown-nice stay”
Reviews.Author: tkmom2010
Reviews.Content: I chose the Doubletree based on the location of the event I was attending. I stayed for five days. It was a great location. Walking distance to central park and a very nice area overall. There were office buildings with people working across the street and Park Avenue a few blocks away. Lots of shops and restaurants. I felt safe walking at night. The customer service at the hotel was top notch. The desk clerk made an effort to remember my name. There was plenty of help, from bell hops to desk clerks to maids. I was impressed with housekeeping staff working into the evening. My room was clean and I am fussy. I ordered room service and the food was fresh and arrived quickly. There was a very active lobby and bar area at all times. They offer warm cookies nightly at the front desk, and free wi-fi in the lobby although you had to pay to have wi-fi in your room. That was expensive. I think it was $14.95 per day. My bed was extremely comfortable. The carpet and wallpaper were a little tired on my floor, and could use to be freshened up, but other than that I had a wonderful stay. For those of you who care, great shower and decent hairdryer. I think pets to a certain size were allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, nice room, large shower, warm cookies!”
Reviews.Author: 2_Casual_Travelers11
Reviews.Content: We showed up very early as our flight landed early and the Doubletree had our room ready. It was an ADA room and the shower was nice and large and easy to roll into. The toilet is a little short for an ADA bathroom and the paper ends up right at your leg. The furniture at the front door was at first hard to get past but the maid, bellhop and maintenance man quickly slid things over for us. The phone next to the bed didn't work but the other two phones in the room did so that was fine. The breakfast downstairs was a little odd for someone in a wheelchair to get to, (in a tiny one person lift), but doable. Not overly impressed by selection but in NY you have so many options, this is a minor inconvenience. Bed was very comfortable. Cookies were delicious! How much more can you want other than warm cookies?!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for rooms in a poor condition”
Reviews.Author: JorgeLD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times. It used to be an average hotel, convenient due to location. But on my last stay I perceived a serius drop in quality. The lobby was refurnished and it looks better than before. But the rooms... oh my God! Dark, humid, smelly and wallpaper torned... Message to the hotel: please shape up! In the meantime consider charging no more than usd 100 for those ugly rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: kenfc
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were adequate and clean. Close to subway and one can walk to many sites.

Reviews.Title: “Too high price lowest for nothing”
Reviews.Author: Itain
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not that good and old. Showes ok but need to refurbish No breakfast No coffee machine in the room No Wi Fi free in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: cf07815
Reviews.Content: Me and my best friend stayed here for my 50th birthday and it was very nice. Hector our conceige was very, very nice and helpful. The other staff was not as friendly. The rooms are small but very clean. The subway is steps away. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE service!!! Unclean!”
Reviews.Author: outlander96
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a fun girlfriends get-away weekend. We made reservations on line, and called prior to our stay to see if we could get an early check-in as we were going to be arriving around 10am.
