I was told that they would try to accommodate this, but there was no guarantee. (I later found out at check-in that there is a guarantee: you can pay for the night before and not stay there. Seriously?) When we were actually checking-in, we again requested the early check-in, and were told they would do their best and call us when the room became available, but regular check-in time was 3pm. We left our bags (at $2/bag) at the bag drop-off and headed out for some retail therapy. We got the call at 3:15 that our room was ready and we could NOW check-in. We were still shopping miles away, and didn't actually get back to the hotel until 7pm. Upon arrival in our room, upon initial glance, it appeared clean, but then we noticed an empty bottle of water and opened earplugs on the nightstand. There was also a hand-written note on the desk. This just made us question whether the room was actually cleaned and whether or not they changed the sheets, for example, or did they think the same people who were there prior to us were coming back. We called the front desk and they apologized and told us they would change our rooms and someone would be up with a key. Twenty minutes later, they dropped off the key and we hauled our luggage do a different floor only to open the room and see AN UNMADE BED AND DIRTY TOWELS ON THE FLOOR IN THE BATHROOM!!! We called down to the front desk AGAIN and were told again that they were sorry and they would change our rooms again. The manager brought us our key and told us she had "upgraded" us for our trouble and had personally checked the room prior to bringing us the key. We finally got to our room at 7:45 trying to make an 8:30 dinner reservation. The room was clean, but we noticed no upgrade (unless the 19th floor is considered an upgrade). The next night, we made reservations to go to The Top of The Rock from our room from an iPad, and were prompted to print our tickets. Again, the staff was incredibly unhelpful and told me to go to the computer center and I could print them. The iPad couldn't connect to their printer, so I went to the front desk, where they told me there were instructions in my room on how to print from my own device. When I asked if they had a copy of said instructions so I didn't have to go back up to my room and then back down to the front to retrieve my printed documents, they seemed very put-out (this was 11pm and there was NOBODY in the lobby). They finally produced the piece of paper and I spent a few minutes trying to get their instructions to work. When I had questions, they pretended they didn't hear me or said they didn't know how it worked. In the end, I figured out (on my own) that I could email myself the link to the tickets and open my email on one of their computers in the computer center and print them out. Overall, I had a great trip with my friend and the hotel experience didn't ruin our fun, but I will NEVER stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and COOKIES!”
Reviews.Author: jujumassoti
Reviews.Content: Excelent location, right beside a subway station, and every time you enter the hotel, you can grab a fresh and delicious chocolate cookie!!!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!! stay away”
Reviews.Author: Lan Y
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay at this hotel. I was there this past weekend Oct 14-17th, and stayed in room 343. Woke up the next day with what I thought were mosquito bites, huge itchy red bumps along my leg. The next day there were more bites. I did a search and sure enough, looks like bed bug bites. I phoned management upon my return the very next day to report the complaint and was promptly transferred/hung up several times. They are "investigating" but offered nothing than "we are looking into it."

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: jomarie57151
Reviews.Content: All staff were so helpful, no question or request was a problem. I went with 2 of my friends the rooms were of a large size and spotless! It was close by to the subway and at walking distance to many attractions, would recommend this to anyone staying in ny and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mitradventures
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Doubletree when I go to NY on business. It has a great location (lex and 51st), right next to the subway and walking distance from many restaurants and shops. The rooms are fairly small but ok for NY's standards. The bathroom is quite small too but was very clean. the toiletries were very nice too. the room has cable internet (and you can get free WiFi in the lobby too). Decent size desk and big flat screen TV (my only recommendation there would be to also add non US channels... having BBC would be nice to have access to real international news). Staff is super friendly and very efficient (checking in and out took no more than a couple of minutes each). It has a bar downstairs where you can also get some snacks but since it is so close to many nice restaurants I only went there once (and the food was nice). Overall, it is not a five star hotel but its is quite good for NY and I would recommend staying at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: Pete026
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a middletown New York location and your priority is not a good bathroom or service - then this is a good hotel for you - just over a mere 100 yard from the Wardorf Astoria. The Doubletree is also 10 yards from the subway. For $29 I got a one week unlimited pass (includes bus). Someone from the hotel took our luggage from the cab ($5 tip) to the hotel foyer (we thought he would take it all the way to our room, how naive of us. We were then welcomed by a member of staff speaking very fast (the only one to do so). She made a sneaky comment when we asked her if she could slow down a bit for us. The room was not ready until 3 pm (current hotel policy). Our luggage was put in storage by another member of staff expected a tip ($3 tip). Wen went out for a coffee. After 3 pm, we returned. We were told that our luggage would be delivered to our room. We waited, not able to change clothes or refresh. It took three requests and by this time we had wasted hours. Although our two small suitcases were it seems lost, then found and delivered at last to us, we were stll expected to tip (another $3 tip). So, it was $11 to get our 2 small suitcases from the taxi to our room! Regretably, after these first encounters, our experience continued to be bad. The aircondition was not working properly and the room was at times too cold. Our son and his girlfriend arrived two days after us. They had a room with a toilet with non-stop gashing water, clearly audible from the room. They asked to be moved on this count and also because they did not want a room on the "smoking floor" (horrible cigarette stench) but the staff was extremly unhelpful and nothing was done until their last night in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience! Safe, Clean, Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Fourseasondreamer
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay at the Doubletree 10/13-10/15. I was a female traveling alone and am very pleased to report the following. HIGHLIGHTS: *10:30 am arrival. Room wasn't ready but recieved a requested upgrade and phone call when room was ready. *Room was big with king sized bed, lounging area and big tv. *Hotel provided earplugs. I slept soundly on comfy bed with no noise problems. *Evening turn down service with chocolates. HOTEL OBSERVATIONS: *Super great location with subway literally just outside the door. *Concierge service was very attentive and helpful. *Elevators are fast. *Evening security was excellent. Side access doors locked, bellmen at front & guard at the elevators. *Business section for free computer use and printer. *Barbershop, nail salon, restaurant, gift shop on site. TIPS: *The subway is being serviced...for the next 10 years as I understand it. Weekend service is somewhat limited. *If you like Letterman you can go to his website a week or so before you arrive and probably get free tickets. *WTC memorial requires a reservation. LONG LONG lines if you don't have one. Make sure you check out the good ole' tree that survived that day. *My room rate was $219 per night plus tax which for the dates was a GREAT price. One week before it was $385 per night. I lucked in to the rate by checking 24 hours before check in and they must have released some rooms. I found many hotels had done the same thing. *Broadway show "Pricilla Queen of the Desert" was worth seeing for the costumes alone. Not everyones cup of tea but the costumes! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel! NIce location”
Reviews.Author: norwegianprincess7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 10/9-10/10 with my 4 daughter's for a girls trip to the city!! Great location, very friendly staff. We loved the location as we planned our trip around visiting the American Girl Doll Store. Room was average for a NYC room, pillows were comfy, but bed was hard as a rock!! Also, tip....if you want to avoid valet parking at $48.00 for 24 hrs. and you travel there saturday or sunday, street parking is available....we parked two blocks away for free on the weekend...if you have any questions about parking you can call 311 and an automated system will tell you the parking restrictions. Also, there is a police station directly next to the hotel, I think it's on Lexington and 52nd. We stopped in there and they were very helpful as to the parking restrictions. I really liked parking on the street, we didn't have to alway lug the stroller back to the room, and we kept our cooler full of drinks and snacks and just refilled as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!!! Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickWelford
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my wife for her 40th Birthday!! I made 2 requests a refridgerator and a high floor, both were granted and we were as hilton honours members upgraded to a king room on the 12th floor. The room was modern and was cleaned thoroughly every day. Customer service was excellent and they couldn`t do enough. The location of the hotel is excellent!!! The gym facilities were excellent and perfect for what i wanted them for. The 1 tiny minus point no cookie on arrival but everything else made up for that. Would I stay here again??? Absolutely!!

Reviews.Title: “check the bathroom first!!”
Reviews.Author: MimiMontreal_Qc
Reviews.Content: we were there from oct.9th to 11th., 2011. We were on the 11th floor. The room was all right, comfortable bed. The walls seem to be made of cardboard as we could not sleep until our neighbours stopped talking and were awakened as soon as they started talking again!! The bathtub was DISGUSTING, with BLACK stains from bottom to top! I had to ask for them to put some kind of rubber carpet in the tub as I put a towel the first night cause I could not bring myself to put even my big toe in that tub. (I wish I had taken a picture) There was no mini fridge in the room....I did not see a pool anywhere in the hotel, either... I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Drop the cookies and buy better pillows!”
Reviews.Author: purplehotgirl
Reviews.Content: average room-but lobby freshener was overwhelming....I had to hold my breath walking through each day. I thought it was me, but I heard others complaining about it too. Conveniently located right by the subway and good shopping. I'd stay there again......they're in the process of redecorating it seriously needs it!

Reviews.Title: “Seedy room!”
Reviews.Author: Jimindc2007
Reviews.Content: Friendly service at reception and nice bar and restaurant. However, for the price the room is sub-standard (at least for this price range. Everything is battered and almost looks second hand. If you are looking for a nice mid-priced (i.e $400+) NY hotel this is not it!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service works so hard to make your stay a great one!”
Reviews.Author: rooneyhagan
Reviews.Content: Its tough to be a big hotel in NYC - people from all over, different languages, different needs. Doubletree Metropolitan staff worked so hard to make our stay a great one (Oct 7-10). They have a customercare phone line that takes care of your every need. We had a few issues with our room, but not only were they resolved, the Manager (Matthew) totally took care of us and made me and my 2 sons feel like we were the only guests there. They took care of last minute requests and did so in a professional and helpful way. Kudos to the whole staff (and I mean housekeeping, concierges, desk staff and manager Matthew)! Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with reasonable accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: aprilmon1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within perfect distance to the subway, grand central, park & Madison ave, and central park. I thought the rooms were a little lacking particularly because my room had the empty space for a mini fridge but no fridge! In addition I had a few issues with the cleaning but the staff promptly responded when called. Bell hop was super nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: magwiech
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights this week. Nice room with comfortable bed. Because I'm an honor member, I was upgraded to executive suite level and was provided with free continental breakfast and snacks in the evening. One complaint - the second night, I received a phone call to verify I was checking out the next morning. When they realized I was staying 4 nights, they aplogized and assured all was fine. The next day, I was locked out of the room as they accidently "checked me out". This was easily fixed, but a minor hassell.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sonia B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and friends were recent guests at this wonderful hotel, located very conveniently in the heart of Manhattan. The service desk as well as the Concierge, were extremely knowledgeable and efficient. The connecting rooms that we requested were large, well appointed, and a great value for NYC. I would not hesitate to return for another wonderful stay. Please disregard any negative comment that you might read, see, or hear as we highly recommend the Doubletree Metropolitan to anyone visiting NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blondeq
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in the hotel, this past week. Courteous staff, great room and lots of amenities. Like most NY hotels, the rooms are a bit cramped. However, the room was still very functional. The bathroom was fairly large by NY standards. The amenities that are important to me, while travelling for work are 1) good wi-fi, which this hotel has 2) decent room service; this was good; nothing to write home about but adequate, 3) fitness center: think good cardio equipment, and 4) elevators that support the number of rooms (I hate waiting for elevators when I am trying to get to a meeting. The hotel has 5 and they were all quick. Valet parking is the only option unless you love the thrill of the hunt in NY. Valet parking can be a bit tricky because there isn't a larget area for check-in/check-out and the taxi drivers like to battle for those spots. Fortunately, the doormen are good about keeping the taxis moving so even if you have to wait to pull up to the hotel, it shouldn't be too long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: gdlstx
Reviews.Content: Double Tree was a last minute choice. Turned out to be a good one. Great rate, perfect location w/ subway across the street, very kind staff, and most importantly a clean and comfy room. Restrooms could use some updating but it's not a big enough deal to overlook this property. Previous reviews about smell caused some concern. I have an extremely sensitive sense of smell and was NOT interested in anything musty or moldy. However, I didn't recognize either. Early check-in is almost always difficult in the city. This property is happy to store your bags for $1/each and will give you a call if your room happens to come available earlier than 3pm. Received a call around 11am. Perfect timing after having breakfast at a nearby cafe. No additional charges for early check in. If you're driving into the city, find your own parking, don't rely on valet (which is all the hotel offers). They can't be held responsible for damages to your car. I had a rental and valet wrapped it around a curb that cracked half of the hubcap off. Hotels generally contract valet and parking attendants from nearby parking garages. They're careless, so just do it yourself. I normally do but with a parade going on, parking was extremely limited. Other than the valet situation, it was an overall pleasant stay. Really surprised by the rate considering the hotel's location in the city and the quality. Thus, I'm returning in Dec :) Note: on the day of check-out there was a larger than life-size balloon of a bed bug in front of the hotel claiming that this property was infested with bed bugs. I certainly didn't experience that and I always do a thorough check.

Reviews.Title: “Nice size rooms and decent value for the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ghfatw
Reviews.Content: A somewhat chaotic check-in area (mainly because of its design) and a guy is always there hawking the Hilton Club on the way to the elevator *but* this is actually a very good hotel. The rooms are reasonably sized and the prices are usually fantastic. THis is the hotel Cathay Pacific uses and the location is great. The nearby hotels - the W, the Barclay, etc. -- are all much more expensive and in my view have rooms that are not that much better. Never, ever use the laundry service at the Doubletree -- use a dry cleaner in the neighborhood - the laundry service is absolutely appalling. And the gym at 24 hour fitness around the corner is a lot better than the hotel gym (which is pretty bad). Not a perfect place to stay but at its price point it is really good value.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: andrea424
Reviews.Content: Very clean, I would stay there again! I went to a concert and got a good deal on this hotel. I loved the cookie you receive when you arrive, and I also loved the scent of the soap in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, good location”
Reviews.Author: TashaLin
Reviews.Content: All the staff here were very friendly. Small rooms, but comfortable beds, good views out the windows facing down Lexington. Yummy cookies available for the asking. Easy walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and the cookie”
Reviews.Author: Dartheboy
Reviews.Content: Second time to NYC and booked here for location. Beside everything we wanted to do, so location location location is what we wanted, and we got it. Room was small as are all in NYC, but the cookie was a nice touch at check in. Hotel is clean and staff are nice. We used them to book tickets for a show (phantom) and all was organised including a car to the show. Bar wasn't great to many suits & laptops at 12am for my liking, lads at 12/1 am in the morning you are impressing no one. Sub station 2 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, quiet, good quality hotel in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: coraclara
Reviews.Content: I don't normally stay in midtown east as it is usually too expensive for me, but I got a great priceline bid my own price, and got this hotel. It is on Lexington Ave kitty corner from the Waldorf Astoria, and a block east of St Patricks Cathedral. A lovely area of town, and close enough to walk to Central Park (6-7 blocks northwest, (Grand Central Station - 2-3 blocks south), and Times Square (5 blocks west - it goes Lexington, Madison, Park, 5th, 6th, 7th & Times Square). Great location. There is a subway staion outside the hotel as well in case you need it. This hotel is an easy 20 minute yellow cab taxi ($28 + tip) from LGA airport, and all around, very convenient. A negative would be that at 1pm, our room was not ready for check in, and although we only travelled with a carry on each, we had to pay to check the bags for an hour while we went to eat something while they were finishing the rooms. We also had to pay when we picked them up. The concierge said $1.00 each bag at drop off and $1.00 per bag at pick up. When I went to do this, the man taking the bags wanted double until i called him on it...I told him what concierge told me the price was and then he said "I guess I'll split the difference then.". I reported the price discrepency to the same concierege, and he didn't seem suprised or to care. Little dod these people know that I have spent a lot of time in new York, and I am not a chump. I have to wonder if he would have done the same to a man??? Anyway, other than that, ther is no free wifi in the rooms (it is $14.95 per 24 hour period), and the lobby was to smoky smelling for me to use the free wifi there. A little plus, the room we had (645) was on the non-street side of the hotel, and although not a great view, it compensated in how nice and quiet it was. It was a non-smoking double, and had plenty of room. No fridge in the rooms, but the beds were comfortable, the tv was good, and there was a safety deposit box. The beds were comfortable as well. the bathrooms were on the small side, but had full tub and good water pressure shower. Lots of towels and soaps and a hair dryer that worked fine. All in all, a great stay. The warm chocolate chip cookies upon check in (and any time my young daughter asked nicely) were delicious as others have mentioned!! Would recommend this hotel to adults and families alike.

Reviews.Title: “Horible hotel not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelto_11
Reviews.Content: So i got this hotel through an opaque provider, at about 40% off. The hotel is in a nice location, close to Grand Central, Rockefeller, Times square, and transit. The lobby is nice. It's close to transit. Now for what is bad... They claimed they had no non-smoking kings, even though they were still selling them on their website, as they were not sold out! They offered us a smoking king, or a room with 2 doubles. We chose the doubles. But this is not why I am upset at this hotel. While they put some money into the upkeep of the common areas, lobby/hallways, the room is atrocious! The headboards were disgusting, the carpet stained and dirty looking. The tub was deplorable. There were stains on both the outside and inside, and I wonder if it has had a good clean in a long time. The wallpaper was peeling from the walls. The water in the sink comes out with such force, and is difficult to regulate, so you end up splashing yourself, as well as the entire bathroom. The room "felt"dirty. It was just not up to Doubletree, or even Comfort Inn standards! They claim to be doing a renovation in 2012. Until that time, I would advise staying FAR away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business and tourists”
Reviews.Author: Barby1301
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for four days and were pleasantly surprised by what a great hotel this turned out to be. The rooms were much larger than other hotels in Manhatten that we have stayed in. The room was spotless and we slept well in the comfortable beds. The location was perfect for us. The hotel is in a safe neighborhood and within a short distance to Times Square, Rockelfellar Center and subways. The only criticism was that the conciege was not helpful. It seemed we knew more about New York then she did.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but hotel needs upkeep”
Reviews.Author: JRMiller07
Reviews.Content: Like other reviews mentioned, this hotel is in need of upkeep/renovation. It's in a great location, right next to a subway stop, and we had a good experience with the staff we encountered. However the wallpaper was peeling in our room, the tub didn't drain well, we waited a long time for an elevator, etc. But, given the amount of time we spent in the room, it served our needs. I was glad we got a good deal on it given the room's condition.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice but expected more for the price.”
Reviews.Author: crazypretty
Reviews.Content: The lobby, hallways and bar area are very nice. Modern, clean and one thing you notice is the very strong and pleasant smell to the place. It all ends there. Once you step into the hotel room it's like you've been transported back into the 1950s and the smell is awful! Muggy, moldy and stale. The rooms are ugly, outdated and lack any charm. I called to the front desk to ask about moving and they basically told me nothing was available but they could send a janitor to spray the room. He came up and gave the room two little mists and it did nothing. I spent $20 in febreeze to try and remedy the room's offensive odor. Little worked, but thankfully I wasn't in the room much. The location is wonderful but for the price with no fridge, water, coffee maker and the overwhelming odor, I wouldn't stay there again. It's pretty ridiculous. Maybe rip out the soggy, offensively molded wall paper and I'd give it another go.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Boab11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel room for 4 nights and had a pleasant stay. This hotel has a superb location with loads of sight seeing and shopping trips within a short walk. Slightly disappointed with the standard of the rooms but they were clean and the maid service was good. Staff were very helpful and friendly especially Rafael the bell boy and Juan Carlos who served me every morning at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: patricia_1057
Reviews.Content: This was the first time staying in a Doubletree -- and I'll tell you, they really know how to set the positive mood right away. #1 We drove up to the hotel and someone was there ready to pick up luggage and park our car for us. Normally, I prefer to do everything myself, but I haven't been to NYC since I was 10, and everything was a bit chaotic, so we appreciated someone handling the car for us right away. THEN - we check in and they hand us WARM chocolate chip cookies. Wow, talk about the key to our hearts! It doesn't disguise that the prices in NYC are ridiculous, but if you're looking for a clean stay (I'd heard horror stories about bed bugs, etc.), then this is a great place, but it's a great location for getting around. Opt-out of breakfast in the morning as it's super expensive and you can grab Starbucks just on the corner. Parking was also quite expensive - $48 a night - but it was a relief to know the car was locked up in their parking garage and we didn't have to worry about it. Overall, a nice hotel --- though, beware of the bell hops, they're super competitive with each other and they tend to put customers in awkward situations (i.e. who grabbed your luggage first?). p.s. Writing this review as I was happy with our stay but some of the reviews before we left freaked me out a bit. It's true the rooms are small - but you're in NYC for pete's sakes!

Reviews.Title: “Small very basic rooms, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: abigail_flutterby
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the rooms in the hotel - very pokey and fairly dated. Needs an overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, but the 4-star rating is misleading”
Reviews.Author: wroddick
Reviews.Content: Scored this property on a very attractive last-minute Priceline bid. My stay was fine, but I can see why others take issue with positive reviews. First, the 4-star rating is inaccurate; it's more like a 3- or maybe a 3.5-star. The lobby is nice and seems to be a gathering place, but that's because it's the only free WiFi hotspot in the hotel and no one feels like shelling out the extra $16 to have WiFi in their room. The rooms themselves are dated and look tired, and, although I have no reason to think they're exceptionally dirty, you just don't feel like walking around barefoot. But that's the worst of it. The beds are clean and bug-free, TVs are nice, and showers get REALLY hot. The staff is friendly although busy, and the location is within walking distance to everything most tourists will be interested in and is subway accessible. This place is probably a good deal if the price is right; if you're looking at a rack rate, you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disregard bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Together85
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Monday 9/5/11. Disregard all the bad reviews. We did have to wait a bit for our room but it was ready right at 3pm like they said. Yes, they should open the bar area earlier like 12:00pm (nnon) would be good. The room was great, bathroom was small but nice. Bed and pillows were great and we slept very well. Had a room on the back side on the 15th floor, smoking room and it did not smell like smoke at all. There was laundry in the hall but it is to be expected. The cleaning crew had it all gone by 5:00pm. They only have one house keeper per floor, 19 floors, so they did a good job considering. Not sure if I would call this a 4 star hotel closer to a 3 or 3.5. Great location and a great deal for the money. If you want a 4 or 5 star spend the $500.00 plus and stop bad mouthing a good place! We would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sillybillyteely
Reviews.Content: I go to NYC 3 times a year just for fun, and always stay at different hotels. I usually stay in hotels anywhere from 20th Street to 30th Street locations at boutique hotels, but this time I opted for this 51st Street location. I've never stayed at a Hilton property before, and I was pleasantly surprised at the excellent service this hotel had. I arrived at 10:00 a.m., but was not able to check in, so I took my luggage to the ladies' room, and changed clothes as I was going to a show at 2:00 pm. I asked if I could check in, just to give me a call, but was not expecting to receive a call until 3:00 pm. At 11:30 am, I received a call that my room was ready. So I ran back to the hotel, got to the room, unpacked, and changed clothes again. I walked over to the St. James Theatre at 44th Street and saw Hair. Came back, and the hotel was really busy. There is a very convenient little coffee shop next door, and I went there the next morning and picked up a coffee and a chocolate crossaint. The subway is right beside the hotel, and I took the #6 train down to NOLITA and went shopping. I also took the subway down to 42nd Street, and changed to another line and went over to the west side to Chelsea Market. The location of the Doubletree is excellent, as you can either take the subway, or you can walk to most of the sites. I checked out 2 days later, and they held my luggage, so I walked over to MOMA for the afternoon. The hotel has a lot of services, and the service people are very well trained. I asked for an ice bucket and received it within 1 minute. My shower could not turn on, and the engineer came within 2 minutes, and fixed it. They have a large HD television, and it has HBO. The cleaning ladies are quick and efficient. They start cleaning up the rooms around 9:00 am. I asked for some more towels and they gave them to me. This room was larger than what I have had in the boutique hotels. They have a business center so you can print your boarding pass. They have a nice bar, and a very large lobby where most people were on their laptops. I really liked this hotel, I felt safe here, I liked the coffee shop next door, and I liked that the subway was right at the door. There's a great place to buy wine, its called Graybar, and its south on Lexington about 5 blocks down. When I picked up my luggage, the bellman offered me a limo ride to LGA for only $35. What a steal. Its costs $75-$90 in Chicago to take a limo to O'Hare airport. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory; cookies but no coffee”
Reviews.Author: Joanne0012
Reviews.Content: Won this room on Priceline and was concerned about comfort/cleanliness after reading the reviews. Relieved to find that my room was clean enough, not musty or smelly (bath exhaust fan ran quietly but continuously), also not noisy despite overlooking the fire engines on 51st Street (high floor might have helped with this). Main area of queen-bed room was spacious by NY standards and well-furnished. Very handy to #6 subway line, so it's convenient to many uptown and downtown destinations as well as Midtown East; crosstown bus on 50th too. Metro Cafe next door has extensive food options including takeout hot breakfast and is open 6AM-midnight. Staff pleasant but very busy. Would not rebook by choice since it lacked two amenities that are important to me: in-room free Wifi and coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “In a good spot for Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: lmeegan
Reviews.Content: I come to Manhattan for work and always stay here. It's conveniently located to many favorite tourist spots as well as my work, so it works out well. The hotel bar is really nice, always packed and serves up a good drink here and there. Right across the street kitty corner is a starbucks for the diehards. The rooms are decent sized for a New York hotel (some can be quite small) and comfortable and clean. Convenient gift shop for snacks or quick souveniers. Shopping is within walking distance in just about any direction.

Reviews.Title: “Ants and mold in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Daytontraveler767
Reviews.Content: Currently staying here, only one more night thank goodness. Stayed here a couple of years ago and it was fine. This time, it is a dump. Bathroom wallpaper is dirty and coming off the wall, mold growing. Tile grout is filthy. Worst, ants on bathroom floor. Was out all day yesterday, returned after six pm, and room had not been made up, the maid said they had a bad day! They sure made my day bad! There is more, but think you can get the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Spend a Hurricane!!”
Reviews.Author: CeremoniesbyNan
Reviews.Content: When in the Big Apple, consider a stay at the Doubletree in Midtown!! It is close to everything and the staff is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “The greatest location but overall very poor in everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clarence41
Reviews.Content: The only saving grace of this hotel is it's location.It is in the heart of Manhattan. Whatever direction you will go,it will only take you at least 15 minutes tops walking. The subway is just outside of the hotel.Perfect Location BUT aside from this, nothing is endearing with this hotel. The staff are rude,abrupt!! I believe it's bec.. they are always busy! the front desk is always with so much people and the staff are not approachable and unfriendly as well.the rooms are "dirty" .The carpets very old and tattered and looks "dirty" . The walls of the rooms are quite thin and you can hear your neighbor.Also, bec. of the location, everyday,you hear sirens and so much noise from the outside of the hotel.The housekeepers are all very loud when they clean the rooms, "banging"and talking loudly to each other while doing their tasks.Metro Cafe is just beside the hotel, good food but again, the cashiers when their "busy",well, let's say,even when the Hurricane was in town and this is the only restaurant available,i will decline! Very poor in SERVICE orientation.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: therodger
Reviews.Content: Doubletree should be ashamed. Not only was this hotel not up to its standards (the room was horrible and smelled). The service was deplorable. I called ahead of time to ask some questions, when I arrived I learned I had been lied to and none of the information (this was regarding parking) I had been given from an onsite employee was correct. Parking turned into a fiasco. The staff was rude upon arrival and unwilling to help in anyway. Please don't stay at this hotel and save yourself some serious heartburn.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews, this place is wonderful and affordable”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy797
Reviews.Content: The bad reviews nearly sent us elsewhere so I just want to report: the staff was absolutely charming and helpful, from the front desk to the concierge to the guy who carried up our suitcases with a smile-- and this was right before Hurricaine Irene. When we left early the hotel accomodated our needs and helped us check out quickly. We had a lovely allergy-free room (which smelled a little perfumy but we had a great night's sleep), the location is AMAZING and the lobby is nice. Yes the hallways need some updating. Yes room service and breakfast is a huge rip off-- there's a sweet little cafe right next door for one tenth the price. Yes they should offer free wireless in the rooms. But my husband says it's the best and cleanest workout space he has ever seen. We have nothing but good to say about the whole experience and we will definitely be back! Great cookies, too!

Reviews.Title: “5 problems with the high rating for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: minimktgmom
Reviews.Content: 5. Peeling wallpaper 4. Dingy and dark 3. Hair dryer did not work 2. No room service between breakfast and dinner 1. No coffee in the room! To top it off I did not get my Hilton honors because I did not book through Hilton. That has never happened before. I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “utilitarian and clean with a good east midtown location”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Although a bit on the Eastern side of Manhattan, this hotel has a good location with close walking proximity to many midtown businesses and tourist sites. Overall the hotel is nice and clean, although a bit utilitarian - especially for the price paid. The rooms are good, but basic. The furniture works, but is small (as are the rooms). The bathroom is nice, but (again) very basic. As far as the hotel amenities are concerned, as with other hotels in the Hilton chain, if you are Honors Gold or Platinum, you get free wifi access. There is a small gym with 24 hour entry for hotel guests. This hotel makes for a decent night stay, although not New York elegant or trendy by any stretch.

Reviews.Title: “I love it”
Reviews.Author: Maryellen70
Reviews.Content: The service is wonderful! I have stayed there several times and have never been disappointed. The rooms are very clean and the bed is very comfortable. I cannot say enoughtgood things about the staff. Terri makes you feel like they are happy you are there. She is very accomodating and a great asset to the hotel. Although it is not a small hotel, they are very personable. I will stay there again!!!!!!!!!! Hated to leave. You can't go wrong. Close to subway, shopping, restaurants, everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ideal place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: UkDinoDog
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel in the past 18 months. Yes the rooms do need updating but the location is perfect as a base to explore NY city. All interaction I had with staff was really positive.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Would Expect for a Large Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pollyop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week and was not impressed to say the least. First of all to pay the bellman to store your luggage while you wait for your room to be ready was RIDICULOUS. But having to pay the bellman again to retrieve your luggage was even more RIDICULOUS... Don't the bellman receive an hourly wage? Looked like they were thriving on the luggage storage/retrieval tips. Even saw a bellman in the corner counting how much he made. UTTERLY RIDICULOUS! In such a large hotel to be renovating the business center when it seemed the occupancy was high was also crazy. How can you move your business center to one of your meeting rooms and only have one desktop available? Not what you would expect for such a large hotel. Not everyone has a laptop!!!! The rooms were also not in the best conditions either. The bathrooms needed some work. The rooms needed renovating. The fitness center smelled MOLDY!!!! The best thing about the room was the flat screen tv. Also the fact that a restaurant was beside it and the subway was within walking distance. Would not recommend this hotel and would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Back Until the Rooms are Renovated.”
Reviews.Author: TXtraveler4life
Reviews.Content: If you don't care about the smelly, musty rooms, then you won't have any issues with this hotel. The staff is very nice and pleasant. It's a great location for business travelers and tourists. However, bring a bottle of Febreeze with you because you will need it. I also read the reviews that some travelers experienced issues with bed bugs. I am very happy to report that I didn't experience bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sorcha1700
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set in a great place for touring NY.It is 3 blocks straight ahead of the hotel to get to Times Square.You pass the Met on the way there and it is very near to the hop on hop off bus collection point.The Hotel is very clean and comfortable and is just like hotels at home which was great.As we were told going to America-the hotel rooms are quite small-but this was not.We booked a package without breakfast because we dont really eat much at that time in the morning.But one morning we desided to go and try the breakfast-we just wanted 2 sausages and toast-no matter what you had they charged us the same price as a full breakfast and for the two of us it cost $60.It was a disgrace hence the fact we did not eat there again we then tried the metro next door a small restraunt which we got what we wanted and it was cheaper the staff in there are not very nice but at least you get what you pay for.The conseirge down stairs in the hotel was very nice and helpful.We wanted to make the most of our trip so we got up each morning at 6am and by the 4th day we had everything covered-all the sites in the city.We wish we had travelled onto Boston and looked at somewhere different as we found ourselves getting bored.All in all this is a good hotel and if we did go back there in the future we would stay here as you are gaurenteed comfort and a clean place to stay! Also just to tell other people the taxi costs $46 into the city and $52 back to JFK that is a yellow taxi-the hotel will try and pawn you with a catalack-this will cost you a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Wiz
Reviews.Content: We went into NYC to show some overseas friends a first look at the city. Convenience was most important since we only had one night and half each of two days. This location was top notch. We checked in a little early and they only had one of our three rooms available, but they identified the other two and "held" them so that they could not be reassigned so that we were all only a few doors apart. The hotel is well located just a few blocks north of Grand Central and a few east of Rockefeller Center. The staff could not have been more delightful. I am a gold member of Hilton Honors so we received continental breakfast - but she gave it to me for my friends as well. That certainly was "above".... Also, each time we went into the lobby we were greeted and asked how they could help. We didn't have a meal, other than the breakfast, but we had cocktails in the lobby bar which was very nice as well. I would definitely recommend this to anyone for a nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: KRenee1975
Reviews.Content: My family and I visit relatives in New York once every summer and have stayed at this hotel each time for the past 7 years. We just got back today from this year's trip and I felt the need to write this review. In the past we have never looked anywhere else. We found this hotel and were hooked from the get go. It was clean, staff was friendly, price was good and the location was great. Also, a wonderful, deliciously warm cookie upon check in was a great touch. There is also a great cafe next door. As a result, we have continued to return. Unfortunately, this time was a little different. We checked in and were NOT offered a cookie. After checking into our room, the first thing I noticed was that it appeared as though our room had not been vacuumed. Also, the vent cover on the air conditioner unit had fallen off and was on the floor. The shower head was old and impossible to adjust (it wanted to spray the wall). My feeling overall was that is just isn't as nice as it used to be. Where as the lobby/bar area still looks great, I feel as though the rooms are looking a bit "run down". I am not quite sure they are as well maintained as they once had been. As a result, I will probably be looking elsewhere next year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveltracy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NY and we were not sure what to expect, but the hotel is a fantastic location and the staff could not have been more helpful! I am a Hilton Honors member so I made my reservations online w/Hilton but had to contact the hotel as we were travelling with our 16 year old daughter and her friend to make sure that we would have connecting rooms and they were very helpful. Rooms were small -- but thats New York! Very clean rooms and property -- our window looked out over the police station and we thought it would be noisy, but they had great soundproofing! Would definitely stay here again -- and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “terrible/not recommendable place”
Reviews.Author: meanjeaniebean
Reviews.Content: we are very disappointed staying 2 days to double tree 569 lexington ny. room 351 besides how outrageous price the room is dirty bed bites bugs & the door deadvolt locks did not work & safety chain is torn out the door , which i was terrified to sleep through the nite feeling someone can easily break-in.I even put a chair against the door just for a liitle security.dont even have exhaust fan in the bathroom or little portable fridge. & NO ice in the machine, evenmore worst is your food is bad & very expensive with 2 eggs & toast is cost $25.oo (the toast is cold & egg is runny) & the juice is another extra $5.00 for a little glass of orange juice...to make it short it was a horroble experienced... i would not recommend your place at all...

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again next time we come to NYC”
Reviews.Author: brookeb80
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is conveniently located on the corner of 51st St. and Lexington Ave. Which means it is within walking distance to both Central Park, and Times Square. And you can get on the Subway right outside the hotel to visit Little Italy, Chinatown, the World Trade Center... The service was great. Franklin at the front desk helped our trip go from good to great, and we loved seeing Bolivar every morning in The Met for breakfast. Everyone we saw was very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Decent NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmorrison
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Doubletree a couple of times for business trips. The location is great (the 6 is right outside, so you can transfer to just about anywhere). The rooms are small, but that's to be expected in a city like NYC. I thought the rooms were fairly quiet considering it's on a major street.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: gm21465
Reviews.Content: Don't let the picture of the room on the website fool you. It looks nothing like that bright, clean room. Our room smelled so bad!!!! Our family had two rooms and they both smelled like a musty basement. Our clothing smelled so bad when we returned home. The room never really cooled off. The bathroom vanity was rusty and water damaged. I wish I would have taken a picture to post. There were hairs all over the bathroom. The carpet was filthy! Room service trays and empty glasses sat in the hallway for over a day before being picked up. The building on the outside is the ugliest building in NYC. The lobby smelled so strongly like a deodorizer/perfume, it made me nauseated. In the evening, when it was time for our family to return to the hotel, we became depressed!! Nothing 4 star about this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, decent room”
Reviews.Author: magnif
Reviews.Content: My wife and I appreciated the friendly greeting and warm cookies as went to check in. The reception area has a warm decor and flows nicely into the bar. The room was pretty big for NYC though we didn't get the king size bed the reserved. Room service food was good, though they did screw up the drink order. Bathroom was not cleaned up to expectations as there were stray hairs in the bathtub that we had to clean away before bathing our baby. All in all a pretty OK hotel experience. Good for families thanks to the rooms size.

Reviews.Title: “Near to everything hotel, and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Josean_7
Reviews.Content: Near train #6 stop at 51st street this hotel got everything. When you are in NYC is hard to be in the room, so if you need a space for go everywhere this is the hotel. Clean and good sense in the lobby get you the imprecision of everything. Good staff that help you with everything you need to be in NYC. From train #6 get you near everyplace.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff was unfriendly and very rude!”
Reviews.Author: d2211
Reviews.Content: Just checked into the hotel and i was shocked with the service rendered by the Front office staff. The gentlemen was rude, impolite and unprofessional. I approached the front desk after check to ask for a colleagues room number, and all he said was to ask me to call the operator using the house phone. He kept pushing the responsibility to the operator even tho i was able to provide the correct details such as guest name and arrival date.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable place 0.7m from Times Sq”
Reviews.Author: jjjham69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 noights. About 20 min walk to Times Square. No room issues, simple clean rooms. Small beds Very expensive Hotel Bar. Staff helpful and accomodating. Air conditioning was so-so

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: andersaxson
Reviews.Content: Double Tree, as I understand it, are meant to be Hilton-standard hotels, but in buildings that are not purpose-built. This Double Tree needs, and is getting, a revamp (by Gensler, of Apple store design fame) and I would say it's about time. Although the hotel is not shabby, it has been left behind by new Garden Inns and alike that are probably a few dollars less to stay in. The rooms, naturally, are a bit pokey; my loo got blocked and I had to call three times (at the weekend mind); they didn't notice my HH Gold status at check-in; they also charge bag check if you check out but want to leave your bags (although apparently not on the way in). Erm, that's it I think. Location-wise it's fine (opposite the Waldorf actually) and you can easily walk three or four blocks to the upmarket shops, of across to the theatres. By the way, there was a bed-bug workers union sort of protest outside the hotel, but I had no problem whatsoever in this respect of bugs...the hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: HappyJoyousFree090
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped out onto the curb, a gentement gives me a smile. He is not fake, he is truly happy to be a New Yorker. Front desk girl very charming, and the concierge was helpful and kind. It is so nice to be at a place to rest your head where you are warmly welcomed after a long , long travel day. Happy to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Read the Terrible Comments... they are TRUE!”
Reviews.Author: Zakdrak
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Doubletree (two weeks ago) and all of the terrible reviews are completely true. I was set to stay at the hotel for two nights while on business. The front-desk staff was fine. There were hotel staff that met me in the lobby that made sure I got to the front-desk and checked-in. After I got my room key, I did get a nice warm chocolate chip cookie. The check-in process was fine. The hotel is dated and worn. The elevator floors were dirty, the carpet on each floor is dark (seems new) and the wallpaper is old. Upon entering the room... WOW, what a smell. Smelled like an old basement.. Extremely musty!!! The room was damp.. The sheets on the bed were damp, to the point that it felt almost wet. Although the days I visited NY was the hotest and humid in July... There is no reason why the room was so damp. I turned on the AC figuring the room just needed to get cool to act as a dehumidifier. I left and had dinner and walked around New York for 3 hours. When I returned.. the room was still very smelly with the must and the room was just as damp as when I left but now it was also cold. My view overlooked an adjacent apartment building. Not the best view so I just shut the shades. I called and complained about the room but they front desk said they were all booked. No rooms to be had. When I told her the room had a very bad odor. She quickly said, we can send someone up to spray. I told her no as the problem was the bathroom and it would take more than spray to fix this. I turned on the TV and the sound did not work. I turned the volume all the way up and still no sound. I called for a tech, and literally, 5 minutes before he arrived, the sound kicked in. When the tech arrived, I told him the TV now works and asked if he smelled the bad odor.. He said not really.. He is either very use to the smell or lying. There is no way he could not smell the room. The bathroom was very old and there was a slimy film on the sink. I had to use a towel to clean it. The tub and shower are very old and the ceiling was peeling. Bathroom had so many chips chips and marks, I actually thought they were bugs when I had my glasses off. I then checked Tripadvisor.com to see if other people had complained. An YES, almost everything listed in the Terrible/Bad sections was exactly what I was experiencing. I read about bed bugs and quickly check my room and bed for bugs. I did not see any, no signs of any and thank god, that was clean. I had a bad night sleeping at the smell started to make me sick and the cold damp room made me actually wake up shivering. Before I went to bed, I called the front desk and told them I will not be staying a second night. No way in hell! I checked out at 5:00 AM, went and changed my train tickets and left a day early than planned due to the room. I then sat outside my office building for three hours waiting for the staff to arrive rather than having to spend one more sicking minute in the room . Horrible, horrible and horrible. If you like rooms that are cold, damp and VERY, VERY smelly like and old basement where water has been sitting for years, then this is the hotel for you. The staff was fine although the front-desk person responded to my complaint without missing a breath so that leads me to believe they hear about the musty smell all the time. There was no surprise in her voice. Message to Hilton... Get your act together. Too many hotels in NYC to have to put up with that crap. A formal complaint will be going to Hilton corporate and you just lost a business account. I made sure I passed on my experience with our corporate travel group so other employees do not have to stay in the same accommodations. Report card.. Staff professionalism, courtesy and friendly attitude â€“ A+ Accommodations â€“ F,F,F,F,F I wish there were a grade below an F.. Good luck to future guests..

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Fairly Reasonable Accomodations in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: FitDude
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan is a very old renovated hotel now branded as a Doubletree. It enjoys a great location about a 15 minute walk to Times Square and excellent access to all major subway lines. The relatively small lobby can be quite busy, and non-Hilton Honors members will experience a wait to check-in during peak periods (The free freshly baked chocolate chip cookies may help excuse the wait for some). My handicap accessible room on the 6th floor with a king bed was a little on the small side for hotels in this class for NYC, but still acceptable for up to 2 people. Although somewhat showing its age with some minor wear, the room was well-maintained and clean. The bed was very comfortable, and the room facing 51st St. was quiet, although rooms facing Lexington Ave. are reportedly somewhat louder based on comments from a business associate who also stayed in the same hotel. In the middle of a record heat wave (100F/38C), my room's AC performed exceptionally. The staff was very helpful in every way. In room internet costs $14.95/day but is free in the Lobby and Bar, although internet speeds were painfully slow when many users were logged on in these areas. The 24 Hour Business Center offers 4 computer terminals and a printer all at no charge, but there was often a wait. The gym is a PRECOR equipment branded facility and well equipped. My major complaint (and the only reason it did not receive the highest rating) was the lack of in-room coffee makers which I was advised was a recent development and according to staff members, the subject of many complaints. Room Service promptly delivered a requested pot of hot water for $1.50+gratuity adding insult to this unacceptable lack of what should be a basic amenity in a hotel of this class. Also on the subject of hot water, in the mornings, my showers were hot with good pressure, although in the evenings, the water temperature dropped off somewhat, and while still warm, did not compare to the mornings. Very few hotels in Manhattan with this prime of a location and level of amenities can be considered bargains, but if you can get this one for $225/night or less during peak periods, it is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mgt_lee
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in March, right in the middle of Manahtten easy walk to all the places you expect to see when you go to New York. Rooms very clean didnt eat there because it was so ner to all the great food places to have breakfast especially right opposite Garnd Central Station. Would stay thee again as the location is a walk away from Times Square 5th Avenue Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: pcp0827
Reviews.Content: OK, it is not the Waldorf Astoria or some uber-trendy boutique hotel in Tribeca, but the Doubletree Metropolitan is WONDERFULLY located, it is clean, it is comfortable, and the price is often right.

Reviews.Title: “Dramatically Over rated”
Reviews.Author: threekidsCt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 4 star on several sites, a poor "2 star" at best. Common areas are worn, room was dirty, bathroom was musty, wall paper riped/hanging in room and a rude front desk agent, rugs were not vacuumed, etc. The only positive, the night manager was very professional in reconciling my reservation. As an intensive business traveler, Hilton was always a brand you could trust, no so much anymore, This hotel should be rated 2 stars and I was VERY motivatd to check out, for by the way over $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “No, thank you”
Reviews.Author: EvanPSP
Reviews.Content: I didn't care for this hotel. I stayed here for 3 nights on business. This hotel was tired in every since of the way. Even though it appears to be re-done, it looks very dated. The rooms have a lot of dirt, chips, and appears very tattered. The service was sloppy, the food mediocre. This hotel isn't worth more than $199 per night in the busiest of times. For business travelers who want even an average hotel experience, this hotel will disappoint. Never again for me.

Reviews.Title: “Got the job done”
Reviews.Author: Othello491
Reviews.Content: First off, I used priceline to book the room, and for a rate of $105/night + tax, I was quite happy to get a hotel in this part of New York. With that in mind, I don't think I overpaid for the quality I got. Pros: -Great location with probably the best transportation connections you'll get on the east side of New York. The 4,5,6, and E trains are all within close proximity, and therefore, the rest of the city is accessible. -Efficient staff. No, they're not particularly friendly, but they weren't rude either. I lost my key, and they replaced it quickly. -Delicious cookie at check-in. -Comfortable beds, new LCD TV, Crabree & Evelyn toiletries, and decent-sized rooms (meaning huge for NYC) Cons: -Paying $10/day for Internet? Um, no. -Tiny bathrooms. I don't need a gigantic bathroom, but I couldn't open the door all the way without hitting the toilet. -I'm pretty sure that I specified a non-smoking room, but I ended up in a smoking one. Ultimately, it didn't matter because there wasn't a smoky smell, but I didn't like how I was told that they'd have to wait to see if a non-smoking room became available. Being tired upon my arrival, I just took the smoking room. Wrap-up: I guess that the staff can rub some people the wrong way, but I didn't find their attitudes an issue. The rooms are a little bit dated, but as long as the decor isn't hideous, I don't really care. At the end of the day, I'd gladly stay at the Doubletree Metropolitan again, but only if I get the same kind of rate that I got on Priceline. Anything more than that would be a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money!!!”
Reviews.Author: chocolate464
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently traveled to NYC and stayed at the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel. With the exception of a very friendly, polite, and professional staff, this hotel was the worst!!! We thought we would stay here and couldn't go wrong because of the location and the other luxury hotels that are on the same block (the "W" and The Marriott). Boy were we wrong. For starters our room was not ready when we checked in that evening (around 7:45pm). When we finally checked into our room, the room was very small, old and dated. The door still had a chain on it for security. Our air conditioner was not working properly, which meant it was hot and we baked in our room the first night. When we alerted the hotel's front desk they sent an engineer to our room to change the filter in the air conditioning unit. The filter looked as it hadn't been changed in a couple of years. And to add insult to injury they charged $48.00 for parking. Not $48.00 a night (which I had no problem with because it's NYC) but, $48.00 dollars every time you wanted to take your vehicle out of the garage in less than a 24 hour period. Amazing!!! This has got to be the worst hotel that we have stayed in in NYC. There is no possible way they can compete with the other hotels on that block. You would assume that because of the location and the Hilton name behind it, it would be really nice. NOT!!!!! The only reason I gave this rating two stars is because of the staff who were professional. If I could take this staff out of this hotel and put them in a "real luxury" hotel that would be great. If Mr. Hilton would take time and invest money into his hotels instead of letting his daughter spend his money on all the non sense that she does, he would make be on point!!! Don't waste your money or time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was great and I don't understand all the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: kellyjlm2
Reviews.Content: It is not the Ritz, but I didn't expect it to be and I was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was given some of the real negative comments on this site. Everyone was pleasant and ready to please. The room was small, but clean with comfortable beds and sheets. The only complaint is that they didn't give us enough washclothes and towels and we had to ask from more twice. There were 4 of us in the room - 2 mother daughter teams. It was hard to find 2 double or queen beds at a decent price. The location was great too. A happy customer.

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot of bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: BraintreeMADjc
Reviews.Content: Could not check in early, not even an hour early!! ended up getting checked in after the posted check in time. Bar was not open, so just had to mill about in the lobby while waiting. front desk staff was very helpful. Room was kinda crappy, peeling paint and paper in the bathroom. Location was a bit of a walk from Times Sq, but very good otherwise. Also, fire station is on side street and can be heard if you happen to be on that side of the hotel. Exercise room was a nice bonus,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great potential”
Reviews.Author: Fijura
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree Metropolitan for a few nights in June. It is in a great location in Mid Town, easy to walk to most places, if not there were 2 subway stations very close by and more line choices only a couple of blocks further. Hotel has amazing potential - rooms are a good size just very tired. They had artists impressions of the new rooms on the wall in the lobby and it looks like it will be fabulous when they have been done. I can cope with the tired rooms if the service matches, and sometimes it did but other times, it was very bad. One member of staff in the bar was fabulous but then the other member of the team on with him was downright rude to customers (not to me personally, but to the people sitting beside me) Slightly off putting checking in with the giant blow up rat outside but having read the information under the rat - it's not even to do with this hotel but another hotel owned by the same company who didn't use union members for something! Did feel sorry for the hotel as this is should not be the first impression for their guests and is not their fault. Would probably stay again once the rooms have been done as location was great and majority of staff were very helpful just an unfortunate few who made a very bad impression.

Reviews.Title: “Simply horrible!”
Reviews.Author: dcor5
Reviews.Content: Our stay started with the desk clerk being very rude, then we were assigned what we think must have been the worst room on the property. As we walked in, the room smelled musty, the bathroom door had dirt streaks and hair stuck to it, the thermostat could not be adjusted, the rug was worn and the only way you could get to the opposite side of the bed was single file pushing the desk chair all the way in. It was one of the tiniest rooms weâ€™ve ever been issued at the Hilton properties worldwide. We would not reccomend this property to any one. The only good part was the free cookies!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Calculus17
Reviews.Content: The hotel met all expectations for a hotel of it's class in New York city. For us, the location was great. It was a train ride away from popular attractions (empire state, statue of liberty) but we saved a bundle. The building engineer was extremely nice and helpful as he explained several things about the city and the hotel, sparked from an informal conversation outside the hotel. Would have been nice to have free WIFI but a Starbucks was a block away.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: flyguywestend2
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Mid-priced hotel in NYC. 20-30 minute walk to the theatre district so kind of far if you'rein town to see shows. Rooms and common areas a bit on the worn side. hallways on some floors had a musty, smelly odor. Water pressure in bathrooms very good. Excercise room has good quality equipment but it's obvious the equipment is not serviced as treadmills are not calibrated and very shakey when running. My biggest issue with this hotel is that the hotel advertises 'queen' beds. These beds are not queen beds. They are double beds. Talked to the manager in reagrd to this and he insisted they are queens. Which, again, they are not. Intend on contacting Hilton and Expedia (who we booked through) to inform them. All in all, the hotel is fine. We paid $150.00 per night over the fourth of July weekend, which is pretty decent for NYC

Reviews.Title: “It functions, not much else”
Reviews.Author: gbmateo
Reviews.Content: I can't add much vs. what the others have said. In general, the hotel rooms are old, musty and need to be redone. A couple of quick points. Pros: --Good location on Lexington --Staff was pleasant --Nearby food was decent (but it is NYC so I think there is good food all over) --Price: I think my company paid ~$200 which I didn't think was horrible for that Hotel and location in NYC Cons: --Old rooms, need to be completely redone. No details since it is literally everything about them. I would stay there again on personal business but would not pay more than ~$150 until the hotel does its remodel

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a long weekend in NYC's Midtown East”
Reviews.Author: diannelinchangco
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a 3 night stay under Expedia's unpublished rate for a 4 star hotel in Midtown and ended up at this Doubletree. Definitely a renovated hotel that shows its cracks (peeling wallpaper, painted bathroom door, rips in shower curtain). Despite those flaws, it's a clean place to lay your head in between street fests, Yankee games, 5th Avenue shopping, and Central Park running. Their welcome chocolate chip cookies are delicious and unlimited! Just stop by the front desk and they'll be happy to hand you more than one warm cookie at a time! The fitness center is small and a bit stuffy but it's small windows look out onto Lexington and 51st Avenue. They have about 5 Precor treadmills, two ellipticals, two stationary bikes, a set of free weights, medicine balls, a couple Swiss balls, and some other weight machines. Thought it was nice that each cardio machine had it's own personal tv and they do lend out headphones if you've forgotten your pair. Small towels and a watercooler are also provided. The number one selling point of this hotel is its central location. -17th NYPD precinct...0.5 blocks -McDonald's...1 block (directly one block behind hotel) -CVS...2 blocks -subway station (6)...literally right outside the hotel Less than a 15 minute walk to Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, Time Square, museums, etc. Tips: -buy the 7 day unlimited ride MTA pass for $29 (I was only there for 3 days and had to add to my about $10 to my $20 10-ride card that I purchased from a Hudson News stand at Laguardia). -catch the free Staten Island Ferry to get a great view of the city skyline and pass by the Statue of Liberty. ferries leave every half hour and is an hour roundtrip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a dump but not like a Hilton-”
Reviews.Author: CamillaLejon
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this hotel and will do so a few more nights. I was a bit hesitant reading some of these reviews before arriving. Some people seems to love this hotel and some people think it is a dump..I do not understand either so here comes my opinion! Please notice that I am a Gold Hiltonhonors and by that I am a frequent traveller at both Hiltons and Radisson hotels from LA to Beijing to London etc.. LOCATION: very good, nice area and very close to everything. Walk to Times Square in about 15 minutes. STANDARD public areas: the lobby is very smart looking and so is the Met grill where you eat breakfast. STANDARD rooms: well..the furniture is pretty new, the beds are very nice but the room itself look old. The finish is not high quality, looking at hanging wallpaper in the bathroom, bad paint jobs on the bathroom door etc..The bathroom is very small but the room is pretty large (2 double bedded room). SERVICE: not what I expect from a Hilton Hotel. When we checked in the lady was searching for a room for at least 10 minutes..asking questions like" do you need two beds" - well we are 3 persons and I booked a room with 2 beds!! She then said "and you are staying for one night?? We had booked a 5-night stay..she also forgot to give us our voucher for 10% discount at Macys. If I come to a hotel, paying 300USD/night and has booked a 5 night stay- I want to feel welcomed! Yes, we got the cookies but I do not really understand what the point is with that cookie... CLEAN? OK. No problems. BREAKFAST: not as many items as Hilton usually has but fine. Good quality scrambled eggs, salmon, bacon, waffles, fresh fruit etc.. GYM: pretty good. Our son used it several times and was very happy with it. NOICE? The hotel has a police station and a fire station outside. We heard some signals before we fell asleep but after that, we heard nothing. AIR CONDITION: Noicy and not working so well. BED BUGS? None so far. So all together: for a very good deal, I might stay here again since the bed is very nice and the location is excellent! They need however to change the attitude among some of the staff. I am a paying guest and even a frequent Hilton guest so I expect the staff to be informed about my booking, give me the correct information with a smile and make me feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “An Overrated Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: DMSVirginia
Reviews.Content: Listed as 4 star property, it is NOT. it is just worn and tired: old carpets in the rooms, pealing wallpaper, moldy and musty bathrooms the size of closets. OK, they are trying with newer linens and bedding, but this is the only hotel in NY I have stayed at that came with ear plugs next to the bed: a hint about a peaceful nights rest. Scheduled for a refurb next year, talk about their rating then, not now. Normal New York $15 per night internet scam. The staff was courteous and helpful, a plus, but no hint about what awaits you in your room. Wake up Hilton! This is not a property I would put my name on.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: jaiuk_10
Reviews.Content: Thought i should finally write about this hotel, firstly new york is absolutely amazing wanted to go their my whole life and was so happy when this trip a this hotel had been booked by suprise!! This hotel is beautiful, rooms were a good size, nice bathroom and HUGE bed! location was excellent, literally walked to time square as soon as we dumped our cases at about 12am! staff were really friendly and also id like to point out, everyone use to tell me that new york was worse than london for rude people (im not a fan of london), but new york for me anyway was completely different! it was friendly random people would say hi n start talking and they are not shy in giving compliments!! its not as expensive as everyone may think, taxis are cheap, and we got the subway a number of times, would recommend getting bus from port authority to woodbury common outlet, nice clothes for CHEAP!!. also try get down to ground zero, very moving and strange as it may sound, its actually quiet down there... its something else. WHEN not if i go back to new york will definitely try to book this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Like an army camp”
Reviews.Author: christinebNottingham
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in hotels of this level all over the world for the last 30 years and have never had any real complaints before. The female reception staff were brutal - at every level there was no warmth. The male staff by comparison were warm and helpful. Full rate prices paid in advance in England two months before but upon arrival reception said "well we never actually confirmed your booking". Then they wanted to charge another $300 extra for each of the two rooms I had booked in case we incur any charges or damage the room. When I resisted we were treated like second-class citizens afterwards, despite having spent over Â£3,000 for 6 days flights and accommodation. In fact, in one of the two rooms booked for mother and teenage son we were told that (despite having the booking receipt for two beds) we would have to share and sort it out with the booking agent on our return to England. It was only after much debate that the hotel relented. And then we were presented with a bar bill which we had not incurred and when we said we had not used the bar at all during our stay and were not even in the hotel at the time on the bar bill we were told that they would be contacting security to find evidence from the CCTV. After going back 3 times that morning to check who had fraudently used our room number we were told to forget it as - "even if it was you or your son who incurred the bill we will write it off" . An unusual form of apology. Also, the hotel had some union dispute with the fumigation company who check for bedbugs and they mounted a 30 foot high inflatable rat in front of the main reception and stopped us on our way in to tell us their complaints about the hotel - also not a good advert. Would not stay at the Hilton Doubletree Metropolitan, Lexington Avenue, NY again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant well-connected stay”
Reviews.Author: nddesai
Reviews.Content: Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel New York City Date: 24 June 2011 The hotel is economical, clean and secure. It is centrally located. There are good restaurants nearby. Transport is easily available. However, little noisy & poor bathroom facilities, which were old, though working properly. Bed linen not changed regularly and surprisingly there was some big rubber balloon rodent kept outside as a protest, warning people not to patronize the hotel as there were bed bugs. I did not find any bed bugs nor was I inconvenienced. Possibly some competitors of Doubletree giving misinformation. However, many people were put off by such bad publicity in this hotel and some others in New York.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: ifestio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week, and we had everything we need. It is noy so luxury, but clean, and the staff was friendly. Ther is free internet only in the lobby. Our room had no good view, but we were all day out, so doesnt matter !! Breakfast is excellent and the price for the room very good. I will definitelly be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, but the hotel needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Ring0rosie
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Good Location for shoppers, tourists and people doing business in the area. -Great customer service. Everyone was friendly, prompt, extremely helpful and I felt like they truly enjoyed having me as a guest. -Clean. -Very comfortable beds. -By NYC standards, the room size was very good. Of course, one is to expect a NYC room to be half the size of a hotel in Florida, for example. Cons: -Smelly. I am a HHonors diamond member, so typically I do get 'good' rooms; however, the first room I was given was terribly musty and smelly. They offered to have someone from housekeeping come to spray the room, but I asked for a change. The hotel was able to send up a bellman immediately to give me my new key. The new room was still smelly and was located in a completely different area of the hotel. -Shabby. The headboard is padded and in both rooms, there were notable stains. Also, the textured wallpaper was notably scuffed up. One towel in my room was noticeably worn in one area and was practically see-through. The ceiling in the bathroom was bubbled and it was clear that an old leak was painted over instead of being fixed properly. The closet door would not close properly. -Noisy. I did not notice much noise from the outside, but the hallway noise is definitely noticeable. -Room service was average at best. Although about the same price and level of service, the DoubleTree on Stone Street is a much better choice, but unfortunately, not within walking distance to my business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & good location”
Reviews.Author: mrmun
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel for three nights in June 2011. We booked the hotel through Priceline (name your own price), and paid $110 per night, about $410 total with taxes. The location of the hotel is excellent, with many restaurants and stores nearby.
