Many major hotspots are also within walking distance - Times Square, Central Park, Empire State Building, etc are all accessible by foot within 15-20 minutes. We got a queen room, on the fifth floor, overlooking the street. Although a little run down, the room was a good size, with a clean bathroom and comfortable bed. The service at the hotel was excellent. All staff were polite and courteous, and very helpful. We requested a crib and a fridge, which were promptly delivered. We didn't have a car, so parking was a non-issue. We also didn't use the fitness center, and can't comment on that. The business center had internet access and printing facilities, which we used a few times without any problems. Overall, we had a good stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, stinky rooms”
Reviews.Author: Will206
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member, so assuming I got the best treatment, this hotel is awful. If you have no Hilton status, you would probably be better off sleeping on the subway. I arrived late and was given a room on the 16th floor - smelled like an ashtray - I called downstairs and the woman said I should talk to the manager since everyone complains and she had given up. Floor 15 is smoking and the smell/smoke is all over the the 16th floor. Rooms are very shappy. Thjis hotel if just plain awful. If you are a Hilton member it has by far the worst executive lounge i have ever seen. Hilton is supposed to provide free internet for diamond members... here it's free unless you need VPN which is extra - so if you travel for work... do not stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Manse100
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the location was great, the rooms were clean, everyone was polite. If you want a nice clean hotel that is reasonably priced then look no further then this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, alwasy clean”
Reviews.Author: CSSnowshoer
Reviews.Content: I often stay here on business. Its only a couple blocks from Grand Central and very convenient. The rooms have always been clean. The desk clerks are pleasant, and they serve a nice breakfast,

Reviews.Title: “Average - but not uncomfortable.”
Reviews.Author: TimmyJamesB
Reviews.Content: The bed was comfy, we didn't notice any bed bugs, so I can't comment on that whole situation which the hotel seems to surround itself in. The staff were standoffish, which can be construed as rude I guess. I don't appreciate a bellhop telling me how much to tip him. I am an Australian, but that doesn't mean I have a pint sized brain. "3 now and three when you pick up your bags" - buddy, I guess that depends if you do a good job. The rooms are small and dated, the bathroom is tiny. But everything functions, the check in and check out was easy, and for one night, it would do. I wouldn't stay there again if I had other options. It all just seemed a little impersonal. I don't care for Hilton hotels anyway, never have.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keyla24k
Reviews.Content: Nice clean Hotel, the staff was really nice and friendly, The room was perfect specially the bed. I have no real complaints about the hotel, the location is good and I didn't pay much for the room. The Best part is after you check in and you get your key to the room you get a big warm cookies that taste so yummyyy...

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: akosz
Reviews.Content: If anyone complains about the size of the rooms at this hotel, make sure you ask them if they've ever stayed in NYC before. It's very rare to find hotels with rooms as large as these in Manhattan, let alone rooms at DoubleTree prices. Everything was clean and comfortable and the front desk was very accomodating any time we needed something. The location is excellent, very close to subways, taxi's, and Grand Central Station. I would not hesitate to stay here again. ===== ===== ===== RATING SCALE: My ratings are generally based on value vs money. Thus, sometimes a simple hotel will receive a 4 or 5, while a fancy hotel can rank a 1 or 2 if I don't feel it was worth the cost. Also, a hotel can do everything right and still only rank as a 4, unless there's something really exceptional about it. 5 = Hotel gets everything right, and goes above and beyond. 4 = Hotel gets everything right. 3 = Hotel is acceptable value for money spent. 2 = Hotel isn't worth the money spent. 1 = Hotel should pay ME to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again for the right price”
Reviews.Author: MetWestBOSman
Reviews.Content: Great location (for our needs). Clean hotel with friendly staff (we didn't ask much of them, but all interactions were pleasant.) The room had just a couple of rough edges (sink drain could not be stoppered and had no hot water--only lukewarm--and too much force; fabric of lounge chair had questionable white stain; queen bed seemed sloped to center). It was a bit tight, but not atypical of NYC. Our room was on the back side of the hotel, so the view was nothing special, but street noise was minimized. The TV was nice, linens and bathroom were clean, maid staff was nice, city noises were minimal, and neighbors were only heard through the bathroom wall. They charge $15 for slow "high-speed Internet" and more for a boost to not-quite-as-slow. Typical of higher-end Hilton brands, but these days it really should be free. Many quick/cheap breakfast options, with Metro Cafe next door, Oxford Cafe a block away, and Au Bon Pain down the street. Not far from some good restaurants, but the west side of midtown has more variety.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: ehub
Reviews.Content: As everyone knows it is difficult to get a reasonably priced hotel in Manhattan. This place is moderately priced, We paid ~$175 a night for memorial day weekend. However, the rooms are mediocre at best. They are clearly old and in need of a revamp and the bathrooms are equally unappealing. The general manager at this location is awesome! very accommodating if you need anything. Avoid his minions though, all very inflexible and incompetent. Oh, and there are cookies! And the location is great. Overall, not a bad deal for the money but avoid it if you're looking for any aesthetics.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service ..... Doubletree ...Hilton Fans for life!”
Reviews.Author: pmldd
Reviews.Content: First the basics... We stayed here during Memorial day weekend and the location is excellent. (corner of 51st and lexington upper East side). Short walk to tons of restaurants on 2nd avenue, subway around the corner, shopping 3 blocks away. Now the extraordinary... Never thought staying in New York City that a hotel can make you feel like you are the only and most important guests in the entire place. First day managers including; chefs standing in the lobby greeting guests and welcoming you to the hotel. Being in the business we were very impressed with the personal attention. We had an issue through a hotel communication mix-up that caused us to miss a boat dinner tour. After a fruitless cab ride to Queens we ended back up at the hotel and communicated our issue to the night manager. He was very empathetic to our situation and asked us to wait a few minutes to look into it. Approximately five minutes later he came back to us and made us raving fans for life. Without getting into details, the Double Tree - Hilton went beyond our expectations and turning a bad situation into an opportunity which showed us great service still exists in the hotel industry. We would like to personally thank Mathew the hotel manager and Scott the food and beverage manager for an unforgettable New York Weekend. We recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to stay in New York City. We will definately be back. Patty M. Leon & Keith Clougherty

Reviews.Title: “The hospitality was top notch!”
Reviews.Author: Samsmom5853
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean, and the bar was good. The guest relations manager Simone Boxhill was WONDERFUL! She really made our trip. I strongly suggest staying here!

Reviews.Title: “"The best thing about this Hotel is the location"”
Reviews.Author: boohoo247
Reviews.Content: After that everything goes down hill, Senior Staff and those at the front desk are rude and have no idea of what good customer service means. The hotel prices are over priced and I would advise take you custom else where. The rooms where quite small, their was three of us in one room, although the size of the rooms didn't bother us as we were there to see NYC not stay in the Hotel. We over looked tha NYPD and NYFD staions. On leaving our bags at the hotel after checking out we were charged $1 per bag to leave at the hotel and $1 per bag to retrieve them. Would not have been so bad until go realise that there is not locked room and bags were left unattended at times. (had the feeling that it was a case of Oh, their are English lets charge them for this). I plan to go back to NYC but not this hotel group.

Reviews.Title: “worst staff attitude ever!!! don't stay here if you are a discerning guest!”
Reviews.Author: travel_man_hk
Reviews.Content: before i comment on all other issues, I must say this hotel is ideally situated i the heart of midtown NYC. Subway station is right next to it. Police station is right across, that will definitely make you feel safe day and night. but that is all the plus points i can come up for this hotel. can you live with noise? as it is right next to fire station and police station, you cannot get away from the noise. there is also no thermo stat in the room. that means the room temperature is fixed and you just have to live with it, like it or not. the room itself is not well maintained. you can see stains on parts of the bed. carpet is dusty. bathroom is tiny. sound proof is poor too. the worst part is its staff attitude. they will never apologize. they are just simply careless, ignorant. whatever the nature of the complaint it might be, they never bother to follow up, resolve nor recovery. the staff i refer to is from front line staff to senior guest relation manager. all in all, if you can live with all that, this hotel is for you to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Chilakeview
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on business hoping to have the weekend in NY. This is NOT a good hotel. There is an awful bedbug warning outside that mortifies me everytime I walk in. The room is surprising large but with tired, worn decor. The bathroom smell musty. There is no coffee maker in the room, no frig. The bathroom is tiny and dark. The good points are that the staff is really nice and the location of the hotel is good. The prices for room service are of course ridiculous - $15.50 for a cup of decaf and a cup of tea last night?? I will never stay here again. Oh and the lobby is small and awkward, and there is always people milling around that do not look like business people, often sleeping...

Reviews.Title: “ugh”
Reviews.Author: Donovan541
Reviews.Content: A couple of things saved this trip. One I am not picky at all and two we bought this on priceline and so my expectation were low. That said....this was the smallest ugliest hotel room that I have ever stayed in. The carpets were threadbare. The furniture was what you would expect in a poor frat house. On the plus side...the bed was comfortable and the shower worked pretty well. The location was pretty good. This room was probably 1.5 stars...but priceline had the property at 3.5. The biggest disappointment is that I had believed Hilton/DoubleTree to be a very good chain. I would think twice about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: bharrisuga
Reviews.Content: Was on a business trip to the city. As a HHonors member, I try to stay in Hilton hotels. I had meetings at the Waldorf, but was not impressed with the hotel rooms last time I stayed there. Was very pleased with the Doubletree. Many places in the city wow you with their lobby, but the Doubletree put it's effort in the rooms. While the room wasn't large, it was very nice by New York standards. Great location and the price was much better than the Waldorf across the street.

Reviews.Title: “I'm done with Doubletree NYC”
Reviews.Author: royallyunique
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Doubletree when I'm in NYC. I've never really questioned it. But it was probably my last time. I've just realized what a dump it is. At first I did arrive at 1pm and was notified that I'd have to wait until 3pm exactly as no rooms were available. I've never had a problem checking in early. At 2pm I checked back in to see if rooms were available. Nothing. At 2:30 I checked in again, nothing. I was being persistent because I had a meeting to be at a needed a room to change in. At 2:45, nothing at 2:50 nothing and finally I left the hotel, changed a friend's home and came back at 5pm. I was put in room 1913. You should discontinue using that room. It smells rancid, the walls are full of mold and it isn't up to par with a Hilton hotel. I am not one to complain, or change hotel room but I couldn't bear the smell. I called to reception and they agreed to move me to 1837 and asked me to wait at the door and I would be greeted by a Bell man. After waiting 20 minutes in the hallway with my luggage, I called the reception from my cell phone. They assured me someone was coming. After waiting another 15 minutes I lugged my bags to the lobby to get the keys on my own. The room was clearly another smelly room. I'm not sure if there is mildew running through the walls or if the rooms need remodeling. Needless to say, I kept my mouth shut and stayed for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “The DOUBLETREE has lost its mojo! Too BAD!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tanquerochicago
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Doubletree on numerous occasions and have always been very satisfied. On a recent business trip to the city I am sad to report that the hotel has lost it's mojo. My recent business trip lasted for 5 nights and I paid 300.00 per night...not a great deal but fair for NY and a late hotel reservation. Here were the issues that made the experience challenging: 1. No temp. control in the room. This meant that even though it was 50 degree outside, yes in May, the place was air conditioned. Can turn off the air in room but not in the rest of the building. A thin waffle blanket did not suffice to warm the night. The sad heater provided the following night only heated it's immediate sorroundings. Spent 5 night freezing in my room. 2. Internet connectivity charge- 18.00 dollars....in all fairness this was advertised ahead of time. However, it's 18 dollars per device...WTF? Are you kidding me? The internet was super slow and not worth it. 3. Noise....this is always an issue in NY but on several nights there were loud parties on the floor- that in combo with the outside honking, which is just part of being in NY, made it very hard to sleep. 4. Bathroom ceiling was decrepit, the towel rack came undone - not really what you expect from a HILTON and certainly not for 300 a night. 5. On one of the mornings we were greeted by a giant inflattable rat with a bed bug warning about the hotel....this was a labor union dispute but the bed bug warning made me very nervous. Called the hotel and was informed there were no bed bugs. I did not see bed bugs in my room...THANK GOD!!!! NOW- the staff were extremely kind, accommodating, friendly and professional. They tried their best to make the stay comfortable. The manager gave me a night for free and took off the internet charges. This made it almost bearable but in reality, I can't justify paying that much when the hotel fails to provide what is necessary to meet your basic business need- great internet service so you can work from your room, a normal temp. room so you aren't freezing, and a proper noise level (even for NY). For 300 dollars a night there are so many places to choose from in NY. You see if you don't keep up your hotel standards, your clients will go elsewhere. That's what I plan on doing the next time I'm in NY.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL & CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER EXPERIENCED”
Reviews.Author: urban5oul
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled to New York with a couple of our friends to do some shopping and the tourist thing. We have visited New York before but stayed at a different hotel and received impeccable customer service there. We didn't expect to receive the complete opposite staying at the double tree on Lexington. We travelled from Toronto and drove about 8 hours straight so we could skip all the traffic. We arrive at the hotel but could not park at the front due to all the taxis and other tourist parking. We decided to drive around to the side where we saw underground parking. There were a line of cars going in and out with a handful of guys parking cars. The infront of us drove into the car elevator to park his own car we assumed. As soon as it was our turn, one of the guys opened the driver's door and TOLD us to grab our stuff because he was going to park the car. My boyfriend didn't want to do valet and told him. Also, we had not checked in yet and wanted to know if we can go in and out. Again, this guy continued to give us attitude and told us once more to grab our stuff. He had to park the car because we did not know how to park the car in the elevator and there were numerous cars behind us. Fine! So we all grabbed our stuff and looked around if there was a trolly or another person to help us unload of stuff. NO THERE WASN'T. WE WERE NOT GIVEN A TROLLY OR ASSISTED AT ALL. They didn't even show us the way into our hotel. We all carried our stuff back outside of the garage and walked all the way around to the front of the hotel. As soon as we got inside - there were bell boys standing around with their trollys and still no one offered to help take our bags!!!! We tried to check in but we were too early. My boyfriend told them that we called earlier and had asked for early check in. The person he spoke to said it would be no problem. but the ppl at the front desk said it was not possible. They suggested to leave our bags with the bell boys and leave our cell numbers and they would call as soon as our rooms were ready. If they had told us that in the very beginning we would not have parked our car so early. We all decided to go and grab breakfast and leave our bags with the bell boys. As we finished leave our bags on the trolly, the bell boy asked for $6.00. He said that it would be $2.00 per bag to be left on the trolly and that he will need the first half now and the 2nd half once we pick up our stuff in the next hour. EFFIN' REDICULOUS!!!! Once, our rooms were ready, we picked up our bags, paid the rest of the fee and then carried all our stuff again to our rooms!!!!! They couldn't even help use the same trolly to get us to our rooms. At the time of check out we confirmed at the front desk that everything had been taken care of - rooms and parking. They confirm and again we walked all our stuff outside to the garage. We had to wait about 15 mins for our car and then they asked us to pay for parking. We told them that we paid inside and the front desk said everything was taken care of. The guy asked us for a receipt which the front desk did not give us. My boyfriend had to run all the way back inside and came back with a receipt. This hotel was the worst hotel we have EVER been to and they provided the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! The rooms were very small and the staff were not polite whatsoever! If i had to rate this hotel it would be -1/10!!! NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Great fitness center, decent location, hotel itself...ehhh”
Reviews.Author: ronneedham
Reviews.Content: This hotel all depends on your purpose and you budget. I travel quite a bit for business, as well as pleasure. This one was pleasure but I keep an eye on my stay from both perspectives. So, I will start with the good news. I was there with cousins for Yankee-Sox weekend. Being middle aged idiots our basic purpose was enjoy ourselves, relax, have a few drinks, and not take anything seriously. With that tone in mind it wasn't a bad stay at all. The hotel in is a decent midtown location. You are a few blocks from Rockefeller Center and other midtown stuff. The fitness center was outstanding. Maybe midweek with a bunch of biz travelers it would be crowded but I was alone in it every afternoon. The room was worn out a bit. Not disgusting or anything (no bed bugs or stuff others suggest at all). But it is in need of upgraded rooms. Bathroom was worn out. Again, it would do but if I were looking for a big weekend in the city with my family I would have been disappointed with the room quality. Having said all that, I paid 200 a night so for that money in Midtown on a weekend it was fine for our purposes Little hint for some fun, especially if you are with kids: walk to Le Meridien for a world class burger at a crazy low price (for NYC). There is a small burger joint in that French hotel that is world class. Fresh chuck, great rolls, etc. It's one of those "in" places that few know about yet so your family or friends will think it is very hip (cool decor), you won't spend much, the food is great, and then you move on. Good experience for your kids and won't kill the bank

Reviews.Title: “FOUR WORDS: INFLATABLE RAT, BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacaysnob
Reviews.Content: FOUR WORDS: INFLATABLE RAT, BED BUGS!!! I don't know how I'm going to survive 3 night here. Ny is.gross but this welcoming was by far a bit much! The room.is totally run down and dingy. Bathroom is awful! Yuk!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Lezg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree for a six days. Without any extra fancy a normal hotel service: clean rooms, proffecional staff, free Internet in a lobby, parking right next to hotel. For my personal taste beds are a little to firm but it works anyway. Overall a good experience

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is horrible”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth60795
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree this week and won't be staying there again. Check -in was a mess. Arrived from the airport around noon and was told there were no rooms available. There would be nothing until 3pm. Others arriving, however, were given rooms. Mine was not a last minute reservation. It had been made weeks earlier. I checked around 2p and there were rooms available, but no one had called, as promised to let me know. When I got to the room, I was shocked. I've seen dorm rooms that look better than the room I had. Bare walls, dirty carpet that clearly had not been vacuumed, moldy bathroom, old chipped bathtub......and ear plugs on the nightstand (police and fire sirens all night). This hotel needs a major renovation....nothing at all inviting about staying here. Have stayed at many other Doubletrees in other cities and none have been as bad as this.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this time around”
Reviews.Author: MissLoreleiLee
Reviews.Content: After writing raving reviews about the Doubletree it pains me to write this one! I have stayed in the Double Tree two times before this trip and have always been very happy with the room and service. However ,on this trip I was very disappointed. When we checked in the staff were very welcoming and friendly. However our room was a big let down. Especially compared to other rooms I know for a fact are avalible in the hotel. We were situated on the 11th floor which wasn't a problem we even had good views from our window. However the room was run-down and almost shabby. The sink was actually located in the bedroom rather than the bathroom which was inconvenient. The sink plug was broken, I actually got on my hands and knees and repaired it myself. The heater grills had fell off and were on the floor. The heater ended up being useless anyway. It took ages to warm up and on one day didn't get warm at all. You could forget about using it at night also because it was so noisey. When checking out the conceierge refused to help us with our pre-booked shuttle arrangement because the hotel was not affiliated with the company we booked the shuttle with. I thought this was strange because the conceirege on other stays had always been more than happy to arrange things for us. He seemed more concerned with telling us how bad the shuttle company was at picking guests up on time- it turns out the shuttle company ended up arriving exactly on time and we had no bother with them at all... also don't bother saying hello to the house keeping staff you get met with snarls! It was also off putting on arrival being welcomed by a huge inflatable rat outside the entrance. Disappointed with my stay this time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Planet_trekker1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Double tree metropolitan for 2 weeks on a Business visit. The best thing about this hotel is its location (Lexington Avenue). Being in Midtown the hotel makes it very easy for business travellers to access downtown and other offices easily. The hotel as a whole is nothing extraordinary. The rooms are basic, though would have loved to have a working room temperature system working. My room would freeze in the night and had to call the staff to check it out. They then installed a portable heater in my room which did make my life a bit easier. During my stay the hotel was being refurbished, so there were plenty of noise down the aisle. The rennovation did give a facelift to the old hotel. Though my stay there was comfortable there are many more hotels in the vicinity which offer more luxury at the same comparable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Smells like a Burger King -- and that's the NICE room”
Reviews.Author: KatieCcccc
Reviews.Content: Yuck. I am staying in this hotel now. I pre-paid for my room, and it was a big mistake. I'm not looking forward to the next couple of nights. When I arrived, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the lobby seemed clean and modern. Check-in was efficient. But when I got to my room (room 752, as a warning), it was horrible. Dark, with dingy yellow wallpaper peeling from the walls. There was something, not sure if it was ear wax or blood, smeared on the side of the nightstand. Just a really horrible place. Old bathrooms with chips in the tub and ancient shower heads. While it seemed clean enough (except for the ear wax or whatever), the smell of the cleaning products was incredibly overwhelming. Lemony and disgusting. I headed right back downstairs, and the front desk agreed to move me right away. I'm in a better room now. It's still not what I'd call nice, but it has a few more pieces of furniture and lights, and doesn't look like it's been through Hurricane Katrina. But, it faces the back of the hotel and a restaurant, and guess what happens around dinnertime? Yup -- smells equivalent to the back room at Burger King. I kept the window closed for awhile, hoping it would help, but it doesn't. It's quiet back here, but it might put me off burgers for awhile. I come to NY for business a lot. I always try to stay in decent hotels, and usually succeed. I have had good experiences with Doubletrees in the past, but this one has ruined my streak.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a telecom utility - watch the multiple internet fees in the room”
Reviews.Author: Ulysees021
Reviews.Content: Watch out for the internet access in the room - costs $ 14:95 PER DAY PER DEVICE ! therefore if you logon with your cell phone, pad and computer be prepared for a $ 45 a day fee - notwithstanding that you can only use one device at a time. This is a rip off and guests would be well advised to demand the hotel correct the bill. PS Other Hilton Hotels provide free room internet access for multiple devices.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: CO_Family_of_5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in May. For $300 per night I was unimpressed. I travel a lot for business and expect to pay about 2x in NYC verse everywhere else. The Cons - Lexington ave @ 52nd st. isn't really that close to a lot of things. Its Mid town -- but you'll walk a few extra blocks. No coffee maker in the room for $300 per night! Serious ! The Heating and AC is really ancient and tricky to make work. Problem in both of my rooms. the neighborhood can be very noisey due to a fire house nearby --- so negotiatie upon check in for a room on the quiet side. You definitely cannot sleep with the window open. the rooms with 2 beds are insanely small even by NYC standards. More like Paris small. This hotel would sell for $70 per night anywhere else in the US. try the Hilton on 6th ave ---much better and can sell for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: DavidSHEFF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on Lexington Avenue which is only ever a few minutes walk from 5th Avenue. We were amazed with how quite the noise were from the streets below and we were not too many floors up either. Next to the hotel was a nice cafe and just after the that is the East 51St tube station. Tube tickets can be bought for $27 and last for 7 days. The rooms was decent enough and the beds and towels were always changed etc. We also received some warm cookies on arrival, which was nice! You are only about 7 blocks up from Grand Central Terminal so if you're flying into Newark or JFK you can pay $15 dollars and get on the coach which drops you off here and then you can easily walk to the hotel. A taxi would cost in excess of $60 + tip. There are some really nice Italian restaurants on 51st and 2nd, one in particular called Lasagne and the speciality.. you guessed it lasagne.

Reviews.Title: “mistreated guest”
Reviews.Author: mshoff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Doubletree hotel on Saturday, 4/23/11. The next day after we checked out, we stored our luggage with the bellman and came back ti the hotel at 7p on 4/24/11 to pick our things up and then went home. Upon arriving at home, I realized that items were missing from my suitcase. Upon informing security, I was referred to their insurance company who advised me that nothing could be done because I did not tell them when I was at the hotel..(how could i have told them then?) Hotel security was not only unresponsive, they were rude. Do not stay at this hotel as you may get robbed and the hotel will do absolutely nothing to help you

Reviews.Title: “The most confortable bed I have ever slept in.”
Reviews.Author: Raluca L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated (the metro station is literally 2 meters away) , the room and bathroom are very clean and the beds are incredibly confortable. Although this is the last think someone would consider when choosing a hotel, I have to mention that at check in, they give guests a couple of delicious chocolate chips cookies. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: CheeseMouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and we got a good rate for NYC, but the accomodations are average at best. I had a room with two double beds. The room was a decent size. The TV was nice, the desk was very small, the dresser was tiny. The closet doors were broken. The bathroom might be the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel. There was only room for one person to stand in it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: munish2005
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great views. Best thing is the location. It is Lex ave and heart of Manhattan. Times square is walking distance and green line is just below the hotel. If you are a Hilton member then you get HHonors as well. Their bar is very good and perfect for business meetings. They have a good business center too.

Reviews.Title: “An Uninspiring Choice for Manhattan"”
Reviews.Author: Frqflier
Reviews.Content: No significant complaints. But it's a pricey option for a not-so-great hotel although the staff really do try to go above and beyond. We paid roughly $299 a night for a rate that included breakfast and wound up with a tiny room with two tiny beds. My wife decided to sleep in our 8-year-old's bed because there wouldn't have been enough room in mine. And apparently a king with a sofabed just wasn't an option, despite my gold Hilton status. This hotel is mediocre. We made a last minute booking and could have done way, way better on price had we booked well in advance. I looked for alternatives but the weekend we were heading into Manhattan there just were few other rooms available anywhere. Hotel is in a great location if you're on the Upper East Side and there's a subway stop just outside. Hotel looks like it has been recently remodeled but I'm sure in as few as five years the remodeling will look cheap and dated. You can probably do better than this particular Doubletree, but again I had no major complaints (other than price). And again have to stress that staff, from check-in to check-out, really were pleasant. "Cozy" is a word that you'll see used to describe the rooms on the official hotel website. "Cozy" means small.

Reviews.Title: “Look for something else.”
Reviews.Author: BalhamBoris
Reviews.Content: I thought that because this is part of the Hilton chain, the rooms would be good. I was wrong. The foyer of the hotel is nice enough, with a decent bar, but I'm here to sleep, and the rooms are awful. I stayed in a room which had connecting doors to the rooms either side. These let through the noise badly (they leave ear plugs by the bed!). The bed is strange and very small, and although the room has a sofa, you can't see the TV from it. The room layout is bad, and unattractive. There's no fridge/mini bar and no tea or coffee making facilities, which makes for a more expensive stay and less convenience. The location is good, but there are plenty of other better value places. Don't risk staying here. The final straw was the bed bug scare. They've apparently had an issue with bed bugs but don't think this affected us. We found out about this after we arrived which made for a few phantom (or maybe real) itches.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great staff, and great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: uri777
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Honeymoon and we have stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. We want to recommend this hotel and mention the great staff that work there! From the check in till the check out they have treated us like we are the most important customers in the hotel! We want to say many thanks to Vritikka Kapur and Simone Boxhill about everything and I wish to have such a women like that in my own bussiness!!! They made our stay more then prefect and we enjoyed every moment of staying at this great hotel. Also we would like to mention that some hotels near that area try to say that this hotel has a "bed bugs" inside the rooms and this is not true at all!! The rooms and the beds are very clean and with a big space compare to other hotels at New York. Go there without thinking..

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_from_Canberra
Reviews.Content: The Good â€¢ Very well positioned â€¢ Pleasant staff â€¢ Access to local restaurants â€¢ The bedding is very comfortable after 33 hours of travel The Not so Good â€¢ Easy access to power points, I needed to move furniture as the desk lapâ€™s external plug was faulty â€¢ I did not receive a booked wakeup call and consequently missed a flight

Reviews.Title: “Real bad experience, will never go back again!!”
Reviews.Author: nenitamemo
Reviews.Content: Even though we had reservations and had paid the room in full, we had to wait one hour after check in time (3:00 pm) because they did not have rooms available!! We were not alone, around 30 people were waiting for rooms too. When we finally got to the room, it was a mess!, the bed was not done, the bathroom was dirty, and it looked like someone had just left the place a minute ago. We went to complain about it and there was a big line for complaints also! The lady in charge of whole checking in process was very rude!! This hotel is not worth the money and the location is not as good as they mention, I rather pay more next time and get a better service!

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: nannya
Reviews.Content: Yes the location is convenient but this is nothing special. Check in kind of unfriendly. Lobby dark utilitarian has the ambience of a train station waiting area. Hallways narrow and dark. Rooms ok size but tired. Real negatives- no thermostat. They determine whether you get heat or cold depending on the month. Not great on a warm day in April to have heat or nothing $15 for internet access? In 2011? Are they kidding? And difficult to even make the connection when you pay. Internet should be like electricity- a basic part of being in a hotel- like electricity or television. This is a dated policy No coffee maker in room. No coffee in lobby. No way to get a cup of coffee but room service for $6 + service. Or walk somewhere No refrigerators- waitlist offered but clearly that was a joke Big inflatable rat on the sidewalk warning of bedbugs made me itch all day. I hope it was not valid but it is not a positive Doors are tired_ locks don't work right. Bathroom door won't close or lock. Closet room right up against the bathroom door. No laundry bag. Tv awkwardly located taking up desk area. Outlets poorly planned Bed was decent- as long as it does not turn out to have bedbugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great deal for NYC”
Reviews.Author: ldldb
Reviews.Content: As soon as I'd booked the reservations directly through their website, Jasmine emailed me asking if there was anything special they could do for my stay. I'd mentioned it was an early birthday trip and there were mini cupcakes with candles brought to my room the first night. Little touches like this can go a long way in getting repeat business, just as much as having a great location and clean, comfortable rooms. Our room was actually decent sized for Manhattan. Can't beat the location--an easy 10-15 minute walk to St Patrick and all the shops near Rockefeller Center. The subway station is right around the corner, and the bakery/deli right next door has decent prices for breakfast food or a quick lunch. I'd debated between staying at the W a few doors down versus the Doubletree for roughly the same prices and went with the latter to get my Hilton points and am very glad that I did. It was a bit worrisome when we got there and saw a big inflatable "bed bug" right outside the hotel's door (didn't have time to read the signs to see what the beef was about), but it was removed by afternoon (though it showed up again the Monday morning after). But all in all, the Doubletree turned out to be a fabulous stay. Very nice staff and fast elevators. Always felt safe walking around the hotel's area even late at night. No complaints here as I've paid a lot more $ for much less space at higher end boutique hotels in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Felt taken care of”
Reviews.Author: SunMakesMeHappy
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay online from across the street. By the time I walked over, the staff had my reservation and I was ushered into a delightful room with views of the Empire State Building. The room was cozy and comfortable. I didn't want to leave. The downstairs lobby had free wi-fi and a great bar to unwind in. This hotel is perfectly situated and walking distance (or train) distance to everything. The staff made this stay memorable. The go the extra mile for you. I felt like the hotel was in sparkling condition and had that touch of class while being down to earth. I found it to be worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Over all rooms where poorly kept not up to date and smelled horribly”
Reviews.Author: Av0513
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The front desk was of no help and very unpleasant. The hotel hallways had a repulsive smell and where always cluttered with maid carts. The room it's self were small. Not enough space to comfortably stay with another person.not enough drawer or closet space. Most hotels I've stayed in have a coffee machine in room and complimentary bottled water this did not. It was a big inconvenience especially when you walk to the vending machine located in a smelly dirty stairwell just to find out it is not working. The bathroom sink constantly clogged. The room tempature was not able to be Controlled. You could also hear noises from outside and noise in the hallway. The only thing this hotel has going for them is the location.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL-CUSTOMER SERVICE IS TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPearl
Reviews.Content: Reviewing my hotel choices on Trip Advisor, I decided on this hotel and as an added bonus I saw a promotion for $135 per night. I clicked on the link to their website and was given a rate of $228. I called the reservations line and hotel front desk and was hung up on four times before asking to speak directly with Jasmine Jimenez, Guest Relations Manager who frequently responds to complaints on Trip Advisor. She wasn't sure how to explain the discrepancy and told me that she would email "Doug Levitt" the reservations manager and asked for my email address. I followed up a day later with the reservations line and was informed that there is no one by that name and I was forwarded to "Pam" who stated that she was from GUEST ASSISTANCE-CORPORATE OFFICE -GUEST RELATIONS. She put me on hold for 10 minutes and basically interpreted the Trip Advisor promo. I asked if there was anything that they would offer me and she said I shouldn't book on 3rd party sites(even though the TA link goes to their website) and that TA is responsible for their content. She wasn't willing to offer anything,not even a free breakfast buffet or even the $135 rate for 1 out of the 4 nights that I was staying there. I've been a loyal Hilton and Double tree guest for years and I'm really disgusted at the treatment. I'm taking my business to a better hotel where customers are treated better.

Reviews.Title: “Really helpful”
Reviews.Author: 2musketeers2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights and Hotel is perfect for main NY sights. All in walking distance.Everyone was really pleasant and rooms were good. Had minor problem with shower on/off lever and fixed within minutes after contacting Reception..Overall we were very pleased with the Hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Fabio_Marzano
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, very clean rooms, friendly staff, i recomend this hotel for sure. The hotel bar is amazing, and the breakfast is superb! The subway is very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charged twice!! Check your credit card statement”
Reviews.Author: juliacat17
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel over the weekend and I was planning to leave an exellent review, however, we just had a call from the Credit card company indicating that the hotel has charged us for 2 nights ( despite this booking being already prepaid at Hotels.com)! If you don`t have a helpful credit card company that will advise you of such fraud - be aware and check your statement. At the time of leaving the hotel we have being given a bill for $14 for using the internet but two days later they charged $200 ! We have now called the hotel and trying to sort it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelers2626
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay! I don't know what the other reviewers are talking about. The service was excellent and the management couldn't be better. We had accidently booked a smoking room and after talking with Ms. Jimenez, it was quickly changed with no hassle. The location was amazing, close to the train and everything else we needed. The rooms were fantastic. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: ArnaudLondon75
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week in February 2011 and booked a standard Queen room, and was disappointed on entering the room to see that there was a connection door on each side of the room with a bed that could be folded back in the wall. Obviously this room is used as a living room or for families wanting connecting doors. I could hear the TV on one side and the guy snoring next door so asked for a normal standard room with no connecting doors, and the upgraded me to a King size straightaway. It was clean, the service was good and helpful but the hotel in itself is more of an American 3 stars than four. The location is great though. The wi-fi at $15/24 hrs is a rip off, just go down to the lobby, connect from there and go back up to your room and you will stay connected for an hour and can do as many times as you wish!

Reviews.Title: “A good brand let down by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: andyse11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice and unfortunately both times have had their problems. The most recent stay was greeted by a 25 minute wait for checkin. That would be fair enough if all desks were open and staff weren't standing around in the lobby (namely the customer relations manager). That was merely an annoyance. Upon entering my room and going to the bathroom i was greeted by a faeces smear on the toilet seat. The mess was properly cleaned by housekeepers after I had to make two separate visits to reception. I was given a "sorry" but no new room or compensation. The second problem was their premium high speed internet access, costing around $20, which was extremely slow. For example google.com took over 10 seconds to load. In the hotels defense they did say "sorry" for the bathroom issue and did refund the internet charge after I complained. That said I think they are seriously letting down the brand image of quality, service and price. I personally wouldn't recommend staying at the hotel as I don't feel you get the quality experience you expect and pay for from a Hilton group hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Fabulous value”
Reviews.Author: bowerbirdschest
Reviews.Content: This is a super place to stay. Apart from the perfect location so close to Bloomies etc (and its right opp a Starbucks & next to the subway as well) its great value. You get welcomed with a warm delicious cookie, free computer access at any time, very comfy beds and quite OK room size. I would definitely stay here again as the next hotel we stayed in was twice the price, was older and you had to pay for computer access! The location is fantastic. The only drawback is the proximity of a police station and you do hear sirens all night but that didn't bother us (it was almost funny as they made different whooping noises not like our horrid sirens at home). There is a pretty awful cafe next door but its very close to other great eating places. You know the Marilyn Monroe photo where her skirt is blown up from beneath? It's taken outside this hotel which was a bit of fun!

Reviews.Title: “expensive and disapointing”
Reviews.Author: esthercbuenosaires
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel -and I admit it is important- is the location. If you are spending a few days in NYC you are close to 5th Ave. etc- But it is extremely expensive in comparison to the quality and size of the rooms, the carpets are old, and it is not as clean as it should be. I wouldn't recommend it to any friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and well located”
Reviews.Author: London_Andy
Reviews.Content: I normally stay with friends in New York, but I was on a crazy flight schedule so decided to stay at a hotel. As a Hilton Hhonors member this one seemed reasonably priced, well located, and also very easy to get to from JFK airport on the subway - you could almost fall out of the subway station into the hotel! I'd never stayed at a Doubletree before I read the mixed reviews here and was slightly apprehensive, but the stay was absolutely fine. Check-in was quick and efficient, and I got my warm cookie (although they forgot to give me the coupon that was part of the deal I'd purchased). I made sure, having looked at reviews here, to make sure I didn't get a room overlooking the police station - probably best to ask for a "quiet/high floor room" upon arrival. The room was spacious, by New York standards, and clean. The room had (in realtor terms) a "partial Chrysler building view". The free internet/breakfast I got as a Diamond Hhonors member was the icing on the cake, although during my one week-day morning the employee in the executive lounge couldn't cope with the throughput of customers - no plates/coffee/pastries. There was a manager there but he seemed to spend more of his time managing the poor employee rather than helping her! I didn't use the main restaurant, so can't comment on that (used the Metro next door and also a diner round the corner, left when you come out of the hotel and left again at the next corner). I was going to meet a friend for a beer in the hotel, but then saw the prices so decided to go to a sports bar a couple of blocks away. There is a timeshare sales rep near the elevators, but either because I look poor, or was travelling solo, I didn't get picked on at all! In fact I already own a Hilton timeshare so they would be wasting their time (go to the presentation by all means, but buy in the resale market for 1/3 of the price!). The only negative thing, which they can't really do much about, is the thickness of the walls. Actually, I should say thinness as I could just about follow the conversation that the couple in the room next door were having - through the wall! Even this wasn't a major issue. Like a previous reviewer I too saw the large rat outside, but luckily no bedbugs inside. I can't see the union's point of view that more staff would mean less bedbugs.... I also find it interesting that a lot of the recent reviews are by people who have posted once, and don't give objective feedback - saying that sleeping at a train station would be better is a really odd thing to say! I paid $150 a night and would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but lousy service - Not up to Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: paf-sd
Reviews.Content: The physical aspect of the hotel is perfectly fine, but the service is not. Great location mid-town Manhattan for business. The room was typical for NYC, a little small, but very comfortable, good bed, easy to work in, and great for business trip. HOWEVER...service is not up to Doubletree and Hilton standards that I expect. First off, the bell hops are either standing around doing nothing or agressively trying to take your luggage, call a cab or whatever. I don't mind the initial service offer, but after I have told them that I am not interested, they need to learn to BACKOFF! Restaurant service was bad. Wait staff was not attentive - and here you need it. Worse, this hotel AUTOMATICALLY adds the gratuity. I really don't appreciate having my choice taken away from me. This place seems to be always pusing the Hilton time share. Every time you walk by their desk and you have to to get to the elevators, you are harrassed to come and talk to them. Give me a break, in a business hotel - really??? Finally the bell staff in front of the hotel is less than honest when asking about transportation. They push hard their towncar option and fail to really tell you that the cabs real cost. They lead you to believe that their option is better priced - isn't. After dealing with those guys I felt like I needed a shower!! The one redeeming service - the conceirge.. This lady was excellent. She provide me with several really good restaurant recommendations, fairly priced and great quality. Now if only the rest of the staff could learn from her.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Bother”
Reviews.Author: kualho
Reviews.Content: you're better off sleeping in the Park. Decor was horrible, reservation clerk was rude as can be, toilet overflowed, the next room they replaced it with had a broken thermostat and nearly froze to death with no extra blankets. A bench in Grand Central Station is more accomodating that this place was.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service for our business meeting”
Reviews.Author: Captain_DaveMontreal
Reviews.Content: My group rented a conference room for a business meeting. When we asked about coffee service in the morning we were told it would not be available because the hotel was short-staffed. It was suggested we stop the meeting and go down to their restaurant or leave the hotel and get coffee across the street. Note to Conference Room Manager - how about going downstairs and getting the coffee yourself? I can never recommend such an unreliable hotel for any further business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: arlhal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights. My feelings Good Cookies-when you register you get the best cookies in the world Clean- My first criteria for a hotel-Clean Towels- I hate calling the front desk for more towels. No problem at this hotel Service- We left some clothing in the room. We called, they sent the clothing back by UPS. We paid for the shipping which is right Maybe Location-On the east side.Not near the most places for tourists. However there is a subway station at the door. If you go to New York learn about the subway system it takes you where you want to go at a reasonable cost. Two blocks away on 2nd. Ave there are lots of reasonable priced restaurants AND a real supermarket. I liked the location Bathroom-Two rooms, one with a vanity(sink), the other with the toilet and bathtub. The rooms were small and I felt cramped in each (see below on effects). I prefer a single larger Bathroom. BAD Wifi- free in the lobby. Cost $14.95 per day in room. Can use the computers in the business center for free Coffee/Tea maker in room- Nope. Got mixed message from the front desk. First they said it was a Union problem. When I pointed out that the Hampton Inn (also a Hilton Hotel) has in room coffee makers, the story was changed to "this is a Doubletree policy". The real reason is that the vanity is too small for a coffee maker, part of the poor design for the bathroom Tub- Makes a good footbath. Too shallow for a bath Vanity Room- No towel bars so the hand towels must be left on the vanity. They get wet and can't be used again. No room for toilet kit Checkroom- Cost us $6.00 for a suitcase and two backpacks for two hours storage. Phone- Free local calls. DO NOT make a mistake dialing. We did and it cost $7.11 for a ten second call Refrigerator- Not in room but available on request. IF ONE IS AVAILABLE

Reviews.Title: “no service but safe and great location”
Reviews.Author: cath049
Reviews.Content: My stay: no cookies offered at check in; did get upgrade as a gold member plus could check in pre three pm; the exec lounge (my third stay here) is a D-. Really rude personnel, no silver ware or plates, coffee maker not working, no clean bowls or plates and if I ask the help looks so out out. Honestly, it was hardly worth the walk down the hall for the so called executive lounge. No juice and no juice cups left either day. After 11 AM, there is not even a water pitcher or coffee available here either. plus I was skittish with all the bedbug alerts: posters and huge signs and leaflets warning me about bedbugs at the entrance to lobby. I feel I had some bites so I took precautions, but came home very itchy. So, great location, okay room, miserable customer service except for one polite helpful clerk as I checked in: Venus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, brand new hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Renatadelucca
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, great bed, very clean, no noise at all, close to the subway station, strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: bbono001
Reviews.Content: Very nice lobby with a comfortable bar that came in handy. Overpriced like anything in NYC but service was very friendly. Rooms were small but comfortable. Location was everything and I'd definitely stay here again because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay - would use again!”
Reviews.Author: st5om
Reviews.Content: We arrived from London for a 5 night break for my partners birthday. On check in the fact that it was to be my partners birthday was independently picked up on by the receptionist and we were immediately upgraded! So far so good! We had requested a late check out due to our return flights and were immediately granted those as well. Once the check in formalities were completed we were given our warmed cookie each! It is, of course, a gimmick but there is something rather welcoming about being presented with a cookie on your arrival after a long flight. As has been said many times, the location is fantastic and just perfect for a stroll to central park after breakfast or to the designer shops on neighbouring streets. The Waldorf Astoria is across the road for afternoon cocktails if you like! Excellant restaurant called "The National" is next door and was recommended by the concierge for dinner. The rooms were beautifully clean and the beds were dressed with non - allergenic bedding! I don't know if it was the bed, the bedding or the combo but I slept and woke up alive and refreshed everyday we were there. Every morning we left a few dollars on the pillow for the maid service and came back everyday to find a thank you note. It is a large, busy hotel and due to that there is an element of it being impersonal. Staff work hard at being friendly and welcoming in spite of the volume of visitors passing through. We had the hotels breakfast buffet twice, downstairs in their restaurant, which did not have the biggest selection ever and I remember thinking it was quite pricey for what was on offer. We met a friend prior to dinner in the Doubletree lobby bar and had several, wonderful champagne cocktails in pleasant, relaxing surroundings! We were always well attended to by the friendly waiting staff. There is a well equiped gym there and a free use business centre with high speed internet access. Altogether our stay at the Doubletree Metropolitan was a positive experience and we would certainly recommend to friends to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; outstanding value.”
Reviews.Author: samueltlogan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home from a stay at the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel. We found it excellent. I am a Hilton Diamond Card holder and would rate this hotel as one of the best values among the hundreds of Hiltons at which we have stayed. To misquote a famous general, "We shall return!"

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing experience in NYC”
Reviews.Author: pupstarEngland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package holiday and stayed there 3 nights on a room only basis. The location was ideal and accessible to many of the places we had planned to visit. One of the attractions for us became the wonderful and extremely popular cafe next door to the hotel which served a fabulous breakfast and range of dishes to cater for all your needs. Back at the hotel our room was clean and comfortable with a flat screen TV and we were provided with fresh towels each day. The complimentary soap, shampoo etc were replaced each day which took away from lugging around these daily necessities. This hotel is extremely busy and it took between 20 to 30 mins for us to be allocated a room upon our arrival. We were able to access wi-fi from the reception area where many of the guests can be found sat on their laptops as there is a charge for access to this service. Both my husband had no complaints about this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The only thing we would advise guests to be aware of is the staff hotel who attempt to recruit guests to take part in a 2 hour presentation involving some type of timeshare with the Hilton hotel group. Whilst we found it difficult to say no to the extremely persuasive young lady at the desk, we did manage to cancel our appointment the following day. All in all this is a good hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: TheFlock1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree with my family on weekend trip to NY. The hotel is well located, clean and has helpful staff. The rooms are a bit small, but certainly functional. The food was good and room service was prompt. The Doubletree was a great base of operations from which to explore NY. The Doubletree is a good value and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, an excellent and predictable value in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: EmptyNestersCT
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree sits at the intersection of several subway lines, and just one one stop away from Grand Central. We have stayed there three time now, and the experience has been consistently solid. It's a busy place, but the staff is friendly and helpful. If you bring a car, the bellhops do a good job of handling the always exciting task of dealing with a car in NYC. While not cheap (this is New York), the rate is an excellent comparative value. Similarly, while the rooms are smaller than those in your typical Doubletree, they are well-sized by New York standards. Some of the rooms (upper floors on the south side) have unobstructed views of the top of the Chrysler building.

Reviews.Title: “moldy smell in bathrooms and indifferent staff.”
Reviews.Author: shercus
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely disappointing! The first thing we noticed apon entering was the stong moldy smell that permeated the room. It was also so small it was difficult moving around. The room in general was a 2 star at most. When we asked for a room change due to the smell, they said no other rooms were available. So, we were stuck paying $259 per night for a room that smelled like a moldy bathroom. The staff are totally indifferent to complaints. This is probably because they get so many!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great cookies, ordinary room, tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: talkingp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and booked a room with two double beds for 4 of us, two parents and two small children. The first room we booked was very ordinary to say the least and this was very disappointing as we had been recommended this hotel by a friend. It was like a very dodgy renovation, nothing was well done in the room fit out, all teh doors and wood was chipped and there was wierd wall paper in the bathroom which didn't seem to match anything. The worst thing about the room was the bathroom, so small you could hardly turn around. We asked to be moved to a suite. The suite was definitely a better size for a family. The bathroom was still as small but at least had a vanity in an anteroom offf the bathroom not in the bedroom like the previous room. The staff were helpful but there seemed to be some confusion about our move the suite. We were told it would be ready to move to at 2 pm but when we returned t this time we were told it was not ready. We waited another 4 hours for it and we had a run in with one particular member of the reception staff about this. The location of this hotel is very good, however I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern and attractive”
Reviews.Author: MrP78_11
Reviews.Content: Pros * Modern and attractive * We were first checked into what turned out to be a disabled room. My wife didn't mind but I found it a tad awkward peeing almost horizontally. The room was also a bit awkward as it was designed to suit a wheelchair. When I rang reception the next morning, we were moved with a minimum of fuss. * Free business room with internet and wifi in the lobby * TERRIFIC location- walking distance to most city sites. CONS * Some lower floors can be VERY loud as a fire station and police station are across the road. * A mystery restaurant service fee appeared on our bill at checkout. We had tipped each day at our breakfast (we were given complimentary breakfast, possibly because they realised we were booked into an unsuitable room), but wouldn't have done so if we knew there was a service charge. I feel that this was quite dishonest and should have been made clear to us upon check-in. * Staff are quite aloof, but that's just a New York thing. TIPS- Don't book a town car to the airport (through the concierge) the night before. On the morning of departure, we were approached by hotel staff who organised the same car for around the same price as a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Now Tips are "Fees", Welcome to Doubletree Airlines”
Reviews.Author: nycflyer
Reviews.Content: First, let's talk about the good stuff regarding this hotel. It is in an excellent midtown location, walking distance to practically everything from Times Square to Central Park and the Upper East Side. The price/value ratio for the hotel is usually good and you can usually secure a rate below $200 during the January/February period. Additionally, the staff is usually very responsive and pleasant. In terms of Hilton HHonors privileges, I usually get upgraded to the Executive Floor with a complimentary breakfast, although like most Hiltons, the room size/quality doesn't seem to be notably better than non-Executive Floor equivalents. Also like other Hiltons, the concept of a separate check-on for Hilton HHonors members is non-existent. Now for the bad stuff which really left a negative impression at the end of a very long trip. I checked out of the hotel and asked the bellman to store my bag. His reply is that there is a $2 fee for bag storage. I am a little miffed that I just spent over $1,000 on my stay and was being asked for two more dollars, but OK, so since I am without cash I ask the reception staff to add the $2 to my bill. "I can't do that", she replied. I explain I was just told that there is a $2 fee for bag storage and I didn't have any cash, so I needed to add it to the bill. "No" she advised and directed me to the nearest ATM. "Or", she offered, "you can talk to Them to see if they will waive it". Of course, Them is the bellstaff, that work for the same hotel as the check-in agent and were standing three feet away, but clearly she was not willing to approach her own co-worker with such a heinous request. So it quickly became apparent. The $2 is not a fee, it's some sort of mandatory tip. And oh yeah, it MUST be paid in cash. I don't have a problem tipping. I tip everyone, including the bus drivers on shuttles at the airport and a daily tip to the housekeeping staff. However, portraying a tip as a fee and not allowing me to pay for it on my bill (just like I am able to add a tip on my credit card in a restaurant) is deceptive to say the least and unacceptable for a Hilton hotel. I will likely stay at this hotel again because of its location, value and my Hilton HHonors status, but certainly there are things to improve here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but several flaws”
Reviews.Author: mk14617
Reviews.Content: Here for a night on business, so I didn't pay for the say. The hotel is quite clean, ideally situated if one has business on the east side or in Queens, and with excellent personnel. But there were a few niggling issues: -faded carpet in my guest room on the Executive Floor (Hilton Honors Gold) -no food or drink of any kindin the Executive Floor lounge until breakfast time at 7AM (latish for NYC, I think); -one of the two telephones in my room didn't work -I had booked a rate that included parking. But the bill slipped under my door charged that same rate plus $48 for parking. They rectified the bill upon my request; still, it's annoying to have to check on this. Would I stay here again? Yes. Did they exceed my expectations? No.

Reviews.Title: “Trapped in NY”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl6570
Reviews.Content: Hotel at check in was the last pleasant part of the stay. Checked and found no bed bugs was reassuring. The room was cramped. The bathroom dated, cramped and the shower controls were broken with little to no hot water. The worst part was the checkout and the doorman who was trying to move patrons to taxis and ignored anyone with car service.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: itbetterbeclean
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here during one of the Winter 2011 snowstorms. For the price $149, it was an excellent value if you're not a fussy. Check in took 30 seconds, as front desk was fully staffed on this sold out night. Most reviewers have it correct, rooms are getting tired and could use some updating, but it was clean, queen bed was comfortable, and flat screen TV was big. Midtown location is great, close to everything, with plenty of restaurants nearby. Would stay again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: AndesRuby
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone to NYC on business in early December and loved this hotel. The room was spacious, comfortable, and immaculately clean, with a king-size bed, ample desk, bedside tables, chaise lounge, and large flat-screen TV. Lots of room for storage too, as the desk doubles as a bureau, and there is a closet by the door to the room. Loved the 1960s vibe throughout the property. Didn't take advantage of the downstairs bar or the seating area in the lobby, but the whole ambience was very chill. Felt perfectly safe even as a solo female traveler, both in and outside of the hotel. As far as location goes, few NYC hotels are better. The Metropolitan Doubletree is within a brief walk of a couple of subway stops, and only 5 or 10 minutes away, on foot, from St. Patrick's Cathedral and Rockefeller Center. Of course, since you're in Midtown Manhattan, there are a million other attractions that are just as close, but those are simply the highlights I remember best. For more daily needs, there are several nearby cafes, a nail salon and massage parlor right around the corner on 53rd St. (The front desk clerk was kind enough to tell me I could find better prices there than I could for services in the hotel.), and a Staples (for your last-minute business needs!). The hotel itself even has a small giftshop with some nice accessories and souvenirs, in case you need to bring a gift home for anyone. It's open until around 11:00 PM, as I recall. I was very impressed by the service; I chatted with room service when they came to my room, and they were warm and friendly. The hotel was also very accommodating regarding the terms of my stay. Extending my stay by an extra night was very easy, and when I invited a friend to join me at the hotel, they took down his information and agreed to welcome him while I was out on the town and valet his vehicle. They gave him a copy of the room key at no extra charge. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who could afford the rates. If you can spring for the price, there's absolutely nothing to complain about. Otherwise, if you need a cheaper option, consider staying in Jersey City and taking a PATH train into Manhattan. Oh, and one more thing -- the complementary chocolate chip cookies ARE fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Top value in midtown east”
Reviews.Author: Fellotrav
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here at $120/night via Expedia. Given the 51st and Lexington location adjacent to a subway entrance, it is hard to beat that. Check in was fast and friendly - including the warm chocolate chip cookies. Our room was on the 11th floor. It was typically sized for Manhattan and similar in size to rooms I've stayed in for $250/night. I've posted a photo so you can judge for yourself. The king size bed was comfortable. The room was in good condition and was relatively quiet (I was a little taken aback when I walked in and found free earplugs on a nightstand... didn't need them.) Others have complained about the a/c -- we had the opposite problem - the room was warm and no amount of lowering the temperature really would fix that. Not very green, but we opened the window a little to chill the room, solving the problem. The front desk said they'd send someone but we saw no evidence of that. The shower was strong and hot. There was free wifi in the lobby and $15 wifi in the room. When we come to NYC, we don't stay in the room much so can't beat this deal while it lasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Antkneee
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite new hotels in New York. I typically stay in Times Square and usually pay alot of money for a small room that is near all of the action. This hotel is about a 15 minute walk to all of that action...I will tell you that one day I thought my face was going to freeze off but it was Feb. so I shouldn't complain. Check-in was great...I got the nice warm cookie which would make anyones day special. The room was nice and big too. I was able to spread out my computer on the desk and get some work done. The bed was comfy and there was a nice big safe in the room for all of my valuables. We had a breakfast meeting in the resturant but I would not recommend that. It took us almost an hour and half to order and get our food. We ate at Cafe Metro next door the next two days and got our egg white omlettes in 3 minutes flat. The hotel is not a far walk to Rockerfeller Center. Always nice to see the skaters. I wanted to do the NBC tour but got there 15 minutes late...it closes at 4:30pm on a Sunday...I was definately bumed because it would have been cool to see the SNL stage. Everything in the room worked great...HBO is always a plus too. There is also a fitness room at the hotel. Lots of cardio equipment and it was included with the hotel...most of the Times Square Hotels have terrible gyms. Do not take recommendations for resturants from the hotel staff...just go to YELP because there choices were terrible...I am sure that the staff gets some free meals to send hotel guests to these locations. Also there is free wifi in the lobby, which is great because it turns into a meeting place for all of the hotel guests. Grab a drink and check some emails.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Reservation Website - Trap Alert!”
Reviews.Author: grovebr
Reviews.Content: I review this hotel last year. It's a good hotel but they must be very desperate to keep their clients. Read on: I booked a room at the Doubletree Metropolitan at a rate of US$151.20 a month ago. At that point, that was the best rate available on their website. I prepaid a non-refundable rate. (Don't ask!) Last weekend Travelzoo announced a US$119 rate for the same room and period. I called Doubletree reservations, they referred me to the hotel's manager (talked to Tracie Cass, the rude manager) and they refused to honor the new rate saying that I chose a nonrefundable rate. I strongly disagree with this policy! Hilton advertise Best Rate Guarantee! Don't fall for that , if you book and prepay for a Hilton hotel, you are stuck and there is nothing you can do! Doubletree never again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, clean room but needs redecoration”
Reviews.Author: TheJagManWatford
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the location being only two minutes walk from the Waldorf Astoria, right next to the 51st and Lexington subway station and ten minutes walk from 5th Avenue. The room was clean but the bathroom needed a little work around the door. and the bath is like a skating rink with no grip when having a shower. The staff was helpful - we would certainly stay here again (I am writing this in the busy lobby!).

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs-HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Flightcrew79
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. However the hotel staff/ facilities and quality of the hotel is totally unacceptable. Few of my collagues got bed bugs! Housekeeping keep banging on the doors, rush into your room without checking for the sign! Front desk staffs were not helpful!! Manager is such a GARBAGE!

Reviews.Title: “Very Small room and really small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromSandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK. Have stayed at many different NYC hotels so for the price I guess this OK. Howerver, no coffee pot in the room is a real draw back. I like a cup in the morning without having to go out. This is the first hotel in 5 years that has NOT had an in room coffee maker. Staff are very nice but the concierge seemed clueless and did not know the city at all. I asked for a small map and they did not have any. The bed was fine and the room was in working order. However, the room is very small. I was solo but it would have been very difficult with another person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base of Exploring the City”
Reviews.Author: babaies0109
Reviews.Content: Good basic hotel. Near to all major attractions and shops. Staff very friendly and helpful. Down side is sound proofing, if you get noisy neighbours you could be in for a sleepless night, to be fare this could be any hotel, some people just not considerate. Small bathrooms but great comfortable beds. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good consistent quality good location”
Reviews.Author: loungelizard2011
Reviews.Content: i visit nyc regularly, often for one or two nights and when i do i am generally very busy. this hotel is in an excellent location for my purposes. the rooms are very comfortable, the staff efficient and polite and nearby metro, starbucks, au bon pain for coffee etc and subway, grand central make it a perfect convenient resting stop. the refurbishment undertaken a few years ago is standing up well and it is a stylish setting as well as comfortable - the hotel was designed by morris lapidus who designed the fontainbleu hotel in miami beach. stayed a couple of times with family for which it may not be ideal as rooms although comfy are smallish for lounging around in - but for business or overnighting/weekending it is superb value.

Reviews.Title: “Still average at best....”
Reviews.Author: clt11
Reviews.Content: the reviewers before this must have stayed at the wrong hotel because this hotel is average at best. Because this hotel is the NYC hotel for my company i need to stay at it at least 6-10 nights per month. Unfortunately the hotel is still only average at best. Bottom line is you get what you pay for. It is always $80-$150 cheaper per night than the hotels nearby including the marriott east side, the w, and the jefferson...and for good reason. The property is in dire need of updating as the decor in the hallways and guest rooms is circa 70s/80s. (the bar next to the lobby was recently renovated). the climate controls in the rooms rarely work effectively, the tubs back up with water while showering frequently, the smell in the hallways and rooms is bad, and you WILL need the earplugs that the hotel cleaning staff leaves on the nightstand due to the fire station right next door to the hotel. Some of the staff of the hotel tries hard to be very pleasant and professional, however, many of the staff are just 'ok' or even unfriendly. Bottom line on this property is if you want to save money stay here, but, if you want to have a clean room at a pleasant 3/4 star hotel go across the street to the marriott east side or next door to the W.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel, couldn't have been better.”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey2008
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel for a long weekend in Jan 2011. Room ready on arrival at approx 3pm. After reading reviews, I requested a room on a higher floor due to potential noise nuisance from the street and Fire Dept. I was given the option of floor 10 with a nice view or floor 16 with the view of a wall! Decided on the 10th floor room and was assured it wouldn't be too noisy. Throughout the stay, we could hear the Fire Dept sirens however they did not keep us awake at any point.
