Walls are thin and we could hear our neighbours on occasion however, this did not keep us awake at night either. The room itself (1004) has a nice view, as promised, and was not to far to walk from the lift (one of my grumbles in most hotels!). It was very clean and spacious enough for 2 people sharing. 1 king bed and a sofa. Plenty of drawer and desk space. Wardrobe was large enough however not many hangers available. Approx 10 which is not a lot for 2 people. Bathroom was small but again, not a problem. Sink was outside of the bathroom which was handy. Public areas are pleasant and clean. Staff always made an effort to greet you and were on hand if there was anything you required. The bar was closed a few times when we returned to the hotel but sure it opens 6pm daily. A beer and a spirit with mixer was approx $20. Slightly expensive but it's to be expected for a hotel on Lexington Ave. Bar food was very impressive and reasonably priced. We ate breakfast at the hotel on our last morning and it was very nice. Full menu available. We had the buffet for approx $23 each. For other breakfast alternatives there is Cafe Metro which is next door to hotel (cheap and cheerful) or I would highly recommend Raffles at the Raddison (left out of the hotel and a few blocks along). The business centre was excellent. 60 mins free browsing. Printing of boarding cards was free. Wifi available for a charge in the room however, free in the lobby. Very reliable. Location is very good. Approx a 15 min walk to Times Sq. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay and could not fault the hotel. As we had stayed in NYC before, we were pleased to be slightly away from the hustle of Times Sq but close enough to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: IsadoreG
Reviews.Content: Nice basic hotel. Pluses were: clean room, nice size for room, comfortable bed, quality toiletries, ample number of elevators (a problem in some other places), great location and good price. Minuses were expensive internet, no coffee service in room, parking (expensive at most hotels in the city). Overall, enjoyed the stay and would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: MM983
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in and very friendly staff. The warm cookie is always a bonus. This hotel is in a really great location. Out of the way of common tourist traps, yet you can still walk to pretty much anything you'd like. Room was a generous size for New York City standards and the room was clean and well designed. What was absolutely shocking is that I received a survey asking about my stay. Although I had a good experience, I did note some small concerns I had. I actually got a personal reply from staff a few hours after I hit the submit button. THAT'S service right there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, exceptional staff and service... and what a location!”
Reviews.Author: lancastertraveler50
Reviews.Content: Was concerned when I read the negative reviews...Boy were the negative reviewers off the mark. Though the hotel is older, the Doubletree Metropolitan provided exceptional service, an excellent room with a balcony, a reasonable price, and the perfect location for exploring the city by subway (right outside the hotel) or by foot! Was there Jan. 15 - Jan. 17 celebrating our 17th wedding anniversary. We will be back next year! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room a little shabby.”
Reviews.Author: rachdawn
Reviews.Content: The location was absolutely perfect for our short weekend trip. This was me and my friend's first visit to NYC and we wanted to hit the major attractions that we could in our short time frame (arriving Friday and leaving Sunday). Although there was a lot of walking involved, we didn't mind the walks and were able to see Grand Central Station, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, St. Pat's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, Macy's, and Empire State Building and I felt we had adequate time to do everything. Saved a lot of money on transportation. The room, especially the bathroom, was more shabby than I would've liked, but overall with such a short trip we weren't in our room much anyway. Check-in on Friday was very busy and our original room wasn't ready at 3 but we were anxious to get sight-seeing so we took a room on the third floor that was ready. Probably the reason for the more run-down room, but again we didn't care much. Overall, this is a great location, continental breakfast was also great, and probably would've given a higher rating had we been able to use our original room as I assume it would've been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Staff, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: bfos720
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in November 2009. I appreciate this was a while ago but I always read reviews before I buy anything or stay anywhere so feel its only fair I write a review on this hotel. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a really polite and smart dressed guy, who helped us with our cases to reception. Checking in was hassle-free and the receptionist was really polite and welcoming. We were given warm chocolate chip cookies as a 'warm welcome' which are the best cookies I have EVER tasted. I even purchased a tin of them to take home!!!! I would like to say that the cookies are such a nice touch and make the stay at this hotel just that bit more special! The receptionists were also very generous with the cookies and would ask you if you wanted one when passing. Me and my partner actually made jokes of not making eye contact with the reception just in case we got offered a cookie haha (refraining from putting 10 stone on in 5 days). This is in no way a negative though - jokes only! Me and my partner had such a lovely feeling staying here it almost felt like home and made our trip to New York the best time of our lives! I can't describe how happy we were with the hotel. The room was also amazing - huge comfy bed, huge tv, powerful shower and clean towels. We were also provided with branded toiletries e.g Loreal/Neutrogena!! Again, that special touch that makes you think they really care about your stay with them. The made service was also excellent. Don't get me wrong, there may have been a little tear in the carpet in the corner of the room or a scratch on a wall but this is no way puts me off the hotel and shouldn't anyone else! Overall, the room was in excellent condition and was kept clean. We could hear some noice outside when the window was open but we were staying in New York - which is of course the city that never sleeps!!! I would like to say a special thank you to the reception who were excellent at all times. I think the receptionist I usually dealt with was called Karen??! An american/chinese lady. I definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying there on my next trip to New York. I know my review may sound a little 'over the top' but our trip was truly amazing and I just wanted to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: nellie1919
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by the mixed reviews for this hotel. We had an excellent stay, on par with my other consistently positive Doubletree experiences across the country. I shared a room with a friend for a two-night stay in the city. Having lived in NYC for many years, I just need an affordable and clean homebase for quick and active trips when I want to keep an independent schedule without feeling tied to or in the way of friends who are hosting me in their small apartments, now increasingly with babies and kids. If this Doubletree keeps offering the excellent rate we got (~140/night), I may very well become a regular here! I found the entrance/lobby/bar area fragrant, cozy and cool-looking, the staff friendly and responsive, the welcome cookie yummy, the elevators efficient, the halls narrow but clean, and the room nice. The room (1 queen-sized bed) was a bit small, but this is to be expected for NYC and the lower rate. The segmented bathroom, with the vanity and sink separate from the shower and toilet is an added convenience for sharing this room. Everything was CLEAN and in order. Our bathroom was spotless -- which is really important to me. However, I did notice that some of the ceiling paint was peeling, probably due to a combination of shower steam and poor ventilation. It wasn't major, but I hope Doubletree monitors it and repaints before it gets too yucky. Our room was provided with a set of earplugs, which I didn't need. But light sleepers should be aware that city street noise or hall noises (room doors opening and closing and/or housekeeping staff in the morning) are to be expected. My only suggestion to Doubletree on this point is that they should consider replacing the room doors with heavier/more solid ones to soften hall noises. I'm a good sleeper, so I really didn't have an issue with noise. In fact, I really enjoyed the comfortable bed! I asked for two extra blankets just after arrival, and staff delivered them promptly. Thanks Doubletree!

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good rate for the hotel then ok....but don't pay full price!”
Reviews.Author: PDDNOSMom
Reviews.Content: My husband, young son and I booked a room here at the last minute the day after New Years - it was a bit crazy in the lobby checking in and the room wasn't ready yet, but the hotel did check our luggage for a small fee so we could explore while we waited for the room. This hotel is within walking distance of Grand Central Terminal and Rockefeller Center. We requested a room on a high floor and got a larger than expected double/double room on the 16th floor. The room we were given was oddly shaped but if you look at the exterior of the building you can see why. The decor is modern and the clientele mostly youngish. We were greeted with the Doubletree Warm Cookies - in fact they gave us extra cookies, which was really nice. Room service was expensive (to be expected) but quite prompt. We did hear a little bit of street noise, but only if a siren passed. (The hotel does provide noise reducing ear plugs) Two things we really didn't like - there was no coffeemaker in the room and the room got WAY too hot if the heat was on - there was no way to control the temperature from the thermostat that was on the wall in our room. It may have been broken. But - even when the heat was off, the room stayed much too warm for us. Fortunately, we were able to open the window a bit to let the cool outside air in, or it would have been unbearable. Also, our son was very disappointed to find out that the option to rent Game Cube games had been disabled by the hotel, but was still advertised on the TV menu. Room was clean but not spotless - I would have preferred a cleaner floor in the bathroom. We didn't use the Wifi or have a car to park - both are expensive extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: MichalCu
Reviews.Content: The reception is very dark, crowded by people in/out, sitting all around on Internet and in the bar. Reception staff is very unfriendly snd features 'Staff is the King' attitude. Rooms are relatively large, however a bit dirty and clearly a major overhaul is required. There is no refrigerator in the room. Internet connection is a disaster, super slow with frequent (short) drop outs. When chacking in, my card have been 'overcharged' significantly (by 47%) against what I have been actually booked for. Much to my surprise, the last night they 'charged' my card by extra 230 US$, i.e. reaching total of 60% 'overcharged'. No logical explanation provided by the staff, except of the fact that 'computer is doing that' and the money will be returned to my account within 24 hrs (remains to be seen).

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has a zero tolerance attitude to its clients”
Reviews.Author: PaulRed
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a number of times over the past 10 years. I made a "non refundable" booking for 2 people on Dec 24, 2010 for 4 nights from Feb 21 next to tie in with an Aer Lingus flight that day from Ireland. However the confirmation showed that the booking had defaulted to Feb 24 ie the night before the return flight to Ireland. I called the Hotel to get them to correct the dates within minutes of getting the incorrect confirmation. Despite my offer to accept a change to the intended dates in an upgraded room at my additional cost the Hotel were not for turning. In their opinion "non refundable" means absolutely no changes will be entertained even one that offers them more revenue.I have never asked for a refund; all I want is to get a booking on the requested dates. I have asked Aer Lingus Hotels and their Web booking intermediaries to talk to the Hotel but despite their severe embarrassment the Hotel still refuses to make any alterations to the 4 night booking from Feb 24. Not only have I used the Hotel in the past but I am also an investor in the Hilton group. What a way to treat a stakeholder!!

Reviews.Title: “We love it !”
Reviews.Author: LucilaLorencette
Reviews.Content: Me and my sisters spend a great time there ! The Concierge service was very kind to us and always helpful ! The front desk was very heplful too. The room was always clean and the bed very comfortable ! The location is great, right near a subway station. Surely we will return to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, TIRED ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: HOMEBIRD4DALTON
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights to celebrate a 50th birthday in NYC. Modern lobby area and quick check in but heart sank when opened door to room. Very tired decor and bathroom was pokey and quite gloomy. On positive note the bed was very comfortable and cosy after long day walking out in freezing weather. We had room at back of hotel so no view and not too much traffic noise. Only woken up one night of stay by screaming guests walking along corridor at 3am. No tea/coffee making facilities. Teens enjoyed free internet access in business centre to catch up with friends back home. The location of hotel was excellent and for us, a better option than the very busy Times Square. We bought a metrocard and used underground right next to hotel to get everywhere. Excellent little diner round corner to left of hotel as you come out. Metro Cafe at side of hotel very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: ArlJeff
Reviews.Content: The staff was simply rude. When I tried to give them my honors number they said they wouldn't give me points because I pre-paid my room (an odd rule, I thought) and they had a serious attitude about it. I wouldn't stay here again - don't lik the way they treated me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in midtown”
Reviews.Author: Hiltongold
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at if you are in midtown, the rooms are a bit larger than other hotels in the area and they have breakfast in the morning for Hilton Gold members

Reviews.Title: “Great Location within walking distance of major attractions and close subway access.”
Reviews.Author: VickieD
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel...subway just next door...clean; very friendly reception people. Be sure to ask for a room away from the fire station...we did hear the sirens but it was not disturbing. The price and location were good for two ladies on a budget. Nice deli down the street...Oxford Cafe I think...not as expensive or crowded as the deli next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbodhe
Reviews.Content: The location was great but that is about it. The staff at the front desk are unfriendly, however the bell men were very nice and helpful. The room looked like it hadn't been updated in years. The walls were dirty, the rug was dirty, the bathroom sink was leaking, the shower was clogged. The room was not worth the price. I would not stay at this hotel again nor would I recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but....”
Reviews.Author: scubatennessee
Reviews.Content: My husband travels extensively, and is a Hilton Diamond member. We have stayed at numerous Hilton properties throughout the world. Thought we would try something different on this trip as we normally stay in Times Square. The Metropolitan hotel location is awesome, but that's about it. First and foremost, the noise level at this hotel is awful. Old hotel, old windows which equates to very noisy. Apparently, this hotel is near a police or fire precinct, so all night long you hear sirens. Also, whenever our neighbors opened or closed their doors, it sounded like they were coming in our room. Very noisy. Now, to the next "discomfort". Old hotel - old heating system. Once they turn on the heat, it stays on. Our room was way too warm, and no way to cool it down except for opening a window. Noise from outside and noise from inside = horrible experience. Hot Water - first hotel I've stayed at in years that we didn't have hot water - just warm - for showers. We were traveling as a family with one small child. There was a small chair/love seat in the corner. However, it was next to a window and the chill from the non-insulated window made it too cold for our daughter to sleep. (Five feet away from the window it's too warm!!) Next item - executive lounge. One of the worst lounges for a Hilton property. This hotel is in a great location, but it needs some major improvements. Doubletree Times Square much much better, and much much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad value”
Reviews.Author: ComebackShane
Reviews.Content: The good: location nice bathroom with shower only staff was good - nice bar - good looking ladies working at check in desk (thought little personality) The bad: - room was really cold at night (tstat was set at 80) - Needed a detailed cleaning (I am a stickler about cleanliness under beds and places dont typically look). Not the cleanest. - There were toe nail clipping (all ten) under night stand, which was directly next too bed. Really gross. - Carpet needed a shampooing. - Toilet. This was a problem for a guy when doing #2. The water was really shallow and needed to be careful something important didnt fall into the water. Overall I would stay here again. For the price I was happy. I have little expectations for NYC hotels. Way over priced and always need a good deep cleaning. This doubletree was OK and I would take my family there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: pk_efc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel, and couldn't really fault anything to be honest. The rooms were very clean & modern although a little small, but it is NYC after all. Hotel has a great location, subway station is right next to the hotel for the 6 Train, and also a really nice Deli next to the hotel called the Metro (I think)!! The wireless in the hotel is chargeable, but you can use it for free if you walk to the corner of 51st and use the "Staples" network, or is also free in the Waldorf Astoria just across the street. Overall a good stay in the hotel...if you are a light sleeper, then ask for a room overlooking the courtyard, as this was where my room was, and couldn't hear any traffic at all, even from the 6th floor!!!

Reviews.Title: “A typical mid range hotel, no more no less”
Reviews.Author: NICOLA091
Reviews.Content: My experience was adequate and I have to say, compared with my pevious 4 day stay in Washington DC, which cost me exactly half, it really was no better and having to ask for coffee making facilities I thought was penny pinching to the extreme. I guess it suffers from what so many similar hotels do by trying to be one thing but having to cater for the mass tourist market. Given the number of hotels in New York I wouldn't denigrate this one but I would certainly suggest a good check of the whole market.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and value for the money but tiny bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: AGrassini
Reviews.Content: Great location convenient to everything. The room was small, but very clean even though the carpets are beginning to show signs of age. No slippers and only one bathrobe in the room and the pillows were also a little less than new. When we first arrived, I discovered that the bathtub did not drain--but a repair crew was dispatched quickly and took care of it immediately. The bathroom was tiny and the caulk along the tub needed to be replaced but it was evident that it had been cleaned with care. The most disconcerting thing was the way we could hear our neighbors come and go into their own rooms--the first night I thought someone was actually trying to get into our room and I freaked out! For women alone, I would be concerned about the long hallways and the fact that the elevator does not have secure access. Late at night, however, there was a security guard checking that all people taking the elevator had a room key. We loved the location and the bed was as comfortable as we have come to expect at any Doubletree. Great breakfast buffet and lots of other dining options around. For the price we paid, this was a fine property...if we had paid more, I do not think I would have appreciated the smallness of the bathroom. I felt that the staff cared about the guests and we were even called by guest relations on our last night to check if the stay had been to our satisfaction. I think management is addressing some of the issues that have gotten this property poor reviews before--I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Midtown Location”
Reviews.Author: SuziQ22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree in mid-November for three nights for work, and it was a comfortable, good experience. My interaction with the front desk staff was probably the least desireable part of the experience as she was not particularly friendly, but I will chalk that up to the New York attitude. The concierge was very helpful, as were the bellstand staff. I stayed in one of the smaller guestrooms, but for just me it was comfortable and clean and relatively quiet (some guests were noisy in the hallway one late night). One small maintenance issue that was resolved almost instantly. Nice little breakfast/lunch place next door offered good breakfast. I was able to walk to the theater district and restaurants on the Upper East Side, so I thought it was a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent value, thin walls -- below average sleep”
Reviews.Author: C_Shore02066
Reviews.Content: T'giving weekend in NYC -- stayed here before but had switched to another mid-town hotel for most recent stays (London NYC --- highly recommend). We enjoy the location, during our original stay in 2008 we were going to a Yankeesgame and you cannot beat the proximity of this hotel to the subway stop -- it's on the corner. For this trip we were looking to get a quick weekend away and cut some of the expenses down. This hotel is a reasonable bargain -- but understand you're getting what you pay for. Bellmen were excellent, quite helpful. Front desk was cheerful, friendly and helpful. We needed a rollaway bed and it was delivered quickly. Woman cleaning the rooms was extremely nice and friendly. All of this was great. Not sure there's actually a restaurant in the hotel -- if there is it wasn't open much of the time. Use the cafe Metro directly next door. Here's the negatives -- the rooms are OK. Emphasis on OK. Not terrible -- but not even close to above average (you get what you pay for....). For his trip the biggest negatives were the paper thin walls. We had a group next door that were taking up two rooms each across the hall from the other and it was non-stop slamming of doors, chatter and other miscellaneous noises from next door. Now, before you say "that's not the fault of the hotel" understand this -- when they slid open or closed a draw for their dresser -- you heard it. When they attempted to open a window -- you heard it. I can recommend this hotel, again, with the caveat -- you get what you pay for. BTW -- Strongly recommend the Smith & Wollensky located two blocks away at 3rd and 49th

Reviews.Title: “Inferior Hilton Family Property, do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: rn4trips124
Reviews.Content: Not happy with this hotel. Stayed here for 2 nights for a weekend "get-away" to NYC. We are Hilton Honors "Gold" members and choose Hilton family properties whenever it is practical to do so. There were several other hotels we might have chosen to book, both Hilton family and non-Hilton, at the same rate or less, but we decided upon the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel. Bad choice. In our rez we asked for a room upgrade if available in lieu of the extra 1,000 pts. Our rez was for a standard queen. We arrived at the hotel at 11:00 a.m. Friendly & professional reception. Room not ready (no prob, we are very early). Stored bags ($6). Went out for the day and returned to the hotel at 5:30 pm. Long check-in line but it is 5:30 pm; got our room key.Went to assigned room, which we were told was an "upgrade" per our rez request. The room was in the process of being cleaned. Went to the "Ex. Lounge" and dialed the front desk to inform them room not ready & request re-assignment. Operator picked up and transferred me to the Front Desk. Phone rang on & on; no answer. Tried 3 times- same result. Decided to check on room; housekeeping had finished and it was ready (around 6:30 pm). Found stained walls, peeling paper, damaged drapes, etc. The room was in very poor condition~ found a number in the room for the "CareLine" & called ~ explained situation & was given a different room. Went to new room, it was just as bad, this time the BR was much smaller and the bathtub & sink were stained. Again, very poor condition. Called CareLine again. Explained again. We were asked to come to the front desk where the manager would meet us and escort us to a "really beautiful room". Waited for some time at the front desk and had to re-explain to a not- too-friendly receptionist the situation. Manager met us and escorted us to another room (the third room), manager very pleasant and apologetic. The 3rd room was in better condition overall and had a decent view of the Chrysler Building, but still several major issues- the shower head was not connected to the wall, the heater/ac unit was banged up, the shades were dirty, carpet worn, walls with obvious scrapesetc. We later discovered that the bathroom fan ran continuously. Anyway- the manager was quite nice. I asked it really, didnt they have something more in line with what we expect from Hilton? Well, this is an old hotel, he said. We thought- OK, enough. We just want to get on with our weekend.The manager later sent us a bottle of inexpensive red wine, choc. covered strawberries, and promised a free drink at the bar. Well, it was something, and we appreciated our concerns being heard. Went to the bar for our free drink. Bartender's attitude was almost surly. Bartender asked us many questions and told us to go get a voucher from the front desk- I said "why dont you just call the manager". OK- CONS: Initial reception area dark, poorly organized, and much too small for the size of the hotel. I dislike greatly the hotel lobby decor and layout. Out of the 8 staff we spoke to on the phone or in person, 3 were friendly and professional. The manager was very pleasant and I give him an "A". The other 5 were almost, if not actually, rude. The room(s) color scheme was not to our liking (retro yellow / orange / blue ) and DH likes retro! The third room we were assigned should have been the room we originally reserved (except it had a king rather than queen bed), NOT the upgrade.I feel strongly that we were "cheated" out of our upgrade- if one isnt available, fine, but dont charge us our 1K pts per night by assigning a substandard room and then making a halfway decent room appear to be an "upgrade"! How stupid do you think we are? The Ex. Lounge is a joke. Small, dark, and unstaffed other than someone replenishing supplies. Very limited selection of soft drinks, snacks, etc. I asked at the bar for a bottle of Club Soda / Tonic (as this wasn't available in the Ex. Lounge). Tonic only available on tap and then charged me $4 for a 10 oz bottle of Club Soda. Mediocore breakfeast. Eggs were awful. PRO's: Nicely located for a midtown east hotel. Subway 10 steps from the hotel; if you are traveling the east side, this is a good location- we were mainly in the East Village so this worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Marbar1970
Reviews.Content: My biggest concern after reading some of the reviews, was the room sizes. Our room was more than adequate, with plenty of room for suitcase storage etc. We had booked a standard room through opodo , so were pleasantly surprised. We were on the 19th floor, and it was really quiet all week (not that we spent too much time in the room) One tiny minus point was being not far from the roof, there was an annoying noise, so we had the window closed most of the time. I am not sure if it was fans etc, but not too much of a problem. The room was spotless, and the king size bed was amazing!! It was just so comfortable, with crisp white sheets etc. I did try & pick spots, by examining the sheets etc for stains, but there were none. If i really wanted to find fault, the carpet was a little worn by the doorway, but that's it !!! The staff were very friendly, and the warm cookies on arrival are a lovely idea, and scummy too. The location is just fab, right next to a subway station, and within walking distance of Times square, central park etc. I would defiantly stay here again, and have no qualms in recommending it to others

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing trip!”
Reviews.Author: tcpearle
Reviews.Content: Seven ladies set out to celebrate turning 40 this year and what an amazing trip it was! We deliberated a great deal about the choice of hotel - and we were so happy with the choice we made! The Doubletree Metropolitan was great! It had it all - location, price, cleanliness, excellent staff (especially the Guest Relations Manager Jasmine) . We will definitley go back to NYC and would certainly reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Fantastic Manager”
Reviews.Author: Freya60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for my 30th Birthday from 29th October 2010 to 1st November 2010. When I got to the hotel, I realised I had picked up the wrong suitcase from the airport. Upset, I asked staff for the Manager (Kerman). He was extremely helpful and so nice. He stayed up until 1am that morning trying to locate my luggage and as it was my birthday, treated us so well. We have never known such hospitality. This hotel was spotless, all the staff we came across were polite and more than happy to help. If it had not been for Kerman the manager, I dont know what we would have done, he finally located my luggage the next day. It was the best trip we have ever been on and such a fabulous welcoming hotel. We would definately recommend it and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Large room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RudyOMalley
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC and I did a lot of internet research prior to booking the hotel and read on numerous sites that small rooms are to be expected when visiting the City. Since I was traveling with a friend, we wanted two beds, and I thought finding such a room might also be difficult. However, we were so pleasantly surprised! Our room was spacious and had two queen sized beds. My only complaint about the room would be that the door seemed a bit loose and didn't seem to lock properly. However, we brought it to the attention of one of the housekeepers in the hallway on our first day and she showed us how to secure it. The bellhops were very helpful and the service the hotel offers for holding your luggage prior to check-in/after check-out was great. There is a minimal charge, but it is worth it. Check-in was simple (don't forget the Doubletree cookies!) and although we were not able to get to our room any earlier than the stated check-in time, we were able to stash our bags and begin exploring. The concierge desk does have room for improvement. The lady who helped us on two occassions didn't appear to be very interested and seemed a little put off by my request for theater information. On the day I asked for information on getting to Yankee Stadium, she simply shoved a pre-printed subway sheet to me. Fortunately, you can't go anywhere without maps and City information being readily available and we were able to fend for ourselves. The best part about the hotel was something we didn't fully appreciate until the last day of our 4 day weekend - it's location. It is located at the corner of Lexington and 51st in Midtown Manhattan. Each day we walked towards Times Square and the Broadway area, and we didn't really just how close we were to Central Park and all the great shopping on Park and Madison Avenues. With it being our first trip, it took a couple of days to get our bearings, but I think this hotel is located in a great spot - with a subway entrance right outside, a Metro Cafe next door, St. Patrick's Cathedral about 2-3 blocks away and Central Park easily within walking distance. There was a fire station across the street, but noise was not a problem. We paid about $200/night and in New York that is very reasonable. While not a luxury hotel, the room was clean, very spacious and provided everything we needed - especially a great location. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but tired and in need of an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: jarakus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had stayed here before years ago, so we booked a room again the week of the NY Marathon. The hotel is acceptable, and we had no bad experiences, but I am curious why the Hilton Corp. does not invest some money in improving the cosmetics at such a premium property. The location is very good, and the staff was fine, but the property deperately needs new carpeting, wallpaper, paint, fixtures, etc. Most of the public areas appear to be decorated in circa 1978 brown and red "mod" decor (which actually looks very bleak, not "mod"), and adds to the tired, old look. Many carpets in halls, lobbies, and stairs are nearly threadbare, and wallpaper in the halls has peeling seamsand bumps underneath where the adhesive is bubbling, and baseboards black with years of cleaning cart wheel impact marks. To be fair, though, many manhattan hotels are expensive, old, tired edifices without any elbow room in public spaces and tiny rooms that serve masses of travelers every day that need a hotel for only sleep .....this hotel accomplishes that need well. Other notes....the exercise room is pretty good, breakfast is adequate, the lobby is fine (but tacky), the bath amenities are good, the HVAC in the rooms is poor, the bed was OK, the neighborhood is very good (much quieter than most other midtown hotels, and safe). Everything was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: STLMV
Reviews.Content: I was there for work and it was in a great locatoin to catch the subway. You get a yummy cookie when you check in. Rooms were kind of small, but it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “No problems, no hassles -- great location, recommended!”
Reviews.Author: badpatti
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Doubletree Metropolitan, part business, part leisure. It was an all-around good experience; no problems at all. Initially we were registered for a room on the third floor, but all we had to do was ask, and we received an upgrade to the 16th -- important in NY and especially here because the police/fire precinct is next door. All the basics you want -- good water pressure, new mattress, good linens, nice decor, good amenities, never-crowded lobby, business center printers that work, good unobtrusive housekeeping, internet service (not free, but it works well). Very clean, room safe works, no evidence of bedbugs. Nice bar in the hotel, and right next door is a cafe with coffee, pastry, breakfast stuff, much less expensive than any hotel's. NYC isn't cheap -- this was around $300/night -- but here you know what to expect and you get it. To me a hotel should be a place you don't have to think or worry about and this one excelled at that. Also, the subway is right on the corner, and the location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, needs a few tweaks”
Reviews.Author: sparkyandlou
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff upon arrival, room was very adequate. One thing that I noticed that made no difference in the quality of the location was the poor workmanship in the installation of the towel racks (crooked), sloppy installation of wallpaper (many loose edges/crooked ). I know these items seem and sound petty, but those minor attentions to detail can shape an impression.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Masons_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there at the start of our holiday, it's costs but it is worth it. We are going back there for thanksgiving and they helped us with booking a nice restaurant with perfect views. Walking distant to all sights. There is an excellent diner for the best breakfast in town and the most friendly and efficient staff - family owned business I think.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfortable, Clean & what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: Fritzandlacy
Reviews.Content: Had a great two night stay at the Doubletree. The location is perfect, the bed was so comfortable and my room was super clean. Very happy and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Customers From Mars”
Reviews.Author: wme79736
Reviews.Content: Caveat emptor: the reviews warned me to expect to be over-charged and housed in a noisy, dirty room located on an un-renovated floor. But Doubletree is a Hilton, right? So it could not possibly be as bad as all that. Well, it wasnâ€™t. Quite. The hotel is in a superb, central location. If you like the Upper East Side and the huge range of tempting distractions that will draw you without end along the apparently infinite length of Lexington Avenue, it is just right for you. Itâ€™s next door to some of the most expensive hotels in the USA and it is impossible not to experience a frisson of delight at the realization that you are getting the same, or a similar, deal for a fraction of the price. Yet, I found it ironic that everything I had been warned about came to pass. When I checked in I was informed that for my website discounted rate I had booked a room â€œon a renovation floor.â€� This meant that the corridors were stripped to bare concrete with the plumbing and wiring exposed and the stimulating scent of wet cement in the air. It hardly mattered. The room was perfectly furnished and finished and you donâ€™t spend much time in a hotel corridor, but they might have said so when I booked. Am I the only person who would not only be undeterred but would leap at a â€œrenovation discountâ€�? To compensate, I was given a free breakfast during each day of my stay, which was very generous, except that it wasnâ€™t free. I was billed for the service fee, which was pretty harmless, but very rude. When I checked out, some intuition, probably planted by the reviews I had hitherto regarded as gratuitously negative, made me check my bill. It just didnâ€™t add up. There was something wrong. By my calculations I could not get within $100 of the total. What with the service fee for breakfast and the various State and City taxes I realised that I might be calculating things incorrectly. I drew up a spreadsheet on my laptop and spent twenty minutes trying to work out where my figures erred. It turned out I had been billed a daily rate considerably in excess of the agreed tariff. This was instantly corrected by the accounts department (well, as instantly as one can be when there is a check-out line of fifteen or sixteen people with the same complaint), without the slightest hesitation, explanation or apology. Could it be that this is a common occurrence, that maybe this hotel rather prefers to wait for customers to complain rather than ensure the accounts are correct before they are handed to the nocturnal visitor who shoves them beneath the crack in the door at 4.45 am? I had had a narrow escape as I do not incur â€œadditional room expensesâ€� and am inclined to pay hotel bills without thinking that they might have overcharged me by almost 100%. The hotel itself is smart, clean and pleasant. The rooms are large, comfortable, four star rooms with large, comfortable beds, large, comfortable bathrooms, pleasant decor and very agreeable staff in whose mouths butter would not melt (but this is part of the charm of Manhattan). Depending on which side of the building you are on it is easy to use the public wireless internet provided by the City of New York (or other less charitable institutions in close proximity) without paying the hotelâ€™s ridiculously high rate for internet access. The breakfast was good but the basement venue was claustrophobic and chaotic and I would not have set foot in it had I had to pay the $20 buffet fee when I could go to any number of nearby diners and have a better breakfast for under $10. Still, the Doubletree Metropolitan was a steal for the discount web rate of $150 per night, and if I had not had the sense that I had survived a pick-pocketing, I would recommend it to anyone. As it is, I recommend it to anyone who is prepared to ignore a concrete lined hotel corridor, who can use a magnifying glass to check their account, and who can apply sufficient assertiveness to demand a substantial refund from a hotel clerk who might be from Venus but who appears to believe that we customers must be treated as though we are from Mars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous! - perfect for our anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: deryckp
Reviews.Content: We booked the Doubletree online. we have stayed in doubletrees before and liked the hotel. reason for doubletree for this weekend was the price - couldnt beat it in Midtown. We were going to see a show and have dinner, so we were only staying for one night. its a lil less than a mile to all the broadway shows so not a big deal walking and my wife was 8 months prego. they upgraded us to a junior suite on the 19th floor which was really nice - i believe it was one of the newly renovated rooms. The room was huge w/ a king bed and a couch and plenty of floor space - something you dont usually get in NY hotels. bed was really comfortable also. the manager even surprised us with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries when we got back to our room. very unexpected, but definitely gives them the WOW factor and a 5 star rating! oh yeah - cant forget the free warm cookie when you check in - nice delicious touch! would defintiely recommend and definitely stay here again for our future NYC visits. my only complaint was the no free internet in our rooms - i think there might have been down in the lobby though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and customer service but lacking in usual amenities expected at a hilton.”
Reviews.Author: callisto11
Reviews.Content: The restaurant is only open for breakfast - otherwise only the bar with a very limited menu or room service. No mini-bar so only way to cool items is in the tiny ice bucket. Room was very clean and we enjoyed the PURE air ionizer in our upgrade room. However, because of the lack of a restaurant and other expected amenities we are only grading it average.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and attentive service in a very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: reneCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Service from the front desk and bellman staff was excellent. Room was very comfortable and quiet. Only down side was the price, but probably in line for Midtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lobby but dated rooms"”
Reviews.Author: biggerduck
Reviews.Content: Wasted about an hour at check in trying to find an acceptable room:maybe it was the" Priceline NYOP curse" that sent me to the dungeon but first shown a steamy dingy room with malfunctioing air cond; the next room ac was a bit better but phonewas not working; the 3 rd room bad ac again! Back to the front desk for the fourth time and fortunately this time it was staffed by a lady named Sylvia who listened to my complaints and located a decent functioning room -thank you Sylvia you saved the day and I had a comfortable stay. While I heard that rooms on the 2nd floor and some on the 3rd have been updated none of the rooms I saw appeared to be- with the possibloe exception of the beds . Time for more renovation. What I DID appreciate at the hotel was no nickel diming as local phone calls were free and there is abusiness center with 4 high speed PCs also free for guests' use .

Reviews.Title: “Will not get the full NYC experience staying here.....”
Reviews.Author: kythomas
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write reviews, but I felt like I actually had a lo of pros and cons to share about this hotel. PROS -right across the street from the subway! take the subway people, it will be your best friend. I mastered the subway to anywhere i needed to go. Including battery park to see the statue of liberty. -Housekeeping left a message letting me know when and where i could reach them since i had a "do not disturb sign". Made it very easy to get my room cleaned later. -nice welcome with a cookie, adds a little extra. -Location is close to 5th ave. took minutes to walk to saks, NBA store, gucci... etc -stayed in many NYC hotels... was roomy compared to most -business center... slow computers but printing available... that's expected though -free wireless in lobby only CONS -raining when we got there and bell hop was NO WHERE TO BE FOUND. -went outside later that day asked bell hop to hail a cab... told us very rudely that we were just going to have to wait for a while because he was busy. - front desk ladies... you have some good ones, some bad ones... the ones that work around 10pm were the most crabby and gave short answers... the early morning/day ladies were soo nice and helpful. very very impressed with their service. -WORST THING... THE FEMALE CONCIERGE LADY.... i've never met someone so rude, unhelpful, and annoyed by her job. I refused to go back to her. Such attitude and could offer no advice. - molding in bathroom, tub had cracks and was very old. they mainly need to work on their customer service. It ruins the whole trip having rude people assist you. for the price you pay for the hotel though, it's relatively cheap in NYC standards.... and thats what you get... cheap service if you are absolutely on a budget, stay here. in NY you're out and about most of the time. If you can spare an extra 150 or 200 and upgrade even a little, YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT. I guess the only thing i really liked about the hotel was the location to everything... but trust me.... there are other hotels with good locations and better service. For those of you just thinking that I had a bad encounter with the service, trust me, you will feel cheated out of your NYC experience staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Mold (fixed) and billing dispute (also fixed)”
Reviews.Author: donmontalvo
Reviews.Content: It's not a flea bag hotel, but it's also not a grand hotel by any stretch of the imagination. I travel a lot on business. Double Tree is one of the hotels our travel agency puts us in (Marriott is another). When I arrived I was met I was impressed with the staff. Front desk staff and management were very polity and extremely efficient (Marriott can learn from these folks). The floor staff were also polite and extremely diligent (I felt like royalty). Things started to go downhill once I got to my room. I went to take a shower and found the ceiling was covered with black mold. It was disgusting and needless to say a health hazard. I went back to the front desk to request another room. The mid-shift staff were not as polite and competent as the day staff. I was told there were no more rooms and that the earliest someone could come by to "clean the mold" is the next day. Unacceptable. I insisted to speak to a manager, which I guess spooked the desk person who came back and put me in another room. The new room did not have mold. The second problem I ran into was that at check out time, Double Tree charged the wrong credit card. They were supposed to bill our company AMEX (they had the credit card authorization form faxed over - TWICE!). Gross incompetence. I've never had this problem with Marriott. 24 hours after checking out, I'm still playing phone tag with Double Tree Metropolitan staff and Chase bank. I'm hoping to get this all ironed out soon so I can pay my rent. Incredible how someone's incompetence can cause such disruption to someone's finances. Double Tree staff is a mix of fairly competent and helpful (day staff) and grossly incompetent and lazy (evening staff) people. My company has a contract with Double Tree. I intend to file a formal complaint to Double Tree (for the moss problem as well as the billing mistake). Further, I intend to recommend to my company to break their contract and find another hotel that has more competent and diligent staff. Would I recommend Double Tree to a friend? Hard to say. Double Tree is cheap. If you get a room without mold and if Double Tree staff don't make a mistake with your bill, then maybe you won't have a miserable stay. My professional opinion, as a constant business traveler, is to expect a level of incompetence and inconvenience (having to compensate for stupid mistakes). My personal opinion, make sure you double, triple, quadruple check that Double Tree staff have the correct information...because they can (and often do - from what I'm seeing) make very costly mistakes. Marriott is a much more sensible place if you're a business traveler. When your boss sends you on the road to work on a project, the last thing you need is to play "Special Education Teacher" with incompetent Double Tree staff. Don Montalvo, Coppell, TX

Reviews.Title: “Guest Relations Manager was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AdamNovotny
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Sunday for one night. Great location, but more than that, we received excellent service from their Guest Relations Manager, KCL. He is a fantastic representative of Doubletree. We will most certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Loves-Vacation09
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York City and it was awesome largely because of this hotel. The hotel itself was clean and inviting. The beds were great and the pillows were so nice I wanted to take them home. The rooms are small, as is common in this particular City, but well maintained. The staff was helpful but do not eat breakfast there it was expensive and awful. The food at the hotel bar however was fairly good. But, the best feature about this hotel is its location. The metro/subway is right there so you are only two stops from Central Park and you are a 10-15 minute walk from all the main attractions (Empire State Building, Time Square, Madison Ave, Park Ave etc.). Plus, you have great places close by to dine at and bars/clubs to go to without having to leave this very safe and popular area of the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Would Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Salsa81
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service! Big king size bed all to myself, room was very clean and comfortable, would have been plenty big enough for 2 people! Great location for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Ask if you are in the SMALL or LARGE rooms upon booking.......”
Reviews.Author: Vegasluver1
Reviews.Content: My Mom, daughter and I stayed here for one week in September, and we booked it on Expedia. The overall experience was average, except for one outstanding employee....he is the evening Manager at Front desk, and his name starts witht the letter T'. He made our trip-he was so helpful in making reservations and getting us directions. His general attentiveness was very much appreciated. Thank you!!! When you are booking this room, be sure to ask for the larger of the 2 double occupancy choices, because there are 2 sizes of rooms, and the one you see on the internet is the BIGGER room. You wouldn't have belived HOW SMALL our room was, In fact we requested a cot prior to our arrival, and it was in the room when we arrived.....I am not kidding, we COULD NOT open it up due to the small size of this room (see the photo I uploaded). Oh ya......ask for a room that faces 51st street, not the back alley. THE restaurant in the hotel is VERY PRICY.....our bill was $90 for three buffet breakfasts.....there is a neat cafe right beside the hotel called CAFE METRO (they are all over Manhatten too), but we could get breakfast there and late night snacks as well, so that was a good thing. The room was cleaned adequately each day, but the decor and overall style of the rooms could use some updating. The beds and pillows are good, but we were so tired at the end of each day, we could have probably slept on the floor. Coffeemakers are available ONLY BY request, so be sure to request one if you are a coffee drinker......ONE issue was the maid forget to provide us with coffee each day, so every night we had to call the front desk for more coffee, so we would have it ready to make in the morning. Finally on the last night, the restaurant manager brought our coffee up, and when he found out we didnt get coffee all week, he gave us 3 breakfast buffet coupons (remember, that's worth $90), so we really appreciated that and we enjoyed a buffert breakfast before leaving for a long day of traveling. Location was good.......the blocks are long but depending on weather its nice to walk so you can see all the shops and cafes along the way. The 'all loops tours' bus stops right on 49th and Lexington, so we used that lots to get back and fourth from Times Square and Broadway shows. Also, there is a subway station on the corner of 51st and Lexington (right beside the hotel). The one on the same side of street as hotel goes all the way downtown (Brookyn Bridge, Canal Street, etc) and the one across the street goes uptown. My recommedation is to get a metrocard of you are using the subway or buses for transportation-you can buy them at each subway station. Hope this was helpful-take care

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job”
Reviews.Author: CGeorgeMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend stay at the Doubletree Metropolitan NYC for Fashion Night 2010. This trip was very spontaneous and I booked the hotel less than 24 hours before the check-in. I was impressed that the room rate was only $179 which a steal for NYC. Location is great and very easy to drive to with safe parking garages in close proximity. The hotel is very busy and I think that the rooms show the wear of having a constant stream of guests. I don't think that any of the rooms sit empty for an evening. The room was clean and the bed and bathroom linens where good. Once again just a lot of wear shows on the room and it does the purpose of sleeping but not for lingering and hanging out. I did try to nap in the afternoon and I could hear everything going on in the hallway. In any event your in NYC and you shouldn't be napping in the middle of the day. Overall, it serves the purpose and will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “great service cant make up for dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: indibnkr
Reviews.Content: Located at 51st and Lex the hotel is ideally located in central Manhattan - when I checked in I was given a room on the 2nd flr which for me was too close to street level and the elevators â€“ I checked out the room â€“ which incidentally was recently remodeled and quite nice â€“ and knew immediately upon entering that it would be too noisy. I went back to the front desk and asked the front desk manager (Sylvia) if I could have another room, preferably one that was on a higher floor and away from the street and Sylvia was exceptionally accommodating - I use the word 'exceptionally' because the lobby was busy and she could easily have told me to â€˜take it or leave itâ€™. Instead she patiently looked up another room and generated new key cards for me to go and check the room out before confirming a room switch. She did this for me three, yes three times, each room I had checked was smaller and either had no thermostat control or was just too dated â€“ the first room was a remodel so my expectations had been set with that room, after turning down three rooms I told Sylvia that I would just stay with my first room. She tapped away on her computer and instead of confirming my first room she â€˜upgradedâ€™ me to a suite. I told her that she did not have to do that but she insisted on accommodating me. The suite was roomy, it was on the 19th flr, and it had nice bay windows. However â€“ the room had a musty smell to it â€“ not because of poor housekeeping but more so from the sheer age of the room and hotel in general, the windows were big but the street noise still came through quite loudly at night (a police & fire station are located across the street and they use their sirens generously!), the bathroom was old and small and worst of all the thermostat only controlled air conditioning! Of course I did not find this fact out until the temp in the room dropped in the middle of the night & I had to call the front desk to complain â€“ they sent an engineer up who wheeled in a portable radiator and stated that this was the only way to heat the room â€“ since it was a suite it was a larger room and the small radiator took forever to heat the room to an acceptable temp. The housekeeping staff was friendly but oddly none of them respected the â€˜do not disturbâ€™ card hung out on the door knob â€“ three separate cleaning staff members knocked on the door through out the next morning to clean the room when I was desperately trying to sleep in. Overall this hotel needs a major remodel â€“ each of the rooms I inspected, including the suite where I stayed, were dated, old and had a musty stink to them. With plenty of less dated competitor hotels in the area they really need to upgrade their rooms â€“ friendly staff, warm cookies, and accommodating customer service are nice to have but they are secondary when it comes down to the basic reason of choosing a comfortable and updated place to stay in Manhattan. I would really give this place 2 Â½ stars but the options on this site did not have Â½ star options available.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service, Great Management!!”
Reviews.Author: Bianca_Gasper
Reviews.Content: It is difficult itself to find an affordable hotel in newyork and this lady helped me according to my availability dates and was very helpful to find us a room. Although we got a double queen bed room but it was very affordable compared to all other rates on the internet. to inform you all, i did call several hotels like, marriot, intercontinental, hampton inn and embassy suites but no one there was really helpful enough. I really cant remember her name but it was sth like supna.I distinctly remember i called her on wednesday. ASK for her and she will help. i am so overwhelmed with gratitude that she made my stay so cozy, that i wanted to drop in some words for her. P.S. Great cookies. Grab some for your kids!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: mplsmarion
Reviews.Content: For New York and for the price I paid, this was a good hotel but it is nowhere near up to Hilton standards. The Good: Since this is a chain hotel, you see more of the "standard" hotel features that are often lacking in New York hotels in this price range. Staff was attentive and friendly. I was able to check in early which is a big plus. The room was huge by New York standards and relatively clean. The linens and towels were clean and fresh-smelling. The TV was great and the air conditioning was adequate. The lobby has lots of seating, a bar, a restaurant and a gift shop. The internet and printing were free in the business center in the lobby although I had to wait while several young women spent a large amount of time checking everybody's Facebook. Really, you're in New York and you sit around reading Facebook? The Bad: The room was awfully rundown considering that the hotel just underwent renovations. Based on other reviews here, I wonder if people who book through a service such as Priceline or Orbitz get the lower quality rooms. I was on the 2nd floor and the wallpaper was peeling away, the door barely closed (and a metal piece was actually missing - you could see the glue where it was supposed to be!) and the carpet was so worn in the traffic path that you could no longer see the pattern. I was also located just underneath the 3rd floor ice machine and could hear every time someone got ice. I would stay again, but try for a better floor. Skip the hotel restaurant and eat at one of the many places within a block or two. Don't be misled by the nearby subway station. The green line runs infrequently on the weekends and the blue line doesn't stop here at all on weekends. Prepare to walk a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and updated business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecchi
Reviews.Content: I booked a 8 night stay at Doubletree Metropolitan, New York for a shopping/sightseeing trip to New York City. We were greeted by a kind and polite receptionist on our arrival, and was swiftly processed and upgraded from a queen to a king size room, which was a nice surprise after an 9 hour flight. We got a room on the 6th floor facing 51st street, where a police precinct and fire station is located. The windows seems to be sound isolated, as we didn't hear much noise from the fire trucks, which we heard about once every evening. The room itself was updated with a clean carpet, 32 inch flatscreen TV with several HD channels. The bed was great, and the room service was great. My wife dropped some water on the bathroom floor around the sink, and dried it up with a napkin, which showed no trace of dirt or filth. The room also had an in-room safe, which was large enough to store a 16 inch laptop and a SLR camera in it at once, which was a big plus for us, with all our tourist gear. The location is both good and bad. The good thing is the hotel's location in relation to the Subway. You got easy access to 3 lines, from a subway station that runs beneath the hotel! The bad is that it is a business area, so the choice of food and restaurants are in generel limited to expensive juice bars and cafÃ©s. The downsides to this hotel is the expensive WIFI, which runs up to $17 per day. The trick is to go down to the lobby, and log on your computer while down there. You get 1 hour of complimentary highspeed WIFI, when you are in the lobby. You can then bring your computer back to your room, and still use it there! There seem to be no daily limits on the complimentary WIFI, so use it, instead of wasting money on something that's free, if you bother going down to the lobby. Another thing that annoyed us a bit was the late housekeeping in the evening. The maid would at times start to vacuum and clean rooms at around 8 to 9 in the evening, and the room's front door wasn't exactly as soundproof as the windows, so it got a bit annoying at times. Overall though, a great place to stay if you are visiting New York City on business or pleasure. The staff was polite and helpful, and the standard of the room was likewise good. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value w/Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while on a business trip to NYC. I've stayed at plenty of Hilton properties in NYC, but this is tops so far. You can't beat the location! Subway stop right outside the door, easy access to LaGuardi or JFK by car. I received a rate on the Hilton website for $149/nt with double hhonors points and a $15 bar credit. I couldn't believe it. I thought it was a joke or that this property had major issues. If I can score a rate under $200 in the future, I will stay here every time. Rooms are nicely updated w/flat screen tv. Didn't feel as cramped as other caliber hotels. My only gripe is that the bathrrom was not totally clean when I arrived. Toilet was not flushed and a dirty towel was hanging on the bathroom door. I'm not going to knock them down for these two oversights by housecleaning, but just wanted to throw it out there. Also, I was double charged for internet service and they did not automatically take off my $15 bar tab. They fixed it at check out, but not something you want to deal with when hurrying to catch a ride tot he airport or if there is a long line at check out. All in all, a great value in NYC with a a great location.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok.”
Reviews.Author: Penn81
Reviews.Content: When we went to our room the room looked run down. The paint looked like it was chipping and so did the wallpaper. To make matters worse when I went into the bathroom you could tell they didn't clean the tub. There was still hair and the sink and tub and was a odor in the bathroom. I was distgusted. So I went downstairs and told them the problems and they gave us another room. The second room was just ok. Nothing to brag about. It's definitely not a 4 star hotel their claiming it to be. It's a mediocre 3 star hotel. Maybe I would stay here again. It's not a definite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, swanky lobby, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: MzMuse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights while in NYC. The location was excellent. The service was outstanding - they must have had 5 bellmen for every customer in the lobby. Drinls at the bar were good and priced reasonably for NYC. The room was good - nothing nearly as swanky as the lobby, but a nice updated room with comfortable beds. I will definitely consider this hotel when visiting NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Radtrav
Reviews.Content: Good location. Not noticeably dirty. Friendly service. Good size room. Nice quality buffet breakfast but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Location was a plus, but the room condition, much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: bfmatters
Reviews.Content: It was my first time at this hotel where my daughter and I stayed for a "girls night out". The negatives: There was a foul odor, like body odor that lingered in one area of the room. I reported it to the cleaning folks on our way out but when we returned it remained. The bathroom door was so swollen we were not able to close it. The bathroom had wall paper peeling off the wall , at least 7 inches long with exposure to the rough drywall behind. We asked if we could leave our luggage for a few hours after check out and they charged $2.00 a bag, regardless of size. ( a lunch bag was charged!) The pluses: Location, nice to be close to the metro, St Patricks, warm cookies (for my 21yr old) Parking validation for $30.00 for 24hr period which is lower than most outside garages. I am not sure if I received a "bad" room since I ordered off priceline. I choice a 3.5 stars out of 4 and this was no where close.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but nickled and dimed the entire stay”
Reviews.Author: laurussell
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location and big rooms, especially by New York standards. However, I did not like being charged for extra pillows, not having free internet in my room, and the self park around the corner. What Hilton gives away for no charge at their lower priced hotels, they charge for here. One good thing: the room rate with the free breakfast. Great breakfast buffet with gracious waiters.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special Here”
Reviews.Author: tdruxpin
Reviews.Content: Second trip within a month to this same hotel and I would have to say this is by far nothing special when it comes to hotels. On my first trip I was greeted quickly in the lobby area and provided my room without issue. The room itself was a ADA equipped room as it was the only remaining room with a king size bed in it. This was not such a big deal as I was only staying a single night. Upon going to my room it appears the floor was under renovation which appears from the various reviews on this site is a common thing with this hotel. I then went to the lobby bar for a quick dinner and was pretty much ignored for the first 15 mins while the waiter was off watching the game that was on the tv's even ignoring me waving to him. After finally getting his attention he pleaded that he was not intentionally ignoring me but I did not feel the same. I would expect someone who is there to provide service to actually watch for people coming in and sitting down and paying less attention to the baseball game that is on. To top it off the automatically add a tip to the bill which is pure BS considering the poor service they provide and that i would have to now ask them to remove it if I want that changed putting me in a uncomfortable situation.. I only stayed one night on that visit appears they did not honor my request to have my airlines rewards number added to my room bill. Fast forward 1 month later and I had to return to the same part of the city as last time so I figured I would give this hotel another shot. Again the check in process was quick and efficient and I provided them my rewards details to hopefully get the air miles this time. I was given a room with a king size bed that is not an ADA room and is on the 9th floor looking into the stairwell of the building across from me and has a very odd wet sock like smell to it and appears the cleaning staff use far to much air freshener to try and mask this smell. The room has a so called 'Pure' air cleaner in it and i am not sure what effect if any this will have on the odd smell and I am hoping that while I am down in the same hotel bar as last time the smell will go away. Speaking of the hotel bar I was again ignored by the staff for nearly 10 mins while the bar tender and lone waitress where chatting at the end of the bar with each other. I just do not understand why they can not pay attention to people walking in and sitting down. I would not stay here again if it where not for the arrangement the company I work for has with this hotel. I will make it a point to stay at another hotel outside of the city just to not have to experience this again. I am hoping the stay will be better over the next night..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the No Frills Traveler”
Reviews.Author: jessholl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit NYC at least once a year. We always stay at this hotel because of the great price, the clean rooms, the fabulous location, the amazing staff and the no frills nature of the hotel. We are generally only in the room to shower and sleep so the hotel is great for us. It's clean and the beds are great. Location is walking distance to many attractions and a very convenient location to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation in NYC”
Reviews.Author: crenfrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is recommended for value and helpfulness of the staff. Our rooms were clean and generously topped up with toiletries. If you are spending your own money, then this is a good place to stay and is fair value for money.Only negative is a lack of coffee/tea making facilities in the rooms and the cafe next door, whilst good is not the cheapest. Noticed that Cathay Pacific use this as a crew hotel. Would book again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service. It's like Vegas, especially if you're Gold.”
Reviews.Author: fastball16
Reviews.Content: Since I'm a Hilton Gold member, I find the Metropolitan as an above average hotel for the the Midtown area. I'm not touting my horn, but I did receive bedside chocolates from turn-down service, check-in treats, daily water bottles, and access to the higher floors. So my review will be somewhat biased. First of all, the hotel's fragrance or overall smell reminds me of MGM Grand in Vegas. I can't put a finger on it, but it reminds me of Vegas every night during my 4 night stay. The overly funky, hip lobby / bar area also reinforces this. The service was great, especially since I lost my key card one night and they helped resolved a business center issue (connectivity) for me another night as well. The bed were quite comfortable (King) and I think they actually had too many bathroom towels and amenities for me. Overall, for the business rate, location to work, and the service, I would rate this as above average. During my stay there were a good mix of international and domestic leisure and business travelers, and all seem quite satisfied from the body language. Keep in mind I received double-points (on top of the bonus as Gold), so this hotel is a good benefit for us Hilton folks.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, reasonable price for NYC, but avoid lobby bar”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: Selected hotel as close to business meetings and very good rate for NYC. Was upgraded to a suite - which was not luxurious, just a bit bigger than normal room. Bathroom felt tight, amenities were nice. Complimentary water replaced daily was nice surprise. Breakfast (included for hilton honors) was good & service there was good. Hotel bar was inexcusably poor service - planned to have light dinner there as arrived about 8:30pm. Only 6 people in bar when I arrived -- two men working & all ignored me & did serve the next 4 people who came in & a guy already there. I tried getting their attention & would look at me & walk away. After 20 minutes I left.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 3-star NYC hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: CatskillMountainMan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent two nights at the DT Metropolitan in late July. Prior to our stay I had previously contacted guest relations about my concerns regarding disruptions to guests from the ongoing construction/renovations in the hotel as well as other concerns I had gleaned from reading recent TripAdvisor reviews. Within a few days, I received a courteous reply from the Guest Relations Manager and contact information for head of housekeeping. I was assured that my stay would be pleasant and enjoyable. We arrived at the hotel shortly after 3:30 p.m. Even though the lobby was very busy, check-in was very efficient and we were in our room very quickly. The room was a pleasant surprise. In an apparent effort to assure that we would have a pleasant experience, the management had upgraded us from an Upper Floor Deluxe Room to a Junior Suite. The DT Metropolitan is already known as having large (for NYC standards) guest rooms for a 3-star hotel (it was built as a 4-star Loew's Hotel). Walking into the Junior Suite was like winning the jackpot. Enormous by NYC standards with two ample closets, it had a pullout sofa bed in the seating area in addition to a very spacious walk-out terrace facing 51st Street. The only thing on the small side was the bathroom (which held the toilet and combo shower/tub)--the sink/vanity is outside the bathroom and was more spacious. Upon returning from a lovely dinner nearby at Brasserie the first night, we entered the room to discover a note left by the GM with a bottle of wine and a cheese and crackers plate. It was an unexpected, pleasant surprise but I suppose the management is really serious about generating positive interest and reports about their property after some negative reports this spring and early summer. I did have a minor gripe about the delivery of the wine and cheese. We had left a do not disturb sign on the door but the sign was apparently ignored. Now, my general critique of this property. Hotel has recently been renovated/"refreshed" but it is difficult to tell what is new on the guest floors and what is legacy. Renovations appear to have been done quickly but not very carefully. Still, hotel is pleasantly appointed for an older 3-star hotel in NYC. I think the 3.5-star rating is pushing the limits a bit. Cleanliness is good, but public areas have high traffic and show it. Buffet breakfast was included in our rate, but otherwise I would not have eaten breakfast at the hotel--it was just adequate in quality and given the price if you had to pay for it, there are much better options in the immediate vicinity. Elevators were usually fairly efficient except for one morning when there appeared to be some sort of event on the penthouse level which tied up all the elevators. HVAC was a little problematic in our particular suite--despite adjusting the thermostat, our unit was constantly running and the room was rather cool (better than the 90 degrees F outside, though!). Validated parking through the hotel is an excellent value for this part of Midtown ($30 for 24 hours with no in/out privileges). Even though we were directly across the street from a fire house and police precinct, up on the 18th floor the noise was not too bad for this part of Manhattan--compared to the even older Radisson Lexington Hotel a few blocks south, noise levels in the room were very acceptable by Midtown Manhattan standards. Most of the staff encountered seemed friendly, helpful and accommodating. My request for an extended checkout to 1 p.m. needed because of a delayed business meeting was met without hesitation. I think high speed internet access was a bit pricey for a hotel at this price point and star-level--charging $14.95-16.95 per 24 hours of access. NYC is a very competitive hotel market. At the time I booked our reservation, the DT Metropolitan was very competitively priced. It's strengths are a good Midtown location for business, large rooms, and an apparent can-do attitude by a good portion of the staff and management. It isn't luxurious but is comfortable for a large, somewhat older hotel in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: sgtreas
Reviews.Content: A wonderful gem in NYC. The staff was very friendly on check-in and a great resource during our stay. The rooms were clean, well-stocked with info on the city, and had great bath products and amenities. When we came back on Friday early evening, the staff was around to welcome us back. The hotel location was perfect...right next to the Green line and a taxi was almost always right in front. The gentlemen who were working the front door and hailing taxis were really nice and quite entertaining (the one time we had to wait, during Thursday rush hour traffic). There were quite a few dining/eating/drinking establishments near the hotel. The area felt pretty safe and it is within walking distance to many businesses and tourist attractions. While we did not get to use the bar or common areas, they always seemed to have a fun crowd and nice atmosphere. At night, there was a security officer checking to make sure only guests were allowed to use the elevators to the guest rooms...noninvasive, yet a nice step towards security. There was a nice mix of what appeared to be business travelers and families. The executive lounge was nicely stocked. The people working the room were nice but when it got a little busy, they seemed a little overwhelmed with things like checking for vouchers and keeping the garbage under control. Outside of this, they did a good job of keeping the food and drinks well stocked and fresh. The hot oatmeal was a nice touch though another hot option would have been nice. Some more options for coffee would also have been nice (flavored creamers, etc.), though certainly not necessary (I usually drink black, but the coffee was a little on the burnt side). Also, it would be nice to have the lounge open during the day with sodas and snacks.
