We would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely plan on staying there again on our next trip to the City.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not a top-notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: ForFunTraveler76
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before and were pleased with the price and location. Both are still good. We were not thrilled with the room or the service. The breakfast (included) was fine, not great. If the price were less, we would stay at the Hilton Towers which has location, nice rooms, fine breakfast, but higher price!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice, comfortable at a great online rate”
Reviews.Author: truthbetold_10
Reviews.Content: What was formerly the Loew's NY hotel, now the Doubletree, was surprisingly nice. I say "surprisingly" because I was expecting something less comfortable for the $179 price tag--a great deal in midtown Manhattan. The room was small (no suprise there), but filled with all the amenities I needed. The lobby was hip and hustling - just like you'd expect in NYC. Only drawback--the concierge made a BAD suggestion for nearby Italian (San Martine on 49th between Lex & 3rd).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with easy access”
Reviews.Author: jan01876
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip advisor when we decided to go to New York for vacation. We had a room on the 16th floor. Rooms are small, but it is a city/business hotel, and you are not usually in the room a lot. We were there during the heatwave, and were met every afternoon by a smiling face distributing water bottles. Air conditioning worked fine, as we remembered to draw the blinds during the day as we were on the sunny side of the hotel. In room high speed internet was kinda pricey for a business hotel, but wifi in lobby worked great. Room rate included breakfast (as we booked far ahead and this is not offered currently) and buffet was always fresh and hot. I could not rate the athletic facility, as that floor was closed, and we were directed to NYSC across the street.the NYSC is not the "cadillac" of their clubs, as we are BSC members, but someone from doubletree needs to go and see the "view" from one of the treadmills, and see what they are referring their guests to. We wouls stay here again, as well as refer friends from BSC .

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: lv4488
Reviews.Content: I was given a room on a floor that was being renovated and there was tape on all of the walls in the hallway and when I arrived there were workers thoughout the hallway. I could barely get by with my luggage. The room itself was disappointing. The shower fixture was falling apart, the toilet seat was badly warped, and everything felt dingy. The hotel was in a good location but I wouldn't stay here again if given a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: teamdoubled
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel from July 9 to 12. It was our first trip to NYC. We arrived to the hotel at 1:30pm and we were able to check in. The front desk was really friendly (btw, the chocolate chip cookies were really good!). The room was clean, and decent size, so it met our expectations. It looked that the room was renovated, it also had an LCD TV (40"?) The cleaning staff was also very good, our room was clean with fresh towels when we came back from our day trips. The best thing in our opinion about this hotel is the location. It is located right next to a subway station (51st and Lex), so it took us 20 min to get to Battery park, 10 min to Central Park. The hotel is also 5-10 min walk to Time Square, 5 min walk to the Rockerfeller Center, 5 min walk to Grand Central. It is also relatively quiet, without much street noises, so we had good sleeps for our long days. We will absolutely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice people, but rooms are very small and smell horrible!”
Reviews.Author: kstrode
Reviews.Content: People who work here are so nice...but the rooms are incredibly small, old, and the smell from the airconditioner (which had to run constantly due to the heat) was unbearable. We traded rooms twice...and the maid kept spraying some very strong air freshener.. into the airconditioner. Horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel - not bad but also not oustanding”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: Check-In was quick and easy. The lobby is rather on the small side for a hotel of that size making it a bit crowded at times (at least the times I was there). The room itself was absolutely ok, but nothing special. Solid 3 star quality. Very small bathroom with hardly any room to move and acceptable bedding. Overall ok, but nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rbj2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this month for ten days with my family (including parents and ourselves over 21). This is a great hotel for families with older children, from teenagers to early twenties. The rooms are basic but very clean and comfortable, all the amenities from toiletries to toilet paper was branded, which was a nice thought. The toiletries provided were vast range even foaming make up remover from Neutrogena! The location is amazing as it is only a few blocks away from blooming dales and Lexington av is full of fun stuff to see and do. We even walked most of the time to times sq etc as it was so central. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is comfortable, friendly and accomplished - good size rooms with good facilities, an efficient business centre and friendly, helpful staff. Definitely recommended for stays in NYC. We were stuck here during the Ash cloud debacle and staff were supportive and sympathetic. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: Givemelegroom
Reviews.Content: This was my first departure since 2003 from the perfect NYC Sofitel for a variety or reasons. I never expected it to compare and at the price it could not. The Doubletree had a comfortable bed, great reliable shower, good guest complimentaries and excellent TV service. In addition I found the staff helpful and the free hallway wifi as good as it gets. The room was clean and well serviced. As such the hotel is ideal for crashing out and the location is ideal not least for being adjacent to a subway station. What it does not offer is a special experience. The rooms are tired and worn out. The fittings are old and have no element of style. Worst of all the air conditioning is inadequate. I had to change rooms for an improved a/c only to discover that it was just as poor. During my stay I had NY friends visit me and they just laughed and asked whether I had become bankrupt. The hotel will not impress any visitors or guests who are there for a special occasion. But it in NYC and most hotels fall below expectations. To the credit of Doubletree they gave me a generous unsolicited credit for the inconvenience of being in a room during the renovation of the floor. So overall it is ideal to stay in while you do other things but definitely not somewhere to be to celebrate.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: PERMiami
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Doubletree was wonderful. The staff was attentive, the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in, the room was large, and the location was great. Overall, a very positive experience and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again and would never recommend this hotel to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: afraser25
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we found the reception area to be quite welcoming, the check in staff seemed friendly so we believed we were in for a good stay, how wrong I was!!! We were allocated room 943, when we arrived in the room, it was absolutely tiny and had a funny aroma about it. There was dust everywhere in the room, the wardrobe/closet was full of dust, the carpet was thick with it, the blinds were filthy. I refused to walk barefoot because the carpet just didn't appear clean. The in room safe did not work, in fairness, security promptly repaired this. The absolute worst of all was when I got into the shower, there was mildew on the surface of the tiles, I initially thought it was a pattern in the tile and thought it unusual, when I rubbed my hand against it, all the mildew came off on my hand, it wasn't between the tiles or along the edges, it was actually on the surface of the tiles, at this stage i had had enough and went to reception to ask for a change of room. Reception informed me that no rooms were available however we would be allocated a new room the next day. Although it went against the grain, we decided to stick it out for one night. I had hoped that the hotel would have sent someone up to clean the room whilst we were out but no, this wasn't to be the case. The next day, we were indeed allocated a new room, this new room was double the size, the bed was much bigger and it was certainly a lot cleaner yet for some reason it did not feel up to the standard I had expected of this hotel. For me it would meet 3 star criteria, absolutely no more than this. I was deeply disappointed in how staff dealt with my complaint and deeply disappointed in the Hilton Brand for presenting this hotel under there name. I would never stay here again and would never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Staff tries hard, but Doubletree needs to upgrade”
Reviews.Author: LusaMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, average overall hotel. The hallways are narrow, have a lot of wear and tear, rooms are a bit larger than some NYC hotels in this price range, and the staff are generally very friendly and attentive. We were awakened on a Monday morning at 8 AM with renovation noise either next door, upstairs or both. We were on vacation and wanted to sleep in. It continued to be noisy all day, interfering with my work in the room. I realize they need to do renovations sometime, but no warning and I'm sorry, but 8 AM is still pretty early. The breakfast buffet (included in our room rate) was very good, service very attentive, although they tacked on a modest service charge without notifying us and we had already left a generous tip in cash each day. Overall a good value for the price with good service, but the hotel floor we were on (4th floor) was badly in need of rejuvenation and that rejuvenation ongoing elsewhere was disturbing to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark04hc
Reviews.Content: We received this room on PriceLine at the DoubleTree. I have a DoubleTree in my town and was impressed with the hotel, so I was looking forward to the stay. We had a great check in. We were told that the hotel was fully sold-out, but that we were getting a room, on a floor that was being renovated, but that the room was already renovated, and for the inconvenience we would be having free breakfast for the weekend. They also stated that if we were not satisfied with the hallway, they would change our room the next day. The room was very clean, however, there were minor issues, scuff marks on the walls, and the AC did not work terribly well. The bathroom had mold however. We called about the AC and mold, and they sent someone immediately up to take care of the AC and stated that we could change rooms in the morning. I was fine with this, as lie I said, the room was very clean, and really that's what I can ask for. The next day, the Assistant Front Office Manager, Tony Cunaj, stated that he had heard about our disservice, and wanted to wow us with a free upgrade to the junior suite with balcony! It was such a delighted treat! The room was extremely spacious, with seating area, and king size bed. It was really such a treat. Now just to talk about the first room. This is a traditional hotel in NYC, the rooms are small. The bathroom is small, can only fit one person comfortably. This did not bother me. This is what I expected. Overall, I have to say, I would recommend this hotel as it was clean, and I was treated like royalty by the staff. They also have amazing parking... $30 a day. The W Hotel next door charged $70 a day for our SUV (needless to say we left our car at the DoubleTree).

Reviews.Title: “Felt very taken care of”
Reviews.Author: travelergal_10
Reviews.Content: This was a good value for the money. It was a rocky start, however. When I was checked in I found a cockroach in my room. I called the front desk and the manager moved me to another room that was completely fine, and clean. He even had my room comped for the incident. The bathroom in my new room was clean and the place overall was comfortable. The hotel staff overall was very courteous and helpful and I had a pleasent weekend stay going all around town. I even walked to 5th ave and saw all of the beautiful shops lit up!

Reviews.Title: “the parking deal is a rip off”
Reviews.Author: vttraveler2
Reviews.Content: A $379 rate was posted on the website, bu the rate changed on the second night to $779 and on the third night to $559. The website also offered complimentary parking or breakfast as follows:"ROOM ACCOMMODATIONS PLUS GUESTS CHOICE OF OVERNIGHT PARKING FOR ONE CAR DURING STAY OR FULL AMERICAN BREAKFAST FOR TWO. . THERE ARE NO IN AND OUT PRIVILEGES IF PARKING IS CHOSEN.* GUEST RECEIVES BENEFITS FOR EVERY NIGHT OF STAY " I booked the room, drove to NYC, parked the car in the proper garage and c hecked in. A very nice gal at the desk filled out my complimentary parking voucher and said "hold on to this; it's very valuable". After checking out on the third day, I trundled my bag back to the garage, offered my voucher and parking ticket, and was told there was no free parking. The voucher was only for a discount! The cost of parking was $135 -- but with my voucher, it would only be $105. I paid and vowed to write this review. Otherwise, be aware that the rooms are quite small and that some of the floors have hallways that are in the midst of renovation and that interrnet access will cost your $15 a day - $17 if you upgrade to a higher speed. On balance, not much value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as one would expect from Doubltree”
Reviews.Author: mellykins153
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for the staff at the Doubletree Metropolitan. I stayed in this hotel for two weeks on business, and they were consistently polite and helpful. That being said, I must say that I was disappointed in the quality of furnishings of the room. It did not meet my expectation based on previous experiences with Doubletree. The decor was outdated, and the furniture was much too large for the room. I would have preferred to do without an armchair in exchange for more floor space. While a small room is to be expected in midtown Manhattan, the large furniture made it difficult to find enough floor space to lay out my suitcase. There was also a large cabinet that must have housed a mini bar at one time. Too bad for me it was now empty, and it didn't provide useful storage. It was just another large useless item in an already small room. Besides that, the decor was a little worn. The wallpaper was coming off of the wall, etc. I do give the hotel high marks on location. The 6 subway line is directly outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some rooms have significant construction issues”
Reviews.Author: IATravelingMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice hotel. I was impressed with the fast check-in and the newly refurbished lobby. II was excited to see that our room was also recently renovated. Unfortunately, the construction quality was very poor. The pedistal sink in the bathroom was not properly secured and the basin would rock back and forth about 3 inches when bumped. The room door looked as if someone had broken the door to gain access (perhaps an improperly programmed door didn't allow access). The door had since been repaired, but the workmanship was shoddy and the door was loose in the door jam when locked shut. All things considered, there wasn't a single 'deal breaker' that made the hotel unsatisfactory. But, the several small issues made me think that the hotel should do much better -- especially given the price of a Manhattan hotel. I phoned the front desk to ask for another room and was surprised to find out that there was a significant hold to discuss the issue with someone. Eventually, the front desk discussed the issues with me. Since I checked in a little early, they said I would have to wait several hours to see what might be available. She offered a compromise: we will fix the issues that are broken while you are out. I agreed. upon returning from a great night out, we discovered that the room hadn't been touched. It was frustrating, but we stayed in the room anyway as we were tired from staying out late in NYC. Overall, I think that we probably got a dud room in what appears to be a nice hotel. I'd still stay there again, but I'd not be talked into waiting for any repairs while I was out.

Reviews.Title: “It took three tries to get me a room that had actually been cleaned.”
Reviews.Author: uberlink
Reviews.Content: The rooms (all three that I saw) were okay. Reasonably sized for the city. Decent bed and TV. They are a bit run down -- wall paper was peeling in one and the faucet was half off the wall in another. But the big issue was that the first room hadn't been cleaned -- small bits of trash everywhere and full waste cans. So they gave me a different room. It was not only dirty, but seemed like it might have actually been occupied. The third room (from which I type) is okay, particularly for the price ($199...not bad for this area).

Reviews.Title: “This was a great place to visit!”
Reviews.Author: Frenchy49829
Reviews.Content: If you are new to Manhattan, you could do a lot worse than the Doubletree Metropolitan in Manhattan. First of all: The subway system was right out the front door and to the right. Next: The walk to Times Square (not my favorite place, but a must see) was quick and not crowded until actually crossing 5th & 7th avenues. Third: Our trek to Yankee Stadium was easy with the subway system Fourth: SoHo and Chinatown were also easy to find and visit from our place Fifth: The staff (This probably deserves to be number one) was great, helpful and diligent! Sixth: There are so many eating places around that it was hard to choose where to eat!

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks and the staff sucks too”
Reviews.Author: msy629
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just ok, but totally outdated and the rooms have a weird smell to them. Room and bathroom are tiny. Definitely not a 4 star property and maybe even barely a 3 star. Worst was we were check in for 3 nights, but on the last morning of our stay they started construction replacing the carpet and wall paper on our floor. Yes we got a note telling us about it, and that we could switch rooms the night before, but when I called down to do so they told me since im checking out the next morning it wouldnt be so bad. Which was totally wrong as I was woken up to the sounds of carpet being torn out, hammering, saws blaring and other construction noises, all before 8:00am. Dust and debris came into the room under the door. If they know construction is going on during our stay, why even check us into this room if they know we are staying through this day, they could have easily just checked in people who were staying till the day before in this floor? When we stepped out into the hallway it was just nasty out there, of course the worker all had mask on, but not us obviously. Totally ruined our stay and left us with a bad memory for our last day in NYC. When we complained, not even apology was offered, just a coupon for a free breakfast. I definitely would not recommend this hotel and it totally does not live up to a hilton or doubletree hotel standard. So many better places to stay in NY, definitely not returning here.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay. Certainly not 3 stars or Hilton quality”
Reviews.Author: juneberkley88
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised that this is a "Hilton" hotel. The folks at the front desk were not friendly at all & no cookies were handed out (not a big deal still). We weren't surprised at the small room size, but we would have liked if it was cleaner & had at least a refrigerator where we could keep milk for our toddler. We stayed in 927 & the bathroom door had peeling paint; the walls were ugly (with stains or just ugly color choice). The only upside was that Cafe Metro was right next door and we could get a cup of coffee & breakfast there. For our next NYC trip, we'll definitely stay elsewhere even if we have to spend more.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, not the worst”
Reviews.Author: TiredTraveler28195
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree property is average at best. Staff with exception of doorman was surly and unhelpful; the room was far from properly cleaned (dirty tissue from previous guest sitting on desktop - not really what I want to walk into; dustbunnies in every corner; windows positively filthy beyond all measure; overall 'feel' to the room like you better sleep on top of the sheets and not under them). It is on a very busy block on the east side (not the greatest of locations for doing business in Manhattan, but not the worst) with FDNY and NYPD right across the street - don't look to get a good night's rest here. The lobby is overcrowded (is this a pilot and flight crew preferred hotel??) and the elevator wait is absurd. On the upside, the rooms are 'large' by NYC hotel standards and coffee service was delivered promptly in the morning. Recommend for one or two nights at best, and only if you can get a discount.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in a so-so location”
Reviews.Author: aaaaa
Reviews.Content: This bustling Midtown East hotel is clean and modern, with sleek decor and comfortable furniture. If you have business in the specific area, this hotel would be a great choice. But tourists should understand that, although the hotel is near some great shopping, there is not much else to do in this largely commercial area, particularly at night.

Reviews.Title: “You are just part of the fodder of visitors”
Reviews.Author: Astontraveller
Reviews.Content: Reception very busy. (used for airline staff a lot) Had to give credit card even though had paind in advance. When I said I would pay for extras by cash they said they still needed it in case I trashed the room- I do not think the recetionist realised what she had said to me. Breakfast in hotel have to queue and no windows. Bar is expensive and very dark. The foyer is usually full of either people waiting to leave or those trying to get free internet connection. They need a lot more chairs. Room was small and badly designed as a large person would not have got to the side of the bed by the window as the access was very narrow. TV was too big for the room. Bathroon OK for occupany by one person but the toiletries were nice. Only got a paper on the first and last day (were the others nicked?) No tea or coffee in the room just 2 glasses and an ice bucket. Lifts were often full and slow to arrive. Costs to store luggage until the transport arrives. The luggage store man will try and con you to have a limo to the airport and quote a cost which is not matched by the driver when he turns up. get yourself a yellow cab- fixed price. Coffee next door at the Metro cafe brighter and better.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before leaving on a cruise from Manhattan. They were able to easily accomodate our early check in and change our room type. We loved the warm cookies. The staff was very friendly. Room was nice. We enjoyed the hot breakfast (it was included in the room rate that we selected.) VERY VERY easy subway access. I'd stay here again. No complaints at all, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Manhattan hotel”
Reviews.Author: music33
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice in Midtown Manhattan-easy walking distance to museums, right near the subway, close to Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, shopping, Central Park, etc. My room was a bit small (although, perhaps, not by New York standards), with a rather worn carpet and nondescript decor, but the housekeeping was immaculate, the bed was good and had nice bedding (including four soft down pillows), and there was a large flat-screen TV and a desk. I had requested a quiet room, and the hotel obligingly assigned me one that faced the back, which did not get a lot of street noise. This is a well-run hotel. You can pre-order breakfast to be sent to your room up until 2AM t the night before, and mine arrived right on the dot at the hour I had requested. The lobby is cheerful, there is a pleasant bar, and the people at the front desk are very helpful. On the whole, this is not a hotel with a lot of character, but it's clean, reliable and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. Not Great”
Reviews.Author: pkpdd488
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Great midtown location for what I needed. Lobby was nice and had a good vibe. The room was a bit small and dated as noted by others. Paid extra for a high floor room and glad I did. This is right down the street from a police precinct and there were sirens all night. Not nearly as nice as the Doubletree Times Square where I stayed the next week, but not too bad. I'm headed back to this hotel in a few weeks and hoping for a bit better experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Mjuliste
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to NYC, and we cannot wait to go back. We've chosen this hotel as a suggestion of our travel agent and for the price. When we arrived at 1:30 a.m they told us that they didn't have our room available, so they offerred a superior room with a king side bed, awsome! The room was big enough, the bed was very comfortable, big TV, nice bathroom, and the best of all was the location, the subway on the corner. I would only suggest the reception to have international adaptors to charge cell phones, or cameras, I had to buy one, and they're very expensive. I would really recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty_Glenn
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were large and bed very comfortable. Noisy at night only if window was left open. Lovely pizza shop around the corner. Excellent location for sightseeing and shopping. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, loved it”
Reviews.Author: UKChicken
Reviews.Content: One of our favourite hotels on our USA trip. The rooms were good size, with everything clean and fresh. The staff were very helpful, sorting us out with trips and taxi's, directions and most importantly - free cookies! What a welcome. Wouldn't suggest having anything from the in-room snack selection - very expensive and looked as though it had been around a long time, but that's standard hotel fare. The bright, modern bathrooms were lovely - all except the loo which was hung on the wall so high I could't sit on it with my feet on the floor. An interesting experience. We were worried about the noise as our room overlooked the police, ambulance and fire service stations, but heard nothing significant during the night at all. Don't know how much it cost us (part of a package and not definined) but we would happily chose this hotel if we went back to New York. The location, directly behind the Waldorf-Astoria and in the heart of it all, was perfect for sightseeing and travelling. A very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, conveniently located, and surprisingly reasonable”
Reviews.Author: JennyC322
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I weren't expecting much from our hotel stay at the Doubletree, simply because it was one of the cheapest Manhattan hotels we found for that weekend and our past experiences had taught us that this typically results in claustrophobic, windowless rooms. Which is usually fine since we're just using it as a place to crash anyway, but for the amount of money hotels in Manhattan can get away with charging, one hopes for a bit more. The Doubletree doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside you'll find a comfy lobby, small hotel bar, and all of the expected amenities. The rooms are spacious with big windows and the beds super comfortable. The location is fantastic--you have immediate access to a number of trains right outside the front door, including the E, which will take you across town. It's a relatively quiet area (by NYC standards) at night, aside from the nearby firestation's sirens. Overall, we found that (again, by NYC standards) this hotel was a great value. We'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Average and friendly”
Reviews.Author: EnglishAngel34
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a very friendly receptionist when we checked in.( If you don't like the smell of very strong air freshener that takes your breath away , then please don't stay here!) We were immediately upgraded to a queen size room because our room wasn't avaliable (although we booked 7 months previous). The room was tidy and clean, just very dated. There hairdryer smelt of burning when I went to use it, so I quicky turned it off. They do supply mini toiletries, which is very nice. Towels were changed everyday if left on the floor for the maids. The one thing that spoiled the stay was the fact that our room backed on to the elevator, so you heard it going up and down all night. (very noisy). But as far as hotels go, it was comfy with friendly staff. Also being right in the heart of Manhattan, you really are not going to be staying inside much at all!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely first class - great service - great position”
Reviews.Author: Fethers53
Reviews.Content: We moved here at the last minute as our first hotel was a disaster. We stayed here for 4 nights. It was a huge success. Rooms were very comfy - fantastic beds (slept like a log every night) good bathrooms (though the plug was a bit dodgy). Spotlessly clean. Huge TV too! The hotel bent over backwards to accommodate us at short notice - not easy as they had to juggle rooms to fit our three teenagers into one room. Not all have room for an extra bed. The rollaway bed was also comfy. Rooms properly air conditioned and very quiet. The front of house staff were charming and helpful - couldn't recommend a place more. Brilliant central position with excellent diner just round the corner where we had breakfast every morning (very authentic). Cookies given to us at checkin were good too! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Tazman1099
Reviews.Content: I moved to the Doubletree after a horrendous experience at The Omni Berkshire Place around the corner. For $50 a night less I got a much nicer room, and a MUCH friendlier staff. The room was clean, roomy, had a great view. Good location close to Central Park and 5th Avenue shopping, and central for about anything on Manhattan Island. Overall, a very pleasant stay. I would return and would also recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “The location rocked! ...the housekeeping didn't”
Reviews.Author: Lewy8
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, but many things have been updated with consideration to style and trend. The elevators, though only two, were sufficient every time our group of 8 came or went. The rooms were spacious enough, the bar area was inviting, the water pressure in the showers was full; my only complaint was the housekeeping staff did not do their job sufficient to my preference. We stayed 4 nights, and nightly we would return to our rooms and our empty, dirty glasses from last night were still piling up on the desk and tables. Our garbage in the bathroom was changed daily, but our garbage in the main sleeping area was changed 1 time (& yes, it was piled up and spilling out...so it was obviously neglected). I started to wonder what we did wrong, because we left a couple bucks the first few nights for the cleaning service but after two nights of sub-par cleaning...we stopped that. We did not complain to the front desk. I guess we had too much to do and too little time to worry about it. Still, it would have been much nicer to come back to a fresh, clean room instead. I would give them another try though, because the location was GREAT for us, and you never know with staff...some people care about the quality of their work, and some don't. It takes all kinds to make this world of ours complete.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: gil_gil47
Reviews.Content: Doubletree Metropolitan Hilton hotel was amaizing,clean, comfortable and has central location. I found it in a web site called lastminutetravel. It is a cool website, were you choose a location and they fit you an hotel by your budget and needs. Since you don't know the name of the hotel untill after the booking, you get price breaking deals. The Hotel was great with Cheap prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: gogogo2
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel many times and are generally satisfied with the location, rooms and service. On this trip, though, we felt that the rooms are getting a bit tired. The wallpaper in our room was bubbling and the caulk in the bathtub was discolored and pulling away. Otherwise the room was comfortable and breakfast in the executive lounge was acceptable. On the service side, my partner pulled up in a taxi and the doorman stood and watched while she unloaded. It was only after she was out of the cab that he offered to pull her roller board for her. On checking out the bellman asked if we wanted a cab and offered us a car service instead. It's clear the bellmen are taking a kick-back from the drivers. Because of that we said we would take a cab and it was no better. We were really disturbed to see the cab driver who had been waiting in front of the hotel, pay a bribe to the doorman when he picked us up. It was sleazy and corrupt and marred an otherwise fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great hotel. Would definitely go again!”
Reviews.Author: Stephy-goes
Reviews.Content: I went to the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel from February 19 to the 22nd with my best friend. I had previously been to NYC and stayed at the Hilton on Avenue of the Americas. Unfortunately, the prices were out of my budget and I could not afford to go there. Thankfully, I checked reviews on Trip Advisor and the Metropolitan Doubletree hotel didn't seem too bad. Well lets just say I am quite happy I booked this hotel and at a great deal too. For two nights and three days, the cost of our stay was less than $340 US total for a single room (tax included). Once at the hotel, the man at the front desk insisted that we would not be comfortable and gave us a free upgrade for two queen size beds. The hotel is very clean and our room was as well. The bathroom needed some renovation, as some of the plaster was coming off but nothing major. Staff was extremely nice and very accommodating. I would like to say a huge Thank You to Keith, Kathy and Doron. They were very kind and made our stay even more enjoyable, with always a nice smile and nice suggestions of places to go try. Positives: Very clean (room, hall, lobby) Great staff (Pleasant, accommodating and helpful) Great location (subway right next to the hotel and short walk to Times Square) Recently renovated lobby Negatives Next to a police/fire station. So there is the possibility of hearing sirens. We heard them once or twice only during our stay and nothing at night. To make the hotel smell nice a flowery scent can be smelled throughout the hotel. At times it can be a little strong. Bathroom needed some renovations

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: fdritz
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel for people who want a friendly and comfortable hotel with a great location. The room size was excellent by NYC standards, and the price was very reasonable. All the staff we encountered were very welcoming. Thanks in particular to Dennis Jarrin and Martina Cacovic at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Service and rooms need improvement.”
Reviews.Author: kitesurfcaddy
Reviews.Content: A 3 star hotel...PROS: Excellent location (51st/Lexington) at subway line. Walk to park, best restaurants, shopping, etc.....Quick check-in...Very nice waiter @ Met grill (breakfast buffet) Neutrogena bath products. CONS: Noisy and leaking rooms (terrace rooms at a premium price- 18th fl), under minor renovations-sloppy carpet laid, caulking splattered in baths and hallways, wallpaper peeling from walls......VERY unfriendly check-in, tiny bathrooms, unhelpful manager, Paid double the price of the standard room- at time advertised as 400sft on line but was given a 200 sft room. Manager said I was mistaken. Sorry. Unbelievable!! There were regular rooms available for $129/$139. I paid $250! Of course that was for the premium suites. Nothing was ever done. Just very poor customer service all around. I have lived in Manhattan and was very familiar with this area of town. I chose this hotel for its location and discount on its suites. I will not return...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: spine1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the past few months. The service has been better than many 5 star hotels. For NY the rooms are above standard-clean, bright, roomy, great value. The breakfasts are an extra perk!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel needs renovations”
Reviews.Author: mmyers168
Reviews.Content: I would like to preface my review by stating I was pleased with the price I paid for this hotel in midtown Manhattan. I used the name your price option on Priceline.com. This hotel's location is excellent! We were only 5 blocks west of Times Square. We were within walking distance to 5th Avenue, Central Park, The NY Public Library, The Empire State Bldg, Grand Central terminal, and so much more. We experienced very helpful staff throughout our stay. Service was quick and with a smile! It was such a pleasure. We were booked into a queen room, and although small, it was quite adequate for me and my daughter. We were pleasantly surprised at the very large flat screen TV in the room and there were ample outlets in the room for charging our various devices. I did feel the room could have been more clean. The tub/shower area had mold stains - this is probably because the hotel is very old, but the grout does need to be replaced as it was chipping and stained which was unsightly. Also, wallpaper was missing and peeling throughout the room and hallways. The mattress seemed to be leaning slightly towards the center which made it somewhat difficult to get comfy, but the room was very quiet - we were not disturbed by any street noises or other guests which was a plus for sure! The room was very warm! Upon inspection of the thermostat I noticed it was turned as warm as it could go, so I turned it to a cooler temp. It didn't seem to cool the room down, so I turned it as cold as it could go and left it there for the duration of our stay. The room finally got comfortable, but something was clearly wrong with the unit, as I had it on 50 degrees and it never got near that. It was chilly wile we were in town, but 80+ degree room temp is too hot even for this Floridian! Although I do feel I received a good price for the location in NYC, I would like to see the rooms and hallways updated like the reception area. The reception area is beautiful! I would recommend this hotel to a friend because of the location and price I received from Priceline.com, but I would have to explain the issues with the hotel so they know what to expect. I did not complain about the problems with my room as I was enjoying my time in the city and didn't want take time away from the short time I had in order to deal with the little inconveniences I was experiencing. I do hope the hotel makes some updates soon, as I would very much like to return and spend more time in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay will be our last”
Reviews.Author: kathrynann31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel once before and had decided that given the convenient location and cleanliness of the hotel, it was a good price for the hotel. Of course, it is a Doubletree, so we did know to come into the situation with lower standards than usual. Our first trip, in 2008, was truly a delight and we were pleasantly surprised by the comfortable beds and new, clean, and modern rooms. However, I cannot say the same for our return to the hotel in March 2010. The King sized bed was worn in the middle, and my husband and I were very uncomfortable. Additionally, the made service was sub-par. We had a leaky faucet. The shower was fickle. The service was mediocre at best. They can dress it up on the website, and have a nice modern lobby, but it's still a Doubletree. I doubt that we will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel excelente”
Reviews.Author: Lucianasrt
Reviews.Content: We arrived in NY Ã s 06:15 am on Sunday (02/21) and we had no problems at check-in at the hotel in the morning. The same happened to make the check out, we ask to leave at 14h and were treated promptly. The hotel has a cloakroom where we could leave our luggage while we finished the tours around Manhattan. The room has a good size, very comfortable beds. The shower is great. From the concierge to the maid, all hotel employees were very kind and always ready to help us. The location is perfect: the subway stations are on the corner, which facilitated our move to Manhattan. Great delis for breakfast, pharmacies and restaurants nearby. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LadyBorikua
Reviews.Content: I had two trips to this hotel during the month of Febraury 2010 Febraury 7-10 and Febraury 23-26 both were for business In the first Trip my agency did not complete my travels but Daniel the first person I met when I got to the hotel at 10pm on the 7th, was extremely professional. He went upbove and beyond my expectations. Again, Iwas there on the 23 this time my agency completed my travels but again Danile was extremley professional and the good part was that he remembered me from my previous time. That was a great feeling; your hotel see thousands of patrons a week and for him to remeber me was great. During this time on my floor you had a woman by the name of Carmen she would be there early in the morning taking care of her tasks. I had an incident in my room and she was too excellent. Very helpfull and attentive. My room was clean and stocked during my stay. I will defintley recommend your hotel to all I can. Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: SunSeeker62
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 16 year daughter to New York City recently to see the Tim Burton exhibit at the Museum of Modern Art and stayed at the Doubletree Metropolitan right in mid-town Manhattan. We got a great deal on a room with parking for less than $200 an night that was in an excellent location that we could walk to MOMA, Rock Center and Times Square. The rooms were adequate and clean, the hotel had a shop, concierge, a bar, and killer chololate chip cookies at check in. There were plenty of reasonably priced (for NYC) restaurants within a short walk of the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel for value and location that is hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wi-fi cafe for non hotel guests, poor service, thin walls,”
Reviews.Author: whimsical_sd
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stayed at this hotel. I usually stay at the Hilton Time Square and I would recommend that hotel much more over this. I stayed at this double tree for 4 nights during the Valentine's weekend. it's at excellent location - right next to metro entrances. Lots of convenient stores nearby (CVS, Duane, etc). When I first got into the room, one pillow case had lipstick mark on it (shape of a full pair of lips!). The walls were thin. I was awaken by the noises of the neighboring rooms several times a night. Bathroom was very small - it tried to separate the sink with the tub and the toilet. I used "parts" of the sewing kit and the cleaning lady just stuff it back into the box as if it was new. The cleaning lady did not replace my shower gel, shampoo and conditioner everyday, which I didn't mind. However, I used up my whole bottle of shower gel and I only got replacements of shampoo and conditioner, which I still had them full, unused. I called housekeeping for new shower gel and they just pour in some shower gels into the shower gel bottles for me, which gels still spilled out onto the bottle. Very poor housekeeping service, not to mention the dirty pillow case and the mysterious hair comb I found on the floor on the last day of stay. The hotel lobby is like a public library with free Wi-Fi access. Lots of locals just come in for Wi-fi with their own computers and AC adapters. While hotel guests are charged $14.95/day for Wi-fi. You might as well just pretend to you are a non-hotel guest (who will receive more benefit). I am a Hilton gold member and have breakfast voucher to eat on the 17th floor "executive lounge". The breakfast selection was poor - no hot food at all... the food and drinks (the most basic, coffee) was out almost everyday I went there, and until you complain, otherwise it would not be replaced. This hotel doesn't worth to be considered as a Category 7 hotel in the Hilton scale.

Reviews.Title: “Quality / Price / Location”
Reviews.Author: pspires
Reviews.Content: Average hotel very weell located, with the pricing accordingly with the services offered!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, Big Rooms, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: UofATess
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business and was very pleased. I had not been able to book a room in the city under $200 for some time! The lobby is nice and cozy with free wireless, so very condusive to busienss travelers. The lounge/bar area in the main lobby gets pretty busy at night. I did not eat or drink here, but the prices were pretty hefty. Service was great, very friendly staff. The rooms are big for New York. We lucked out with a room that was not off a street, so we had no noise at all, expect from the hall a bit. The hotel has a great sized gym too, which was a plus. I would recommend staying here. It is an older hotel that has been renovated, so just don't look too close into any of the corners=)

Reviews.Title: “A New York Bargain”
Reviews.Author: TonyD285
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree was well situated in Midtown on the East Side. We stayed one night to attend a family gathering in NYC and were quite happy with the price, the room and the complimentary breakfast. When you can stay at a 3 star hotel in midtown for less than $165 total with tax included along with a free breakfast that is a really good deal. The room was small but nicely furnished and on a high floor (at my request - there is a fire station on the same block). The included breakfast buffet was better than I expected, hot and cold items, all very fresh and plentiful. The next time we need to stay in New York this hotel will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMango
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights...it took forever to get a room. The room said it was non smoking but smelled of cig smoke and deodorizer. There was only a sheet and light blanket on the bed and the room was cold. I did get an extra blanket the next day which helped. There was no coffee pot and apart from a breakfast spot there was only the lounge which like the gift shop opened whenever they wanted to. Although easy to get around via the subway from this location there isn't much around it for places to eat etc. Basically there was other places in this region for the same price but with better rooms and service. I would recomend you check out other choices in the area!

Reviews.Title: “would come back again”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelx2
Reviews.Content: I flew down to watch the US Open, I normally stay in Flushing to be close to the stadium but I decided to stay in Manhattan this time, and take the subway into Flushing. I thought that the rates were a big high, but I guess I just ended up paying the market rate for a nice hotel located in Manhattan. I really enjoyed my stay at this Doubletree, I love the complimentary chocolate chip cookies. Great room and amenities. Walking distance to just about everything: shopping, restaurants, sights. We got complimentary breakfast at the hotel restaurant, the service was great. I would come back again, though would probably try to shop around some more for better rates rather than booking last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dctwin
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel. Although the room was smaller than anticipated, still a great room for the price I paid. Its great that they have parking and you can't beat the location. Close to Rockefeller Center and the Subway! Loved the cookies they give you too. Overall a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: klsikes
Reviews.Content: I read the terrible reviews on this site AFTER I booked the Doubletree on a discount hotel site. Concerned, I called both the vendor and the hotel and couldn't get a refund. I'm glad I didn't because we had a GREAT experience at the Doubletree. I asked for an upgrade to a King room (we didn't reject the small room, just wanted a preferred bed size) at $30 a night - no problem. The room was a good size, clean, the towels were wonderful, and the decor was simple and modern. Staff was pleasant and helpful and the location fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, but overpriced and horrrendous service”
Reviews.Author: farfrmpurrfekt
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend found a sweet deal on priceline.com for $110 a night, not including taxes, for the DoubleTree on Lexington Ave (Midtown East area). Our excitement was short-lived, for as soon as we walked through the entrance, we were met with terrible service. Never once did we observe a greeting or smile from any of the staff. One of the concierge workers in particular was extremely rude and curt. It became quite obvious that the workers there hated their job and perhaps hated life in general. I was furthermore disappointed that this DoubleTree would not provide complimentary travel guide booklets (in fact, it did not even carry any) for its guests. The only complimentary item you can ask for is a chocolate chip walnut cookie, one for each guest, at check-in. But beware, the cookies are of Chips Ahoy quality--not BAD but not amazing either. That said, i gave this hotel 2 stars because the 1. rooms were not that bad and 2. the location was good. Our room was of avg size, relatively clean, and had a comfy bed. The HD flatscreen (complete with many channels) was a positive. Bathroom was an okay for me. 'clean and well stocked with supplies (including Neutrogena bath products, which i appreciated). The bathroom, however, inconveniently only has 1 bar to hang your towels.. so if you are someone who uses all 6 of the towels (2 washcloths, 2 hand towels, 2 bath towels), you will have to create your own towel hanger using a clothes hanger. Bath towels are also incredibly coarse and abrasive. Overall, I still had a good trip, but I DO NOT recommend this hotel for the price it advertises ($200-400). For that price, go to the Carlton on Madison Ave. You'll find an exponentially more worthwhile purchase there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: acswift
Reviews.Content: Basic but clean and comfortable. A bit noisy. We could hear people out in the halls and in adjacent rooms. We could also hear street noise. The heating unit was sub-par. Room had poor air circulation and was stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Great staff, very friendly and very helpful. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.”
Reviews.Author: SandDancer7609
Reviews.Content: Vicki Crichton at the front desk made sure our stay was absolutely fantastic. We asked for non-smoking rooms when we checked in, and she went well beyond taking care of just that. Our room was extra large, the bed was king sized and provided an amazing night's sleep after several long days of walking around the city, and we even got breakfast! Vicki wore a button that said "10," but she's clearly more like a "27!" Julio, the doorman, was also fantastic. We had a bit of trouble with our car from the airport to the hotel, and he got the driver to take us to LGA for the price we had agreed on for the car we reserved rather than the more expensive SUV that arrived. The housekeeping staff was friendly, the bartenders in the lobby bar were friendly, and the entire experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: cglex
Reviews.Content: The rooms are poorly laid out and worn, heat is either on or off, slow internet. Today the conceirge floor for hilton honors guests is closed and the staff is indifferent. Given the abundance of hotels in the City including other nicer Hiltons, there is no reason to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: mick1958
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel for a special birthday treat for my mothers 80th, unfortunately there was nothing to make it special in anyway. We asked to upgrade our room, as the room we had been given looked out onto a roof with a/c condensers and breeze blocks. This could be arranged and although we would be given a room with a better view it had fewer beds, an additional fold up bed would be supplied at a cost of an extra $100. One of the young girls on reception was lovely and did try to help when I explained the reason for our visit, however one of the senior members of staff who she asked for advice wasn't really interested and we were told because we had already booked in this now wasn't possible. The decor is way past it's sell by date, with peeling wallpaper in the common areas and mis-matched carpets. If you are only using this hotel as 'just a place to sleep' then use it, but if you want anything even a tiny bit special or luxurious then go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for NY”
Reviews.Author: UkDinoDog
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 nights city break in NY and the Doubletree is an ideal place to stay. About 6 months ago I looked at cancelling (after reading some of the reviews) but I couldn't without loosing my deposit and I am pleased I didn't. We opted for the upgrade option when you book ($30 or so per night) and we got upgraded on arrival. The room wasn't massive but for us (2 adults and 1 child) was ideal although probably needing some renovation. Staff attititude mixed, some very good, others need an introduction to customer service. Breakfast really good and although in a temporary room was ideal with a good buffet selection and fresh eggs being cooked to order. Best thing is though as others have said is location, it is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location - nice room”
Reviews.Author: Husenissen
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a brilliant location. We just stayed for two nights, but because of the great location we were able to see a lot and to do a lot of shopping. The room was nice and clean, with a good bed. High-quality tv and good internet access. Staff was mostly friendly and efficient. It is however impossible to buy anything to drink if you arrive at night as we did. I did not feel like going out to get my bottle of water in the middle of the night, so it would be nice to be able to buy some from reception. Would really recommend this hotel if you do not know NYC and need to get around easily.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Makatoosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice first time in May 06, everything was brilliant. Stayed again on Dec 08 - Jan 09 and oh dear (giving a smoking room although the booking was a non-smoking room) in the space of a few years the standard of the (some) of the reception staff has fallen, there were some that could not do enough for you. Best experience was the security maintenance guy, he was really friendly, even after repeated visits to our room as the safe was constantly breaking. He gave us 'local' knowledge of all the best places, the places that 'New Yorkers" and as a travel photographer that was excellent and really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Sunshine80
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two-night stay at this hotel and have only positive things to day. Location is great. Steps away from subway and within walking distance to Rockefeller Center and all the great diners. Room was superb, very clean and yes on the smaller side, but thatâ€™s New York for you. Hotel staff was excellent and helped us with all of our requests, even checked our luggage the day we were leaving so that we can go out for lunch. This was the New Yearâ€™s weekend and they were extremely busy, yet very courteous and professional. I have stayed at other higher level hotels in New York and they do not compare to room clealiness or staff here. I have had an excellent stay here and will definitely return in future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DELTRAV
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and have nothing but good things to say about it. Very Clean rooms and bathrooms. Excellent service from check-in, concierge, hotel staff and cleaning staff. Excellent location-- right next to the E/F/V and 6 trains, where you can go anywhere in the city from there-- We went everywhere!-- top class restaurants, shows, etc.... while making this excellent hotel our hub-- Walking distance to lots of attractions.. but we tookd the train, walked... and did everything! The only low ratings I would give is on Noise-- (not sure if it was cleaning staff or other guests) in the morning, and the neerby firehouse and police station on 51st-- And if I can suggest some improvements, it would be to upgrade or buy new towels and sheets and also to post the weather somewhere so one can plan better (the weather channel was not always on) and the paper was not readily always available.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Location, Unfortunate Experience.”
Reviews.Author: julionasb1
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel with great location, which is why we stayed here. Unfortunatly, I left a pair of sun glasses in the hotel room and upon returning no body wanted to help out. When I finally got to speak to someone who cared, they said that nothing was found. So from a pretty good experience, it went to a bad one since though this event I got to see the low quality of this hotel's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Courteous Staff.”
Reviews.Author: jbama
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget and location is very important to you, then this is a good choice. Currently under some cosmetic changes, the Doubletree is a comfortable, no frills place that is a perfect location for major sites and subway access. The rooms are clean and the beds were comfortable. Of course the decor needs updating but i can overlook these things when the staff is friendly, helpful, and services are good. The area of town if perfect for hitting the shops, broadway, rockefeller, etc. and you can catch the subway literally outside the door for ride down to SOHO. To me this was the right kind of hotel for a 3 night getaway, but if you are more into "W" style hotel or Ritz then this may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay during very busy time of year”
Reviews.Author: zippypeep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed between Christmas and New Year's, although we checked out on Dec. 30th. I wrote a review about this hotel before in 2007 and wanted to update since we decided to stay again. Check in was smooth and everyone was very friendly. We received two warm chocolate chip cookies - which came in handy the next morning when I was starving and needed something! As far as our room, we did not get a free upgrade this time but we had a good room. I had requested a room that was not near the elevator, was on a higher floor and was non-smoking. Also, I did not want to be on the side of the fire station on 51st street. Our room was 1443 and met the criteria. Our view was not particularly exciting, we looked out onto what looked like luxury condos, but it was fine for what we needed. The hotel provided Neutrogena shampoo, conditioner, soaps and lotion. The water pressure was great (i always check that first) and the sinks and tub drained properly. There was some bubbling of the wallpaper near the window but other than that, the room was clean and the bathrooms were very clean. I forgot to take pictures, but the room was similar to my last post in 2007. This time we had a huge wide screen TV which was very different from our last stay. It was fun to watch TV on such a huge screen, it was like being at the movies! I had them bring us a refridgerator to help us store leftovers and drinks. There was no coffee maker in the room, but they provided a hair dryer, iron, ironing board, extra hangers and a safe was in the closet. There was only one chest of four drawers, but we weren't there that long so it was fine. There was also a sitting chair, writing desk with office chair and side table. There are two sets of window shades as well, one to prevent light and one to block out stong sunlight, one of the windows opens about six inches in case you need fresh air. It was warm in the room when we walked in so we changed the thermostat from 72 to 60 and we were comfortable the rest of our stay. The sheets were cotton and soft but the pillow cases did not seem to be all cotton, again this was not a deluxe room. We didn't order from the Met restaurant because I heard that the food wasn't very good and not worth the price. We went to the Oxford Cafe one block down on Lexington. They have all kinds of food, including breakfast, and the food is good quality. They even sell beer! The prices are reasonable, you can get a meal for under $10. If you need to go cheaper, the Metro Cafe is right next door to the hotel. The hotel was in the process of slowly re-doing the the Lobby bar/lounge. They replaced all of the furniture before we left and now have brand new couches, ottomans and chairs - all are the cushy sofa style. We didn't try the bar but it looked nice. My only serious complaint about this hotel is that they use an air freshner/flowery scent and pump it into the Lobby. The scent was so strong that everytime I was in the Lobby or the elevator I began to sneeze! It was really uncomfortable and upon check out I complained about it. I did have a little stuffy nose cold during my stay which did not help, but on my last day there my cold had cleared up and I still sneezed in the lobby. My only other complaint was that they piped-in music in the elevator and the Lobby was cheezy pop music(Brittany Spears, Usher, etc.) that I didn't really care for. It made me think that since this is a "Hilton" hotel that maybe that cheezy Paris Hilton had something to do with that! We checked out at Noon on the 30th but didn't leave NYC until 6pm, so we gave our bags to the hotel to store for us. They store them in a locked room and put numbered tags on each bag. I believe it cost $2 per bag to check them in, and $2 each to check them out. However, they charged us $5 for all 5 bags to check in and $4 to check out. Not sure how that math goes! Anyway, that freed us to head off to lunch and visit a museum before returning to retrieve the bags and head home. By the way, the hotel is located right next to the Green line Metro stop and the blue/Orange line is 1 1/2 blocks up on Lexington. The hotel location is really great, we went to four museums during our trip and took the Metro right on the corner. This was really important because one day it was 20 degrees and it was nice not to have to walk far to the station in the cold. All of the service people were very nice and service was prompt. There was no line when we checked out and everyone seemed like they were genuinely happy to help us regardless of the chaotic pre-new year's crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Manhattan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilaki
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at this hotel just before the holidays. We found a great deal on the Doubletree site for $127.20 per night. Yes, the rooms need a makeover. But it really is just superficial. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean AND spacious (for NY), and the location cannot be beat! Free wireless in the lobby. Cafe Metro has great coffees, Ess a Bagel is just around the corner, Eggs Travaganza (breakfast cart) is at 52nd/Park for a good/cheap breakfast. CVS and Duane Reade for supplies like water, snacks, etc. are also close by. The subway is just outside. Price and location really can't be beat. We'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Complainers read this!”
Reviews.Author: grovebr
Reviews.Content: I paid $119 a night during the Holidays for a Queen Bedroom. Great room, with everything I need - comfortable bed, huge plasma TV, great shower. Busy lobby (but I'm not sleeping there, right?), great gym (not an exercise room, they have a very nice gym on the second floor!). Subway in front of the hotel, Cafe Metro next door with everything you would like to eat for breakfast, lunch and dinner at very reasonable price (lunch for 3 - salads and subs + drinks - $30). So I wonder why people complain so much about this hotel? If you want luxury in New York you have to pay for it, otherwise enjoy a decent Doubletree hotel in the heart of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “DISSAPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: saphire303
Reviews.Content: Where do I start! We had two queen rooms during December 09 and were extremely dissapointed by the hotel, the rooms and the staff. The only pleasant staff were the maids in the morning who always said good morning. The reception staff, the doormen and in particular the conscieges couldn't have been more rude! Not once were we addressed straight away, but left to wait unti it was convenient for them to speak. Unfortunately it wasn't just the odd member of staff we came accross. The hotel is in desperate need of refurbishment, couldn't have a bath - hated standing in the shower then having to use old towels - the only saviing grace are the decent toiletries. The beds were ok, but the pillows were too soft. We wanted to print out our boarding passes and was told it was free, it took $10 to log on and print out the boarding passes. CAN I SUGGEST TO MANAGEMENT THAT THEY GO TO LAS VEGAS TO LEARN WHAT CUSTOMER SERVICE IS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: cymw88
Reviews.Content: Compared with many other hotels I have stayed domestically and overseas, this hotel is over-priced. The so-called wireless internet is not free ($14 per day); the restaurant in the hotel charges $30 for each person for the poor-serviced breakfast; the parking is across the street ($30 perday); the front-desk personnel are not customer-oriented. I have to say that I am quite disappointed at choosing this hotel to stay at NY.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Sightseeing in NY”
Reviews.Author: tazmanjc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to see the sights at christmas , Its in a great location in midtown manhattan . Walking distance to The empire state , rockefeller centre , times square etc etc . Subway right by the hotel for travel to the lower manhattan area . Several restaurants and snack places within easy reach . Cafe Metro i very good next door and Duane reade for snacks and drinks on the move cant be beaten . Services at hotel were excellent . You only had to ask where places were what to do and the lobby staff were a mine of useful info . Got us a town car to go back to the airport at no extra cost . Spot on . rooms were great ..although we didnt spend much time in it . clean tidy and well equipped . Cant praise this hotel enough .

Reviews.Title: “Central but not the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Twoadultsthreekids_9
Reviews.Content: Room was basic , We were not met with a warm welcome at check in however the maids were very nice . we paid for up grade to 18th floor , I would not like to have seen room we were to get ! . The breakfast is top class and the staff at breakfast were very helpful . The hotel is very central . If Waldorf had been available I would have stayed there again .

Reviews.Title: “Junior suites not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: rejsemor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a girls weekend in NYC. The location was fantastic with subways nearby and close to other major points of destination. However, we decided to splurge and stay in a junior suite. It was definitely not worth the money. The room was fairly small for a suite. The bathrooms were teeny. We called several times to get an extra blanket - there were none in the room - before they came up with one. There was no mini-bar. I also heard that the breakfast was awful. I would most likely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $450 a night they charged”
Reviews.Author: bizskitravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK and it's not a 4 star as they claim. At best, it's a three star. Mold in the shower grout, missing floor molding, etc. Great location, at best $150 a night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get much better than this for the price and for New York”
Reviews.Author: rooner-k
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a just a Friday night in October. We paid about $230 including tax (breakfast not included). That's alot of money but then again it was NY and we booked a bit last minute and really didnt have much time to shop around. For the price, it was an excellent stay. 51st/Lex is extremely subway-accessible with connections to the E,V,and 6 and also Grand Central is not far away. The staff was friendly, the room was cleaned extremely well, the view was ok. It was a little noisy with the traffic (I think we were on the 14th floor), but its to be expected. I think there was a gym but not sure. The bed was perfect. The TV was probably a 27 inch flatscreen. Its NY, so the room is going to be small - but we had a great time and it was a great room in one of the best parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, run down and worn out.”
Reviews.Author: brooklynsd
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Monday evening, put my things away then ran out to dinner, got back looked at the bathroom and was disgusted. wood under the vanity was rotting and falling out, rust surronded the metal underneath the counter. the shower tile grout was covered in black mold. I requested another room, the desk agreed to move my things to another room the next day. When i returned, they didn't move my things but i did get another room. The second bathroom is just as bad: peeling wallpaper, ceiling paint crackled and falling, more mold and hairs on the sink! All this for $420 a night! This gives Hilton a very bad name. No way will my company stay at this overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid experience”
Reviews.Author: omeirish
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I almost canceled my reservation at this hotel. I am glad I did not. It is a solid hotel and a decent place to stay -- not the Waldorf, but clearly NOT the worst. It was a good value for the money -- basically it is what you would expect from a Doubletree. You will not be disapointed. The room was quite large and while it needed some updating, was very pleasent. The bed was great. The room was clean. Both VERY high on our priority list of must haves in hotels. We stayed on the 18 floor overlooking the back of the hotel. It was VERY quiet. Make sure you ask for a room on this side of the hotel. My only negative is that the room had a distinct BO smell to it. While the hotel tried to correct the problem the smell lingered until we returned from dinner (almost 6 hours from when we initially asked for the issue to be addressed) The lobby was very busy (and just completed) but we had no trouble getting a taxi. The subway is litterally outside the door of the hotel. We explored Soho on this trip and it was fantastic. It was well worth the trip -- a lot of trendy restaurents and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Ken452
Reviews.Content: We stayed here right after Thanksgiving. The hotel was full and very busy, but the staff were friendly and helpful. We found the room comfortable, not large but with plenty of room for the two of us. We have to agree with another reviewer that the room was warm, we just left the window open and did not find the outside noise excessive. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Agreeable hotel, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: TheRealMiL
Reviews.Content: Located nicely in midtown with easy access to the subway. Lots of selection for eating and shopping nearby. Some construction in lobby but this was minimally inconvenient. Room was clean and well proportioned, staff was friendly and helpful, even for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Wonderful with remodel underway”
Reviews.Author: ke417
Reviews.Content: We had a large group of familes with jump ropers in the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. Staff got us into rooms after long bus trip and always helped with details. While the hotel is undergoing remodeling (and it is needed as with many NYC hotels), it was clean and comfortable. Internet is free in the lobby and the warm cookies are available all the time as a bonus. It was a very busy time and each person received individual attention and service. Hilton standards, realizing construction was going on, were maintained. Staff was most helpful and took care of our needs and more. New York hotel rooms are small and that is just a fact of life. Clean is important and our group had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good---but that's it...”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: I always try and stay in the Hilton chain.. This hotel is old and run down. There was construction taking place on Nov 30, which is probably a good thing.Rooms are really small and they are for sure HOT. In NYC, most hotels turn off the AC for the winter. You have 1 choice, heat or open the window. This can be very noisy with the horn blowing etc..The staff are excellent but the one thing that was very bad was the breakfast....The chef should consider other career options. Being in the restaurant business, I couldn't believe what he put out....Cold and bland......Other wise, the location is great....

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: srr250
Reviews.Content: The hotel is currently under renovations (they fail to mention this). The rooms are small and cramped, but worst of all no particulary clean. It was so hot I had to ask for a fan. To top it all off, when you cehck out and ask to leave baggage they cgarge you $2 per bag!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: bonsai35
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent if you want to be right in the heart of midtown. the staff is extremely helpful and accomodating. The rooms are on the older side and could use some general redecorating, but they are very clean and extremely spacious by NY standards. This was the 1st time Ive had a hotel room in NYC with my own large and private terrace. I have stayed here before and I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: MNnice07
Reviews.Content: Great location--walking distance to many of Manhattan's great tourist attractions. The warm cookies at check in were nice, however, the service was less than great. Upon entering the lobby with our bags, 6 bellmen stood watching us...no offering to help, no greeting...they were discussing something else amongst themselves. The check in was quick and efficient with very little effort or hospitality put in to it by the gal working the desk. The lobby was under construction, and their bar was a makeshift portable bar with a few tables and chairs surrounding it. No notification of construction when booking the room--a heads up would have been nice. The room was nice and clean, minus some peeling wallpaper in the bathroom. The housekeeping staff was outstanding, very friendly and very willing to go above and beyond. I have stayed in Hilton Hotels many times and have never had this poor of service before. I was very disappointed for the price we paid. I firmly believe that the staff of a hotel makes or breaks your experience there, and this one left a pretty sour taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Neutrogena bath products AND a warm cookie”
Reviews.Author: stephaway
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC frequently and lately I've been staying at this hotel for two simple reasons - that warm cookie they hand you when you check in is lovely and I'm a big fan of the Neutrogena bath products, including the face moisturizer so I don't have to bring my own from home. Hotels of a certain class/price level are basically all the same - it's the little touches that distinguish one from the others. So these are the two little touches that keep me coming back. Silly, but there it is! Oh, my one criticism is that the fitness center is too small for a hotel of its size. Both times when I've tried to use it, there haven't been any cardio machines available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not really worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Bunny28
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this hotel. The location was awesome as you could have walked from there to most of the great sites nearby. The staff were not that friendly, which was a bit of a turn-off. The construction going on in the hotel took away from the ambience and the lobby was always pretty busy since the wifi was free there but not in the rooms. I had to let the water run at a near trickle for it to stay hot, which was annoying. It was an okay stay but for the price, I expected better than okay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in a less than perfect world”
Reviews.Author: BizProf
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended if you need a convenient, clean, respectable place to stay in mid-town. All of the amenities you need at your fingertips. Great breakfast for Hhonors Gold members. Very responsive to special requests. Despite construction and small lobby, very comfortable. Wi-Fi is extra in rooms, which explains why so many people park in the lobby and corners to work.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction, good location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: shawbee99
Reviews.Content: I had a short, one night here for business nearby. Check-in was quick, efficient and friendly with the warm cookie offered. The lobby area was under construction as of November 2009 so the hallway to the elevators was very constricted. The "bar" consisted of a few tables and a portable bar shoved into said hallway; congestion was constant in this hallway. Room service & dining hours were restricted due to the renovation, none of which was advertised before arrival. My room on the 10th floor was average size for New York standards, but the bathroom was definitely sub-par. The ceiling paint was peeling and the tub had been worn down to the base metal in places. The bedding & furniture were quality and clean. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. Overall it is fine for a quick trip but should not be near the top of any list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Horrible Hotel”
