The A/C is not self regulated, it's regulated by the hotel, but I found the room comfortable. Neutrogena products are available in the room (soap, shampoo, conditioner). The sink area was separate for the shower, so it was great for couples getting ready. Lots of towels and they were quite nice. Loved the bedding. All white and very comfortable. TONS of pillows. :) Chaise in the room too for putting my luggage as I unpacked. Large closet with wood hangers. Lots of drawers to store all of your clothes. Windows open in case you feel the need to hear a little NYC night noise. I loved that the windows opened so I could here the cars 10 stories below. I have to have a little noise at night so that's why I opened them. Otherwise, you could have heard a pin drop if the window wasn't cracked. Great for light sleepers. The hotel staff , in general, were quite nice. There is a bar that is nice right off the lobby and a restaurant (we didn't eat there but it smelled nice!!) I heard that a gym was in the hotel too but with all the walking we did in NYC in 94 degree weather, we didn't make it to the gym. There was also a gift shop that looked very nice. The elevator was very quick.Taxis are ALWAYS outside in front of the hotel. Around the corner is the W hotel with a bar and a place called the Whiskey Bar. There is Starbucks, Au Bon Pain, Bliss spa, a great deli with buffet foods for breakfast, etc. within one block. The train was also within a block. Times Square, Bryant Park (eat at the outdoor Bryant Park Cafe at night - great cheap sandwiches and martinis), 5th Avenue, Central Park entrance within walking distance. But, if you love boutique shopping, bars and pubs and nightlife, don't stay here. This is mostly for tourists with kids doing the tourist thing. Lots of the 40+ crowd stayed here too - I saw groups of ladies and lots of older couples. Many screaming children in the hotel too so don't stay here if you are looking for the upscale hip crowd. But again, dead nightlife in this area and no real shopping except for 5th ave, which I found so amazingly boring. 5th Avenue has ZERO charm. I was so disappointed by the large department stores. SNOOZEville. Overall, the hotel was nice and I'd stay again if I was looking for a deal in NYC. But, I would NOT take a queen room - tiny room and bed plus the bed wasn't comfortable and the space was very tight. I wouldn't stay here unless I booked a King room. I was happy they upgraded me to a King for having to wait though, so doubletree if you're reading, thanks for that. Made wasting my entire afternoon in your lobby a little less painful. Also, if you're reading, don't charge people to hold their bags, super tacky. And at the end of the stay, don't have your hotel manager standing in the lobby approaching guests in line to check out telling you to rate them a 10 online. That was very cheeseball.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to the Big Apple. The Doubletree turned out to be a fantastic place for us to stay. Our room was pretty good sized and there was more than enough room for us to be comfortable. The bed was comfortable, the room clean and a plasma TV! That was a nice surprise. I know there are some complaints about service, room size, cleanliness, etc., but we received impeccible service and had a great experience. I would stay there again. Jason, the concierge was extermely helpful in giving us information about things to see, booking some tours, getting our JFK transportation set up and reccommending a fabulous restaurant to us that wasn't ridiculously overpriced and touristy. I can only say good things about the Doubletree Metropolitan. Also, a convenient Cafe Metro is right next to the hotel where you can get snacks, breakfast and lunch for a reasonable price. It was also pretty good!! I would recommend the Doubletree for its central location, its proximity to the subway (it's right on the corner) and its comfort and service. Fred O. California

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The staff was very friendly or, at the very least, cordial. The bell hops speak english, most as a first language. My husband (who's a native Texan) enjoyed the "Soprano-like" accents very much and I was glad to be home. The hotel is located on Lexington 1/2 block from the subway station -- you can't get more convenient. The beds were comfortable, the room was very clean, and we enjoyed the automated check-in terminals, which we used to check into the hotel as well as to print out our boarding passes for the trip home. I booked our room through Priceline and, except for one snotty telephone reservations clerk, we were treated very well. About the clerk -- I hung up on her and called back and got a very helpful clerk. It didn't matter though, because when I checked in I was given the option to change the room I'd been assigned from a one with a queen beed to one with 2 double beds. Then I asked the bell hop for a rollaway bed and it was delivered within 10 minutes. The only thing that's keeping me from giving this hotel an Excellent rating is that the room didn't have the lighted makeup mirror and similar (luxury?) appointments that I was hoping for. I would stay here again, but I also would have liked a little refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonAdrianne
Reviews.Content: Booked a room with a queen sized bed, when we arrived they didn't have a queen, so they gave us a king sized bed - but it was a handicapped room and the toilet was unusually high off the ground to the point my feet could not touch the floor. Other than that- the room was clean & respectable, the location was a good 10-15 minutes walk to attractions/shows etc. And the gym was surprisingly modern.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel”
Reviews.Author: red heavy tag
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I stayed at the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel from June 23 to June 26 and found it to be wonderful. We went there as a part of a American Girl package. The rooms are great. Spacious, clean, comfortable. The only problem we had was as to how to work the shower. Very confusing. Make sure they show you what to do. The cookies at check in were a hit with the granddaughter. Soft and warm. We stayed on the 11th flood and no outside sounds were noticed. The pillows were the best I have ever put my head on. And there were four pillows per bed. We had two double beds. They provided a bed for the American Girl doll my granddaughter brought with her. They also brought a rob, but they wanted $40.00 for it and we passed on that. Be careful about the prices for food. It cost me $20.00 for a buffet breakfast and $10.00 for the granddaughter. A little pricey for french toast, sausage, juice and coffee. The buffet does have a lot of food, and it is all tasty, but just too expensive. The service was excellent and prompt. If it were not so expensive and I could get the same room, I would stay there again. I think that since we had a package deal, that the price was quite high for 4 nights and five days. Location is great. Just a few blocks from 5th Avenue, St. Patricks, Rockafeller Center, The American Girl Place, Park Avenue, etc. We took a pedi cab one night when we were very tired and it cost us $15.00 for the short rride back to the hotel from 5th and 49th. The next night we thought we would do it again but this time they wanted $25.00. I said no and told them I would walk rather than pay that much for the ride. One of the other pedi cab drivers said he would do it for $15.00 and we went with his pedi cab. So be careful about the pedi cab charges. Ask BEFORE you get in as to how much they will charge you. There is a Fromms book (not a very big book) that has a wonderful map of Manhattan that was a great investment for me. It has detailed areas and a lot of great ideas. There is a fold out map in the inside cover at the back of the book that I relied on while there. I copied the are we stayed in and kept it in my purse for a reference. Really helped me.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for???”
Reviews.Author: jmlparis
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay at the Doubletree Metropolitan. Both myself and my friend booked a few months in advance and got a king size non-smoking deluxe room. We also asked for the rooms to be near each other (though not connecting). We were very happy to receive rooms next to each other. I was a bit apprehensive when I read all the other negative reviews, but perhaps you get what you pay for. Our rooms weren't the cheapest, but they were very big for New York standards. The bathroom, however, was tiny but everything was there that you needed including nice Neutrogena products. The bed was very comfortable (perfect after walking all over New York). The air conditioning in my room did work well but was noisy - I was at the end of a corridor so I think that was why. My friend's was not as noisy. The room was well laid out and there was plenty of room for all our stuff. It did not have a minibar or fridge in the room, which we missed especially since it was so hot in New York. The hotel itself is in a good spot - walking distance to Moma, Central Park, shops on Fifth avenue, etc. The concierge was very helpful though the front office staff were a bit snobby. We ended up paying about US$240 per night direct from the hotel's website - this included a full buffet breakfast, so I felt that it was good value for the location, the size of the room and the breakfast. Would I stay again? If I was in New York, probably, but I have decided I am more of a European girl - absolutely adore Paris and just got back from London which I preferred to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Lower your expectations”
Reviews.Author: beachloungerUsa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this doubleTree three times, twice because my company booked it and once because I ended up with it on Priceline. I will never stay there again, but for some it might be an OK choice. First, except for the person who checked us in this last time (who was charming), the staff are either overworked, or totally indifferent, or just rude. I'm not sure which, but either way, no one really cares how your stay is. For instance I asked for more hangers three days in a row. Service is basically crappy, generally no one will answer the phone when you call reception. Location is very good, you can walk a lot of places. It's NY so plan ahead if you want to extend your stay, I've seen rates go from under $200 to over $600 in the course of one week. Housekeeping is very good, and the rooms I've stayed in are clean, and the beds are very comfortable, decent decor. AC is good (although I guess it was broken in some rooms last week). Beware that there are some VERY small rooms, but the ones I've stayed in are OK for NY. Ask at the desk not to be put in the extra tiny rooms -- I'm not sure what the numbers are but you can see from the fire safety maps on the wall -- go back and ask for a bigger room. Unless you hate NY traffic noise, get a room that is not on the back/inside side. I have stayed in both, and the big fans make a droning noise that to me is worse than traffic - zero view. The windows have heavy soundproof glass so you should be OK. try to get a room that is higher than the 10th floor or so -- there are only 18 floors in the hotel, so higher is better for less sound. My biggest complaint - we had a laptop and a hard drive stolen out of our suitcase from the luggage storage last year. Stupid me I actually said 'please put this somewhere safe, there is a laptop inside'. We discovered the loss the moment we got to the airport, but of course the hotel would take absolutely no responsibility and blamed us instead. I suppose they were so worried about liability that they could not be professional and instead were complete jerks - seriously, dealing with them about the theft was a terrible experience. No apologies, no callbacks, total runaround....nothing but hostiility. I recommend locks on your luggage, and check your luggage before you leave the luggage area. I'm sure this was a random event, or one bad apple or whatever, but I've never been so disrespected as I was when I was trying to deal with the stolen laptop. When I got the hotel again on priceline I thought it was a cosmic joke, cause i swore i'd never set foot there again.. My travel service (corporate) told me they got lots of complaints about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Breif and to the point.....internet access if very important to me, internet is iffy...alot of times I had no access and took forever for pages to load. Hotel staff is unprofessional and seem unconcerned of your privacy/respect. Al ot of staff hanging around hitting on me. Plus very noisy inside hotel with banging doors and staff yelling to each other. Clean but nondescript rooms. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “what a value for new york!”
Reviews.Author: buddhafly
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 200 a night. they give you these big warm gooey chocolate chip cookies at check in. staff friendly at checkin. concierge way overworked so cant help enough. room big. style decent. bathroom had problems though. toilet was wibbly wobbley and not mounted and toilet overflowed once right afetr we checked in!. water all over the floor! bell hops helpful. modern stylish lobby and bar. though no mini bar in the room which would not be good for business travellers. i assume (hope) the toilet was just an isolated problem. so, other than that i thought it was a good value (by NYC standards) especially since we paid the same 200 bucks for the skyline hotel (motel!) in nyc which was quite bad. would stay again at the doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed every month for 6 months”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel every month out of the last 6, not because it has anything special about it, but it's fairly close to our NY office. I first stayed here in 2003 before it went through the much publicised "extensive refurb" and to be honest it hasn't made a huge difference. The lobby and bar area have certainly been improved, but as far as I can make out the only difference in the rooms are a basic flat screen TV, better beds and window blinds that may be more modern but are already showing signs of wear. They also put new shower curtains in. WOW!!!!! My biggest complaint is the the bathrooms are ridiculously small and claustrophobic. This month they gave me room 1402 which at least has a good view up Lex, but mostly the rooms have poor views (most look out over air conditioning units and the back of office blocks). Basically, if I weren't on tight corporate expenses, and I were paying with my own money I'd look for somewhere else with more character and better value. The gym facilities are not bad and it's worth dropping in for an hour after work. The doormen also have a nice little scam going with private cabs and will charge you $70 to JFK no doubt skimming $10 for themselves in the process. They're more interested in booking you a cab than they are in anything else. When you arrive at checkin they make a big deal of handing over one of their "legendary Doubletree chocolate chip cookies". I've never eaten one of them (mostly because I arrive after midnight!!) but to be honest it's a hollow gesture that doesn't even come close to making up for shortcomings elsewhere. If you're paying with your own cash, go elsewhere. If on expenses and you like midtown, it's worth considering only if you can book a King room at least and demand one with a decent view (not at the back).

Reviews.Title: “Being Gay at the DoubleTree Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Doubletree Metropolitan over this past weekend. Some things to note if you're gay/lesbian and staying here. 1. The concierge didn't give us a room with a King Bed, like we'd reserved on Expedia. This was my partner's 30th birthday and I wanted to provide a romantic weekend for her. I mentioned that the Standard King is what we booked, but she wouldn't budge, leaving us with two double beds. It wasn't a bad room, but just neither what we'd reserved nor expected. I felt that if we were a straight couple, this wouldn't have been an issue that needed explaining. 2. The hotel bar downstairs is for super made-up straight people. We felt out of place. Because we didn't look like the Real Housewives of Orange County, we didn't get served for a very long time and we were annoyed because we had money to spend. Funny how quick people are to judge. 3. The room was surprisingly quiet for being in midtown Manhattan. The beds were very comfortable "Sweet Dreams" beds. 4. Midtown probably isn't the best part of town to stay for people who don't really care too much about shopping at Cartier and Louis Vuitton, but I will say that there was a Starbucks right around the corner and one of Manhattan's best bagel places one block away, "Ess-a-Bagel". 5. We loved SoHo, the East Village, TriBeCa and Chelsea. When we go back, we'd probably stay in lower Manhattan, which was more our speed. 6. The Russian bar in SoHo, Pravda, is great! I loved that place. Bottom line, if you stay here and midtown isn't necessarily for you, don't be afraid to take the green line subway (right outside of the hotel) to lower Manhattan. You will have a much better time and fit right in.

Reviews.Title: “Unworthy of the Doubletree name”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There's nothing wrong with the Doubletree Metropolitan that a wrecking ball wouldn't fix. This is a dingy, dilapidated property - not at all what I've come to expect from Doubletree. Our windows overlooked an airshaft, though the desk clerk said "I have a very nice room for you". The touted "flat screen TV" is tiny and the picture is bad. If you're thinking HDTV, think again. Loud "top 40" music in the halls and elevators. The carpets in the halls are old and dirty, and halls smell bad. The rooms are tiny. Need I go on? We wanted to leave as soon as we saw our room, but they told us we would have to pay for at least one night. So we hightailed it out of there after one night of a planned 5 night stay, and instead went to the Doubletree Guest Suites in Times Square. It's a bit more expensive, but a great value. I don't know why Hilton bought this place, or why they stuck the respected Doubletree name on it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Levi22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights while visiting friends in the city. I used to live there so this hotel was in a fantastic location... Midtown Manhattan, Lexington Ave, near all kinds of shopping (if you are into that) and close enough to cab it downtown for a night of bar hopping. The staff was friendly and courteous. Rooms were very neat and quiet. Very satisfied with the hotel and will definitely stay there again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, adequate accomm. would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: suks
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Doubletree for 3 nights at the end of March 2006. Myself and my mother were on a shopping trip in New York and were looking for a cheap but cheerful place to stay. I had been to New York several times before and knew that location is far more important than room size or luxury. The Doubletree is situated on the corner of 51st and Lexington and is perfect for walking to the obvious touristy things and 5th avenue shopping. As with all hotels the foyer looked very promising and it was only when you exited the lift at your floor that the 1970's carpet came into view. We had a twin room on the 17th floor and barr the carpet in the hallways really couldn't fault it. There were 6-8 lifts which brought you up 17 floors in seconds. Our room was big enough for 2 double beds and we had a lovely clean recently refurb bathroom with powerful shower. The movie channel had all the up to date movies. Check in took no time at all and we got the yummiest choc chip cookie which was novel. We opted for express check out so had no delays there either the only thing I did find unusual was that we had to pay $2 per piece of luggage to be stored after we had checked out as we were not leaving New York City untill later that day. All in all would def recommend the hotel for basic clean rooms in great location. Will def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: mathas
Reviews.Content: We stayed from march the 5 to 12 at the doubletree metropolitan. The check-in was very easy and fast. By the way the cookie was a very nice touch. The room was clean and the bed comfy. We stayed on the 11th flooron the side where the firestation is, it was qiuet. Only the AC was lil bit loud. thats y only 4 points. The bathroom was small but clean. Towels changed every 2 days, throw it to the bathtub and u get some new one. The location was perfect, located right next a metro station. Many attractions in walking distance. Rockefeller , Chrysler Building, Central Park in only few minutes away (about 10 minutes). We def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: ExDirectory
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree last week and was pleasantly surprised given some of the adverse comments on TripAdvisor. My room was quiet, clean and the bed very comfortable. I think being at the back of the building on the 7th floor made it particularly quiet for Midtown Manhattan. The bathroom is small. To misquote another poster "The bathroom is so small I had to get out to change my mind!" but very clean and well equipped. The check-in/check-out and service were good and the location excellent for midtown (and my NYC office on 53rd and 3rd). The Metro cafe is right next door for breakfast. I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Got Overcharged $2,600 by Mistake!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival, all was great - the cookies were outstanding. The room was also fine, we had a twin room and the size was good for a NYC room. The bed was comfortable. For our last night we booked a triple room. We did not realise that this would be the same double room with a trundle bed squeezed in. Needless to say, with three girls and all of our shopping there was no room to move. Our room was also not made up, twice - which was not great. But the worst part of our stay was that I was overcharged $2,600 - by mistake! We paid for our rooms in full at the time of our booking over the internet. No one at Hilton took responsibility for the mistake and I was given the run around. It cost me time and money (many phone calls from London to the US) trying to have the error corrected. I would find it hard to bring myself to stay in a Hilton affiliated hotel again. ...The hotel bar was great though!

Reviews.Title: “Stop giving it such a hard time!!”
Reviews.Author: Boola
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 5 days for my 30th birthday, and having booked it before finding Trip Advisor I was a little worried about staying there. Well for those of you going there fear not. We checked in, and everything was ready and waiting for us including our warm cookies which were yum by the way. Must say they had not managed my request of a smoking room, but they never guarantee it anyway. There were three of us stsyong in our room in two double beds which were so comfy. The linen was pristine, and was changed after two days, I then spilt a bit of drink on there and they were changed again. The towels are not changed daily as a matter of course but there is a sign saying to put them in the bath if you want new ones which was done without fail. Did not eat in the restaurant so can't comment, but the bar was great and the little shop carried all the essentials although it did look like just a gift shop from the outside. I found the concierge's that I spoke to very busy but very helpful and knowledgable and not unhelpful as mentioned in some previous reviews. All in all the Doubletree was just what I was looking for. It was very clean, right by a subway station, a five minute walk from Bloomingdales and ten minutes from Times Square. Must mention the Cafe Metro which is next door breakfast for less than $5 and not bad, lovely cakes and fab sandwiches. Come on everyone give this hotel a break!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected More...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had waited a long time to get to see the sights of New York, so when we found the Doubletree we were very excited! The location is excellent as are the cookies however, that's about it! On arrival the staff were too busy to take much notice of us, we didn't even get a smile with the Hello, and to us British that is very important! The room was very small with no view. The rooms, I guess, are supposed to be 'Retro' however, I would say that they haven't been decorated since the 70's but just had a flat screen TV and some new lamps added. When it came to bedtime, we tried to turn off the heating in the room as it was very noisy however although we switched it off, it carried on. We called the Engineer who was very helpful but he had to totally switch off the heating at the mains which meant no heating whilst we stayed there at all...hmmmm...March is a little cold for no heating! We also had to put a towel against the door to stop the light from the hallway shining through. We called the Engineer out on a second occasion as the TV / Internet service screen froze and we couldn't check anything, not even our bill!! Our bus back to Boston did not leave until 4pm on our day of departure therefore we asked if we could leave our bags. Not only did they charge us $1 per bag in but also $1 per bag on collection...total rip off after spending $419 for 2 nights!!

Reviews.Title: “Location was great for our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night in order to take my daughter to a charity event on the Today show at Rockefeller Center. The location was perfect for us, since it is only a couple of blocks from Rockefeller Center (and the American Girl Place). For a one-night stay, the Doubletree Metropolitan was fine for us. Check-in was a pleasure -- the front desk clerk was very friendly. Our room was very nice, two double-beds and more space than expected for a New York City hotel. It was neat/clean. The bathroom is fairly small, but had a full tub/shower. Beds were comfortable and we didn't hear much street noise. The walls are thin though and did hear people talking and watching tv at 2 a.m. Easy express checkout. Like others, we checked one suitcase to be held for a couple of hours after checkout -- and were charged $1 for checking them, then told by the bellhop that he gets a dollar tip when retrieving the bag-- like another reviewer mentioned, I don't mind giving a tip, but I find it very rude when someone "charges" a tip. I think that's a poor final impression to leave on a customer. Be aware that if you park in the parking garage you will not be allowed access to your vehicle during your stay so make sure that you don't leave anything in your vehicle that you will need. Overall, it was a good stay for us for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: “great cookies, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: keely027
Reviews.Content: when we arrived we was very impressed, the room was good and the bed was amazing. the bathroom was very small and the shower took ages to work with hot water. The location is great, but the service was poor. I had some valentines roses delivered from my husband in the afternoon and they didnt bring them up until 12.30 in the night and they woke me up. The suprise was wrecked and had to ring down to the front desk twice they denied they were in the hotel at all. what was worse i had to call home to find out 'what my husbands suprise was' and they charged me $19 for the 3 minute call to the uk ! What annoyed us most was the charging for bag storage. they charged once to put it in and again to take them out! and the guy on duty charged us for every single item, when we returned the people had change on duty and he said we had been ripped off! all these little issues leaves a bad taste in, in atually a not bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really marginal service”
Reviews.Author: G-de-Paris
Reviews.Content: The location is great if you have lots of meetings up town. But the maid service was ridiculously bad (they *never* emptied the trash or tidied up the room. They only changed the sheets when I requested and left fresh towels). The bellhops (when they were around) let me struggle with my luggage almost the entire way, then held out their hand for a tip. Likewise they charged me for storing my luggage for 2hrs after checkout, and again, wanted at tip for taking 20 minutes to find it. The walls are thin and the hotel attracts a non-professionial clientele. There were teenagers shouting to each other down the hall, the concierge was clueless (or perhaps new), but worst of all... There was no refrigerator in the room! No mini bar, no fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree at the beginning of February 2006. This was my 5th visit to NY and the Doubletree is undoubtedly one of the better hotels I have stayed in. It's great location makes it very accessible for many attractions and getting about. Warm cookies on check-in are a nice touch. Booked a king room and wasn't disappointed. Room was large, modern and clean, with good facilities and a decent hairdryer! The bed was so comfy - just what you need after a days pavement pounding! The Metro Cafe is located next door and open from 6a.m. (perfect for those suffering from jet lag, as we experienced). The Broadway Diner across the road is also a good choice, especially for breakfast but there are plenty of places to eat round and about the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but got good price”
Reviews.Author: GQue
Reviews.Content: There for two nights on business a few block down the street. Got Queen bed room for Avg $170pn. Location served it's purpose, but rooms were very tiny and I agree with another reviewer, bathroom so small, you have to step out to change your mind. Given room in back of bldg, with window view of another building about 50 feet away. Kept shades closed for privacy. Small Plasma TV more a upscale gimmick. Give me a regular TV with a 25" screen. But then again because the room was so small, a small TV screen was par for the room. Would not stay here again. Felt cramped after being in a hotel in another major city with a waterfront view before this that was about 50% larger and the same price.

Reviews.Title: “plasma to make you think you are going to get luxury”
Reviews.Author: charlie_dog
Reviews.Content: have stayed at a variety of nyc hotels and variety of size rooms doubletree lexington was average but the bathroom you couldnt swing a cat.... i would stay at this hotel if a good price was available and as we paid 179 usd plus tax it was a bargain for the nice white bed linen.. had a view of the fire station. i would say this hotel is a glorified travel inn with plasma tv; and fancy hotel bar which was very trendy and always busy when i passed.. the nicest hotel so far has to be the crowne plaza on times square it was lush and big big rooms... at the doubletree though only booked a queen but very nice lady upgraded to 2 doubles after being super nice to her at check in.. they charge you a doller to check in and then out each piece of luggage with the luggage man which is a bit much when you have lots of bags including carriers and un expected when you are on the way home and spent up on your dollars....i would stay here again but only if a good price... i would not pay a fortune but location for subway is ace...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last November for 5 nights the location was excellent if you are a serious shopper! The room was of excellent standard extremely comfortable beds to rest our weary bodies after trawling the city for bargains! The only down side to the room was the size of the bathroom other than that this hotel cannot be faulted. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as it seemed quite expensive for what was on offer. There are plenty of coffee shops/diners near by with the metro cafe next door, which is just alright. The staff were quite fiendly and extremely helpful with organising a taxi to the airport and storing our bags whilst we shopped some more! The location was excellent it was less than a five min walk to Bloomingdales. We didn't use the hotel's conceriage but had heard from other guest that he/they were always helpful and infomative. Overall this hotel was very reasonable, comfortable and I wouldn't hesiate to recommend a stay at this hotel. I know i will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent position to explore new york”
Reviews.Author: DPW3
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from 4 nights in new york staying at the doubletree metropolitan. Opted for this hotel after the usual search through tripadvisor for a decent hotel, and were not dissappointed. We took the shuttle bus to grand central station from JFK ($27 return)which took approx 40 minutes. Took subway from grand central to next stop at 51st lexington avenue, which brought us out directly next to the hotel. We received our cookies on check in which were very nice. We had booked a standard double, but on arrival were given a lager room on the 17th floor. Very good room with extremely comfortable bed and pillows. We had no problems with noise as others have mentioned. The only downside was the lack of tea/coffee facilities. The maid seemed to appreciate the first day's tip, providing extra toiletries, but for the following 3 days seemed to only bother with towel changes and making the bed. The hotel is in an exellent position for tourist activities. Times square/ 5th avenue / central park are approx 10-15 minutes away on foot. There is plenty of activity in the surrounding area at all times and the streets were well lit, which makes walking back at night safe. For those that do not like to walk, there is a subway just outside the hotel and a further subway 2 blocks away which will take you to most places in new york. There is a small deli/cafe next door which serves a wide variety of food all day until late at night.We found this to be an ideal place for breakfast in the morning,as well as any late evening snacks/drinks before returning to our room. This hotel offers good accomodation at a good price, and in an excellent position which is not always easy to find. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, GREAT location, a few problems”
Reviews.Author: azzure
Reviews.Content: Here is the text of a message I sent to the Doubletree/Hilton web site after our stay: "Many travelers now use the Internet service called "TripAdvisor" for information about hotels. I will soon be posting my opinions on that site, but thought I would first let you know of our concerns. First, your front desk staffperson was rather brusque and unwelcoming. Secondly, our room was still not cleaned one day when we returned at 4:30 pm from sightseeing. Third, the door to the room did not fit snugly in its jamb, allowing noise into the room from the hallway and other rooms. On the plus side, the room and bath were well appointed and the hotel's location was terrific. I hope you will take steps to address these concerns, as we would probably stay at this hotel again if these problems were alleviated. Thank you." In summary, I still think the hotel is a good value, and the front desk/housekeeping problems were minor. The doorways do need better insulation, however!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DonegalGirly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in december. We got a fantastic deal booking in advance through their website. The check in was very fast and the cookie a welcome addition. It is in a great walking distance to a lot of new york landmarks and just as well as we were there during the transit strike. It is a great base for tourists. There was a really nice deli next door to the hotel, good food, we recommend the sandwiches :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms/ Bad heating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a three star NYC hotel, it is above average. Rooms recently renovated, in a cool funky decor. Lobby/entrance nice. Bar is very expensive, but it's New York. Only problem was thermostat on wall didn't seem to work- had to call engineer. And of course, noise can be heard from hallway (near elevator). These are problems I've encountered in many older building in New York. Other than that, very nice and a good deal for under $200.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: kenmatt
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the doubletree in january and were very pleased with this hotel. Check in was quick and friendly and although the warm cookie was good, we thought it was a a little odd. (didnt stop us from eating it!) Check in person was very accomodating by placing both of our parties on the same floor. Rooms were very boutique-like in decor and were clean. Bathroom was small but adequate. LCD (PLASMA?) TV was pretty cool. Views were mostly office and apartment buildings. Only negative is that I usually judge a hotel by the condition of its corridors, which in this case, were a little worn (in my opinion) This hotel is wonderfully located!! For you walkers (What better way to see NYC?) it is so close to so much in midtown! So, between the quality of the accommodations, price and location, I would say this hotel is a very good value. Hint: go off the beaten bath for breakfast. a lot of the diners close by are way overpriced and appear to be tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks 8/10 boxes, but best location!”
Reviews.Author: NuZu
Reviews.Content: Thought l owe it to this site to post my review, as l spent hours trawling through this site before l finally decided to book the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel. So...location could'nt be beaten unless you can afford one of those lovely suites in a 5* overlooking Central Park. The hotel is just in the next block from the Astoria,W Hotel and other very posh ones. The only negative thing l can say, is that the hotel staff are quite short, but then l guess it is part of a large company corporate. If you re staying there over a weekend, ask for a free up-grade if they have spare rooms, as we did and got moved to a larger, higher room with a view. Overall, more than satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great charming and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: gatototo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and I highly recommend it. It's very modern and has all amenities, as most Doubltree hotels have. The location is OK but not in the middle of all shops or theaters. It's a calm neighborhood and a very safe one also. You can reach all major attractions quite easily. The subway is just in front of the hotel and the bus also passes by in front of it. The room I got which had a king size bed was spacious enough for us and 4 large pieces of luggage. They have great beds, modern bathrooms, and everything was very very nice. Just don't make long distance calls from you room. Free wireless internet from the lobby and a very popular bar. I really enjoyed it and will stay here again next time. Plus reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Room”
Reviews.Author: M_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight in January '06 and loved it. The hotel is located on 51st and Lex and is a 5-minute walk from Rockafeller Center, Radio City, the upper reaches of Time Square, and the Winter Garden theater on Broadway where Mama Mia is playing. I lived in NYC on 51st and 7th back in the 80s, so I'm very familiar with the area as well as what types of hotels are available in the area and for the price I paid here versus what I've paid for the Hilton or either of the Sheratons on 7th I can't recommend any other place to stay. Room and bed were comfortable. Small deli/shop next door was convenient for some inexpensive grub. Easy walk to my appointments the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AimeeinTX
Reviews.Content: From La Guardia to Hotel -Cab Fare average around $30 with the toll fee Check In -We got there early around 1pm on a Saturday so I didn't expect to get into a room right away. -Service was great. We were greeted right away. They kept our bags for $1 a piece when we couldn't get into our rom. We got our room around 3:15pm. Room -We booked 1 room with 2 double beds. The room was smalll, which I had expected since it was NYC. -Rooms were clean and bedding was comfortable. Unfortunately the double beds are a little small for two grown people. -One complaint that I have is that the a/c didn't work and the heat was set really high. -We ordered internet in the room. This helped alot because we needed to get different schedules and information for our vacations. Hotel Amenties -The Met bar was nice even though the drinks were a bit steep. I didn't realized that the tip was included so I ended up overtipping quite a bit for the first few rounds. -I didn't try the restaurant, but nextdoor is a great cafe called Cafe Metro. They had good breakfast & was great for a snack if you didn't want to go to far away from the hotel. It is also opened really late. -Close to the the subway. The 6 train will take you almost all the places that you need to go in Manhatten so it was really great to be next to it. We bought the all pass for the subway which was only $7. Well worth it. Check out -No problems on the bill. -Easy & smooth check out. -The doorman got us a cab right away. Overall, I like the location and the hotel very much. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for short stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the DoubleTree Metropolitian prior to Christmas for 3 nights. The location could not be more perfect as it is within walking distance to Times Square as well as Central Park. The hotel is older and needs refurbashing, but if you are touring during the day and only sleep there is is sufficient. Rooms are small and the bathroom was big enough to turn around in. But, it was clean and we felt safe. Safe location for female travelers with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a Christmas Vacation to NYC from December 18-21. We got a great deal on a standard room with queen size bed on the Doubletree website ($130 CAD). I was a bit nervous to see the place judging from some of the reviews here, but I am not sure what all the negativity is about. We were greeted by a very friendly and helpful front desk person, and were provided the excellent warm chocolate chip cookies upon arrival. We had arrived at 8 AM, and were not able to check in that early. However, the hotel was able to put our luggage away for us until we returned at lunch time. Check in was quite smooth and we were into a room, as they said, by lunch. We were on the 6th Floor and thought the room was great. Not large, but cozy and I found they made great use of the space. The room had been recently renovated, and was bright and clean. We enjoyed the flat screen TV, and found the bed to be very comfortable. It was greatly appreciated each night after long days touring the city! The bathroom was clean and modern, with no complaints. With regards to the noise, though we were facing the NYPD and FDNY stations, the noise didn't really disrupt us that much. Maybe if it was the summer and you had the window open it would be noticeable, but with the windows closed it didn't bother us. The hallway noise was noticed (thanks to the young children running up and down the hall), but as has been suggested could probably be drowned out with a towel under the door. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel as a great home base for your trip to New York. The rooms are clean and modern. The location is fantastic--within about a 10 block radius you can walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Trump Tower, Times Square, Empire State Building, Fifth Avenue, Madison Avenue. We were there in the middle of the transit strike, and weren't terribly effected because of our proximity to everything. And now that the strike is over, it is good to know the subway is right next door as well. I recommend the Broadway Diner across the street. You can get a great breakfast there for $5. The food, service, and prices are great. The only negatives I would have were that they told us toll free calls were free from our room, then charged us for them. (They were quickly removed when we pointed it out to them.) Also, we were told the luggage storage was free, then were charged $3 when we picked up our luggage. Overall though, I would come back to the Doubletree Metropolitan again. If you ever have the chance to see NYC at Christmastime, I would highly recommend it. Nobody does Christmas better!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms, Big Price, Big Attitudes”
Reviews.Author: Menri11433
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I, lifelong New Yorkers, decided to stay over in Manhattan for two nights during the transit strike, especially when we saw how low the rates were for this hotel: we got a king room for 150/night, and were upgraded to a king junior suite because of our Hilton Honors status. Despite the lower-than-usual rate, this place was still a bust. The "junior suite", on the 19th floor, was the size of a normal small hotel room anywhere else in the continental United States. Welcome to Manhattan, kiddies. And because this hotel is in midtown Manhattan, you get no view. The top floor of this place is the middle floor of the skyscrapers surrounding it. As if the room itself wasn't small enough, the toilet and shower were crammed next to eachother in the "bathroom" to the point where if you stood in the middle of the room, you would be unable to fully extend your arms in either direction. The whole place has a very claustrophobic feel to it, and remember, this is a top-floor junior suite! The real kicker is the front desk attitude...twice, from two seperate employees, my polite inquiries or standard dealings were met with the tone of voice normally reserved for the exceedingly little of little people. Any good...location is alright, the sheets were clean, and the heat control, though carefully hidden, worked quite well once discovered. Also, the elevators were surprisingly fast for a hotel this big/busy. Would stay here again only if it was the lowest rate in all of midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in this Hotel on 17th-22nd of December. Went to New York City for a shopping trip and light sight-seeing, so didn't really care about a view, from the room. Ended up on the 19th floor of the Hotel which faced the rear (I think)(Not much of a view-didn't care). At any rate, at check-in received vouchers for "free American breakfast" and warm cookies all 'round. Nice touch. Counter person was interested and informative. Breakfast was great, to say the least. Full buffet-can't think of anything that was missing. "Metro Cafe" next door (10 feet away) was a great little oasis for coffees and quick lunches; reasonably priced. "Marilyn Monroe" Subway entrance another 10 feet beyond Cafe. General location of Hotel was perfect and seemed central for walking to shopping and street level sight-seeing. Also, double-decker tour bus stop nearby. Great place, no complaints, will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great subway location”
Reviews.Author: Jason Koulouras
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Doubletree Metropolitan hotel on December 14th. Had a very personable and friendly front desk check in person who would not allow me to have a cookie since they were not hot and fresh (very kind of her). The check in was fast and efficient. The room was very clean and had a very comfortable bed and work area along wth a divan - it was pretty much slightly bigger than average for a NYC midtown manhattan room. The sink area was spacious and well designed as was the bath/shower combination. There were some minor issues with the room - toilet paper holder not fastened to the wall and some wallpaper not sticking properly and these issues kept me from rating as an excellent The location is great with next door access to the Lexington Avenue #6 local with one stop to Grand Central to transfer to multiple lines Yes, there were decent sized gaps at the bottom of the door - solved by towels I would stay there again if my business required me to be in midtown/east side

Reviews.Title: “Cant Understand The low Rating”
Reviews.Author: masyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights while doing some xmas shopping and cannot understand the reason for such a low tripadvisor rating (#180). I was concerned after reading the reports but to be honest we couldnt ask for more. The room was bright, clean and well decorated and the location excellent. Whenever we needed staff assistance they were good. I think some people rely too much on hotel assistance and invariably are let down, try to be a little independent and you wont have to complain about the staff as much. We usually stay in fitzpatricks but this was very comparable at half the price. Will certainly stay again once the credit card bill is paid off!!!

Reviews.Title: “Does Austin Powers stay at the Doubletree?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights pre-Xmas; had to change rooms on the after they put us next to the elevator shaft first night. Both rooms had constant plumbing problems: mysteriously the bathroom sink would start to back up from the drain and nearly overflow. Our bathtub plug never did work despite multiple visits from "Engineering", and would jam either open or closed. Staff try to be helpful, though they have their hands full keeping this place running. Can't figure out if this hotel is trying to look 60's retro or just never got reno'd. Either way, not so groovy, baby: awfully tired-looking, especially for $580 US per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern interior. Frendly, helpful staff. Great location - walking distance from time square. Also - its right about a subway station so easy to get around the city. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, dusty, some cigarettes and ashes found under the bed, expensive Internet access... I would'nt recoommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed impressions”
Reviews.Author: CDOJ
Reviews.Content: We have just had 4 nights at this hotel and got back today...sorry for the length but a lot to say! When we arrived we were checked in quickly and the staff were brilliant and really funny, we even had a laugh about them getting my wifes name wrong. We went up to the room and as soon as I opened the door I got a strong musty smell combined with urine like in a public toilet! There was no way we could sleep in there (decent size though I thought!) so went back down.We got a room change straight away which was in fact a little larger and plenty big enough for us although had no view but you can't have everything! We woke at about 4AM the following morning to the strong smell of cigarette smoke which my wife traced to be coming from the aircon unit, we just opened windows and carried on but we came home that evening and the room stank of fags again!! We went back down to check-in....they offered to get security to patrol the corridor which wasn't where the smell was coming from and after some discussion they changed our room again which was the 2nd in 24hrs but in fairness was not their doing. The final room was great and had a view of the Police precinct and the now closed Fire Dept. Yeah there was some noise, we were on 6th, but hey it's New York and a busy city and didn't bother us much, BUT.... As mentioned before in other reviews the gaps around the door were huge and light from the corridor streamed through...we had a ritual each evening of plugging around the door with magazines,scarves and towels which worked...but should you have to for the price you pay bearing in mind it's a Hilton and refurbished??? Also when we were waiting to go home all I seemed to see two porters in particular do was count their tips, one had a missive 'wad' of notes which he would stand in the foyer and count. I have to be honest in that we wouldn't stay here again because of what happened but the staff were extremely helpful when we went to them with the problems, I couldn't fault them at all, the problem I think lies with the hotel itself and not enough thought when the refurb went ahead... Oh yeah the cookies were great. Hope this long review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Used to small rooms in New York, but this was a good size. Very well equiped, you could even connect your iPod to the clock/radio. Good staff and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: NP73
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 4 family members during thanksgiving week. We had picked this hotel as i had hilton honors points to use-and the doubletree is a hilton family hotel. Check in was very speedy as there is a dedicated checkin for honors members. Warm cookies which we received on arrival were gorgeous. We were given room upgrades and free breakfast for the week which was a major saving as eating out all the time can be expensive. Rooms were comfortable, bed linen and towels were clean. lcd tv worked fine. This hotel is very very close to a subway stop-about 10 metres from the front door and taxi fares back were always less than 12 dollars with tip..even from lower manahattan. Some great restaurants in the area on 2nd and 3rd avenues, especially zarella-mexican restaurant.Went to O'Neils around the corner which had good food but expensive. Drinks in hotel bar are expensive. Japanese/Sushi restaurant round the corner beside o'neils is excellent and very reasonable - 20 dollars for 3 course lunch. I only have 2 complaints-the air conditioning was very noisy and there was no anti-slip mat in the shower and i slipped quite badly one night and fell out of the shower... Other than that, 7.5/10.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + great rooms. Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: design-dw
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was incredibly impressed with this hotel. The location is fantastic. No matter how you choose to get to Manhattan, the hotel is easy to locate. Not far from Grand Central, and on a major Subway link â€“ it couldnâ€™t be easier. I want to start this review with about the only negative impression I got â€“ and that was at check in. The guy behind the desk didnâ€™t seem interested that Iâ€™d be staying at the hotel, he just did what he had to do and that was it. No conversation. No welcome. I just got a room card. He only just remembered to give me my free cookie (a nice touch). My room was on the second floor which I was slightly concerned about as I had heard that the street noise is quite loud. However, when I entered my room you couldnâ€™t hear anything more than the general hum of New York. This is my first time to New York, but the room was a lot quieter than in other major cities Iâ€™ve stayed in. Even during the night, there was no need to worry about the noise. The rooms were nicely decorated. The hotel had been refurbished last year I believe, but the rooms still looked like new. The beds were huge and very comfortable. There was an office-like chair in front of the desk and a chaise long in the corner of the room which was very comfortable if you get chance to sit and watch TV â€“ which was a plasma screen â€“ another nice little touch. The bathroom was on the small side, but it was split into two, with the toilet and shower/bath in one section, behind the door, and the wash basin was in front of the door. Overall, there was plenty of space for what was necessary, but if you like a big bathroom you may be disappointed. Despite itâ€™s size, the bathroom was nicely decorated. The shower was very powerful (which is a must for me!) and had a number of setting depending on how you like your shower. There was also adequate wardrobe space â€“ including quite a lot of hangers instead of the usual one or two! I didnâ€™t have time to use the fitness facilities at the hotel, but did take a look and the equipment all looked fairly new. After my second night in the hotel, there was a message asking me to call reception. They said there had been a â€˜problemâ€™ in the room next door and they were having to relocate people to other rooms. I was a little annoyed at this inconvenience, but the hotel staff were incredibly helpful â€“ they even offered to help me pack and then unpack my stuff. I politely declined as I didnâ€™t have too much. I was relocated to the 9th floor and the room was exactly the same standard as my first room. I would therefore presume that they were all of this standard. As an apology for the inconvenience, I got loads of free cookies, plus another one each day in a cookie jar in my room, a free newspaper each day plus tickets for free buffet-breakfast for the rest of my stay which made the whole move ok! I was staying room only as most hotels charge ridiculous prices for their breakfasts, and the Doubletree Metropolitan was no exception, however armed with my free breakfast token, I indulged every morning. The food was freshly prepared and there was a wide selection to choose from. Everything from a traditional cooked breakfast to cereals, fruit salads, fresh fruit plus lots more. The food was very nice â€“ but still wouldnâ€™t have paid their price for it. The service that the staff in the hotel provided was (with the exception of the check in guy) exemplary. Nothing was too much hassle and I didnâ€™t feel like I was asking the earth if I needed something. The concierge were brillirant and booked me a helicopter flight with Liberty Helicopters and the porters were always ready to help with luggage storage and they always had a cab ready if you needed it. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again and would definitely recommend it to anyone â€“ businesses or pleasure travellers. I will definitely be staying here on my next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Anji Page
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and can't wait to stay there again. I had 4 nights there at the beginning of November with a girl friend. The room was clean and a good size for New York, particularly considering it had 2 double beds in it. The beds were so comfy! The bathroom was a little on the small side but hey, who comes to New York to spend all their time in the bathroom! It was clean and functional so that scores points in my book. We had no problems with the reception staff, check in was quick and easy - the warm chocolate chip cookies were delicious! Had trouble trying to use the internet access in the room which I was charged for (even though it didn't work) but after explaining the problem at check-out, it was taken off my account without argument. We were on the 9th floor which was lovely and quiet. The location is great - it took us about 20 minutes to walk to Times Square but it was perfectly safe, even late at night. The hotel is close to Fifth Avenue, Bloomingdales, the Rockefeller Centre and the subway. Plenty of places to eat nearby, lots of coffee shops. The cafe right next door to the hotel was open late and their latte was much nicer than Starbucks! And it had the most amazing cheesecakes! The whole area outside the hotel was always busy and had a real New York vibe to it - a film was being shot right across the street. Got the subway down to Battery Park on my own one morning, again felt very safe, there was a policeman on the platform who gave me directions. Can recommend doing the Sex and the City tour (not for children!) and visiting the top of the Rockefeller Centre which had just opened when we were there - the views were amazing. This hotel is in a great location for exploring New York - from Battery Park I walked all the way back up one morning, stopping at shops and walking through different areas of New York. Central Park was just a few blocks higher up - this is a great hotel and my husband and I are already considering booking it again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was everything we'd hoped for - and then some. Between the stainless steel sink and fixtures in the bathroom, the luxurious down bedding and warm decor in general, it was very appealing and cozy. I slept like a rock in that bed. The staff was impressive, most notable the Concierge named Jason. He was phenomenal!! He got us 5th row seats to see Blue Man Group (on a Saturday night) with less than 24 hrs notice. He was extremely helpful and because of him we ate like kings in some of the best restaurants in the area. We would definitely stay there again. The location was very convenient. Close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and great shopping. If you're into sightseeing, it's conveniently close to the Waldord Astoria which is where you can catch a free shuttle to the docks for one of the sightseeing cruises, sightseeing tour buses also stop here to pick up riders. Anyone who knows how much is costs to take a cab from one side to town to the other will appreciate the free shuttle. Great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Soulsis
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying 5 nights. The room was bigger than I expected - huge bed and the pillows were great. The room was clean but the bathroom on the small side but the water was hot and plentiful. Nice comfy sofa and we were on the 11th floor and was reasonably quiet. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: tlightb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights at the end of October with my wife. Comfortable, clean hotel. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful (must have caught different shifts from other reviewers). Large double bed was extremely comfortable, and room was exceptionally quiet for a large hotel with room frontage on to 51st Street. Great location in midtown with plenty of diners and deli spots close by. In house food looked a bit expensive, but didn't try so can't comment on quality.

Reviews.Title: “It did the job !”
Reviews.Author: sleep007
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my wife for a 3 night flying visit. Of course the cookies were great as was the bar area next to reception, and whilst the room generally had been lovingly refurbished, it didn't quite feel that the bathroom had been given the same attention. Don't remember which floor was on but only remember looking directly onto a not very attractive block. On the plus side I guess that reduced chance of noise from the main street. Didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment. Good location for all attractions, next to subway and 5/10 mins from Bloomingdales etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location-needs a few touches”
Reviews.Author: bkimel
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night; Hilton Honors upgraded us to a suite and got breakfast for two. Had a balcony. Room was large w/all ammenities except: 1. needs a coffe pot and 2. high speed access should be free-they have it in the lobby,but it is ridiculous not to have it in the rooms--Bathroom small but well equipment, bed was extremely comfy and of course, the hot chocolate chip cookie when you check in is a great touch. We usually stay at boutique hotels and so for a large chain, this was an ideal stop for us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for business. I was impressed with the friendly staff both at the desk and the bell hops. The warm cookie and the efficient check in process was wonderful. The room was nice. The bed and pillows were wonderful. The bathroom is a little small but was not a big drawback. The next day I wanted to go sightseeing and Danny took care of my luggage. He also made arrangements for myself and a couple of other people in our group to have a car waiting for us to go to the airport when we got back.

Reviews.Title: “Could have done better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To say this was a little basic is an understatement. The staff particularly on reception after 19:00hrs were about as helpful as a bout of influenza. When I asked "can you get me a cab" I was greated with a pointed arm to the door, that's customer service for you. Food average, room small and below average. Have a nice stay.....somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Great place to base your visit”
Reviews.Author: Mikesul1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a five day stay in September to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. This turned out to be a great choice for a number of reasons. Firstly the room was excellent and a good size for New York, fresh and clean with the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in. The location was ideal with a subway station at the corner for trips uptown or downtown and easy access to the tour bus which stopped one block down in front of the Waldorf. You are right in the middle of midtown and you can walk everywhere, we both found the staff to be very helpful and accommodating especially the concierge who booked restaurants for us whenever we asked and provided recommendations to some excellent places. We found most people respond to a smile. The hotel is not large and as we were on the 8th floor the views were not spectacular but by the time we got back we really did not care. Could not comment on the eating facilities in the hotel as we ate out for every meal. There are a number of small cafÃ©s on each corner which serve breakfast so we tended to use these as you can watch life go by in this busy city. If you want a good base in an area with lots of restaurants and attractions within an easy walking distance then this is ideal. I cannot comment on the eating facilities in the hotel as we ate out for every meal. There are a number of small cafÃ©s on each corner which serve breakfast so we tended to use these as you can watch life go by in this busy city. If you want a good base in an area with lots of restaurants and attractions within an easy walking distance then this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Chocnuts
Reviews.Content: At first, I was reluctant to book this hotel because of the mixed reviews here in tripadvisor. But after searching for so many hotels that had good reviews and on a budget price (that were near to our target destination but not available for our scheduled trip), I ended up with Doubletree Met. I was nervous at first because my husband is expecting that our first trip in NYC to be a very good one. But Im glad to say, that our experience with Doubletree Met is so wonderful my husband wants us to stay there again for our second visit to New York. When checking in, I was expecting for the people in the front desk to be rude but no, they were so friendly and cheerful. They gave us those oh so deliciousl chocolate cookies. The lobby is just ok, nothing grand. We were surprised how clean and big our room is. My husband and I just loooooved the bed. I would love to have that kind of bed in our home. I really had a very wonderful night sleep there. The housekeeping lady was very nice. But I have a small tiny problem with the bathroom though. I dont like the smell of the shower curtain. It smells like...hmmm dont know really how to describe it. Other than that, the rest of our stay in DT Met is a fab. I couldnt ask for more of the hotel's location. Its basically walking distance to so many attractions in NYC and there's a near subway station on the side of the hotel. We are definitely going to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best to place to stay in NYC, closed to everything and very hip trendy hotel Renovation is done (Finally!) Very trendy (60's hip-style) hotel, nice stuffs and location. If you don't much care about the Times Square area, this is the hotel to stay in NYC. Even though the Times Square is a few minutes away... I will stay this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “great, clean rooms - great location”
Reviews.Author: woolennium
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel. i reiterate what others have said - the rooms are a little on the small side, but what do you expect for new york? the rooms are new, clean, and have a very metro feel to them - even have a flat panel lcd in the rooms. my wife is really a stickler on having a clean room and this place made her feel at ease. we originally booked a room at the sheraton manhattan (the worst hotel of all time) - got into the room and it was pretty much motel 6 quality (wet carpet, mold, peeling wallpaper) - got on the computer and immediately did a search for a new hotel - found this place and jumped on it. i was a little wary, considering it was such short notice, but it turned out to be great. it's a great location, the subway stops are right out the door on 51st/lex. one stop up is bloomingdales, one stop south is grand central. within walking distance of just about everything - moma, rockefeller, even central pk isn't that far away. would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Gold member and this was my first stay in New York. I had a room on the 16th floor and it was pretty nice, flat screen TV, the only knock was the bathroom was super small. The Location is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! I almost switched reservations last minute because of what I read and I am sure glad I didn't. 5 minute walk to 5th Ave shopping, 10 minute walk to times square, 20 minute walk to Central Park. I couldn't have been more pleased with the location. The reason I didn't give it an excellant is because the conciearge gave us an absolutly awful recomendation for dinner on Saturday before the play. My wife and the other couple we were with got up and left. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good quality”
Reviews.Author: Axeman21
Reviews.Content: For our 2,5day trip we booked for a fair price (payed in advance) a nice queen size room. Checkin was ok, the guys for the storage could be more friendly and quick - but it's ok. Clean room, nice bathroom. The rooms are not big, but when we're in NYC the room is just for sleeping. Location is perfect because of the Metro Station directly in front of the Hotel, the Metro Cafe (for breakfast recommended with a Starbucks coffee from over the street) and nice restaurants along 51st. Just a few steps away from the W hotels bar, the Waldorf Astoria, Grand Central and Chrysler building . Perfect! We had a room facing the street with the fire and police station - and we heard nothing! Much better than staying on Time Square! Whenever we come back, we'll stay again in the Metropolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the best price ever!”
Reviews.Author: dmeurer
Reviews.Content: OK, let me start wirth this: It`s not the RITZ, THE MARRIOTT or any other 4 or 5 Star Hotel but pretty close to it! Stayed there for 6 nights and got the best deal ever on expedia (140 DOLLARS / Night for a double room withount Breakfast). Stayed on 5th floor. (544) This was actually one of the smallest rooms on this floor. (Could see that on the fire escape plan) The Room was big enough for NYC and very clean. The Police/Firestation was loud only one night (Sunday->Monday) The other nights were absolutely alright even with our window facing to that street.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale, nice rooms, good deal”
Reviews.Author: Tanquerochicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location in new york. It is right next to the 6 train which will take you almost anywhere in New York. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The rooms have been updated and are actually very nice. The best thing is that it is reasonable. I stayed for three nights and it was an excellent deal. I will note that it is a large hotel so if you are looking for a quiet place to stay this might not be it. There were plenty of tourists crowding the lobby ,and the outside noise was a bit much at times. So I suggest staying as high up as possible. The staff is helpful but not really in the know. Get your suggestions for trendy places in advance or from locals. The overall experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fantastic location = 9.5 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and it was fantastic. Warm cookie was a happy surprise, and super-comfy beds compensated for the smallish rooms. 2 adults and 2 teenagers for 3 nights was a little cramped, but we didn't spend much time awake in the room anyway. We got a killer deal on their website--approx $150/night, practically unheard of for this area and this level of accommodations. Awesome location just a few feet away from the subway station which enabled us to travel all over Manhattan quickly and easily! Only a few minutes walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza! The Metro Cafe located right outside the revolving door was a dieter's heaven. Delicious gourmet healthy food available all day and night long (not sure of the hours but they were open at midnight when we got back to the hotel from a long day of sightseeing). They had something for everyone! I would definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. Great value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why someone would not think the Doubletree Metropolitan is centrally located! You are right on Lexington Avenue, with a subway literally underfoot. Of course, it's not Fifth Avenue and it's not Times Square, but it's a nice -- very nice -- and pricey neighborhood! Away from the tourist madness. The room was spotless, great modern furnishings and wonderful bed. Not too small by NYC standards. The service was efficient and people friendly. Breakfast buffet left a little to be desired...no pancakes or waffles, only french toast. If you don't like eggs or meat there's only pastries and cereal. The only negative thing I would have to say is that some of the sleek, modern furniture in the lobby needs a good cleaning. Orange swivel chairs...I'm looking at you! This is a really nice hotel at a great price. Our room rate was around $200, which, when you consider it's about the same as the Red Roof, is a bargain for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “2 Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: AmyGT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a 2 night getaway. We booked through Priceline for $130 per night. We did drive into the city from Virginia and parked the car for $30 per day. We had a good check in experience with nice friendly staff. We got into the city much earlier then our 3:00pm check in and since they had a room available they checked us in early (10:00 am) so that was fantastic! The room was very nice. The bed comfortable and the bathroom very spacious. Many people complain about the location. I think it is a very good location. It is centrally located if you are interested in doing more than just the Times Square thing. It's perfect for going Uptown or to Central Park and just a bus or train ride away from whatever you want to see or do. You are in New York so be prepared to walk. If you want to see the city, Midtown Manhattan is a perfect spot in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average-But not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: champdds
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here July 13-17,2005. We checked in early at 2:00pm, with no wait at all (When we left Sunday, early check-ins were coming in at 1pm, but there was a long,moving, line). One problem I did encounter at check-in was we had reserved a 2 bed room, plus rollaway. I had received an email from Hilton Reservattions stating the rollaway was at no charge, and even presented it to the clerk. He stated they made a mistake and the charge was $25/night. I was tired from the long flight and did not feel like arguing, but I will be sending a complaint letter to Hilton Cutomer Service. The room was average size ( I actually expected smaller by the reports I had read), and the bathroom is cramped, but workable. The beds are VERY comfortable, probably the best I have slept on away from home. Our remote control was missing, and they sent one up immediately, with a coupon for more cookies for our trouble (Those cookies are GREAT !). The rollaway took 2 calls to finally get it delievered, and it was beat-up, but fine. The ice machine was broken the first day we were there, but fixed later, but I found it interesting that it is tucked away in the storage/housekeeping area, and I probably could have moved one of the rollaways stored in this area to my room and save the 25 bucks ! Our room was 1407, and had a very obstructed view of the hotel next door, but we did not need a view, and it likely kept the noise down. I agree with the earlier post, the gap at the bottom of the door is ridiculously large, allowing too much light and hallway noise in. Placing a towel in it at night resolved this issue. We did not eat in the hotel, as it was never busy, and I would like to see more people eating there to feel that it is worth it. The Cafe Metro next door, and other close cafes were more that adequate for a good breakfast. Location is the only problem we had, we will likely pick a more centrally located hotel next time.The Lexington line subway is right outside the door, and this was great going to Battery Park/Statue of Liberty, but not so for Times Square/etc. My wife and I did discover that going east, instead of heading to central Manhattan, that there is a plethra of great bars to visit. I would highly recommend JD's, an Irish Pub, I think near 53 (52nd?), between Lexington and 3rd Ave. A great Irish bartender gave us great insight to the city, and the atmosphere was great. Overall, I little pricey for what we got, but clean and staff was average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay if you don't mind the walk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 3 year anniversary. We booked it late (about 4-6 days before we drove to NY from Baltimore) and were able to get a room. I would have preferred to stay closer to Time Square... but during peak season rates, and accounting for last minute availability.. these were two factors that were not on my side. With that being said, I have relatively nothing to complain about in regards to this hotel. It was VERY clean, modern looking furniture was cool, flat screen tv in the room was nice, freindly staff, descent location (right in the shopping district). It was a bit of a walk to Time Square though. I'm not much of a walker, so by the time we strolled up to Time Square after all days walking around the shopping district...
