I was definitely taking a cab ride back. Best $15 I spent all weekend. :-) To be honest, if you don't mind walking a little bit... this hotel is definitely the choice for you! By FAR it was the biggest, most spacious room I've stayed at in NY. The bathrooms were clean too. That's always a plus! There's a cool modern bar down in the lobby, we didn't stop in but it wasn't very noisy and seamed pretty low key. If your out for a bite to eat, I'd recommend Georgio O'Neils Steak House only a block away. The guest services at the hotel pointed us in their direction for a reasonable and romantic place to eat. And they were right on point. But hey.... if all else wasn't said... they had me at "hello, here's a free hot cookie compliments of the DoubleTree hotel". ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: Sunnychick
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 28-July 3rd. The Doubletree is in a great location, most attractions are close, and there is a subway station across the street. We asked for a nice room and were given the highest floor (19th). The room was small, so was the bathroom, but except for the used bar of soap (taken care of immediately) it was always clean and the beds were very comfy. Noise was not a problem except for Sat night when someone was yelling in the hallway. I guess we were too high up for the street noise. We ate at the next door Cafe Metro almost every day for breakfast or a late snack. I think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worh value”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia D
Reviews.Content: We stay at the hotel for 3 nights in June 18. We arrive early for check in after a long trip and we have no problems. We obtain a room in 4th floor just in front of the police station, we talked to the reception and were change of room. Our next room has some problem with the ac. A supervisor came inmediately and as they saw it will take some time they upgrade us the room. This new room was very good, a wonderful bed, plasma tv, good bathroom and spacious. The location of the hotel is excellent. I think what we pay for this hotel was ok. And if I could have reserve it with more time in advance would have obtain a better price. Now I see it is much less in price. Maybe $170.00 is its price, but we paid $250.00 I recommed this hotel

Reviews.Title: “If Ikea furnished a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MrSnarkyPants
Reviews.Content: ...it would be the Metropolitan. Kinda cool at first but by the end of the week it left me cold. Which sums up my experience at this hotel nicely: It's nice, but there are some things that annoy me, too. The bed is very comfortable. Rooms are on the small side unless you get bumped to an executive level. Great location. Indifferent bell staff, great front desk people. The restaurant is decent but pricey and there are lots of dining choices in the surrounding neighborhood, too. Overall, I've been pleased enough to stay there twice and return again tomorrow, so I can't knock them too hard, but if they'd just kick the service up a notch this would be an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nicollej30
Reviews.Content: I thought the Doubletree Metropolitan was an absolute delight for the price!!! Our room was small, but very clean and very nicely decorated. Goosedown comforter, wonderful pillows, fresh warm cookies upon arrival -- and the location is AMAZING!!! I will stay there again and again and again and again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Family-C-L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Hotel on 50th and Lex during a short business trip. The hotel used to be called Metropole Hotel and was taken over by Hilton/Doubletree recently. Almost all of the rooms have been renovated in a minimalist, designy style, and have nice beds with fluffy pillows. The television is a flat screen, which goes well with the decor of the room. The bathrooms are stocked with Neutrogena products, and you can get Internet connection in your room for $10 a day (wireless is available in the lobby for free). We stayed in the executive room, which has a bit more space than the regular rooms--- I took a tour of the smaller room and I think the price difference is justified. I would take the executive room and pay a bit more. The service is fine: the front desk receptionist Karen is one of the friendliest and nicest hoteliers I've ever met. Each guest is greeted with a warm chocolate chip cookie, which is funny considering we are in tough, very un-chocolate chip cookie NYC. One thing that irritated me was when I checked my luggage in with the concierge for storage (I had a late afternoon flight), he told me: "Oh I won't be here when you come back to pick up your suitcase." Kind of too obvious in his effort to get a tip. You can have breakfast in the hotel or at Starbucks down the block and an equally good cafe nextdoor. The W hotel is right next door as well, and you can go for a drink at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very courteous staff. Pleasantly surprised at the price, especially for New York. In a wonderful location, close to everything, but away from the noise. Would absolutely stay here again, and have recommended the Hotel to our company's Travel Agency.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAlli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Metro over the weekend of June 17-19. I generally agree with many of the comments made by other posters including the great location, generally good value and comfy beds. I did not have the AC problems others had, but apparently the AC had been turned on by mid-June. I did not hear the fire engines, but maybe it was just a slow weekend for the fire dept. My negatives: I was not greeted at all at the front desk. The man who checked me in pointed to my room number and told me where the elevators were and said nothing else to me! He could have used some guest service training. I also agree with others about the outrageous price of the continental breakfast. I am a Hilton Honors Gold member, and was disappointed that the supposed lounge was closed on weekends. Although I was given one free breakfast coupon per day for the Metro downstairs, my friend staying with me would have had to pay full price (we did not eat breakfast at the hotel anyway). Finally, I agree with others commenting on the lack of noise buffering between the room doors and the hallway. My conclusion--great location and adequate facility that is worth it if one can find a special rate/bargain rate. Nothing overly special about the place though.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It! DoubleTree Metropolitan (51st&Lexington)”
Reviews.Author: gabriel06
Reviews.Content: June 10-11th: Took a shot with this one and was great! The room was recently remodeled, nice linens--even a down comforter, soft towels. Flat screen TV too. Perfectly clean bathroom. Fresh warm cookies upon arrival. Was a bit small, but it is NY--was perfect for two people. Had a personal safe in the room--bonus! The bellman even held my luggage until 7pm after checkout when I had to catch the train home. we were plesantly surprised to stumble upon the subway stop right on the corner...couldn't have been more convenient! I was reluctant to pay the price, but was worth it for a clean room, good service, safe neighborhood and convenience--would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: DixieSheri
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree Metropolitan. We were able to check in when we arrived around 1pm. The room was very clean, it was a little small--but I have seen smaller in NYC. I thought the bed was extremely comfy. Air worked great--thank goodness because it a humid 90 degrees outside. Bathrooms were small but clean and nice--everything in room looked new. Very modern decor. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Only one problem--when we entered our room, I was a little shocked to find a repairman in the bathroom and later that afternoon a maid just walked in the room while we were watching TV--she was very apologetic, but after that we put the "Do Not Disturb" sign out and latched the door!! Keep in mind that prices in the Bar and Room Service are a little steep, but after all, it is NYC. We liked the location-the subway entrance is just steps from the hotel and never a problem getting a cab here--we would definitely stay here again--try booking on Octupustravel--I save about 100 bucks on the going rate.

Reviews.Title: “NO A/C IN THE ROOM”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pay that extra money for other hotels but not for this one. No A/C during my stay in May 2005. I complain twice to the front desk manager said since the weather temp. was 68-72 degrees there is no need for A/C. The individual room controls didn't work. Never again. this is a 2 star hotel. The rugs in the hotel were very dirty. I wanted to book into other hotel however everything was already booked.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with some staff problems”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel opened after renovation in 2004, I was still able to get a pre-opening rate (186 USD) for a king executive room for May 2005 on Doubletree's website including lounge access - at least so it said on my reservation confirmation. Upon arrival, I was asked by an rather arrogant front desk staff member if would like the twin bed room I reserved (?). Furthermore, she denied lounge access stating, that the lounge is for Hilton HHonors status members only. She got the manager for me, who said the same thing. Showing him my confirmation print-out which clearly stated "lounge access", he oh so generously gave me continental breakfast coupons for the Met Grill, but only for five out of seven days, stating that the lounge is closed on weekends (in fact, for those weekend days guests with lounge access get breakfast coupons, too), repeatedly saying "I don't have to do this". THANK YOU VERY MUCH! After that unpleasent incident, a bellman showed me my king room on 14th floor (I wonder if that really was an executive room as the exec floors are according to my confirmation floors 16-19, but front desk said so at check-in) facing 51st Street with its police and fire station which was NYC standard size and well appointed with flat screen TV (although NY1 and Weather channels missing) and the best bed I ever slept in at an U. S. hotel, Doubletree's new Sweet Dreams bed, with lots of cushions and downs. Bathroom featured Neutrogena toiletries and lots of hot water. Room attendants did a great job: room was very, very clean, they replaced the many towels every day. Bed linens were changed on a daily basis, too. Don't believe that the new windows are sound proof (as mentioned on some websites) - they are merely sound-resistant, but nevertheless keep enough noise out to have a good night's sleep. The biggest noise problem (as many reviewers mentioned before) comes from the inside: the very thin doors with a huge gap between door and frame which let a lot of sound and light through and which you can't close without a major "bang". IMHO, it should not be a problem giving those doors some rubber isolation. The in-room safe deposit box was a nice touch. Two features I at first wondered what all the fuzz was about were very good: the really delicious warm signature cookie you get upon arrival and the arched shower bar, which prevents the shower curtain from sticking to your wet body. I was not so impressed with the hairdryer, whichs cord was only about 6 inches long (prepare for unusual hairdos using the hairdryer head-down). Breakfast buffet in the bunker-like Met Grill with its stained chairs was a laugh riot considering - not holding coupons - you have to pay 20 USD for continental and 26 USD for an pathetic American breakfast. Luckily, there are enough diners and other hotels you can have breakfast at in the proximity of the hotel. Unlike guests rooms around me, mine never got a morning newspaper, although I am Hilton HHonors member (apparently they think foreigners can't read English, anyway). Check-out was a breeze, but only because I had some phone fees for 1-800 calls removed from my account beforehand (front desk said, they were still having problems with the phone system - Hello? The hotel is open more than half a year and is surely not the first to run this system!) Location of the hotel is great: several subway lines and downtown buslines right outside the door, crosstown und uptown bus lines only one or two blocks away. To sum this stay up: if you get a good rate, absolutely stay there! If only they improved the doors and management/front desk attitude, the hotel would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “All was right”
Reviews.Author: LaniLaniLa
Reviews.Content: Read some recent reviews and decided to stay at this doubletree got a decent rate through orbitz. The room was quite roomy by any standards (not just new york). Nicely furnished with a flatscreen TV. Room service prompt and staff was friendly and helpful without being overbearing. I asked for a room away from the fire station and on an upper floor- they upgraded me to a King although I only booked a queen. Excellent location! I will definitely try to stay here next time I go to New York! The only slight complaint I would have is I couldn't access internet from my room without my own laptop but if you have your own or don't mind going to the business center, everything else was near perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in the Heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: mvruiz
Reviews.Content: Modern and very clean rooms just steps from the subway and few blocks from the Rockefeller Center. The staff was very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Lackluster Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: Step out the front door of the hotel and you almost fall down the stairway into the 51St Station of the #6 train as well as the E and V trains (53rd St). The rooms are clean and modern but far from impressive. As another reviewer pointed out, they don't even have a coffee maker and, for high speed internet, you pay nearly $11 per day. The only "perk" is the chocolate chip cookie you get at check-in but that's a Doubletree trademark and not unique to this location. The staff is pleasant enough but there is nothing special about this hotel. If you can get it very cheap and you're staying for a night or two, you will be more than satisfied. Otherwise I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: flygirl529
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 2 nights at the DM, April 21-22, and we loved the location. We flew in to see "Wicked" (which was amazing!) and the hotel is about a half mile from the Gershwin Theater. Hotel staff suggested we walked to the theater because traffic would be terrible that time of day and we would probably get there quicker on foot. They were right!! I had on 3 inch heels and even though we walked slowly it only took us about 15 minutes to get there. Passed Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and Radio City Music Hall along the way. The rooms are newly renovated. They are very modern looking and small. You have plenty of room to walk around, but there is no extra space or mini-fridge. The bathroom was the smallest one I have ever seen!! We booked thru hilton.com and paid $239 for a king bed. I am Hilton Gold and had expected to be able to use the Executive Lounge for breakfast, but it is closed due to renovations, so they gave us coupons for continental breakfast. The normal charge is $20 for continental and for $6 more you can have the hot food at the buffet. Very overpriced for what it is - but that's New York. There are a lot of restaurants within walking distance, so explore the city a little bit and avoid the hotel food. Loved the flat screen tv and the safe. We had plenty of towels, great bed, and because it was cool we didn't need the a/c. I woud agree with the other reviewers, you can not adjust the temperature. You get what they offer, so if it's too hot, or to cold you will have to get over it. Because of the great location we took the subway everywhere. We took it in from LGA, to Battery Park (Statue of Liberty), Ground Zero and the Empire State Building. Jamba Juice is half a block away, Grand Central Station and the Chrysler building are only blocks away. We enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree and we have already decided the next time we go to New York we will stay there. I usually stay at the Hilton New York when I am in the city, but I will try the Doubletree for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelthru
Reviews.Content: Found a rate of $249 on Expedia for superior/king suite. The beds are very comfortable--Doubletree is giving Westin a run for their money here. There was a flat screen TV and a fainting/lounge chair in the room, both of which my husband thought were terribly cool. I had read the trip advisor comments about the doors slamming and really didn't seem to notice. I did see, however, that there is about a 3/4-inch clearance between the bottom of the door and the floor, because a lot of light was getting in to the room at night--a towel shut the light out, and maybe some of the noise. I am a light sleeper, and the doors didn't keep me awake. The room was clean with plenty of towels and the staff was very, very friendly and helpful. I really liked the fact that there aren't too many children or college kids that stay here. There was very little noise in the hallway. It seems to be an older/business crowd, possibly because of the price point. The location is perfect--not too close to the hustle but not too far away either. There is a subway stop--the 6 line--right around the corner. Metro Cafe next door has wonderful Panini sandwiches and a salad bar. We didn't eat at the hotel because it looked too expensive and we hardly saw anyone else eating there anyway. The bar was nice but I'm still trying to understand why I paid $16 plus a service charge for one drink (a well Bloody Mary). Now, for the ugly: This place is right across the street from a fire station!!! I don't remember reading about this before on trip advisor. We were really worried when we checked in on Sunday afternoon as the trucks left about 10 times with blaring sirens. I think maybe they do more checks on Sundays or something, because we didn't really hear any more sirens throughout our stay (left on Wednesday). And we don't remember hearing any sirens after about 7 p.m. Another thing--I had read on Trip Advisor that the air conditioning doesn't work well--SO CORRECT! This hotel, as many other older hotels, is on a boiler system--so it's either hot or cold air. The front desk informed me they hadn't switched the AC on for the summer yet. So all you can control is air flow--which there really wasn't any. I had called the front desk before our stay to make sure they have individual climate controls in the room--which they do, but you can't adjust the temperature at all. Thank God we stayed here in the Spring and it wasn't too unbearable--just slept on top of the sheets. I guess we would have the same situation in any other older hotel in the city. Lastly, there are no coffee makers available for the rooms. I have stayed at probably 10 different Doubletrees all over the country and they always have coffee makers. Seems they might need the money to help pay for the renovations they just completed or something. There's a Starbucks across the street, at the NW intersection of 51st and Lexington inside an office building.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited New York for the first time, a week's visit combining a 21st and an 18th birthday trip for my two eldest boys. All of the refurbishing has been completed in both the lobby and the rooms. Could not imagine a better deal at the price of about $200 per room. Comfiest beds we have ever slept in, and among the quietest rooms - the only noise was that of the aircon units outside the hotel (we had a back room), which lulled one to sleep. Could be noisier in Lexington / Police station facing rooms. (You would expect that anyway in NY! Madrid is much noisier.) Concierge an absolute buzz at giving information. Every query dealt with immediately. Bar a bit pricey but a good meeting place before going out on the town. The location is excellent - right next to Grand Central, almost underneath the Chrysler building, and next door to the tube. Food so cheap in the location - from the Grand Central food mall to the Waldorf's restaurant. Find of the week had to be the Indian Restaurant, two blocks around the corner DARBAR. Most courteous service I've ever had, and some of the finest food at a superb price. Go on your first night and you'll have to return. Excellent place to get your bearings. When we go back, we'll re-book this hotel. Had a look at some of the other contenders which we considered prior to the visit. Nothing matched it considering location, appearance and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain! Great room!”
Reviews.Author: ncsf
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a GREAT bargain!!($150 + taxes on priceline). Got upgraded to a King bedroom at no extra charge. Warm chewy chocolate chip cookies upon check-in. Staff was courteous. Room was clean and updated. Bathroom fixtures were stylish. There was a conveniently located 2nd phone in the bathroom so you didn't miss calls. Bed was comfortable. The best part was location. The subway to the 6 line was just right outside the front door. The alarm clock in our room was busted, as the snooze button didn't work, but I guess that's a good thing if you really need to get up. I would definitely come here again. In-room safe was a great, much used amenity! :)

Reviews.Title: “Average NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband,11 month old daughter and I stayed for 3 nights in March. We pulled up to the entrance to unload and were greeted with a smiling face. The bellhop/doorman was very friendly and helpful. He brought our bags into the hotel but did not bring them to the room. Instead he handed them off to a very strange unfriendly porter. He did not say one word to me and the ride to yhe 5th floor was very uncomfortable. I did not even want to tip him but I did. I would have rather given the extra $20 to the bellhop/doorman. The room was nicely decorated. It was modern,but not cold ,ultra-modern. The flat panel tv was great and we were able to hook up our portable dvd player to it. The bed was very comfortable. They even brought in a full size crib for my daughter. There was absolutely no climate control in the room. So therefore it got very stuffy in there,not to mention you need some kind of fan or white noise to drown out the city noise at night. The first night was rough. We wondered, why all the sirens? We looked out of our window and to our dismay, there was a fire department across the street. The door to the hallway was not very sound proof. I heard detailed conversation from inside of my room. It made me wonder If everyone outside could hear what was going on in my room. Room service was was very friendly but not worth the money. Go out of the hotel and go directly to your right for some really good food at the Cafe Metro. They have just about anything you would want to eat at great prices. I would definetly recommend this hotel to any families traveling with infants and to business travelers. My husband was there for business also. He had no problems getting online and getting a cab in front of the hotel. We did not use the concierge or go to the bar, so I cannot comment.This hotel is great for a short stay if you get a good price. We paid pretax, $299/nt online. My husband's business associate paid $239/nt for the same nights. He called the hotel direct and made his reservations. Shop around.

Reviews.Title: “claen, pleasant,well located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: went here on honeymoon in march 2004. no bottles of wine or flowers in the room. wasnt as plush as it looked on the web. restaurant and bar were closed for refurbishment. however the rooms were fine with a large comfortable bed. no views to write home about. well located for the subway and walking distance to most of the famous attractiionss, as you leave turn right for bloomingdales. a fab coffee house next door, try the irish cream coffee......to die for. the hotel did it's job but not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: LYFB
Reviews.Content: Just stayed three nights at the Doubletree Metropolitan. Our room had a King bed and faced Lexington Avenue, on the 8th floor. The room was very clean and simple but stylish design. I thought the flat screen TV in the room was pretty nice for that price of hotel. I really have no complaints about the hotel itself. We could hear so many horns honking, but I'm sure that just comes with the city. After awhile, I was able to tune it out and fell sleep nicely. The high-speed internet access was about $11 per 24 hours. There is a nice Cafe Metro right next door which has an assortment of things for breakfast and lunch, with late hours too. I would definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel couldnt of asked for more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from march 4th 2005 till 7th march. For my 21st my partner took me to New York shopping he gave me the choice of hotels and i picked the doubletree met!!!!!!!!! Dreading what it would be like we pulled up and for once i had made the best decision! Staff were friendly check in was quick and the room was fabulous. Quiet, modern and spacious situated centrally to all great locations! I had read so many bad reviews on this hotel and was dreading our arrival imagining the worst, but i would like to clarify that this is a great hotel you cant go wrong with.... well worth it! If you pick this hotel your stay in the big apple will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Let's see what happens when the renovations are done”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Doubletree in February 2005. The room was clean and the bed very comforatable, but they squeezed a king bed into a room too narrow for it, and the desk chair filled the space between the desk and the bed so you have to climb around it to get to the window. A lot of the hotel was under renovation: the "business center" was closed, and a couple of other common rooms on the first floor were blocked off. I was not able to get internet access in my room, and when I called the internet provider at the hotel was told to go to the business center to make sure the problem was not with my computer. When I called back to tell them there was no business center, they insisted there was one. In any case, it turns out the internet was down for two days hotel-wide. The hotel failed to inform people of this, which was the only service failure I experienced. I am sure a lot of guests wasted a lot of time on the phone with the internet provider who wouldn't have if they'd been told that the problem was hotel-wide. It was clear that they were still working out some issues in the rebranding from the old Loew's brand to the Doubletree, so I'll try again. It's very convenient to the Park Avenue business and has great potential

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but the room doors need to be quieter”
Reviews.Author: sd_trainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Metropolitan February 18-20, 2005. I had a room on the 14th floor and did not face the street. Yes, the hotel's location is excellent with its proximity to several subway lines. The hotel's hip decor is nice-- the lobby and bar, remodeled room and bathroom, and the LCD television. But my room didn't have a coffee maker, so I had to get dressed every morning and run downstairs for a cup. Fortunately, a Starbucks is a block away on the corner of 50th & Lexington. My biggest complaint was that while I was in my room, I heard each door of the nearby surrounding rooms close very loudly as other guests came and went. I felt like I was sleeping in a college dorm room. Despite this, I didn't hear any noise through the walls from adjoining rooms. I hope the management decides to fix the door-closing problem.

Reviews.Title: “The Metropolitan is a good value”
Reviews.Author: Doctor01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel Feb 25 through 27 and had a very nice stay. The location is excellent (within walking distance of Rockerfeller Center and 5th avenue shopping). The room was clean, of adequate size (for NYC) and had an extremely comfortable king-sized bed. I paid 125 dollars a night before taxes and would rate this an excellent bargain

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Clurburuk
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stopped at the Metropolitan 10-15th Feb 2005. On arrival we were greeted by courteous staff and a delicious cookie! Our room was on the 12th floor and was at the back of the hotel (We could see the Chrysler Building from our room). The room was clean and spacious with a courtesy safe, ironing board & iron, LCD T.V, gamecube games (installed in t.v) and sony alarm clock. The bathroom was a bit on the small side but everything you needed was there (hair dryer, spare towels, Neutrogena toiletries, decent shower). Didn't notice any noise from other rooms only the slight hum of a busy city outside, what I would expect from staying in a busy city on a main road. There was no sight of construction, certainly not on our floor or near the lobby. For the price we paid we couldn't ask for a better hotel in Manhattan, close to Bloomingdales, Central Park, Grand Central Station and the Rockafellar Centre all easily within a 15 minute walk. Will definilty go back there on our next trip

Reviews.Title: “surprised since all reviews are so bad”
Reviews.Author: JO911
Reviews.Content: Not sure where all the complaints come from. We stayed there 4 nights, Feb 10-14 one of our 4 our neighbors could be heard, but that's not the hotels fault, I do believe walls are a little thin though. Check in/out was a breeze, everyone was polite, bar does close at midnight which is alittle disappointing, forced us to go elsewhere at night. This is NYC, all rooms are relatively small and the remodel I think went as well as to be expected when you can't tear down & start again.

Reviews.Title: “A good sound place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: DHutch457
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan on Feb. 11th & 12th, 2005. Most of my feelings about the hotel are positive. The Metropolitan recently went through a $30M renovation, but quite frankly I couldn't see where that much money had been spent. The lobby while attractive, is rather plain and simple as were the other community rooms. The guest rooms were comfortable but not lavish. I think the wall paper in the rooms could have been redone as I noticed a tear in the paper in my bathroom. The staff, in my opinion was quite courteous and professional. On my way out in the evening, I stopped at the front desk to let the clerk know that the toilet in my bathroom was constantly running. While it wasn't annoying, I was mostly concerned about water conservation. The clerk said he would call someone right away to let them know. I had to return to my room about 20 minutes later to pick up something I had forgotten and the toilet was fixed! I guess the mixed feelings I have are because I stayed in this hotel back when it was the Lowes Summit and I suppose it's like comparing apples and oranges. The Summit was much more opulant with more ammenities like bed turndown and Godiva chocolates on your pillow and they had a very nice hotel restaurant. As the Doubletree Metropolitan, it's much more simple with fewer ammenities and there was no bed turndown and no chocolates. If you're looking for a good clean, safe and sound place to stay that is in an el primo location, then the Metropolitan is the place for you. If you're looking for something with more elegance and ambience, then you may want to consider staying some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and no complaints”
Reviews.Author: galwaylass
Reviews.Content: Checked out loads of NY hotels on the net, also on tripadvisor. This hotel was best price booking on net. Hotel was lovely, big bed, clean room, no noise from other rooms, excellent service from reception. Definitely i will return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Impressed from the moment we stepped out of the taxi....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've been to NYC many times, and we both agree the Doubletree Metropolitan was a very pleasant surprise! We stayed there from February 5th to the 8th. Our room was on the ninth floor, and was surprisingly quiet, even without double-glazed windows (which we were told are being installed). It makes us wonder how other reviewers could have had such apparently bad experiences........it appears that hotel managment has taken steps to address concerns, and has done a fine job correcting things. We got a super rate on the Doubletree website, and we got excellent value for the price. Our room was newly refurbished with very attractive furnishings, a very nicely fitted bathroom (with a great shower-head), and above all - it was a decent-sized room for a NYC hotel! We found all of the staff to be attentive, pleasant, and helpful - we were greeted at the front door by the duty manager, and looked after all the way from there. Like most (all) hotels, the prices for meals and drinks in the bar were on the high side, but if you can manage to walk the length of yourself, you can find wonderful options closeby (including a very nice deli right beside the hotel). The location of the hotel is super - close to everything you want to see, and right on a subway line and bus routes. This is truly a wonderful find from our perspective, and we've been in many hotels all over the world. Next time we visit New York City, it's the Doubletree Metropolitan for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Naomi-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 27 -31 Jan and loved it! Fab location, gorgeous room, great bar and friendly staff. Delicious cookie on arrival too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropolitan Jan. 26-30, 2005. Lobby was NOT under construction and was lovely. Our room was beautiful with new linens and bathroom. Absolutely the best location and we were thrilled to be next to the police and fire station. We met very friendly policemen who recommended excellent restaurants and bars nearby. We loved the Metropolitan and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “rather sleep in a doorway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: arr on 26 jan."grand opening" to welcome it into the hilton family(give it up for adoption). all the staff were running around trying to get things just right, showed no intrest in any of the guests just the vips. the room? well you can see where they tried thier best to do the place up,try painting the doors with a brush instead of throwing the paint at them! inside carpets dirty, nothing seems right. feels like they opened the door and threw everything in, where it landed it stayed! instead of a 5 night stay got our parachutes on and baled out after 1.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong about Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: Arturas
Reviews.Content: Do not understand all negative comments on this hotel. Stayed there 2 nights in january, 2005. Check in was good and quick, check out too. Room was comfortable and I slept like a baby in their comfortable bed!Bathroom clean and quite big. Was freezing outside so it was nice to use bathtub, it is though small but big enough to get your body warm...Good location too, subway just on the corner! Though, I would not say they invested so many millions in hotel renovation...But come on guys, who spends long times in hotels when you are in NYC??? Clean, great bed, nice shower, great location,great rates..It says enough! Just try yourself and do not be scared about negative comments...But if you search for something hip or luxury there is enough choice in NYC. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, good location”
Reviews.Author: 2citybreakers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel over New Year 2005 for 6 nights. It was a nice hotel, room was clean and had a nice flat screen tv with lots of channels. Bed was comfy, and they gave you Neutrogena shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion everyday (I thought the lotion (moisturiser) was best). Nice hot, powerful shower above the bath, bath was very low and not really designed for lying back and soaking in, but nice all the same. The hotel is in a good location on Lexington Avenue, with the Chrysler building further down the Avenue. There are plenty of places to eat, which is just as well as the hotel restaurant is very pricey. Try the excellent Longwood Gourmet on Lexington, open 24 hours, it is chinese buffett style where you pay for your food by weight and can eat in or take out. We ate there most nights it was so yummy! Basic but fun. We tried to go down the stairs instead of using the lift, and we found that on the second or 3rd floor there was a lot of building work going on. Credit to the hotel is due, we were on the 6th floor, and if we hadn't have gone down the stairs we would never have known about the builders. We found the concierge guy was very helpful, although there is often a queue to see him as he is so good! He helped us book our helicopter flight and helped with the problem we were having phoning the UK. He also helped us get return transport to the airport. The check in was quick and fast, as was check out as we had no charges or anything. They give you free cookies when you check in! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms good for NY, service is poor”
Reviews.Author: blazegeorgia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Metropolitan for four nights before Christmas 2004. We expected it to be busy and it was. We were slightly early arriving at the hotel and were unable to check in, reception advised us to return at 3pm. We left our cases with the porter (bellhop?) and went for some lunch. We returned at 3 as requested and were advised our room was not ready. We were asked to take a seat, a problem when there are no seats as several other parties were waiting for their rooms. After an hour of waiting we managed to get a room, however it was on a lower floor and I had paid my travel company extra for a deluxe room that should have been on a higher floor. Check in advised all the rooms were the same, no matter what floor so I had paid extra for nothing. Finally got our room on a higher floor an our hour and a quarter after we wanted to check in! The room was excellent by New York standards - a decent size, good tv and fab bed. Even the shower was pretty good - not a power shower but not a trickle that you get in some hotels. However, after we had been in our room for 15 minutes, another couple entered our room. I was in the bathroom and my wife was laying on the bed and to say we were a little shocked and concerned is an understatement! Our room had apparently been allocated to two lots of people - not sure how this happens but it is unpleasant. My wife contacted reception and was made to feel that this was her fault which is clearly unacceptable. We went out for our evening meal and were then unable to get back in our room - all in all a frustrating first day at the Metropolitan. We were given a complimentary breakfast in the hotel but this was distinctly average and would recommend you don't eat at the hotel. The hotel bar was nicely decorated but heavily over-priced. There was also a lot of work taking place on some floors at the hotel and although we couldn't hear anything from our room, the lift often stopped on floors where work was taking place. In summary, the room was very good and the location was good being away from the hustle and bustle but a 5 minute walk to Rockerfeller and 1 minute from the subway. It was just the service that let this place down. Would I stay here again - no. The next New York trip is booked for the summer and I am off to the Trump Tower - I hope the extra cost is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best VALUES right now in nyc”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad place at all. If you are trying to have your dream vacation in nyc, this is not the place to stay as it is under construction right now. even with the renovation it is not an especially posh place. they've made an effort with t he new bar lounge downstairs, but it's still not the w. then again you can walk 1 block over to the w bar/lounge and save yourself 100 bucks a night. anyhow i like it and will stay again. it is clean and comfortable. the bathrooms are nicely redone in marble and there are plasma tvs with cable. i have no complaints about my stay. the carpet was very clean which is unlike many hotels in this price range $120-160 for the small rooms. also the rooms aren't closets. size wise they average 250-300 sq feet vs many hotels in the same price range that are going to be 180 max. this is one of the best VALUES right now in nyc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Concierge and room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Metropolitan Hotel from 3-7th January 2005. Our room was cosy, beds were huge and comfortable, clean and tidy. Did miss a bath though as the room only had a shower. Anyway the staff were polite and the concierge department were extremely helpful - providing us with maps, subway routes and pointed us to some of the best bars in NYC. We did experience some sirens at night and traffic noise but after having very tiring days walking around NYC we were just glad to get into our comfy beds and so it did not cause us any discomfort. Overall the hotel was fine and its great location made our 4 night break run very smoothly indeed. 3*. Steph, Amy and Becky!

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan - Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: RueDePassyParis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel on Jan 9-11 at a great "pre-opening" Doubletree rate. You get what you pay for! Front entrance was covered with plywood. Entire lobby was under construction and under constant chaos. After three tries, finally were given an acceptable room on a floor with clean carpet. Room was nice, but facing a police station...and we heard sirens, outrageous street noise, and lots of corridor noise all night. Beds are wonderful, but it is impossible to sleep with all the noise. Complaining did nothing but result in empty management promises. We're in NYC almost every month and will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Metropolitan/DoubleTree was the bomb!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Metropolitan on December 19 -21 and we had a wonderful time. Our room was very nice, it had a nice plasma tv, a very big comfortable bed and a new bathroom. The staff was very friendly... The hotel is at an amazing location! It's in walking distance to TimeSquare, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Broadway theatres and much more... The staff was very friendly and answered any questions that we had. The concierge was really good! When it was raining and we needed a taxi to get to Broadway they went out of their way to get a cab for us, even almost getting hit...lol Everytime I go to NYC I probably will stay at the DoubleTree/Metropolitan...I just hope I get it at the same price I got it for in December ;)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Metropolitan!”
Reviews.Author: Enii
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Metropolitan Doubletree from 23rd to 27th of December and had no problems with it at all. Our check in took a little bit longer than normal due to a small problem so the receptionist upgraded us to a kingsize bed for no charge. loved the cookie on arrival!!!! This hotel is in an excellent location. It is beside a police precinct but we heard no noise from it, however, NY seemed a little bit quieter than normal, maybe because it was Christmas time. Any staff we dealt with were friendly and courtous, the concierge booked a bus tour for us. However, as we were leaving on the Monday morning, construction could be heard from the lower 3 floors but this is sure to be finished soon. There is no construction to be seen in the public areas. All in all a great hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 2 friends and i just returned on saturday the 8th from New York, The Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, The room was large and spacious and extremely clean. Fabulous Location! Bloomies just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan Hotel's idea of "renovation" isn't quite on the mark. Firstly, I don't know that I've ever been to a hotel that advertises parking, but does not have valet. After we self parked in a lot around the corner, we had to juggle all of our personal items and luggage to around the block to the hotel. The front desk was consistently understaffed the entire weekend, but not particularly unfriendly. Upon arriving in our room, we found that they had given us a double room instead of the king we had requested. Furthermore, the room smelled of body odor. We were moved promptly and settled into our "renovated" king room. Now let me just add, wallpapering old, water damaged and unsightly walls doesn't change the fact that they are still old, water damaged and unsightly. Similarly, putting "modern looking" furniture in a small space doesn't make it appealing. In addition, the rooms have absolutely no soundproofing and the housekeeping staff apparently felt the need to vaccum starting at 9am on Sunday morning for at least an hour, I also heard every person that walked by the room. While the room did have a safe, there was no second lock on the hotel room door and I definitely would not have felt comfortable there had I not been with my fiance. Lastly, the construction entrance feel to the hotel is definitely not charming or attractive. While the hotel location is prime, there are about 10 other hotels in a 2 block radius I would stay at before ever staying at the Metropolitan Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff from Hell (with the exception of one lovely blonde)”
Reviews.Author: cmalloy
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed one night in September after I found out that my house had been seriously damaged in Florida's last hurricane. We had been at the Omni but thought that we couldn't afford its rates due to our stay being extended. We felt that we should look for a cheaper place because there was no point in getting home before roads were accessible, etc. The rooms that we were shown when we walked over to the Metropolitan were not the rooms that we got. I literally had to argue and beg to a front desk clerk who had the personality of Lurch; basically, I cried to get a better room (the same one, by the way, that we had been shown when we first decided to take a room there). We checked out the next day and decided that it didn't matter what we had to pay: we wouldn't stay there another minute. You definitely get what you pay for. Oh, the custodial and maintenance staff were beyond nice...they just didn't have much to work with. Yeah, we had to ask the maintenance man to turn on the air because it didn't come on unless one had a pair of pliers.

Reviews.Title: “On balance, good”
Reviews.Author: Canexpats
Reviews.Content: Except for getting a smoking room despite a clear request for non-smoking at time of reservation, I was quite satisfied with the stay. Renovated rooms are cool! Stayed at this hotel 6 years ago and the change is amazing. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jvrab12
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Metro DoubleTree and was very happy with our stay. First, I'll give my negatives-our bed was very small (double) and uncomfortable for myself, however I am a very picky mattress person so take my opinion as you will. The hotel was very loud at night with people coming home from the bar at 4am and slamming doors but that is nothing they can control. Also, maid service would knock on our door as early as 9:30am, so make sure you put the "do not disturb" sign out if you want to sleep in. Now, the pros-the hotel was in a great location, friendly staff, good bar, internet access (for a fee), and a nail salon right downstairs. Would stay there again if I can get the same price on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropolitan from 24th December 04 to 28th December 04. Room was perfect - Clean, Warm, really comfy bed, good shower and a plasma TV. No idea why this hotel gets so much negativity, when you're in NY a hotel is for getting your head down at night and thats it! Can't vouch for the food, room service and the restaurant was very expensive judging by the menu's, take a left out the hotel and walk for 5 mins to the deli on the corner and eat proper NY food for next to nothing. The bar was completed and up and running, looked expensive and was trying hard to be trendy, didn't use it myself. Maid service was excellent and they were friendly and pleasant enough, didn't really have much dealing with other staff. 20 mins walk from 5th Avenue and 20 mins the other way is central park. Very enjoyable Christmas break, would definitely use this hotel again (its now known as the DoubleTree Hotel as part of the hilton group to avoid confusion!) If you want a comfy place to stay and a location to see the best of NY then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed in a suite for a weekend in Oct 04 before heading to CT and liked it so much we stayed again the following weekend before flying out. The bell staff was terrific, helping load/unload bags, stopping traffic so our car could get right in front of the hotel. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms are very nice, modern ala Stark, with great linens and a super shower. There was construction going on in the lobby but that was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Walk to Rockefeller, Radio City, Cathedral. Subway (6 train) right there. Former NY resident so I can tell you this was a great stay. Doubletree bought it on the 17th. I was there 20-23rd, lucky me cause I got a great deal on it (about $10 more than my friend paid for a room that had the bathroom down the hall) I had a plasma TV in the room, brand new bathroom, big clean comfortable bed and a chocolate chip cookie on my arrival (yummy). I was very HAPPY.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel the weekend of Dec 18-December 21. Our room was clean and the staff was friendly except for one employee when we tried to check in early. The hotel is in walking distance to all sights or transportation is nearby. We truly enjoyed our stay, and we loved the chocolate chip cookie on the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Room was excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: with great size bed and very clean. bathroom and wash area was more than adequate. Staff were very helpful at all times answering any queries regarding shopping,sights etc. Know many who have stayed here and found the location and standard of hotel first class. It had been refurbished and was been upgraded as we left. Price of room was reasonablwe and will def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again”
Reviews.Author: Cruzinaround
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights and would do it again. The location is great, subway, bistros,deli and bus stops. Good "homebase" to walk to Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's etc. The rooms are clean, no frills, comfortable, smallish but adequate. There was steady limited construction going on on the premises but tolerable. We didn't "hole up" in our room all day. THe housekeeping staff did a great job and were very friendly as was the concierge (booked a tour bus & broadway show, "Wonderful Town" w/ Brooke Shields, it was great) other employees were happy to help in any capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to web Site”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Period of stay 4 - 7th November 2004. Having read the review of the hotel my wife and I were a little apprehensive. However, we were assured by the hotels web site that all refurbisment would be completed by the autumn. What a pity the hotel doesn't read its own publicity. The bar was still under construction. Our room had the new TV etc but also a plug in heater because the radiator did not work. This restricted the space a little. The windows were dirty although they could be opened to look at the traffic etc below. The warddrobe was very small and very old fashioned. When having a shower the water half filled the bath and took about 20 minutes to go down the plug. On the plus side the staff were extremeley helpful, including the bell hop. Howevevr, on the day we were checking out Reception did not know it was the day of the NYC Marathon, depite there being a team of Italian runners staying the hotel. Don't bother with the breakfast - to dear. Instead go to the NY Luncheon Diner on E49th Street. Excellent service and they refused a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jogllLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the standard of this hotel. The rooms were modern, clean and warm. There were three of us in one room and we had plenty of room. I would deffinately recomend this hotel to friends as I thought the location was great, just three blocks from 5th Ave and Bloomingdales just down the road. It had a sub way station on one corner and a deli on the other. Although I did not have many dealings with the staff on the odd occassion I did need them I found them all to be very pleasant. I don't know why this hotels has so many bad reviews some people must be really hard too please after all when your in the big apple your only in your room to SLEEP.

Reviews.Title: “Poor excuse for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel last December for 4 nights. There was no heat on 2 separate occasions, one of which was all night on a cold December night. They proceeded to finally give us a space heater which was placed on a table by the curtains, an obvious fire hazard. Using the space heater caused the breaker to blow while my daughter was in the shower, a very scary experience for her being in pitch darkness. The hotel was nice years ago when it was Loews, but as even the bellman told us they have allowed it to go downhill because they were not willing to spend the money for updating. It was a terrible experience and after complaining to 3 managers, their response was 10% off on our next stay to make up for the problems we experienced. Needless to say that discount will never be used as I would never consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “19th Nov-25th Nov 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel as it has considerably better reviews than some. The location was very handy for the subway and there was a nice deli for coffee etc in the morning just down the road, especially as the hotel only had an expensive restaurant for a sit down breakfast ! The hotel has had $35,000,000 spent on its renovation. What a shame that it didnt stretch to quilt covers, pictures, or remotely freindly staff. Do not expect your luggage to be taken to your room by the bell boy but if he wheels it 3mtrs do expect to give a tip (conversation and smiling not included) It did the job but would look elsewhere in the future, New York was fantastic !

Reviews.Title: “what a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were very disappointed in our hotel experience. the staff was rude and not willing to accomodate small requests (no heat in our room for 2 nights-we thought that it was included in the $400/night price). we experienced many examples of a poorly managed business. we were most disappointed in the extremely poor customer service. i would not reccommend this hotel to anyone i know.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews would indicate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like a few of the others, I was very apprehensive of this hotel after reading some of the reviews below, but for the money this was a nice hotel. The room was clean, and although not too big, had enough space for everything. The bed was comfortable and the shower worked great, which for me are the most important things. It's a bit noisy, but this is New York. And the location was great, walking distance to many nice restaurants and tourist spots, and right on the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Put it in Perspective”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In reality the Metropolitan, especially for someone who has be be E. Midtown is a perfect location. Yes it is under renovation, and is in a state of flux. I have been there 3 times in the last month on business, and I am a diehard Marriott client, but am pleased with the rates and ease of use of the Metropolitan. If you are expecting Hyatt Regency service, dont waste your time, but feel free to waste your dollars at another hotel. Bang for the buck a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the mostly negative reviews of this hotel, I was very apprehensive to say the least. However, it was the only pet-friendly hotel in the City in the location I wanted within my desired pricepoint. I was pleasantly surprised to say the least. The room was extremely spacious and the king bed was very comfortable. The bathroom area was nice because the shower and toilet were separated from the sink area which makes it easier for everyone to get ready. My only qualm about the room was that the thermostat did not work. Of course, I stayed there over the Thanksgiving weekend and did not require A/C but the room did have a tendency to become quite stuffy--at night especially. The service was fine and the location was fantastic. All in all, this was a pleasant stay with all the things you would normally expect from a 3-star hotel being just as they should.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Manhattan, but first time to stay at this hotel. I was able to check-in early, but that was the most positive experience I had the whole weekend. They are also a block from one of the subway stations that appears to be available 24-7 (some stops are closed on Sundays). Had requested 2 double beds at reservation, but only got 1 king (told doubles had been sold out that weekend). Room and bathroom were cramped, but appeared to have mostly new, modern appliances and furniture. Could never figure out the alarm clock. The staff at most times were rude. The concierges seem to be most concerned with selling you something related to their "contacts" (I was told to stay away from the 1/2 price tickets line which I have done each trip - better to buy full price tickets through them). Lobby bar apparently closes by 11:30pm on Saturday night. We stopped in for one drink after a show and was told they already had last call. They still agreed to serve us, but were not interested in providing us with water, or napkins to clean the mess they made in delivering the drinks. The drain in the tub was not working well, and someone had taken the stopper out. When we asked at the front desk to have it repaired, all they did was replace the stopper - nothing changed with the drainage. The morning of our check-out, housekeeping tried to walk in on us to clean. We told her we wouldn't be ready until checkout time. When we had our luggage out around 10am and passed her, she asked if we were checking out then, and why had we told her not until noon. As far as I'm concerned, housekeeping shouldn't be knocking on my door 3 hours before check-out. As long as we are out by then, it shouldn't matter. The front desk did not want to cash a check for me. At this point, we spoke to a manager - he agreed to cashing a check, as long as I had an AMEX number for them. Hopefully, when it becomes part of the Hilton family, they will have much better staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service was terrible! The front desk staff was awful!! The hotel was not very clean. I would pay a little extra and stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “In general ,ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I ve spent 8 nights in the hotel in Nov 2004. With the price paid through Hotels, I was expecting a liitlle bit better than what I saw considering the season of my visit. In any European Hotel with a price above 300$ per night you would be a KING!!!!. Nice placement downtown, quiet and clean room ,satisfactory morning buffet, above subway station. Rennovation takes place in the lower floors without annoying the others . The staff was not the frendliest ever, needs customer orientation. If what you pay is what you get ,donÂ´t expect to fool them .

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but no frills”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, convenient, and the staff was couteous. Best of all, it was a nice price for a midtown NYC hotel. The hotel is undergiong renovations, but we were not affected by this at all. The restaurant, gift shoip, elevator and all common areas, and our entire floor was completed. However, this hotel is "no frills" -- not sure why it has such a high star rating. There is a flat screen plasma tv in the room and nice duvets. But there are very few toiletries (pack well!), there in no in-room refirgerator, and there is not even a coffee maker. Service was fine, but the staff wasn't just falling over trying to help us out. Sometimes we had to call several times to get what we needed (like, a crib for the baby, which we'd requested at booking). Also had to call several times to have hot water brought up to room for sterilizing baby bottles (had planned to use coffee maker...). Staff made it very obvious that they expected to be tipped. I would've tipped them anyway (and did!), but I didn't really like that attitude. Concierge was available but all of them were incredibly young and had somewhat limited knowledge of the surrounding area. Overall, the hotel was fine for what we paid, but next time I will spend a few bucks more for a higher quality hotel in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan Hotel is a great place to stay. The location is fabulous, and the rooms are clean â€“ what else do you really need? The staff was very friendly during check in and even upgraded us to a different room free of charge. The bar and restaurant were both open and there were only a few renovations being done to the back of the hotel. The concierge was very friendly, but was not at all helpful or knowledgeable about late night dining/drinks. The conciergeâ€™s desk closes at an early 9:00pm and the attendant did not want to stay a minute over the scheduled time. I am sure the concierge would have been more helpful in the â€œworking hours.â€� Overall, the Metropolitan is a great place to stay and I highly recommend that no one pays any attention to all the negative reviews posted on this web site and checks it out for themselves. I would defiantly stay at the Metropolitan Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gizmo47
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this Hotel on the 4th Nov.2004 with wipes to clean everything after reading bad reviews. What a fantastic surprise when I opened the door LUXURY. Everything was brand new really lovely. I found the staff very helpfull, The bar was not in use but will be by the end of the week. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: 1gizmo29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mum on Nov 4th to Nov 8th. After reading these reviews we were dreading it and even tried to get hotel changed but couldn't. Now we are glad we didnt. Hotel was excellent. We got a renovated room which was spotless. It had two doublebeds , a plasma screen tv, hairdryer, ironing board and iron and a beautiful bathroom. We had nothing to worry about. The staff were all very friendly we didnt find any of them rude. The bell hops were especially good. There is also an ice machine and drinks machine on each floor which is good. Renovations still going on but look to be nearly finished and they didnt affect our trip at all. We discovered on first day our shower didnt work, after reporting it, within 5 minutes someone was up and put on a brand new shower head. I would give this hotel 5 stars and we cant understand why it got so many bad reviews so if you are planning a stay there dont be worrying like we did because it really is a beautiful, clean hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd read the reviews before my stay - quite a few bad, some good - and it was my first visit to New York, so I wasn't sure what I was letting myself in for. But my tenth floor room was clean and serviced every day, everything worked and I'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly relieved”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was worried. My wife and I were accompanying my daughter and grandaughter on a business trip to NYC. Her company had booked her into the Metropolitan for five nights and I had read the reviews posted here. When we arrived the staff was very helpful. Granted, the renovations still continue, but what is finished is very nice. The health club is still not done, nor is the bar, and only one restaurant is done, but this is New York City. You only have to walk a few steps to bars, restaurants, etc. We were in an upgraded room on the tenth floor. It was very nice. The duvet covers are white, so you know they are clean. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. Maid service was daily and all linens were replaced every day. I can't say for sure that they change the duvets every day, but twice our grandaughter got a small spot on the duvet and in each case it was replaced the next day. The television was a flat panel, very nice, with 60 or 70 channels. The bathroom was very nice with an "optimizer" shower curtain, slate floors and walls in the shower, etc. Watch the water in the sink. If you turn it on too high it tends to splash out. As for noise versus view, if noise is a major concern ask for a room on the "back side" of the hotel. If view is, ask for a room on the front. There will always be noise in NYC, and the easternmost part of the motel is across the street from a police and fire department. Keep both windows closed to minimize noise. I don't understand the comments about holes in the windows. Each window has both an inner and an outer window. The inner opens, but the outer one didn't. I would assume this is a safety concern. Room service is expensive. Make sure you check the rates before ordering. One of my daughter's coworkers didn't, and ended up with a $30 breakfast. It was interesting watching the progress on the bar while we were there, (10/23 - 10/28/2004), and it looked like it would soon be done. Feel comfortable about going to the Metropolitan. It's nice, clean, fresh and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service!”
Reviews.Author: erikabobs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worth the money you will spend per night. We spent $250+ the first night and $300+ the next night, and for a grand total of $600, we got a bathroom door that didn't shut, no refrigerator and VERY rude staff. When we asked for a room change as the bathroom would not shut, they told us that they could not change it because it was already paid for. When we requested a room change (again) the next day, they told us to go upstairs and pack as they only do room changes between 3 and 5 pm. When we got back at 8 pm, they told us we did NOT pack (when we obviously did) so they could not change our room. After a lot of rudeness, we were finally given a new room. I would not stay here again just because of the extremely bad service!!! I've stayed at hotels that aren't as nice but had better service and i've always gone back. This hotel is a different story!!!

Reviews.Title: “Honestly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_sales_grl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on business. I had requested a non-smoking room and was only given the option of a smoking room for the first night. This room was dull, dreary and......smelt of smoke. Upon being given a non-smoking room, there was a noticable difference in room scent and size (this one being larger) but all in all I would not stay there again. Location wise, you are near to most things but you will find better hotels elsewhere. Service was below average.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK”
Reviews.Author: trebla99
Reviews.Content: If you like the smell of a sweaty, stinky gym locker room then stay here. I had what they call a "renovated room" and it was horrible. The room smelled like a sweaty dirty gym locker room. My non-smoking room reeked of cigarettes. They advertise "goose down comforters" on their website when in reality it is more like a piece of cardboard with two sheets around it. My sheets had hair on them and hair on my towels too. The lock didn't work on my door so I had to pry a chair up against it so no one could get in. The window had a whole in it and a freezing breeze was coming in. The hotel would not give us heat since the said they legally don't have to until November. I think they are wrong about that. I finally had to shove a towel in the whole so I wouldn't freeze. The wall paper was just thrown over top of crooked, bumpy un-sanded walls and looked terrible. They painted the door ways so poorly they were chipping and showing the old pink color through. My window had a bumper stick on it. Priceline sells this hotel cheap a lot so unfortunately the clientele there were rather low class. They were partying and drinking in the hallways all hours of the night and the hotel did nothing about it. Between them waking me up, the fire sirens going off all night, then the loud remodeling starting at 7 in the morning I got no sleep or rest for my meeting I had at all. Do not be fooled by the pictures on their website!!

Reviews.Title: “It's Manhattan! not the Riviera.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a place in Manhattan, and not throw away $500 a night...this is well-located, extremely mid-town, and yes they're renovating.. but that's a good thing. After all, it is only a place to sleep, not to throw a Debutante gala!

Reviews.Title: “I Wouldn't stay there for free!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan with my partner in March for 5 nights. We were extremely disapointed and disgusted. The rooms were dirty, especially the bathrooms, where there were hairs in the bath (and It didnt look like the kind you find on peoples head!) The bath was clogged up so when you had a shower you were knee deep in dirty cloudy water and there was mildew all over the tiles. The whole time there were plumbing problems where the toilet only flushed when it felt like it, and one morning it flooded the entire hotel room. The manager reluctantly agreed to give us another room and we wasted hours packing our stuff and moving mid stay. Our new room was smaller, dark, smelled stale and had a brick wall for a view. The manager was unsympathetic, implying the flooding problems were down to us and in the new room we amazingly continued having similar plumbing problems, with strange noises coming from the toilet?!? The temperature of the room was either boiling or freezing and like the toilet problems we had to call the engineer up many many times. On the whole, it spoiled our stay and disrupted our enjoyment of an excellent city. We will never stay at the metropolitan hotel again. Its an absolute disgrace, and should be closed down until these serious issues are sorted out and they can provide the quality they display and promise on their website. I would expect this from a 1 star B&B in Skegness, but a 3/4 star hotel in one of the greatest cities in the world.....Its a joke.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump! Just one word: hair”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd had the time to read reviews of this hotel, but I was stuck between a rock and a hard place. I work in mid-town Manhattan and couldn't get home the night a fire shut down train service in and out of Penn Station. For the price I paid ($149) I could at least have gotten a room that was clean; hair in the bathroom, hair in the sheets, ugh ugh ugh. Since it was already late and I was exhausted from having to deal with commute problems, I tidied up the room myself. When I checked in I was a little nervous because I saw the front desk clerks had fans to cool down; so I was glad when the air conditioning worked, although only too well! It was freezing and there was no way to turn off the air! I ended up putting pillows on the vent to inhibit air flow. Needless to say, this was not a renovated room! When I checked out, I asked the clerk, "Aren't you going to ask how my stay was?" I thought he was going to burst into tears; I am sure he is demoralized by all the complaints. I am grateful I had a roof over my head that night since I could have been sitting in the train station all those hours, but I'm not sure which was worse.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan for a week in January, 2004. They were undergoing renovations at the time, but you wouldn't have known that from their website when I booked the reservation. The only 2 amenities that were advertised & which were the biggest draw for me were the gym & the restaurant/bar. What major disappointments! The restaurant was closed for the renovation (again no warning!)The gym ceiling was leaking & the carpets were soaked & mildewy. The stench was unbearable. The windows were open (in 0 degree weather) in an (unsuccessful) attempt to reduce the stench. It was a health hazard.The carpets in the hotel & room were also filthy & smelly. The gen. manager did not return any of my 8 calls to complain. He and the rest of the staff were unaccomodating & unfriendly. Worst New York hotel experience! I will never stay there again. Stay away at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews, I was surprised that my stay was so pleasant. Nothing fancy, but the room was clean, quiet and comfortable, and the staff was courteous. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from Sept. 3-4, 2004. The hotel public areas are completely torn up. The ceiling is completely open, with wiring visible. Holes in other public places are covered by black curtains. There is no lobby. The only place to eat is a small corner of a conference room where they serve a continental breakfast. Rooms are okay, but lack a hair dryer and coffee pot. Staff is completely indifferent to guest complaints about the renovation, suggesting that people complain to the online services where they made their reservations. Management put a copy of a Jan 2004 letter in the elevators that tells guests that public area renovation will be complete by July, 2004.

Reviews.Title: “A disgraceful hotel, filthy. Terrrible management.”
Reviews.Author: sheilab56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked into the Metropolitan Hotel in June 2004 for what we hoped was a lovely NY weekend. We entered the lobby to the sound of jackhammers and to find it completely stripped of all furniture. We also noticed signs all over that due to construction there were NO restaurants or bars open. After a terrible begining things got worse. Our room was a dirty, tacky mess, torn bedspread, musty smelling with peeling wallpaper. I immediately went down to the manager to insist that this hotel was unacceptable and demand a full refund. I politely stated that he had an obligation to inform guests of extensive noisy construction work and a comeplete lack of srevices. He was rude, unsympathetic and refused to give me a refund...he told me it was and "unrefundalbe" rate. My husband and I checked out and went to another hotel. I repeatedly wrote this hotel to get a refund with no satisfaction. Not only did we lose our entire nights stay, but has to incur an additional hotel bill for the same night! This hotel is apparently being taken over by Hilton. I sincerely hope they do some serious upgrading in facilties and custoerm service...which was atrocious. I wouldnt stay her at any price!!! Sheila Brown

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff; Dumpy Room”
Reviews.Author: racer25
Reviews.Content: Tiny room and not so clean... granted, it was one of the rooms that had not been "remodeled". However, the staff seemed friendly for New York standards.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dariacon
Reviews.Content: Ok, I booked this hotel because it was not too expensive, even though a lot more expensive than other US towns i visited during my recent holidays. They are in the middle of a renovation, which I can understand. However, it is not acceptable to enter a lobby, if so we may call it, and have the impression to be in the train station. Everything was dirty, the works were not even covered with a screen and the staff were really depressed, which I can fully understand. At that point I would have gone away, ready to spend a lot more in another hotel, but at the end of the day I only had to stay there for one night, so we decided to stay. The only thing which was cheering us up during check in was that we had reserved a refurbished room, so we were expecting at least something decent and clean. Instead, even though our room was on the 17th floor and was indeed new, it was really horrible. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen, even worse than in a motel. We were lucky because we are thin, but I wonder what an average American would do there if when you open the door it almost touches the toilet. The ONLY positive aspect of this hotel was the plasma TV screen, which seemed even out of place in a room like that. I cannot imagine what a non renovated room is like, and honestly I don't want to know. Our only desire was to leave as soon as possible. In a few words: avoid this hotel, believe me!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - Right in the middle of a remodel”
Reviews.Author: gt8059a
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel August 26-27, 2004. I booked a remodeled room and it was in nice shape. Minimalist style, comfortable beds, nice flat screen TV.
