But, this hotel needs some work. They are in the middle of a remodel so they can become part of the DoubleTree chain. The A/C in my room was great, but the thermostat didn't work. The windows/doors/walls are not soundproof and with a police and fire station down the street it makes for a loud night. For the price and location I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst places to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting in NYC. The location is excellent and the staff was friendly but other than that, its one of the worst places you can live in. The carpets were so worn out and dirty that it felt i was in some rowhouse. The hotel had woefully inadequate electric outlets and i was forced to unplug the lights to use my laptop. Overall, avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As reserved, we received newly renovated, non-smoking rooms. (People need to realize that in order for a hotel to renovate there will be construction and inconveniences!) Very comfortable beds, good televisions, and we used the internet with no problem. Hotel staff was fine. The location of the Metroplitan is great. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad rooms, bad service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awful. The rooms are being renovated, albeit not well. I reserved a king, non-smoking, renovated room with high-speed Internet. I got a 2-bed, really smokey, beat-up room with broken Internet. When I called the front desk, the new guy on duty told me they were suddenly out of non-smoking rooms even without Internet. (They had some when I first checked in at 11:30 at night, a mere 20 minutes before.) And they are under construction for the next several months. On my way out the door at 8:15 AM I passed a woman in pajamas, who was yelling at the management due to the hammering in the next room. At 8:15 AM. Find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect (Midtown) and the newly renovated room was very nice. However, the staff were surly and not very friendly or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Dingy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Halo11
Reviews.Content: We visited the Metropolitan hotel in December 2003. We had never been to NYC before and decided to take a Christmas / New Year shopping trip. We found the Metropolitan to be conveniently located for all the shops and "touristy areas". It's perfect for Bloomingdale's / Central Park / Bars / Grand Central Station etc The one down side was the actual room itself. We asked for a smoking room (but didn't realise the room actually appeared to smoke itself). The walls were a dull brown and the smell was horrible. The rooms are fairly small - as you expect in a large city, but the bathroom was horrible. When we were there in Dec 03, there were notices going up all over the place talking of a big refurbishment, so i would consider going back there due to the brilliant location, especially if the rooms are re-done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel in March 2004. What a great location.Had two double rooms, no view but very comfortable.Only complaint was that the reception staff were not very friendly.Very convenient for the subway & great coffee shop next door. We will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perhaps the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I was in NY for business in the beginning of July. I booked the hotel knowing it was a budget property, but it was hardly that. Upon check in I was put in a non renovated smoking room (I had requested non). It smelled awful, I couldn't unpack, and it was filthy. I went to the lobby and was met rudely by the woman at the desk, who informed me that despite reserving a non smoking room, I would have to live with a smoking room for the night. I did not unpack a thing, and slept on top of the sheets. The only saving grace was that I was given a renovated non smoking room the next night. DO NOT STAY THERE

Reviews.Title: “A Fraud”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel bears no resemblence to the description on Expedia. It is a total fraud! No health club, despite the pictures of it on expedia. No restaurants (or room service) despite the glowing description on Expedia. Even a temporary lobby while construction is going on in the lobby. Stay away at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel on July 17th. What a dump!! Only part of the hotel is renovated. We booked (2) doubles and non-smoking. Upon arrival, the front desk clerk told us that double, non-smoking was an extra charge but he would accomodate us (ha ha). We were sent to an unrenovated room which had not been cleaned. The beds were made but the bathroom had used soap and someone else's shampoo and conditioner. We asked to be moved and were sent to a renovated room. Not much better. No soap or hand towels. The hallways smelled stale and old. The following day we were moved to another renovated room with double beds. Again, no hand towels, the room did not lock and the bathroom door would not close as it was at least 1/2" too big for the jam. Hotels rated it a 3 1/2 stars. It's more like a 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was wonderful for NYC. I had nothing to complain about at all! The rooms were very clean and so were the bathrooms. They were not the largest, but it's NYC and space is hard to come by there. For the price I couldn't have asked for anything more. I had a fairly nice view of the city and the maid service was excellent. If you are sight-seeing or on business it is perfect, but don't expect the Plaza. It is located in a perfect part of the city, very close to everything and not as noisy as being in the heart of Time Square. I would suggest this to others in a new york minute!

Reviews.Title: “Questionable at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel left a lot to be desired. I did not receive a renovated room and was appalled to find extremely stained carpeting and filthy bedding with hair! The woman at the front desk barely looked at me when I checked in. There was no clock of any kind in the room and when I requested a phone book it took them almost an hour to deliver it. As others have mentioned the renovations are not complete and there is no restaurant on site. The location is great and perhaps once the renovation is done this will be a desireable hotel. Until then, stay clear.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was extremely satisfied with my stay at the Metropolitan Hotel. It was the first time I had stayed in a hotel in Manhattan. The location was excellent. The desk people were courteous. The room was spotless. The renovation is impressive. If you like a new modern looking room in Manhattan, this is the place for you. My only two complaints are that my bathroom didn't have a ventilation and the "continental" breakfast was $11 a person. But, there's a coffee shop right next door on Lexington. Overall, great place to stay. It's about $22 by taxi from Lauardia. Book early and take advantage of this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan Hotel/Excellent value & location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a July 4th getaway to NYC. This is the 2nd stay for us at the Metropolitan in the past 2 years. The construction/renovation is still underway, but disruption is minimal. The bar/grill in the lobby is still closed (and walled off) due to construction, but our rooms were refurbished and exceptionally clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful & friendly, as well. We love staying at the "Met" due to the fantastic location and reasonable rates. We'll definately return and look forward to the re-opening of the lobby bar & grill. We learned a bit of history on the Metropolitan this trip. The builder in the 1960's was from Miami, FL. The building is designed in a curve, supposedly to represent a ocean "wave" and bring a bit of South Beach to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't have any horror stories- but the main thing I appreciated about this hotel is that it is right next to the 51st street subway stop. The room (the deluxe for 2 people) was tiny. the bathroom was even tinier with the sink jutting into the shower. The toiletries were meager (shampoo, conditioner and a tiny bar of soap) and of indeterminate brand. There were not even enough towels. I would rank this maybe as a 2 star - and I have stayed at better 2 star hotels. The room was so small that the TV cabinet was placed in the corridor so that one could not even watch TV from the bed. Before this hotel I stayed at the Mayfair, which expedia ranks as 2.5 stars. The room was huuuge as was the bathroom, and the toiletries were of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not very cheerful”
Reviews.Author: jenster001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan in May 2004 for three nights, booked through Expedia on a 25% discount rate, which worked out at about Â£80 per night. On the plus side it is very well located and fairly cheap for Manhattan. On the downside it is very basic and is in serious need of major refurbishment - signs in the lifts say this is happening, but we did not see much evidence..... Some of the criticisms here are about the staff - we actually found them helpful. We had a problem with our a/c (room too cold), but the hotel were v.quick to send a maintenance man up to deal with it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to NY on business, randomly came upon Metropolitan hotel....stay was wonderful. I was pleasantly surprised with my room, becauce I've always stayed in tiny hotel rooms when in New York. The room was newly renovated. I was probably one of the first guests ever to sleep in that bed. My overall experience with the hotel was wonderful and I recomend it to anybody coming to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “misleading internet information”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The metropolitan looked great on the internet but on arrival it was soon obvious that the precieved look atmosphere and facilities have not yet been accomplished. There was no bar or dining facilities and the room renovations had not been completed. For a 30th birthday celebration this was a disappointment but as so little time was spent in the hotel we were able to enjoy the rest of new york.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel at Reasonable Rate Let Down by Crap Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got off to a very bad start here as we'd booked our rooms through an Internet company that went bust and the hotel claimed no record of our booking. This, DESPITE the fact that I had called to confirm directly with the hotel on two previous occasions. The front desk told me a mistake had been made because there was another guest staying in the hotel that night with the same name and from the same town, city and country. Sure. What aggravated me most was the fact that the hotel staff appeared to take such pleasure from our predicament, gleefully explaining that every other hotel was booked up in the city that night. (Assuming that was the case, it doesn't say much for the Metropolitan that they were the ONLY hotel with vacancies in Manhattan). Under duress, we booked in and so, effectively, ended up paying twice for our hotel room. I appreciate that it's not the Metropolitan's fault if a booking company goes bust but I resented having to hear the hotel manager's fairy story about my 'doppelganger' guest and the staff's general demeanour. The rooms were not tiny and appeared to be clean and the midtown location is pretty good. Decor is outdated and the rooms are very dark but for â‚¬130 per night, it doesn't represent bad value for NYC - assuming you pay the rate just once. New York, New York. So good they charge you twice...

Reviews.Title: “Great Metropolotan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in NY at the Metropolitan hotel. We were in a newly renovated room and it was very comfortable. The staff is helpfull and friendly. The concierge is very efficient and guided us well on a lot of sightseeings. We highly recommend it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, where to start....! 5 women arriving late at night on 5/17, lugged our suitcases into hotel to find no bellman. Loaded them by ourselves onto rack prepared to take them up ourselves. Checked in and staff was unfriendly, perhaps too late at night for them? Headed up to our rooms and a man dressed in a black sweatshirt approached us and offered to take our suitcases to our room, we refused thinking he was someone trying to get money? Later found out it was the bellhop! (Not dressed in any hotel identifying clothing) Got to our rooms, BAD ! Old , disgusting and scary! Would not walk on carpet without socks, showered with flipflops on! Lucky we did not stay in rooms too long each day, too much of Fab NY to see! Great location , subway to your right as you walk out of hotel, always cabs around to grab if needed. After reading reviews previous to stay, knew not to expect too much! Stayed til 5/20(locked in by Priceline) checked out (front desk still very unfriendly)went to another hotel near Times Square. Would recommend if you can deal with getting a crappy room, unfriendly staff, and constant construction noise in morning! A plus was no sign of BEDBUGS! Yay!

Reviews.Title: “hotel nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was truly the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I was booked in to the hotel on a business trip with a colleague. the nightly rate being charged was about $300. The night we arrived there were no flights out of NY due to weather only flights in. We arrived 10 pm at the hotel to find no rooms had been allocated to us for that day although we were on their list to arrive they had made a mistake. However they offered us lower standard rooms to be moved the following day. My colleague, a non smoker, was given a very smelly smoking room. She was lucky. The first room I was shown in had been used. I had just realised this and was on the phone to my colleague when a porter barged into the room without knocking. Strange!!??Another room was allocated. The room was next to the lift shaft (as was the other used room). This is a big hotel and the lift was in constant use throughout the night which basically meant it was impossible to sleep. I wnt downstaires to complain. The night porter looked very sympathetic - the room was basically not lettable - however the manageress to whom we later complained wouldn't give a reduction on the room rates. As it was in the run up to Xmas we unfortunately were unavble to find alternative accommodation as everywhere was booked (I only just found this website to warn other travellors now). Having initially settled into our rooms we wanted something to eat or at least a coffee. The hotel couldn't provide either of these and suggected we wnt to the all night deli round the corner!! (as 2 females in NY for the first time we were reticent to do this in the middle of the night). There are no facilities in the rooms and no room service. The bar (not serving coffee) was in the entrance foyer , was very noisy, smoky but I think had stopped serving although it was still crowded with the bar (or should I say entrance foyer?) TV on full blast. The rooms were dirty and had wall hung blow heaters from many years ago which you could put on if you like, a bizarre breakfast was served in the morning to premium rate guests in a strange room without proper seating at the top of hotel a meagre affair of melon and a danish pastry but get there quick cos it runs out. Staff were rude. My colleague discovered a used condom in her room when we were finally were allocated rooms on the second night of our stay. The decoration was I think from the 1940's it looked awful. The bathrooms had bugs in them.

Reviews.Title: “Not entirely what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel from Expedia when traveling to see a wedding (5.26-6.2). We viewed many nice pictures of the hotel and their rooms, but unfortunately, many of these reviews have legitimate complaints. To the hotel's credit, they are in the middle of a renovation, however, they do neglect the rooms that have not been renovated yet. The carpet was the worst. I wouldn't walk on it in my bare feet for our entire trip (7 nights). The bathroom grout was terribly stained by grout, but the bathroom smelled of cleaner, so I think at one point the mildew was out of control, and they never got rid of the stains. We had the superior room. I expected it to be larger than a typical kleenex box, but that was not the case. Between the desk, two chairs, bed, and nightstand, two people can not manuever around the room comfortably. We did not have control of the temperature in our room, which was extremely frustrating, as we like to have the room cold before going to bed. The thermostat either didn't work, or we had no control. The AC would randomly click on/off. This place IS located right by a fire/police department so EXPECT to hear sirens at least once a night. They do have double paned windows, but road noise is still very audible. In addition, the renovation construction noise begins around 7:00-8:00 am EVERY morning. On the upside: the linens were always clean, the staff was always attentive and helpful. Their concierge was outgoing and friendly, which was great. Whenever we needed something, the staff was quick to respond. Our room was always cleaned when we left our room, regardless if we were gone for a few hours or all day, which was a nice surprise. You do not get what you pay for here, but then again, you don't ever get that in NYC! Advice for future travelers: Pay the extra amount and get a renovated room, or go somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “My Fab Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel made the trip . It was recommended by friends ....service was excellent and prompt. I highly recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “As Good as home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune of staying at the Metropolitan Hotel (51st & Lexington) whilst our Apartment was being renovated. The service was excellent / the staff courteous / the rooms extremely comfortable. Since it is located in the Midtown area, it was easy to get to work. There are numerous places in the vicinity where you get good, affordable food. If you should so desire - there are other excellent restaurants though a bit pricey. I owe my friend who recommended the Hotel - a fabulous dinner. Thanks - Metropolitan

Reviews.Title: “Run down facility, misrepresented on web, surly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The picture on the website must be from some other hotel. I sure didn't see anything like the photos when I was there. When the TV and network didn't work in the 1st room, and I was knee deep in water in the tub during my shower, and I noticed that I could see the concrete under the threadbare carpet, I asked to be moved. A doorman came to move my things, but was sharp with me for not having all my stuff packed yet. Odd, since nobody had yet told me that I *would* be moved. Got to the new room, sat down at the desk and it FELL OVER ONTO ME. No kidding. Had to wedge stuff under one corner to keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “MISSING $ ,EMPHASIS ON FILTHY, FILTHY, WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have no proof but I KNOW I put 150$ in the side pocket of my suitcase it was gone when I went to retrieve it. When I spoke with staff they did not seem the slightest bit shocked or concerned with what I was telling them. I went with my parents they did not take it. TO make a REALLY long story short. It literally took 80 minutes to be checked into a room, we had resevatons weeks ahead. They stuck us in a room that reeked, the room was filthy the bed was broken to the extent that all you had to do was look at it. We reserved a NONSMOKING 2 DOUBLE BED ROOM. We received a SINGLE BROKEN BED IN A FILTHY, STINKY SMOKING ROOM IN WHICH WHEN WE MOVED THE BED TO SQUEZE THE ROLL AWAYS THEIR WERE A TON OF CIGAREETE BUTTS UNDERNEATH. The staff acts if you are annoying them. I think they have to listen to people complain so much that they are immune to it. The tenth floor is moldy it will offend you the moment the elevator door opens. We had our room moved three times and they were all disgusting. I have never paid so much to be totally screwed in my life. I bet the shelters in NYC are cleaner and your belongings just as safe. THE ONLY REASON THEY ARE STILL IN BUSINESS IS THEIR LOCATION. I BET THEY DO NOT RECEIVE REPEAT BUSINESS.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Carpets are unclean and smell of mold. Lots of black mold in shower tile. No air fan in toilet. Wooden furniture and lamps cracked. There is no air conditioning. The fan only circulates room air. Lobby has not been renovated as stated. Soft drink room very unclean, chipped plaster. Lobby carpet and glass not clean. Too much bleech in bedding caused mild rash. Bed comfortable otherwise. Staff OK. No breakfast available, perhaps under construction? I would never recommend, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “The Metorplotian: Euthanise it, please.”
Reviews.Author: flshmymrs
Reviews.Content: The metropolitan Hotel is ideally situated, and thats preciesely where its attributes cease. What a dump. Just stayed there 5/7-5/8...if you had a comb, you could brush the bathroom floor there were some many hairs on the tile. The tub, with its several cigarette burn tattoos, was quite unappealing, as was the lack of chaulk arojnd the fixtures. OK, heres the real deal..the cops and FD were completely tolerable, right across the street, and unless they had an emeregency, it was exteremly quiet. Location of the hotel is perfect..but the renovation, which is heraled in the eleveators as being completed in April, 2004..aint anywheres near being done. No room service, no lounge, the lobby rug should be condemed..Ok Im done...the place sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I ever Stayed in, A dump would be cleaner.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in March and it was a nightmare, please take me advise and do not waste your money in this filty hotel, the toilets overflowed into the bedroom and the floor was soaking, the manager was so so rude to us along with other members of the staff, please don't waste your time trying this hotel its a disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a horrible place. There was no ice to be found on any floor, lost money in 2 soda machines, mold growing in bathroom, shift supervisor was rude and pretended to be the manager at first until pressed for owner's phone number. If you already booked - it's worth losing the money and book another hotel. Loser hotel on Lexington! Dirty, dirty, dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a Great price”
Reviews.Author: N111kkx
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay for a group of 5 of us and had 3 rooms. All of us were happy. Hotel under renovation but the noise was during the day and we were sight seeing. Clean, comfortable rooms. Excellent central location and staff helpful. No problems here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel December 29 & 30. We had a large party and it was not a pleasant experience. When we got to the hotel we had trouble getting our rooms. We had called earlier that day to confirm that we had two rooms with two full size beds. When we got to the hotel we found that the rooms each had one King bed in each. After a long talk with management we got the rooms but they were on different floors. The rooms were dirty and the bathrooms were terrible. The soap was open and the toilet was dirty. We wont be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't belive any bad things about this hotel, we stayed last year for 4 nights and had no problems! Hotel was clean and smart and the staff were really helpful and friendly. The postion of the hotel is great, only a few blocks from all main attractions and there is a underground right outside the hotel. One thing i will say is don't use the phone in your room as it cost a mint! I paid around $90 for 2 calls home (England) that lasted around 5 mins in total! Hotel has all the sevices you expect, ATM machine, hairdryers, gift shop e.t.c. All in all a great hotel, would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Lexington”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I knew I was in trouble when I checked in to find that the hotel is undergoing renovations, and there was no food service other than a continental breakfast. My room had scratched furniture and stains on the carpet. Renovations or no, that is the sign of a dive. My first night was uneventful, but upon returning from a late dinner the next night, I discovered a large cockroach or some such insect taking up residence in the bathroom. Recognizing that such insects rarely travel alone, I called the front desk. They sent up someone from security (who knows why-- maybe the guy was going to arrest the roach), but by then the roach had crawled into a hole in the wall near the floor. I packed by bag and went to the front desk. The manager offered me two options. The first was to have the room sprayed. Great--I spend the night breathing in that poison. The second option is to be moved to another room -- but they only have rooms in the smoking section, so I can breath in that poison instead. I asked them to find me accomodations in another hotel, but they claimed that all hotels are booked solid from here to Laguardia. I wanted to call Amtrak to see if there were any trains back home (since I was leaving the next day anyway). The manager could not even provide a phone book to assist me (the rooms have no phone books, not even a Gideon bible). But it was already 11:15 and the next train was not until 3 AM. So, with no choice, I agreed to be moved to a smoking room. More scratches, more stains on the rug, but I survived the night. The next morning I go to take a shower (the shower heads are only high enough to give you a colonic irrigation) and the knob came off in my hand!!! I showered as best I could, packed up and went to check out. I told the manager of my experiences, and he would not offer to discount the price. Instead he offered me the laughable options of either (i) late checkout privileges (I explained to him that my goal was to escape that hellhole as soon as possible, and not delay it), or (ii) am "upgrade" upon my next visit to the hotel (which I explained was extremely unlikely). Avoid this place like the plague!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel from hell. We went to New York for a long weekend. The first night we were put in our "superior room" which was a smaller than normal double bed in a filthy room with stained and torn carpets. We called the manager and he agreed to switch us to another room - it was the same only a little cleaner. At 2 a.m. the toilet overflowed and flooded the bathroom. We had to go down to the lobby and use the bathroom the next morning. We couldn't shower until they fixed it after 10:00. They finally moved us to a bigger room but it was not much better. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone at this time. For $159 a night I expected at least clean and functional accomodations - even in New York City. This was without a doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The restaurant and bar are shut down for renovations, they are doing construction and renovating which they dearly need but in the mean time the guests are paying the price with construction noise, dirty old deteriorated rooms, and very uncomfortabel accomodations all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Metropolitan for 9 nights from 1st march until 10th march 2004. we made the mistake of booking then reading reviews and as you can imagine we were filled with dread! we were told when we booked that the hotel was under some renovation but it only affected the fitness centre! not true the reception, bar and restuarant which is closed! are all being renovated so are some of the floors and rooms which is well needed!!!! When we arrived and got to our room, our fears were realised it felt dirty, drab and small stains on carpets bed cover was threadbear though the sheets were very clean it has no frills at all ! we were not happy but at that point to tired to complain. In the morning i went straight down to reception and asked for another room i explained that they must have got our reservation mixed we are supposed to have a superior room, I was told that it was a superior room at this time I asked what she meant and she told me that allthe normal superior rooms are under renovation so the best of the normal standard rooms are being classed as superior! but she moved us to a slightly better room but we lost our view. apart from a couple of other minor quibbles we got used to it. its is in a good location and the staff are friendly! This will be a very good hotel when all the renovations are finished! and having seen the plans i think the rating will go up!Having got home and reviewed the holiday we enjoyed very much and the hotel didnt deter from that so dont let it worry you any problems just speak to reception and they will help!or dont go to this hotel until june thats when everything is supposed to be finished.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 year son and I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel from March 3rd to 7th, 2004 and although I was a little apprehensive about the hotel due to some reviews I had read it turned out that I had nothing to fear. Our room was very clean and a good size for a New York hotel. The staff were courteous and very friendly and happy to help us out with directions and recommendations. Even though the hotel was being refurbished there was absolutely no inconvenience caused by the renovation. Some of the reviews included comments about peeling wallpaper and stained carpet but our room was very comfortable and there were no signs of such issues. Perhaps we were lucky or perhaps too many people expect a 5 star hotel for the half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Although A Bit Worn, This Hotel Is A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value in the $125 a night range given its location and access to the subways. No, this hotel is not the Waldorf. Yes, it is a bit aged and the current remodeling plan is going to help. If you are traveling and need a one or two night stay in the heart of manhattan, this is a great place. If you will be spendnig a lot of time in your room or will be entertaining, you may want to pay a bit more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, right next to a subway stop!”
Reviews.Author: Kateupstate
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Metropolitan Hotel every time we come to NY (about 4 times a year.) It feels like our home away from home. Yes, there is a fire department across the street, but it's never been a problem noise wise, and you can ask for rooms that don't face it if you want. The rooms are good sized for NYC (if you are not used to hotel rooms in NYC, they are generally very small compared to other areas of the country) and very clean. They are larger rooms than some of the 4 and 5 star hotels we've stayed at in the city. No, they aren't posh, and sometimes you may find some chipped paint or a corner of the wallpaper peeling in the bathroom. But for the price, this is a great hotel. Staff is very friendly, there is a coffee shop right next to the hotel, and you are literally 50 feet from a subway stop - the biggest plus, in our opinion! Plus, you are just a couple of blocks from Rockefeller Plaza and all the mid-town sites. The location and reasonable price makes this our favorite hotel. They frequently run specials (stay 3 nights, get the 4th free, etc.) through Expedia, so check that site to see what the rates are before booking directly with the hotel. The hotel also has a frequent guest program, you can sign up on their website.

Reviews.Title: “dirty room with fake female finger nails”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stay at this hotel on sunday feb. 29 from 9pm until march 1 2am only five hours. i found a used bandaid on the floor by the bed, a lady's fake finger nail under the chair and pretzel crumbs all on the floor. the room was dirty had not been clean with stains on the floor. when i requested that i should be reinbrust for half my money i was told to call and speak with the front dest manager instead i went at 11am that morning to speak to him in person and had to pay 119 plus tax for a dirty room and if i would have picked up that nasty bandaid i could have caught some kind of diease or something. dont stay here is is dirty and nasty and you could leave there with an illness.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to its rating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here November 2003 for a 4 night break with our little boy. We had a long wait checking in, and they took time tracking down our reservation. The hotel lobby was very basic, in much need of renovation and the room itself was in great need of renovation and wasnt very clean. We ate in the hotel 'Grill' which was very nice but very expensive for what essentially is 'Snack' type food. Best thing about this hotel is its central location. Wouldn't advise friends to use this hotel if they were going to New York City

Reviews.Title: “Great location, probably worth it if you pay under $100USD a night”
Reviews.Author: bm93travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel NYC on the weekend of Feb. 7th. Overall, the location is great and the proximity to the subway was excellent. The room itself was "adequate" (dirty tiles, frayed carpets, and stains), but definately in need of a rennovation. Things to avoid: pop machines on the floor may not work and just chew up your change, try to get a room at least 4-5 rooms away from the elevators (quieter between 12am-5am..but otherwise pretty loud), and if you're in a rush, electronic check out doesn't work so make sure you make other arrangements. Overall, our superior room was a little overpriced (over $100USD/night) for the quality so I would recommend you wait until rennovations are completed (May 2004) before trying this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Humph”
Reviews.Author: North_Wales_Lass
Reviews.Content: Oooooh, good points: Good location, LOVELY food!!! Bad points: Bloody fire station!!!!!! Honestly!!!!! Breakfast was diiiiire!!!! Only ate there once and we recieved our money back due to the poor selection at the buffet. When we arrived our reservation hadn't come throught, so we had to make do with a cramped room after a sweaty 6 hour flight (was very annoyed). Food overpriced. Also, if they offer you a transfer to the hotel, DON'T take it! We waited over an hour after a long flight (and not a good one) and it turned out that it would've been cheaper to get a taxi, and when we were on the overly-cramped bus, the idiot driver took us to the wrong hotel. No seatbelts, and the road was bumpy and the roof was low - had a good few bumps on my head the next day! Also, the driver reminded me of Benny Hill. A very creepy old man!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan for 2 nights. I found the staff very polite and helpful. I booked my room through hotels and got a great deal ($109.00) a night. My room was exactly what I expected it to be. It was small, but that's what you would expect in New York City. My room, bed and bathroom were spotless. The location of the hotel was the best. It is right in the middle of everything. I didn't hear many, if any, sirens during my stay. My room was also very warm, with a working thermostat. I was nervous prior to my arrival after reading all of the reviews on this site, but when I arrived and was shown my room I was delighted. I would defintely book my next trip to New York at the Metropolitan.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 569 Lexington Avenue at East 51st Street, New York City, NY 10022
